review: Man I've been a fan of Rockstar Games from a very young age. With the release of Grand Theft Auto V I thought it was groundbreaking and the best thing for next gen games.With Take Two's recent decision that I'm sure they will regret in time. You can't have any mods whatsoever. The whole purpose of PC gaming to me is to have a mod friendly environment. I'd only have things like retextures to make my game's graphics look higher than they should be.Online... From the start online was incredible. Money wasn't hard whatsoever. Some missions would give you a payout of $30k robbing stores would give you $14K. Updates after updates It's clear as day Rockstar has sold out and wants you to buy their awful shark cards. Want to rob a store? Enjoy the $2K and impossible police chase that builds up. I put nearly all of my online money into a business that looked promising and to help out players that don't have much money. It's not worth it. You need to drive a slow truck or van to pick up cargo and drive back to a warehouse HOPING that a player won't try to destroy you to get XP from you. As I was saying with helping out new players. All the hours of work to build up a normal warehouse will give them about $30K. Way too much grinding. Online is fun... If you're rich. And the only rich people are the ones who played online from the start. If you're new? Don't support the shark cards. Anyone who is rich that wasn't from the start had a modder shoot loads of money bags at them or randomly received $9M out of nowhere undetected. The game is all about crime for crying out loud.What is unfortunate about my online expereince is that one of my single player mods resulted in me getting my character with $2M completely wiped and suspended for a month. Want to reason with Rockstar and prove that you weren't modding or doing anything whatsoever? Not a possibility unfortunately. It's very sad to see what Rockstar has done to their online community compared to GTAIV and Red Dead Redemption.Now back to Take Two. I don't see what they will get out of banning single player mods as you can see with reviews several people are very unhappy about this. It's also sad that Rockstar so far has kept quiet. Rockstar surely can't be for Take Two's decision as they started from making a modified version of a game and supported the modding community for so long. Seeing that their being harsh on modders compared to their laidback approach in the beginning makes me lose hope in any future game to come. This isn't exactly ''protecting online''.My opinion PC gaming is all about singleplayer mods. Modifying the game to your liking. Making it your own. No mods is just going to make this game die out in my opinion.Rockstar don't do this to us.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The PC Version of GTA is all about Modding. Cutting that away is a realy bad move. I preordered the XBox360 Version and the PC Version of this Game so i payed 130 but apparently i've been "undermonitized" and a CEO that dosen't even play games thinks that microtransactions is the way to go instead of a complete good Game.The online mode of this Game was a mess from the start glitchers and hackers everywhere. Now Take 2 bans the modding scene and the one mod that strictly affects ONLY the singleplayer mode because they think it could harm their precious Money Making Machine which is the multyplayer. The Money it makes comes strictly from kids that are to lazy to play the actual game so they just buy ingame money with real money. So Take 2 does not only adress the issues the game has on their side very slowly or not at all(wich makes hacking and glitching possible in the first place) they actively attract cancerous players for the sake of milking even the last few cents out of this game.It is sad for the crative team at Rockstar that sits behind this masterpiece and no doubt about it the singleplayer IS a masterpiece of gaming. But the greedy money hungry people in suits at Take 2 that just can't get enough ruined thos otherwise brilliant game.Under this circumstances i will never buy any Take 2 game ever and i strongly recomend the same to anyone that loves gaming and good games.

review: I have played literally every Grand Theft Auto Game since I was a wee lad. I enjoy them. I have watched the evolution into multiplayer. If you want a game where you can literally do anything you want from beating up people to racing to stealing cash cars guns and drugs then this is the game for you. If not its probably still one of the best games out there. I play this game with my family I enjoy most sessions except for when some dirtbag is modding and kiling us all(20% of the time). This game pushes my pc harder looks better and has more content than any game released ever. you can go watch a movie tv throw snowballs hack computers and fly helicopters or even jets. I have a jetpack lowriders and a garage full of motorcycles. You can take selfies. Try it you will not regret it except for the worlds most annoying intro(after you have had to play it eleven times). Graphics 10/10 gameplay 10/10 modders 0/10 fun 11/10.

review: I have bought this game on three diffrent systems Xbox 360 PS4 and now PC. As expected PC is better than both. Even though I had already completed the story missions twice before I didn't feel bored completing it for a third and final time. The story is great it provides great entertainment and hours worth of fun. You can play as three main chracters each with hugely diffrent personalities this helps to keep the story intresting. You also have side missons called Strangers and Freaks missions for each chracter. Even without the story the singleplayer still provides plenty to do such as exploring the beautiful city and the breath taking surrounding area. You won't run out of things to do on GTA V.GTA V also comes with GTA Online which allows you to play with your friends or complete strangers this adds extra hours of entertainment the online is much better than GTA IV's. GTA Online uses a seperate chracter for online activities (obviously) and this chracter can do missons for various chracters to gain exp and level up. Now GTA Online includes heists which are amazing to play but require a team of 4 to complete(bar the first mission which requires 2). These heists help add even more hours of entertainment to the game.Now to the graphics I play the game on high at about a median of 50fps. I would say the game the game is well optimized and doesn't provide too much of a challenge to run. If intrested or if you want to compare my specs are AMD FX 8320 Nvidia GeForce GTX 760 8gb DDR3 RAM(1600mhz) Even for returning players GTA V introduces director mode and rockstar editor this allows you to film and edit your own movies a great addition to the PC version. https //www.youtube.com/watch?v qHkKY1PITU0 example of director mode here. Please don't mind the self promotion ).TLDR Amazing game with great graphic a must buy.PS. Feel free to add me on GTA Online/Steam. RS social club name 'WiggazFiggaz'.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V is an big game which contains a lot of details. There are tons of things you can do both in the offline and online mode.The gameplay in both modes are excellent smooth and fun. However Rockstar (in my opinion) let us down by the way they optimalised stuff. Pros Excellent gameplay Tons of things to do in both offline and online mode Ability to install mods in offline mode Ability to have fun and drink beer with your friends in online mode Ability to grow bigger and bigger in online mode by buying buisinesses and expand your (car boat plane etc.) fleet Frequent updates on the online game mode (for free)Cons The loading screen (sometimes) takes ages to load (or even worse it'll never finish loading) The anti cheat isn't as it should be in 2017 They do ban cheaters but unfortunately they also ban players who never cheated No updates on the story mode or anything in offline mode.Conlusion It's a good game. If they spend energy in optimizing the loading screens and work on adding a good anti cheat the game would be the best game ever.

Please check your connection and click Retry or click Cancel to quit."Yes I purchased through Steam activated through Social Club played 25 hours (6 on most recent install no tweaking) and maintained an internet connection. Nevertheless Social Club activation issues continue to ravage my area and question my sanity to this day. Multiple redownloads and reinstalls of the 60GB game files were futile. Otherwise Rockstar is greedy GTA Online is cancerous and I regret buying this. If you're considering buying any Rockstar game which uses Social Club (including RDR2) avoid avoid avoid!.

review: Not really sure how to review GTA 5 but here I go (I had over 200 hours on GTA on disk before I got the steam version so calm down when looking at my hours)GTA online is the only reason the game is still thriving to this day. There are so many new releases that make it so interesting to play. The downside to these releases is that with new releases comes overpowering weapons and vehicles. There is no easy way to stop these vehicles unless you have one yourself or simply find another lobby. There are H E A P S of modders in online. This can make the game so much better or make it hell for you. Majority of the time they're all relaxed and give out money drops which can be very useful since EVERYTHING IS MILLIONS OF DOLLARS. Moving onto the money part EVERYTHING IS EXPENSIVE! I would say im fairly experienced in GTA and don't struggle with the money side of it but newer players will find it soooooo hard to get decent vehicles and weapons. (Don't give into buying shark cards!)Overall GTA can be either a very fun and addictive game or you hate it due to modders and the whole absolutely everything is expensive problem. Buy the game and im sure you wont regret it. Just don't expect to get everything quickly it takes time! )

review: This is my first and likely to be my only ever Steam review of a game but given current events I felt it necessary to say something.First things first GTA V is a good game all in all. It provides for hours of hijinks and entertainment but can easily become monotonous. GTA Online had the potential to be a repreive from this monotony but was handeled with such greed and a complete and blatant disregard for its audiance that it's frankly insulting.The "gameplay" offered by GTA Online is based entirely around a grind for cash and RP for leveling and many gameplay elements are blocked out to the player unless they have enough cash or a high enough level. This not only serves to prolong this feeling of monotony but also stips the gameplay of any of the fun that could be acheived in the singleplayer.This is only worsened by the games use of microtransactions "graciously" allowing players to skip the ridicilous and unnecessary grind by rewarding the player with cash and RP in exchange for ridicilous amounts of real money. For instance the price of a yacht in in game currency is $8 00 000 which translates to either dozens of hours spent in game grinding or $100 in real world currency.GTA Online is also completely hostile to new players new players lacking the necessary level or cash to have access to any decent vehicles weaponry armor housing and vehicle storage have no way to combat the more experienced players or those who chose to pay for their levels and cash. This makes it nearly impossible for new players to advance in the game without having to waste their money on microtransactions as they will not be able to compete with the other players.This monotony could and was eliminated through the use of mods giving the player a potentially indefinite amount of hours of hijinks and entertainment through the hard work of dedicated modders. Unfortunately and what I find has proven to be the nail in this games coffin the game's publisher Take Two issued a cease and desist to OpenIV one of the major modding tools of GTA V used by most of the better mods. Now I am no lawyer so I could be completely off base but from my limited understanding this cease and desist has no actual basis but instead is just an assualt on the modding community and on the fans. Unfortunately independent modders don't have the funds necessary to challenge a multi million publishing company in court so instead they've been allowed to get away with this frankly disgusting behavior.Without mods I cannot honnestly recommend this game nor would I want to and I'd recommend that potential buyers avoid this game for the time being if for nothing more than to send a message to the publishers that we will not tolerate such greed and disgusting underhanded business practices.On another note the keyboard controls or terrible but the game has controller support so it's not that much of an inconvenience.TL DRAvoid this game unless the publishers go back on their current practices and begin to at the very least tollerate the existance of mods.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

No. Grand Theft Addiction. Update After over 1200 hours of playing the game on PC I'm afraid I have to edit my review. Rockstar as a company show time and time again they do not care for their customers and will you over in every conceivable way. While I do believe a lot of the reviews on here referencing false bans are in fact just raging cheaters not all of them are. Cheaters still plague the game like mad and innocent players are still being banned with absolutely no way to appeal it regardless of how much evidence you may have to the contrary. And this is coming from someone who hasn't been banned from GTA even once.

review: "Don't Say Nope to Dope!" GTA5 In Game AdvertisementOverall this game is worth the purchase and I would recommend it to a friend.Pros Huge area to explorePlenty of vehiclesLots of intuitive street activityGreat character dialogAwesome music (radio stations and cut scenes)Fight aliens and zombies in side missionsOnce I get further into the missions and I finally fly some aircraft I will most likely be more thrilled than I currently am.But at the moment I do have a few gripes...Cons Graphics aren't as clean as I expected (settings maxed) Clumsy controls (character smacks into walls when attempting to jump them character gets turned around and takes too long to correct positioning especially while in a shootout) Firing range is buggy (screen went blurry shooting range didn't initiate locked into the room police called when I fired the weapon wasted by cops) Pause menu is poorly designed (must scroll over to the 'game' menu just to exit *save and exit options should always be in the primary list of options) Tutorial dialog appears on the screen while diving a vehicle which makes it almost impossible to read while avoiding a crash Must download extras from the internet instead of being rewarded in game (the dog Chop doesn't obey wothout a download exclusive cars must be obtained online)
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Got this game when it went on sale. It has a good single player and is worth the price (when it is on sale). I say this because multiplayer can be a bad experience because of the hackers that plague the servers. It can also be a good experience when you have friends to play with you. But when you are a solo player then the vehicles that you want can be grindy to get and you may be force to buy premium currency. The only reason I recomment this game is for its single player. If your looking to play in multiplayer with no friends then I cannot recommend this for you

review: Enough maybe even too much time spent on the game.Besides CS and some story based games GTA pretty much made my 2015. And the game was great. Free content for online as well as more complex missions and objectives for it. Playing with your friends really took the time off from you and eventually it was night.... or the next morning.Money in online always was a problem for me and my mates. Replaying a heist costs money purchasing an office for the cool jobs costs enough already and the new cars and slick clothing had to come short. And oh boy you don't want to miss out on cars or suits. You really don't.Anyways it was always possible to afford all these items without having to buy the ingame currency with your real cash. And that was a good thing. I pretty much spent enough on skins for CS anyways so SharkCards came short.With the recent updates however items became so incredibly expensive that buying these cards almost became necessary or well it pretty much became necessary. Purchase this bunker to play the new heist. Purchase this. Purchase that. It's not even the fact of new items that are required to play the new content I'm all for it. You needed a high end appartment to start the heists in 2014 but with the increase in pricing you are not able to afford a hangar or a bunker or whatever. It pretty much becomes impossible to achieve all of this without spending real money. Sure you could play the game for thousands of hours and you may be stacked with money. But when I left the game in spring of 2016 and came back a year later I was not able to do a lot with the million I had left.And purchasing some house or bunker is not just enough no being able to enjoy the full experience granted by Rockstar means that you may want to invest 1 or 2 million dollars additionally or more.Don't get me wrong here I absolutely loved the story. Action packed hilarious moments you know. Just some GTA and for Online... Well let's just say I would not have played 320 hours of it if it was not good. But with these DLCs and the pricing of the new items you either have to grind your off for lots of hours just to be able to afford a bunker i.e. and then need to start the grind again just to finish the missions or a new heist whatever.All this leads to me not recommending this game. As much as I used to love it it just became and to be fair boring. I may should have written such a review a few months or maybe even a year ago but anyways.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is alright. I have owned this game on PC and XBOX 360 and One. I have to say this game is much better on console but having the modding aspect is a game changer. The game looks pretty good and runs good but some of the mechanics are trash. Switching weapons is absoulety dreadful and you sometimes lag out during a mission. This can be super frustrating because you will be in midddle of a heist and then you lag out and the entire thing is cancelled. This has only happened to me twice. Overall the car customization and gun modifying is a blast. So much content in this game it is almost hard to get bored unless you have no money which makes the game boring. And that comes to my next point everything is so expensive now I can not afford a $3 000 000 bunker just so I can play the new heist! I think this game is fun but you better have some friends or download some cool mods to have fun on this game otherwise I think you will find yourself getting frustrated. Anyways that is just my opinion of owning the game since it has came out for xbox and PC

review: At this point they should not even publish a PC port. The controls are a nightmare (example swimming) and to add insult to injury nothing is explained properly (like how to swim UP). I spent probably half my game time in the key bindings settings trying to figure out how to complete the current quest. Then add the just disastrous decision to have three half baked characters instead of one good one and all the little glitches like quest targets disappearing behind walls. Story is boring as hell compared to older GTAs (e.g. Vice City). For me the second worst GTA of all time (with San Andreas still number one). And instead of a real DLC such as "The Ballad of Gay Tony" for GTA IV they keep adding online modes.Oh and by the way the "world record" on the airport race is 0.170 seconds at the time of this review. Yes less than a second for two laps around the airport. Basically all the top places in all such modes be it golfing or races or anything are cheated. But Rockstar just does not care.This game is not worth the money.

review: Ok I finally broke down and got this game because friends playing it. Thank Jebus I only paid 20 bucks for this single player marvel and complete multiplayer hack fest trash. First the main issue... 1.) The developers do NOTHING to stop people from hacking the game2.) It completely stops you from just playing with your friends. every damn mission the game forces you to join public or throws some random joe into your misson. It FORCES you to join public servers and deal with those hackers in order to do ANYTHING with your buisnesses.3.) It only supports MODS in single player. There are some AMAZING MODS for this game like the graphics overhaul mods that are only on your end and in no way affect the game for ANYONE ONE ELSE that are straight up not allowed into online because of rockstars BS controling how you play the game. So in reality the is NO MOD SUPPORT FOR THIS GAME!!!!4.) the SUPER BASIC concept of alowing players to create their own PUBLIC SERVERS allow who they want in their PUBLIC servers and have the ability to browse PUBLIC servers that are online has aparently escaped rock star. THIS alone would have made this game amazing and would have completely looked over the other glaring issues because they really wouldn't be an issue....THIS would eliminate 90% of this ing games problems.5.) STOP AUTO CORRECTING MY HELI FLIGHT AND ALLOW FOR MOUSE AXIS PITCH CONTROL!!!So overall impression of this game. If your looking for an AMAZING singleplayer game that is deep and entraling in it's execution and has SP Mod support... This game is an absolute must...If your looking for a multiplayer even close to most other games basic functionality and options for multiplayer.... STAY FAR AWAY FROM THIS GARBAGE

review: I own GTAV on X360 X1 and PC... why am I leaving this bad review? It's not specifically about the anti modding support... but that's now a big part of it. My bad review is based on the actual decline of how fun this game has been to me and my friends.On launch 360 a long time ago... I went to a launch party played some gtav with people and came home and actually enjoyed the game offline and it's still fun offline but ... i discovered online after the 100% story mode and really had tons of fun with my friends and then the nerfs and really stupid stuff happened. First it started with nerfing cash payouts for tons of jobs you used to get 18k on hard mode for blowing up 3 trash trucks that were decently far apart. and raiding a compound... now you get maybe 4k for the entire thing. the weapons/ammo you use costs more than 4k.There was the admittedly cheaty mission where you blew up cars in a parking lot and got a quick 25k understandable they made it harder... but then nerfed the entire mission to 10k the car spawned running away and you had to chase it and then take the case and deliver it to martin... all for 10k. 10k honestly will buy you nothing in the game now. Now we have supercars that are 2m+ giant garage's that you have to buy each level of gang warehouses all sorts of new content! but ... all the heists and missions don't pay near enough to actually afford these things you must buy shark cards. Don't get me wrong I understand shark cards support the game as I've bought 2 3 of them myself to support the game... but there's a point when it has to stop. I can't enjoy the game because there's so much content that it's impossible to earn enough money for it all just playing normally and normally meaning not 12 hours a day... The game itself has lots of content lots of great fun to be had... but the structure is gone it's no longer fun because of how stupid and difficult it is to earn anything anymore. I only have 55 hours in the PC version of the game simply because all of my friends stopped long ago and no longer play for the exact same reasons. I hope in the future when the new GTA Online is released it's not this bad... because reading all the reviews just about mod tools makes you realize one thing it's not even the mod tools that was the issue per se... it's the fact said mod tools spawned money players flocked to these 'modders' because making money in GTA Online is ridiculous now and the only way to do anything is through modders. There are still tools out there for this... but I just stopped playing because it's impossible to make enough money to do anything anymore the game is dead and not even because of the open IV issue....
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: BLUF (TL DR) Harassed by in game characters calling you constantly to remind you to buy that mere $5 million 'thing'. While you grind along making $5000 here or there on missions. Malevolent modders that treat the online servers as good fun to harass and kill everyone with invulnerable vehicles or teleporting you to the great unknown or deciding to derail your CEO plans by destroying your cargo or spawning items over you. Why? Because they can and in a world where Rockstar cares more about you buying that new 'thing' then maintaining gameplay you won't see anything get resolved soon.My History With The Series Fanboy LevelI've played the GTA series since its inception. I remember losing hours playing the previous installments and even more hours with MTA and SAMP. You would think with this type of history I'm probably a fanboy and for the most part I would agree with you. However this game has broken that winning tradition.Game Mechanics Spot On Great Mechanics and Physics.The game mechanics at least for me are spot on. The flying driving swimming physics are all great. In single player the game is a winner however the sustainment of this game is through it's online component and that's where it fails. The netcode seems fine the interactions are great and I like the idea of having CEO/VIP/MC missions that sometimes involve the entire server's population.Online Great until you run into an evil modderThere seems to always be one modder in every server that wants to ruin the fun. Modding isn't necessarily a bad thing but when modding includes providing a single player an invincible vehicle to then mercilessly torture the rest of the players with then it is. Time after time I frequently end up in servers with such players constantly harassing me as I try to grind through missions to pay the exorbitant fees rockstar feels the need to charge for their 'new' content.New 'Content' These are like DLCsIt's great that Rockstar didn't abandon creating new content for the game adding nightclubs yachts bunkers facilities etc. However the goal is to get players to buy 'Shark' cards which translate to in game money. So if you're like me you aren't going to do that but that won't stop non player characters from calling you every minute to remind you to buy these things. So while you're dodging that modder who's flying around on a hover bike with missiles that can't be destroyed you'll be busy answering a call from Lester the Molester who wants to remind you to buy a bunker or a hangar or any number of stupid things.With these last two topics the game has lost the fun it once had. Now it's down to luck in getting a populating server without a modding who is merely out to ruin your day.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Got this on the Holiday Sale because I had the patience to not spend on the game for 60$. The game at this time during the Holiday sale was 24$. Which honestly is the price it is currently worth right now in general without sales.GTA 5 Singleplayer is a complete blast so much fun and so many things to do. The game just goes your way and you have a nice and smooth storyline. A lot of sidequests and tasks to complete outside of the main storyline. Honestly what more can you want? Well that is why we have GTA Online.GTA Online well this is no where near GTA 5 Singleplayer besides the fact that you get more and more things to do which keeps you entertained. In some aspects of course. GTA Online has become horrible due to very very very long loading times. Not only that random connection drops and having somebody disconnect because of GTA Online servers ing up which cancels the heist missions.Another view is modders and cheaters that either purposely attempt to get others banned from the server by dropping a lot of money and cases on players.Another experience I had was when I had a group of players to do a mission with me from my Clubhouse and I was the President. Then a few moments into the mission I get a dude in a tank with his friend spawn right on me and kill everyone in the mission from my group. Which is not fair at all... Another thing is using the Orbital Strike that is just ing stupid. It is one of the most cheapest ways to kill players and groups of players.GTA 5 Is an outstanding game itself thank god Rockstar hasn't touched or altered the singleplayer from this point because there would be even more negative reviews. But Rockstar is now only focused on GTA online to hoard a lot of money from players who buy Shark cards. Because grinding is so much harder than before.GTA Singeplayer 10/10GTA Online 4/10If this game was 24 dollars then It would be decent because of the singeplayer but since its still 60 ing dollars since its release it is a no for me...
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A fantastic open world single player game with a great story many features and stellar visuals that are well optimized. The multiplayer has great amounts of content but limits the amount that can be done in co op making you grind increasingly to try and push up sales of shark card in game currency. Connection issues and still to this day many hackers can make online a poor experience. Despite this you can still have fun with the large amount of things that can be done the game is worth it for the single player alone and hightly recommened the online has too many problems to be worth purchasing the game alone for though.

review: This Game is Amazing! I really can't stop playing! I have had all of the Grand Theft Auto series and I have to say this really holds up the name! I have played every heist and they are really enjoyable. If are like me and want the freedom to just do everything then this is a game for you! The guns are well designed with the snipers being my favourite class of weapons. The graphics are out of this world! The game mechanics are well designed with the user in mind. Servers are okay could be better but nothing to worry about. It is extremely well optimised even for people who have laptops with a 480M (me) and below! I really like this game and recommend it to everyone who can get it!Pros +Very well optimisedGraphics are amazing Great weaponsWide range of places on the mapGreat selection of Rockstar made missions and Heists along with player made missionsCons Loading time is a little excessive (1 to 3 mins on my laptop)Some people do get banned for someone else's actions. (Very rare)Servers do go down now and then (not often only experienced this maybe 3 4 times this year)

review: Its a real shame what rockstar has let happen to a game that could have been so much more. When this game was first revealed I almost came. I was glued to my tv for a solid day and a half on release the amount of detail they put into the world was beyond belief and the cars and driving felt like a good balance from the previous games spongy feel. Even as time went on and gta online kept getting pushed back further and further I didnt think anything of it. I mean it has to be difficult developing a game on this scale right? So I patiently waited and low and behold they released it in some form or another. It was pretty fun fofr a while until the question of heist came up...another few months pass and then the game gets released on pc...still no heists. Finally heists get unveiled after months of scrounging for rp and cash like some kind of bottomfeeder and its still barely enough to afford the already expensive clothes cars and apartments. but I keep playing with the promise of being a ceo and the owner of a biker gang and single player dlc that I'm pretty certain they mentioned but it only gets worse. With each dlc the cars get more expensive the headdquarters even more so and the missions get more and more grindy. Finally they release their gunrunner dlc and big goddamn surprise everything is pricey as . So many cool things that will never be used because theres no reason for anyone to buy a ing anti aircraft trailer to pull around. So unfortunately this is the end for me until rockstar gets their together they will get anymore support from me.

review: To begin with the story mode of GTA V is fun. It's fun to play as the characters use their abilities and explore the world. Many reviews focus solely on the online aspect which is a bit broken. To be fair I wouldn't buy this game just for the story mode but it's definitely something to take into consideration. Now online. From the get go online is pay to win. In order to have fun you have to get past multiple million dollar (in game) paywalls. Some people might argue that you can still play races and minigames but dealing with unmodified cars and weapons you have no experience with can be annoying. There's always that one guy with a perfectly tuned supercar and the extensive combat knowledge. The races are still fun but they're more enjoyable when you have a chance. To be perfectly honest the shark cards are hugely overpriced. If i remember rightly at one point my profit from import/export was 18 million. Would I have paid upwards of $200 AU for that? Hell no. If you want to have fun in online you have to be ready for the grinding.The hardest part of online is starting out. Getting that first few million to grab an apartment and a decent car. It's getting easier these days with Rockstar giving out fairly frequent login rewards to try and keep this game alive a little longer. There are plenty of guides on how to make the maximum amount of cash per hour. Take what those people say seriously but do what is most enjoyable for you. If import/export gets you the most cash but you find heists really fun do that instead. There have been times when I've gotten sick of it all and the key to not getting there is finding the stuff in online that you actually like doing. I personally love the game. The freedom and satisfaction from finally modding out that supercar or buying that facility is great. I hate how long it takes to get there though. Everything is hugely expensive in order to encourage people to buy the overpriced shark cards. If you can put up with the grinding and even have some friends to help you through it I would definitely recommend this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is a rollercoaster of emotions for me. It makes me want to have a 'Mixed' review option the most. But since we do not have that I simply must surrender to lord Gabe and rate it up.Singleplayer The single player is without doubt one of the most amazing experiences you will have. The world is vast and the missions are a delight. The attention to detail is amazing. The storyline although not very deep is still very engaging. I absolutely love how the character develop and how they manage to connect a small time gang member a retired bank robber and an absolute psychopath the character of who in itself is a huge plus for the game. It is worth the money for the single player alone and I would not thumbs up this game if not for it.Multiplayer This is where my dliemma begins. Almost all of my odd 1100 hours clocked in this game have been online and I am STILL conflicted about it. On one hand you have times as much content in online as you do in singleplayer and the ability to play multitudes of heists missions races and other activies among freeroam with your friends. even with over a thousand hours clocked in I still haven't played all the modes this game has to offer. On the other hand is how Rockstar has turned this game into a cash cow and are milking it for every single penny. The game began relatively balanced but now you have humongous paywalls put up to encourage you to buy microtransactions instead of grinding your way the top (which believe me you will not unless you make GTA the only thing you do for the rest of your life.) The payouts are absurd compared to the prices of the in game content. To put it in a prespective the highest you can earn from the most rewarding heist is around $1.2M which will barely get you one of the nicer supercars (full modifications excluded) but will take around 3 4 hours to complete. Many more if you don't have in game friends. But if you have an active group of friends or a crew you can run all the bussinesses and earn around a couple of millions every 2 3 days or so if you play regular. If you play solo running businesses is a nightmare. It's simply undoable the grind is unreal. If Rockstar's predatory approach to the consumers wasn't bad enough the matchmaking is absolute trash. It doesn't matter if you have the best internet in the world the load times are painfully long and the frequent disconnects ruin all the fun. Then there are the hackers and rockstars errant banning mechanism. There are a lot of hacker and most of them are hostile. Look at them the wrong way and they spam your character with toilet bowls and spaceships till your game crashes. The banning system is a cherry on top of the dung cake. They ban people who've done nothing and let the obvious hackers play on. The very fact that you play GTA puts you in the risk of getting banned. Plus the bans are absolute. You cannot get them reverted and if you try the support bot slaps you with the "all bans are final" message.So how is it that with this essay on how bad it is I still recommend this game? Because despite all the flaws It still manages to be extremely enjoyable. It's a nighmare when it doesn't go right but an absolute delight when it does. If ethics are not a big deal to you and you're okay with modding/glitching (as I am there's no enjoying this game to the fullest without screwing the system) go ahead buy this game you'll love it. But if you're all about the legit play and wouldn't cheat/mod if your life depended on it save yourself the money you'll spend more time grinding the money than you will enjoying this game.P.S If you do buy this game NEVER EVER PURCHASE SHARKCARDS! MICROTRANSACTIONS ARE CANCER!

review: Everyone forces solo lobbies because R* capitalizes on the social incentive of being an (Incentivized griefing and force to sell in public sessions) and they did it well. 90% of PvP is Toxic and shady (Cargo Griefing Easy Way out (Killing Yourself) spamming Job Teleporting etc.) the other 10% is against Godmode hackers that either put you in a cage or kill everyone (after they spam their website info and costs of hacker gta$ first) then leave. R* allows game breaking glitches/exploits/cheats as long as they are at the expense of the consumer and it promotes Shark Card purchasing. For example MkII Oppressors... will be a great addition once R* fixes the glitch that allows it to fly faster than the Lazer with near impossible missile tracking (missiles will u turn and it's griefers best friend). They will however fix car duplication IMMEDIATELY from the Nightclub Garages as After Hours still drip feeds and will even create a system that just even limits the amount of cars you sell. Pounder Custom will get stuck under bridges armor will highcenter itself on a pile of leaves and the ram stop you 60 0 if you hit a curb. Speedo Custom proxymines don't work right either. The B 11... was a waste of GTA$ and a huge letdown. Most examples are from most recent DLC but they're everywhere. The game can be fun though. You HAVE to know all of the nuances of GTA V for it to be enjoyable. I do enjoy killing cargo griefers in public sessions with my Savage until they leave. But most of my hours involved with this game are AFK (Nightclub/Bunker) because thats the only way for you to make enough money without trying to convince yourself of the value of a shark card. A++ in mircotransaction psychology.Wrote this review as I hit 10m Gta$ and I've got nothin to work towards till next DLC except sale purchasing novelty vehicles. Done till then.

review: When I play as Franklin I only shoot black people. That's acceptable right?Anyway after a full story mode playthrough it was fun. You're basically being a sadistic no matter which character you're playing at any given moment. That's why you're here in the first place so you go with that. It tries to throw in a shy family values attempt but you can cringe your way through it. I have no idea how I clocked close to 100 hours in it. I must have left it open idling in a car quite a few times because there's probably only about 40 50 hours worth of content max. Even most of it gets boring so it's probably closer to 30 40. You can skip things like buying most properties unless you want the grindy side quests. You can buy clothes if that's your thing. Everyone on my crew simply rolls with one really nice suit and one fully upgraded stolen car which I leave all over the ing city rarely to find it again for the whole game. Stunt jumps? I was able to pull off two. Screw that also. Other than that you're pretty much spending most of your time driving like an killing random pedestrians and then running from the cops. You have to scratch that itch though.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Okay let's do the bullet point thing as everyone loves bullets (and points) I've never played any console version of this game. I remember buying the original Grand Theft Auto in 1997. I skipped GTA 2 but then bought GTA 3 for my PS1. I owned GTA IV for the PS3 which I loved. I have never played GTA 4. I am drunk. I think there should be different review categories splitting 'single player' and 'multiplayer'. A lot of the negative reviews for this game focus on multiplayer aspects and the disgruntled feelings of players who have been banned for various and what appears to be spurious reasons. There are actually many gamers such as myself who do not rate the multiplayer aspects of a game highly. We're old and decrepit and prefer single player experiences. I cannot fault the single player experience of GTA 5. I am lucky enough to have a modern PC with a blisteringly fast CPU and graphics card and I am running Windows 10. I have experienced no te al or performance issues when running GTA 5. Buy this game.

review: As its own game GTA 5 singleplayer is amazing in every respect graphics gameplay depth and enjoyment. However the online section of the game leaves much to be desired and has only become more grindy as time passed. To put into perspective most of the latest vehicles costs around $2.5 3.5 million in game. This could cost you around 31 just for one vehicle if you buy a Shark Card. Earning this much through grinding is no small feat either I have access to some of the top money making methods (such as having an office and warehouse to play missions from these cost around $2.5 million at least) and it'd still take me about 7 8 hours to earn this much (if optimistically I could earn $400k an hour) just for one vehicle. Grinding is not fun and none of the recent DLCs have done much if anything to reduce this. All they've given is a few more shiny toys to play with nothing has changed up the gameplay since CEO and office work came out in June 2016.I played Payday 2 through its microtransaction debacle and that comes nothing close to how badly infected with microtransactions and grinding GTA Online is. The Payday devs learned from their mistake and now the game is microtransaction free unlike Rockstar.Let alone the fact they've suddenly decided to attempt to kill singleplayer modding for no good reason.I guess having the 4th best selling game of all time makes you greedy huh.I can't recommend a game so blatantly anti consumer like this if it weren't for all that crap I'd have gladly given this a glowing review as at its core GTA 5 is an amazing game but it's been rotted over time by greedy publishers.

review: Note This review is concerning the singleplayer component of the game.Grand Theft Auto V is a barely interactive linear action game. It is not a sandbox game by any stretch of the word and nor is it a good game in general. Yes it is humorous the graphics are amazing the production values are high and the world is nice but all of that does not equal an engaging experience. Other than the dialogue and the scenery I couldn't find much else to enjoy in this game.I'll get the story out of the way first. While the campaign does have its moments via humor and social commentary overall it fails to tell an interesting story or at least a sensical one. It's ridiculous and over the top. With the exception of Michael the protagonists are badly written they lack motivation and aren't relatable. The trio lacks chemistry with one another and you often wonder why they are doing the things they're doing. It also doesn't feel like they are in control of their story but rather just pawns in it.The core gameplay in GTA V comes down to driving shooting and flying. Coming from GTA IV you'll notice that all of the above was dumbed down to a laughable level. Driving a car and riding a bike now require way less skill and caution cars take tons of damage before their performance suffers to any significant degree and with both cars and bikes you'll rarely lose control at any speed. Likewise shooting is now also extremely forgiving and again requires almost no skill mostly due to the lack of recoil and recovering health but also thanks to the huge arsenal of weapons you're able to carry and the practically infinite ammo capacity. To make matters worse all three player characters have superpowers which turn the game's mechanics into an even bigger joke. GTA V's campaign delivers gameplay through extremely linear missions. The vast majority of them consist of three main elements driving from A to B cover based shooting and chasing or escaping enemies in various vehicles. Of course none of the missions challenge you or require you to use your brain. You have a built in step by step walkthrough text instructing you at all times characters yelling instructions at you every 10 seconds (even if they're your subordinates story wise) waypoints and GPS routes and finally a mothеr ing skip button. Furthermore any deviation from the tightly arranged path results in a "mission failed" screen. The same screen appears if you happen to die and of course it respawns you pretty much where you died. Not only does the game not punish you for failure it actually heals you to full health and offers to skip the section.To summarize GTA V fails at fulfilling the basic requirements I have for a game. It expects nothing from the player so the player won't feel like he achieved anything. It doesn't demand tactics good driving navigational skills or any sort of situational awareness. The text at the bottom just blatantly tells you what to do. You can watch TV and eat popcorn while playing this game on mute and still finish it. You cannot defend it by saying it's a "sandbox." It is absolutely not a sandbox blowing up cars and playing horde mode with the police is not a sandbox. And to me It's a great shame that they utterly failed to put the pretty world they have created to good use.

review: Hello everyone i have spent 3314 hours in gta 5/Online.Single player stuff in game is ok but online part of game is better on so many levels which i played 99% of the time.Most of it is frustration loading and some of it can be really nice fun with friends.I got banned (for one month) after all those years of playing and being loyal and regular player.Of course all my progress was reset both characters deleted and all their properties vehicles etc...Everything i worked for over the years was reset and deleted just like that!!!My characters were 330 and 380 level. Criminal mastermind challenges and elite challenges i completed over the years with my friends are all gone too now.At the time of ban i had almost all cars bikes vehicles yachts planes etc and other fun toys that i worked hard over the years. Also had around 21 million in bank.If you have good friends you can make nice money with various business and heists in game.So why would i cheat now?I never cheated nor used mods in any way. I'm very skilled player and i know almost all tricks in game and how stuff in game works.I got banned literally for no reason you also get no explanation of course to why you were banned.How is it possible that regular player get banned like that?I don't have money to buy gta 5 every month like people from other country's.When i bought the game in April 2015 i always tried to comply to the rules. Why would i waste my money on a game just to get banned?Never really understood people who cheated in games.There must be some flaw with system I'm confused how can this happen?If I'm confused about all this what can new players in game expect?I'm now treated like a regular fella cheater/modder. Basically type of player i always hated. I will say it again I never cheated!Rockstar does not know to handle cheaters in game that's a fact. So it leaves banning to some scripts that most of the time ban randomly and yes innocent players too.Just by reviewing youtube videos they can manually ban at least real "public" cheaters in game with impossible levels like 2000 8000 that have billions or even trillions of $.Every public session has at least one cheater or more that like to participate in collective mayhem of destroying the game.Invite only sessions/friends sessions are sometimes only way to play. There's a periodic outbursts of cheatermania from time to time in game.You can report them (i reported over the years at least 1000) but they are free to ruin everyone's time in the game.You get no protection they set you on fire make you wear funny clothes and constantly explode you or make your game crash.They also give money to random players which could trigger ban. But as we can see on youtube some people are just protected and can do whatever they want (mod money abuse game mechanic do glitches etc) while others have to work to get money and get banned after for no reason. And yeah almost forgot you can buy in game money with real money using shark cards. That's why everything in game is super overpriced.So either way you are destined to end up frustrated and annoyed like me.Actually you'll end up either banned or quit the game because some neantherthal decided it want's to have fun.Rockstar has terrible support actually there isn't any.You can talk to their auto bot replying system because that's how much you are worth to them.Your support tickets are closed right away with no right to appeal. Basically you only get more frustration nothing else.That's it thanks for reading.I wish you guys all the best.Endless...

review: THE GAMEPLAYThe gameplay is really good i like the 3rd person shooting alongside the weapons and the mods getting to cover and killing some dudes was and is really really fun tough i feel some stuff have been dumbed down like phisics car destruction and melle combat compared to GTA IV but its still really really good.Theres also alot of customization like in cars clothes weapons and they all appear in cutscenes making your adventure truly yours.The missions are also fun they have more variety compared to older titles and i liked that the heists had A B options making the game replayable killing cops and causing chaos was more fun than ever and overall i really liked the gameplay its really solid and for a title of modern AAA thats a really good acomplishment.THE STORY AND CHARATERSMan this story was really really good well writen funny specially Trevor and most importantly engaging i loved all of these charaters Trevor Michael Franklin Lamar Dave Devin etc where all memorable and fun charaters this is a story that youre gonna love i know i did.THE ONLINEWell the online is a mixed bag for me giant loading times playing whit a friend sucks cuz sometimes for whatever reason when we try a game mode it goes for something else entirely or we go to separate lobbys not having the option to chose the map for the get go you need to do that before hand not being able to choose a gamemode from the menu instead you need to go to Online and overall i feel like the online couldve been much much better it just has alot of annoing inconsistencies that make consistent fun rare and far between.Its alrigth but if you re not patient good luck trying to play this.Well go buy it its really good the online leaves much to be desired but it still was fun and even if you dont like the online you still have the amazing story mode.I recomend it!

review: A fantastic game with many issues all from the greed of Rockstar. It's honestly a pity that such a well made fun and full game is destroyed by the multiplayer. The single player is untouched thank god and still is one of the best games ever made and if that is what you are looking for you need not look further than this game With engaging game design fun characters enjoyable timesinks and a deep gorgeous and active world. Very few games can even hope to match GTA V's single player experience. Sadly the multiplayer is no such paradise. With rampant cheating horrible pay to win microtransactions the utmost grind I have ever seen in a game and not to mention the treatment of players as statues with wallets. No other game demonstrates the good and the bad of extremely large triple a game development in general. The worst sin of the multiplayer however is that it shifted the focus from the single player expansions to horrible microtransaction laden multiplayer expectations. Removing all of the new content that was going to expand the single player and shattering hopes and dreams everywhere. Not only that but if you want to mod GTA V you would have to have two of the 65GB game installed onto your computer as if you even start up the multiplayer with a mod installed you have a much higher chance of being banned(also for playing the game normally). Once again if you want a fantastic single player game this is one of the best if you want a multiplayer game make sure that you have a fat wallet or 64 hours in the day to dedicate solely to this game.single player 8.9/10multiplayer 4/10

review: Overall Game I have followed GTA 5 for a long time now. I first got the Xbox One version of the game and it was amazing! I got with friends and did tons of missions not realizing that we spent half the day in the game! Then hiests came out and that made the expierience even more fun. Don't forget aboutr the story mode too. I mainly play the Online mode but I always found myself playing this amazing story mode! I would definently recommend that you try a few missions of the story mode to get a feel for the world of Los Santos! But enough of how I think of the game let's get into how the game plays. How it Runs If you are worried about how the game runs don't be. This game runs completely fine for me but that might just be because I have a decent to high end computer (GTX 970 NON OC 16gb of RAM i5 6600k NON OC Windows 8.1 64bit and this IS running on a Mechanical hard drive).This game does not require to run on a SSD but if you have enough space you might as well to make sure you are getting the best performance. Everybody say the loading screens are horrible but they run completely fine for me. It's not extremely fast like some games though. You can always mix and match what your graphics settings are to get the performance If you want me look at your computers specs to see if you can run it just send me a message. Game Mechanics I was a bit skeptical about the driving on a keyboard but it turns out that the driving was actually really fun in my opinion. Just in case though you should have a controller plugged in just so you can switch between them. On the other hand I'm not a big fan of the flying with a keyboard I would definently recommend a controller for flying. On foot this game plays amazing in gun fights. It all comes down to your opinion on how you want to play the game though. If you don't like the controls for the keyboard experiment! You can fully customize what your controls are from on foot or in a air craft! Thoughts I completely recommend this game to anyone who likes open world shooters heck why don't you just buy it already. This game is great with friends or just by yourself!

Honestly it dosn't matter how much *Free* content is relesed for GTA online all of it is placed well behind a grind that you will always be encouraged to skip. Public lobies are wank there are two kinds of people here the ones that have all the content already and are just bored or the ones being killed while just trying to grind out the medocre content every patch.Best part of it is all the new content is built in a way that force you to play in public lobbies making a vicious shart eating cycle The haves buy theire way to the top the have not's are constantly harrased in the public lobbies just trying to scrape by. GTA Online has ruined the future of the franchise and possibly the future of all games under the corperate eye of Take Two Interactive (Take Two wholly owns publishers Rockstar Games and 2K Games.)... To Quote Take Two CEO Strauss Zelnick on GTA Online "You can t give stuff away for free in perpetuity there s no business model in that. We are convinced that we are probably from an industry view under monetising on a per user basis. But we re not trying to optimise the monetisation of everything we do to the nth degree. My concern is if you do that the consumer knows. They might not even know that they know but they feel it. There is wood to chop because I think we can do more and we can do more without interfering with our strategy of being the most creative and our ethical approach which is delighting consumers. We re not going to grab the last nickel" Strauss ZelnickEven the CEO Thinks you're wank. Avoid playing anything published or created by TakeTwo or its subsidiaries.

The online mode is where things take a turn for the worse. The online mode is very grindy and similar to a F2P game like War Thunder. Everything costs a little more than a million in game dollars. Rockstar wants to make as much money off of the online mode as possible. The last few updates have been big money grabs. The core mechanics of Online is good however. You can do absolutely stupid things with friends on cars and motorcycles. You don t need a $1000 computer to play this game all you need is an AMDFX or equivalent and something above an 650ti. TL DR Good game not so good story online is main focus nowadays. Online is grindy

review: Overall a very well polished game although it lacks clothing variety(and quality since the utility vests are just too basic) certain Online features(like the heavy military grade armor from singleplayer it would be great if it was possible to call an airdrop of that thing as VIP). Also the final mission was way too basic and rushed. And as an addition to all of that the multiplayer is overfilled with cheaters most of which are abusive 10yo children that keep screaming in the mic while running all over with godmode and killing everyone with world objects explosions and other kinds of crap.2017 update From my experience of returning to the game after having upgraded the PC it's still a decent game on it's own but it has it's enormous flaws that simply can not be looked away from. Ranging from degenerative toxic community with child mentality to various glitches and exploits poor weapon balancing etc etc.As it stays right now it's really hard to tell whether the game is worth it's price or not. Sure it has a decent amount of content great storyline and all that... But when it gets to multiplayer it's but a sad scene of cheaters exploiters and obnoxious trash tearing the game apart. The anti cheat software doesn't help the game at all. After all these years I still get to see absolute scum every second session. And even those times that there isn't one you have to be the lucky one in a million to have your session stay that way for more than an hour.As a pure example to that some time ago R* decided to completely prohibit client modification which brought down all that garbage for good. Except... The toxic herd was displeased by that so after some whining they managed to get that update reverted so they could continue ruining the fun of legitimate players.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: ***EDITED FOR OPENIV MOD BAN*** In support of the OpenIV mod team I'm retracting my positive review and giving this game a negative review.I can't support Take Two's actions. Singleplayer with mods and that's about it. Don't let my hours decieve you it says I only played an hour but I've actually played probably 500 hours into this game and beaten the story mode two times about to play it a third time.I haven't gone near the online part probably never will. I didn't even go online in GTAIV just played singleplayer. For the time I played GTAV I'd say it's worth a try. The story is funny action packed and cliche but surprisingly I enjoyed the cliches. There's plenty to do after beating the game like finding hidden objects and completing time trial missions. There are also hundreds of mods out there that you can download to enhance this game. My biggest complaint is they ditched pool from GTAIV I played pool so much it was the best part of GTAIV.My favourite mod is probably the body guard mod because getting 4 strippers armed with assault rifles is good times.Something memorable is driving along the highway just as the sun is rising it's quite relaxing. Flying an airplane or jet through the mountains and valleys. Driving a dirt bike over the sand dunes. Taking a sail boat through 2 storey high waves in the middle of a thunder storm (can make those waves bigger with a mod but I found them big enough). Or stealing a passenger jet from the airport and flying off with it then ditching it at high altitude and parachuting. Exploring the bottom of the ocean as a fish. Flying around the whole map as a bird. Playing as a monkey and running around decking people with my monkey fists. Starting a traffic jams and creating fist fights between NPCs. Getting someone to chase me and make them punch me in front of the police and then he gets shot to death by them. Crash landing a jet in the mountains and managing to barely survive.Car customization is a lot better than GTAIV. You can do a lot more and add a lot more to the cars. It was fun to take a car and upgrade it with a bunch of stuff. Funniest thing is taking a rusty beater car and adding chrome paint and big off road SUV tires to it.Not sure what else to say it's good and will keep you busy for a while.Pros Tons of cars bikes boats submarines utility military and air vehicles.A lot of customization for vehicles.A lot of gun customization.Funny NPCs.Decent story with humorous cliches.Fun police chases.Relaxing atmosphere.Well built world with believable locations. (Even the bottom of the ocean is detailed with seaweed and coral which you will almost certainly never see in a normal playthrough)Custom radio station which announces your music it's been in other GTA's too but it's my favourite returning feature.Princess Robot Bubblegum. Nuff said.Wide variety of wild life from cats dogs birds fish mountain lions monkeys whales and sharks and more I forgot.Tennis mini game is fun.A lot of story mode locations are still accessible after beating the game.They brought back the military having Marines as body guards is pretty bad Some cool secrets and easter eggs.Free game updates.Cons No pool.No girlfriends. (except for Michael's wife and sex contacts which don't really count)Fewer television and radio shows than GTAIV.Can't go to restaurants anymore. Only source of food are soda machines.Can't sell drugs... This was my favourite feature in China Town Wars I made hundreds of thousands of dollars in that game buying and selling drugs.End game payout is too low.Johnny Klebitz dies and is less of a bad The writers portrayed Johnny as this really hard core stone cold killer in the Episodes of Liberty City but in GTAV he acts like a scared little boy and gets his head kicked in by Trever Philips. Doesn't make much sense. I think the version of Johnny from Episodes would've been more than a match for Trevor.Neutral I haven't been able to see a huge difference between a silenced weapon and an unsilenced weapon. Both seem to scare people easily.Driving a boat outside the map will cause it to eventually randomly sink. Driving an air plane outside the map will cause it's engines to eventually die out. this isn't a pro or a con but I'm putting it here because I have a phobia of deep water and this was probably the scariest thing in the game for me. It literally sent chills down my spine when my boat sank in the middle of no where.The game tries to make hunting a thing but it doesn't really fly since you're doing it between two busy highways. Didn't feel authentic.The buildings under contruction remain under contruction for the whole game and are never ever completed.Ordering a blimp via cell phone. Ordering a freakin' mother en' blimp with your god damn cell phone. That makes no sense strangest feature in this game imo.I almost never used my cell phone. I often used my cell phone in GTAIV for activities but in GTAV it's less of a presence in terms of features and can be easily ignored.That's not everything but it's an idea of what I think about this game. It's really worth your time in terms of singleplayer I had a blast with it and continue playing it.Nominated for Game Within A Game award (2016).

review: I've played this game for so many hours finished 100% and enjoyed every bit.There is just so much to do which brings you hours of entertainment I've felt so free in San Andreas.San Andreas is a beautiful map with quite the size and activities whether it's exploring or doing some extra missions races or triathlons you'll always enjoy yourself in San Andreas.The Online missions are very well crafted and enjoyable given that your crew knows how to handle themselves.Of course with the later updates people seem to be a bit disappointed most reviews will tell you there are an abundance of modders long loading times and overpriced items unfortunately most of this is true and I've yet to see Rockstar implement any better means of preventing cheaters. The items are indeed very expensive and you can expect a very long grind to even get a foothold in this game (like getting a Office or Motorcycle Club) and even when you manage to get this far you haven't even scratched the surface for the pricing on in game items are just ridiculous for players who have not advanced so far in Online.So Rockstar decided to add Shark Cards for those who do not feel like grinding so hard asking for ridiculous prices for almost a handful of cash (74 99 for 8 000 000$ in game will get you about 2 3 high end vehicles) the economy in the game is just very broken I usually fill up my businesses and sit afk for hours on end waiting for them to turn me a profit while I'm waiting. Rockstar has addressed the modder problem significantly I have not come across a modder for an extended period of time unlike one in every lobby back in the day. This doesn't mean there are no more modders as there are certainly a few hanging around. Players are often very ware and hostile towards others so I would certainly recommend having friends with you to help you in sessions and more importantly doing jobs together because doing everything in this game solo will make you think the grind I mentioned earlier is just a walk in the park.Otherwise there are just so many things to do both Offline and Online. I recommend this game to anyone who does not mind grinding and those with friends to help them.It's certainly worth the price you pay even if you just plan on playing Singleplayer I would just advise against spending money on Shark Cards.

review: Although I enjoyed about half of the time I spent playing Grand Theft Auto V recent decisions made by the developers involving the modding community (seriously almost every negative review in the last 24 hours has covered that) and the FREE DLC as well as me reflecting on my experience as of late has led me to realize that this game is only a good buy for a select few.From my over 800 hours spent in GTA Online I will tell you that it is not worth anybody s time unless they a) have several friends b) have a crap ton of time and/or money and c) have friends who also have a crap ton of time and/or money. The best experiences I ve had in this game have been with my friends friends who have booted up the game in almost a year.So why do you still play?I only play this game as something mindless and repetitive like an grindy MMO something I do while watching endless amounts of youtube videos and podcasts. This is the only game I have found where I can simultaneously be as productive as someone who is not distracted while never missing a word of what Philip DeFranco or the Nerdwriter1 decide to talk about this week. This is the only way I can justify spending time binging these videos even though I have a ton of free time this summer. I also semi enjoy the challenge of trying to manage my time between the various activities in game so as to maximize long term profit and have learned a lot about the reward system developed through content updates. Boring Information Incoming! Ever since last year Rockstar have been pushing out content that revolve around setting up businesses which have a high several million dollar upfront cost that generate a reliable income that is by far the best way to make money long term. Once everything is maxed out with all of the businesses offered you can make almost $400K per hour if you are working as productively as possible and know what you are doing. Not bad until you realize that it costs at least 13.5 million to get to that point meaning it would take at least 34 hours to pay off those upfront costs assuming you buy all those properties and upgrades at once and that you do not buy anything extra when purchasing your properties. This is of course if you can sit through the repetitive missions you will have to do hundreds of times in order to make that money. To add insult to injury if you were to decide to flip burgers at a minimum wage paying job in the US and use all of that money to buy GTA V Shark Cards you could earn almost 600K an hour doing repetitive work and if you live in a state like California you could earn over 800K per hour! TLDR If you do not care about doing boring work and don t mind give hundreds of dollars to Rockstar you can potentially earn twice as much as you could through legitimate methods. It is no surprise loads of smart people unlike myself have decided to either hack money into online to enjoy the game with friends mod the DLC content and more into single player or opt out of the GTA experience entirely. Now with single player mods being deliberately axed by Rockstar the only options that do not involve hacking in money which will get you banned are to grind away your valuable time at a videogame in order to buy expensive jets and cars to fill the void where your friends should be or to just not buy this stupid game. Unless you have not played the single player which is amazing.

review: This game can be whatever you want it to be. Whether you choose to see it as what it appears to be at first sight (that being the action packed reckless killing for no reason) or a real chillout behind the wheel of a car. You name it this game has it.*UPDATE the 15th of June*So how should I put this. One of the very few things that make you choose how you play your game which is essentially what this review was focused on has been halted and declared "illegal" allegedly by this game's publisher (who is also responsible for GTA Online) Take Two Interactive.Before you ask yes I'm talking about modding. In case you're new to the GTA V universe let me tell you that the modding community is a huge huuuge part of the overall GTA V fan and/or playerbase. Due to Take Two Interactive acting the way they just recently did projects like OpenIV (a tool that had been used for mods to be inserted into the game safely etc.) to a close.So my personal opinion on this product changes DRASTICALLY with this piece of information at hand. I do not recommend you to support the game over this reason alone. No developers/publisher teams should be able to create this sort of weird "monopoly" with their product and screw their customers over like this. I get it it's their product they have the right to do it. However it is certainly not a nice move one that will most definitely leave scars on the game itself.Last but not least thanks for taking your time to read this review. Also I'd like to apologize for any spelling errors/grammar mistakes in this text beforehand.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The online version of this game is a really great game with heaps to do but is completely ruined by a phone that keeps popping up on the screen and constantly ringing and it doesn't shut up EVER. While you can stop the sound the phone continually pops up onto the screen and while it is on the screen you can't select weapons or aim weapons and after twenty hours of playing the game I now regret my descision to buy the game as I don't want to play it anymore simply because the phone wont stop ringing and it continually interrupts the gameplay and is literally driving me ing crazy. I play games to get away from annoying phone calls idiot people who I don't want to talk to and work. The last thing I want in a game is a phone that I can't get rid of or turn off that literally interrupts the gameplay every fifteen to thirty seconds or so. Now I remember why I didn't buy this game years ago when it first came out because the ing phone just wont stop ringing and interrupting gameplay. Why they put this phone in that stops you aiming stops you selecting weapons and that wont stop annoying the out of you and completely ruining the gameplay I have no idea I will never buy a GTA game ever again and will go back to playing GTA3 San Andreas if I want an open world do whatever the you want game. They have made a great game with great graphics and heaps of missions and then just completely destroyed it all with a poxy phone that never stops ringing and interrupting gameplay and driving the player crazy. review: When I was only in 6th grade Grand Theft Auto V was released for PS3 and Xbox 360. That was back in 2013 and from then we have come a long way in terms of videgame design graphics and general quality (Depending on who you ask). Not only for its time but in the modern gaming landscape this is a true masterpiece of art and entertainment. Since I first played it on the PS3 a few years ago I've played it 9 times over yet to my suprise I discover new missions interactions vehicles and locations that I didn't catch previously. It seems like the world goes on forever because of the vast arid desert of sandy shores to the buzzing bright never asleep city of Los Santos. If you have ever played the other installations in the GTA franchise this is nothing like them. Everything is so much more refined and overall amazing. Above all else the character development for each character both major and minor is enough of a reason to get this game. The contrast of the ghetto life of young Franklin against the yuppie middle aged rich Michael is a good relationship that you see blossom and make each mission feel like it matters. There is minimal filler missions and the mission that are are the optional ones. This is and always will be one of my top 3 favorite games and to truly experience it to its fullest you have to play it for yourself.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

These incompetent "M O F O S" took my 60 bucks and later banned me &amp thousand others without any reason and its been 1 week since we are banned. I have posted 4 5 tickets on their worthless support service but they dont give a damn about our complains. I have never seen such an incompetent and unprofessional game development company in my life. I am already moved on from this game and will never ever support this "S H I T H O L E" company in future.P.S NEVER EVER BUY ANY GAME FROM THIS "S H I T H O L E" COMPANY OTHERWISE YOU WILL GET SCAMMED TOO
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA Online has turned into pay2win filth it's an exceptional grind to get the money to do anything and each new dlc requires a bunker or some other garbage facility to be purchased and upgraded so you can start to make your money back. If you aren't prepared to grind like it's a full time job or buy multiple shark cash cards then sadly this is not the game for you.The pricing of ingame items is a joke too. It takes multiple hours to grind to get 1mil for example (even once you have multiple businesses set up) and this won't even buy you a decent car. Let alone allow you to upgrade it.Also EVERY SINGLE TIME you log on be prepared to be bombarded with calls from random characters who wil ring you incessantly to try and flog whatever trash Rockstar has added to the game until you eventually cave. If you don't cave they will ring you every single game/session change without fail. They don't stop. It's infuriating and while I used to enjoy the game it simply isnt fun anymore unless you have a bunch of friends who play and have good enough gear to defend yourselves from the griefers and don't mind switching lobbies as soon as a modder decides to mess your game up. And dont mind hanging up on lester 15 times a day.I've only played it recently to get the free money for logging in as part of whatever random promotion it is this time.TLDR No I wouldn't recommend any new players purchase this game. At all.

review: I've put numerous hours into this game (including 800+ hrs on the Xbox version's online alone and who knows how many in single player) so I figured it was time to give a quick review. Grand Theft Auto V has received a lot of negative reviews because of the direction that GTA Online is heading. Sadly I have to agree with most of the complaints. Online has become too much of a grind. It is good to have to work for what you earn but you end up devoting entirely too much time just grinding out the same missions and jobs to try to make enough money to buy only a fraction of the things that the game has to offer. It is still enjoyable but Rockstar is simply trying to cash out by getting people to purchase shark cards. Despite this negativity the game still has a lot to offer. Single player has an amazing storyline that is very entertaining the whole way through. The world is incredibly detailed and has tons of easter eggs hidden throughout it. Playing with friends online is an absolute blast and can provide near endless possibilities. The driving mechanics are very smooth and feel really good. Ultimately this game is an experience to be had. I will always look upon this game fondly and am certain that any players (new or old) can find pleasure in playing.
title: Grand Theft Auto V
