review: So this is without a doubt one of the most polished PC ports I have seen in quite some time. Although I have found that as of late every update that comes with this game also drastically impacts performance. Now I know that most of you are thinking that this is entirely on me and that my rig isn't up to the task of running this game but I know my specs and I'll be damned if this thing can't run this game or any other game for that matter.Anyways the game itself is one of the most enjoyable online experiences I've had in a long time and for all of you out there that prefer to go it alone this game delivers an amazing story with rich gameplay and diverse campaign missions. There was never once that I felt that I was doing something as "filler" only existing to lengthen the time needed to finish the game. The gun play is extremely polished and feels fluid although first person view while shooting feels awkward as hell but while driving it is my go to view.This is my first Grand Theft Auto game so I can't speak as to how it compares or differs from past titles but despite that on its own this game is definitely worth the price. Although if you want the best experience in my opinion of course then I recommend you have a friend who also has the game and play with them online. I haven't enjoyed a multiplayer experience like this is ages there truly is nothing quite like being in a car chase while being shot at by police with armored vans helicopters and swat vehicles. All in all the game feels polished plays like a top of the line AAA game has a great campaign full of interesting characters missions and gameplay. This is a game you should probably keep an eye out for during steam sales!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Very fun game. Best played with 2 3 friends. Can be a grindy mess if your trying to make money alone. After about 1 900 hours I'm level 318 have about 42mil and about everything I can/want to buy. It really helps if you've got a group of buddies that helps you out and you can run with. had about 5 10 people on every day at 1 point then got into a good secure money making crew for a few months until the 2 crew leaders fell out and broke it up lol. I still play from time to time and i really hope to God that Red Dead Redemption 2's multiplayer is not this broken. D So should you Buy this game? Yes because the price was cut in half and with RDR2 multiplayer still about a year out I'd say this game's got about 2 4 years before GTA6 Online comes out and makes this game irrelevant. So go play the single player first to get a good feel for the game and then get out there and grind/shoot your way to the top! 9/10

review: It breaks my heart to do this but Rockstar and TakeTwo need to learn you don't handle someone using a tool in a way in which it was never intended by completely banning the tool altogether you talk to the tool's creators and mention the issue with the tool and suggest they look into fixing it. Cars are sometimes used to run people over or commit crimes but you don't see people banning the use of cars do you? TakeTwo need to take a step back and think about what they've done here. This kind of business practice can have a HUGE impact on future sales If people think you're a scummy company they're not going to want to buy your product anymore. This hurts not only your company but as a publisher it can have a negative impact on the sales of every single game you publish and if you earn that kind of reputation nobody will want to come to you to publish their games meaning that you lose a ton of future potential clients.Take two is signing their own death warrant with this little stunt. It's only a matter of time at this point before they lose all credibility and can no longer stay afloat. Too bad about Red Dead Redemption 2. I would have really liked to play that game.

review: Personally Grand Theft Auto V s extraordinary scope is summed up in a couple favorite moments. One is from a mid game mission in which I piloted an aircraft into another aircraft battled the crew seized control of the aircraft and then parachuted out and observed it crash into the sea to avoid death at the hands of incoming military fighter jets. A different time whilst driving about in an off road motorcycle I got distracted by something that appeared like a trail up one of the San Andreas mountains. Turns out it was a path and I spent 15 minutes following the trail to the summit where I almost ran over a group of hikers. Typical! one of them screamed toward me. That is one of the things I enjoy with GTA 5 the random callouts and yelling by the AI.I could go on like this for ages. GTA V has an plenty of before mentioned moments big and small that make San Andreas the city of Los Santos and its surrounding areas feel like a living environment where anything can occur. It both gives you enormous freedom to explore an astonishingly well realized universe and tells a story that s gripping thrilling and darkly comic. It is a leap forward in narrative sophistication for the series and there s no mechanical element of the gameplay that hasn t been improved over Grand Theft Auto IV. It s immediately noticeable that the cover system is more reliable and the auto aim less touchy. The cars handle less like their tires are made of butter and stick better to the road though their exaggerated handling still leaves plenty of room for spectacular wipeouts. And at long last Rockstar has finally slain one of its most persistent demons mission checkpointing ensuring that you never have to do a long tedious drive six times when you repeatedly fail a mission ever again.Positives Free multiplayer Intrusive story modeNegatives (mostly online) Bad Anti Cheat system with ban waves that causes suspensions even for legit players et there are still many modders It has a lot of bugs Tuns of super long loadings screensGrand Theft Auto V is not only a preposterously delightful video game but also an exceptional and sharp tongued satire of contemporary America. It represents a purification of everything that GTA IV brought to the table five years ago. It s technically more accomplished in every imaginable way but it s also exceptionally ambitious in its individual way. No other world in video games comes close to this in size or scope and there is sharp intelligence behind its sense of humor and gift for mayhem. It tells a compelling unpredictable and intriguing story without ever letting it get in the way of your own self directed experiences through San Andreas.I would give this game a 9/10 for the story mode but a 4/10 for the online aspect.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Not worth it unless you're cheating.Game mechanics are overly complicated and poorly expained on purpose.Input delay is annoying and not fun.Combat is flawed and not fun most weapons are completely useless.Flight controls are gay.Missions gets repetitive or are played only once because there are better payoffs.Cheaters and glitchers are running rampart.Bugs are still present.Banned people for using singleplayer modsPut all of the above aside because the following is the main and biggest reason why tar is killing this game and why people hate the game and stop playing it 90% of the content in the game is bought with via in game money. the important ones are the ones you are gonna use the most including cars aircrafts seacrafts heavy vehicles property and specific heists.The problem? 60% (and that's lowballing) of that 90% of content is bloatly overpriced on purpose.why?Because you can bypass this problem with buying the in game money with overpriced real life money. Already the microtransactions in a paid game especially in a triple A game is a red flag but let's continue.Hypothetically you can unlock all said content for free of course but for the average player it won't happen and here's why Rockstar intentionally designed the game so that to get expensive stuff you'll have to grind. a lot.not just a few hours. but days just to get a couple of millions for that 1 car you wanted.and its worse than you think.The game constantly over complicates missions or mislead adevrtised content to squeeze money out of you.and it's not only that the game finds every way possible in you do to squeeze as much as money as possible from your character.and its still not only that because the rockstar artifically increases mission and money making time by either putting delays while grinding or puts unnecessary obstacles in your path purposely making the destinated objective location as far as possible from the cheapest starting point(your apartment bunker facility hangar office vehicle warehouse that are required to actually start doing stuff).Heists are hard to complete not because of any real difficulty but because the community is nearly braindead from all of rockstar's skull g practices they die or leave all the time for stupid reasons and in hard mode(which is what you aim for because of extra pay bonuses) 1 death will literally make you lose and either restart from a checkpoint or leave.even after the hard work and time input the payment sucks anyway. and if you're in it for the story you won't do it more than once.Dispatches are fast and more forgiving but are also too repetitive and pay about 15k for about 5 minutes of work.Every content update after release only gives you a taste of the BBC of said content via specific missions where you can drive the new cars or they gibs you the new weapons and the costs of a single car goes up with each update.They went full EA with the years and want to make you as angry frustrated and desperate as possible via repetitive low paying and time consuming missions to make you purchase overpriced shark cards that costs more than the game itself to begin with that give you less than 8 000 001 Million $.an example for the grinding is this This is the most efficient way to make the most amount of money Source import/export of cars and it goes like this Step 1 Buy the cheapest office and vehicle warehouse which are about 2.5 million combined.Step 2 Go to your office waste 5 seconds for the sitting animation and waste another 6 seconds for the leaning in and logging in animation. press the "source vehicle" buttonStep 3 Gtfo drive for 2 years through traffic to steal a car. either hop right in or kill some enemies. sometimes theres an annoying part of following a car/picking it up and a Carbobvegene.Step 4 Drive for 2 more years through traffic to your vehicle warehouse either chased by cancerous enemies or DA POLEESE. call molester and waste 600$ to save time and get rid of the police because of the broken star system. a good mention is that getting the car damaged will cost you a repair fee about 5 000$ on average.Step 5 Go to your computer waste more time on the animations choose a car to export. you WILL choose top range and the specialist for maximum profit.Top range you ask? You have (i guess) 1/3 chance to find a top range car when you source one increased by the more standard and medium cars you have. You will waste 20 000$ to randomly mash your keyboard to change the appearance of your car.Step 6 Drive for another 2 years through traffic to the DESIGNATED location pursued by godlike AI that drives better than you ever could shooting at you. again damaging the car will reduce your payment usually around 5 000$.After you finished you get up to 100 000$. but hol up you wasted 20 000k for the upgrades and around 10 000k for repairs so the total profit is 70k(if you export a top range). You can export up the 3 more in the same time with your friends. if you have any. but they only earn 9000k from this.Step 7 Repeat steps 2 6. but after the 15 minutes delay after exporting This is the best way to grind money as it can get annoying repetitive and time consuming just to get 70k.in between exporting you can source vehicles or you can do the annoying and repetitive dispatches that pay you 15k.The average good car costs around 1.7 million without all fo the upgrades. the really good cars cost around 2.4 Million. You do the math.Unless you have an anime profile picture you probably don't have time for all this just to enjoy a game.

review: Scrapped my old review. I went from not recommended to yes I do recommend it but only for single player.This game is fantastic in singleplayer. I like the story thus far I love the graphics I love the gameplay I love the characters I love the humor ... it's all so wonderful. Plenty to do. Runs well too. Plenty of graphical settings to choose in order to get the fps you want provided you're not running on a toaster/potato.I have near max settings capped at 30fps (I prefer consistent fps) with an i5 4690K an ASUS 760 OC and 8GB RAM. Very enjoyable. WIll be a lot more enjoyable when I get one of those newer cards! )However...I would NOT recommend this game for mutliplayer at all in its current state. Rockstar are overbearing parents and the game is full of hackers and trolls. Not my idea of a good time. I would definitely stay away from GTA5 if your only desire is MP unless you wanna get banned for doing nothing wrong (seems to happen a lot) or you want to troll people selfishly screwing up other peoples' fun because you lack integrity.I'm a long time GTA fan. I played the original 2 taht were 2D. I played a lot of GTA 3 VC and SA both on console and PC. I couldn't get into 4 honestly feel it was a terrible game compared to the others. Mostly GTA4 runs like garbage on the PC is full of painful jaggies and the camera when driving really irked me.

review: I bought this game for ps3 then got it as Christmas gift for the PC. I have a very powerful rig as I do 3d modeling and such and for the whole year the game ran fine up till the beginning of this year when it started not saving and started shugging a bit. Also the fact that they only care about massive multiplayer pisses me off to no end. I like a story and that's why I got the damn game in the first place. Now I'm done with it cause apparently they don't give a crap about the people who played the game when it wasn't online. 174 hours played on pc but more then 500 hours played on the ps3. Would I say buy I don't know as I have been a long time supporter of R* but with that said I don't think they care about that anymore. I can't give it a thumbs up because of all the problems that happen in the game along hackers. I do belive they should have the abilty to do so but not at the cost ruining someone else's game. Not till they fix these issues would I recommend this game to anyone.

review: I went to a clothing store to buy a nice set of pants I went to pay and the clerk told me that they were $500 each. I was like whatever I have the money I'll buy a pair. Damn these inflation rates.Across the street I see a guy who punched a woman and nabbed her purse. I jumped out of the store and took somebody's bicycle to catch up to him. I was going to lightly run into him with my tire but I ended up rupturing his kidney upon impact which left him spewing blood. It was sad but I picked up the purse to return to the woman.Unfortunately the LSPD had caught wind of me stealing a bike and had already converged on my location. I tried telling them that I had to do it to stop a purse thief and that I'd give the bike back. They wouldn't listen and pulled out their guns on me can never be too careful i guess. I then rode through an alleyway with bullets whizzing past me can't believe the police are spending their time hunting heroes nowadays (Now I know how Captain America and Spiderman feel).After a few miles of riding I was exhausted the police were still on my tail. I needed to get something that I didn't have to expend my energy on like a car or motorcycle. Fortunately there was one of those teensy smart cars in the parking lot that I had resting in. I broke the window hotwired it and sped away. I made it to I 1 heading towards Mount Chiliad man this car was quick quick enough to lose the cops after a few minutes of swerving around traffic. I ended up at a bar near Sandy Shores $500 dollars richer but I left behind both my pairs of pants back in Rockford Hills.Pretty good game haven't played singleplayer yet.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: TL DR The game runs like a slideshow after between 30 mins and an hour as a result of a memory leak rockstar haven't acknowledged the issue community solutions only delay the onset of the issue at best I've been able to get 1h30/2h before the game becomes unplayable. The game itself is completely fine gameplay great story decent etc etc however there is one MASSIVE issue with this game since an update that occured around mid 2015 (as far as I can tell from trawling google).Essentially the game suffers from a disasterous memory leak which results in ever increasing stuttering regardless of your rig to the point where the game becomes unplayable. There are countless solutions on the internet none of which actually solve the problem at best they delay its onset by maybe 10 minutes. Some have condescendingly suggested upping RAM from 8GB to 16GB but from reports I have seen this only delays the onset of the stuttering (you might be able to play for 2 hours rather than say half an hour). Lowering settings doesn't work adjusting control panel settings doesn't work and setting priority doesn't work. My rig Intel i5 4590MSI GTX 1070Even with the above on Med/High settings the game begins to stutter after around 30 45 mins becomming unplayable after maybe 1h30m. The game runs fine up until memory and pagefile usage is topped out RAM isn't being cleaned like most games do hence the memory leak. I have seen people with rigs far exceeding mine reporting the exact same issues since mid 2015 nothing has been done on rockstar's behalf to solve this issue. Any solutions provided by the community only delay the issue slightly even restricting the game to 30fps results in maybe a delay of around 30 minutes. The game needs to be fixed before it's worth buying. If you have a console and really want to play the game you're much better off getting it on there.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Rockstar has become one of the most greedy and pathetic game developers I've had the displeasure of dealing with. I can't begin to describe how disapointing this game is. They removed EVERYTHING that was good about GTA 4 and created a cash cow. They're still charging full price for a nearly 6 year old game. There is NO support for offline play. They've abandoned the single player experience. All vehicles they put out cost in excess of $1 000 000. You cannot play the game without a group of friends. Every "Update" Is a some stupid new add on that requires guess what? $1 000 000 to buy yet another stupid base. The physics are terrible the driving is horrible. Driving a Semi Truck brings the same feel as driving a Super Car. The Rubberband physics for the police is like something out of a 1999 PS1 game. Don't even get me started on the Toxic community. I've been followed an harassed even when in Passive mode. So badly you have to change servers constantly. The children that own all the upgrades will hunt you down and make it impossible to have any kind of fun. I wouldn't reccomend this game if it were $10. When playing online you get this ing beep that reminds you to buy the latest crap they've put out. Then you get a phone call every 3 seconds guess what? Reminding you to BUY MORE CRAP.The offline story is You get a pathetic washed up criminal who's wife is ing the yoga guy. A typical gangster black character who's really a wimp. And the deranged lunatic that is sure to have every 11 year old laughing with his jokes and bloody rampages. Horrible game awful greedy developer. I'm really hesitant to buy Red Dead Online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Seriously what an absolute waste of money.GTAV is if nothing else a giant mess. When things do work you can guarantee it won't last long.Online has about 120 different issues at any given time from poor servers to garbage availability. Games constantly disconnect or refuse to connect at all. I was feeling a little bit nostaligic for some GTA Online due to all the progress I made so I downloaded it. Tried to get online 3 times. Failed every sing time. Promptly uninstalled.GTA was cranked out as a cry from fanboys to get something good. It almost was.Hesits are a great idea with the most garbage execution possible. Not only is it a giant grief machine due to the way it's designed but they take FOREVER to load. And if one person disconnects (bound to happen frequently) so does every else. WHAT.Conecting to online takes FOREVER to do even with a SSD.The only salvaging grace about this game is the spats of fun you can have in between the disconnects server failures frequent cheaters and bugs. It still isn't worth it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Came back after a few years without playing. Thought online would be fun with all the new stuff. It definitely would be except for the sheer number of "modders"/"hackers". Now don't get me wrong most players are not cheating online but just enough are that I haven't been able to find a free play in the past week that didn't at least have one person cheating.This may not sound like a big deal at first but here's what I've seen so far Spawning invincible vehicles (think rocket plane with unlimited ammo spraying the map with explosives)Invincible playersSpawning money (that yes it is a grind to get but that is what gives it any value!)Auto completing missions (sure you get a few grand for it but you don't get to actually PLAY the game...)TeleportingThese will absolutely suck the air out of your experience. Online is run by modders.If you think you can play the online without encountering a modder think again. There seems to be a critical mass of 10 or so players that can be in a free play before you're pretty much guaranteed to have a modder ruining it for everyone. GTA Online is pointless in its current state.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The only game where I felt there was genuinelt nothing to lose by cheating and potentially getting caught and banned. Either I have money to play with and the game is actually fun again or I can no longer play the game and am no longer tempted to see if it's still frustrating to play.The game can be a lot of fun playing with friends but that applies to anything. Playing solo as I did for almost 600 hours the game is a tedious array of loading screens and waiting for other players to join the heist hoping that they're competent and won't quit out. Repeat that for a week or so and maybe you have enough to buy one of the many recently added toys Rockstar added into the game.The real fun of the game is messing around in freeroam with all the planes trucks etc that the game has available but even after 600 hours and running into several hackers that spawned vast amounts of money for me I was still broke and having to grind endlessly every time a new update came out.The game is genuinely fun at times but Rockstar have worked so hard to make sure you have to earn those moments and it simply isn't worth it any more. The most fun I ever had in this game was after I finally started cheating when I could buy whatever I wanted without having to worry about how much I'd have to grind to get that. But then I got banned a few hours later and haven't reopened the game since then.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

A "wanted" system governs the aggression of law enforcement response to players who commit crimes. Grand Theft Auto Online the game's online multiplayer mode lets up to 30 players engage in a variety of different cooperative and competitive game modes.Great Game in my opinion. We can spend lots of hours without noticing playing.

review: I have over 300 hours on this game yet they still believe that I am somehow hacking? They have no proof of my so called hacks and I have had modders drop me money but I wouldn t consider that my fault. I just got my account back from a one month temp ban about a week ago and I happened to log on today. I saw that I somehow had 25 million on my RESET NEWLY MADE CHARACTER! I didn t know what to do in this situation so I just let it be.A couple hours after I log off of GTA Online I recieve an email stating that I have been permanently banned from GTAV online and there will be no arguments or repeals to this ban. I find this to be 100% unfair. I did not have any hacked clients installed on my computer or downloaded into my GTAV files. For whatever reason I had 25 million in my account so I let it be. It wasn t my fault that it was there. Apparently Rockstar thought it was! This game would be so much better if they didn t ban people for the dumbest reasons. You had me hooked GTA but you have lost one of the few chill members and good customers from your community. Thank you for constantly f*cking me over. Kudos to you.I highly do not recommend this game until Rockstar and Take Two get their heads out of their asses. Goodnight folks.

review: GTA V is a very very big game. The community around this game have been changing and modifying the game to make it more fun and enjoyable for years and the PC version has stood out as being the best version for its incredible customizability from settings to mods. Take Two saw this thriving ecosystem and decided that instead of letting it work and improving it that they would C&amp D a critical SINGLE PLAYER ONLY mod that is REQUIRED for safe and fair use friendly modding called Open IV. I wish bad things on a laughably small amount of people but Take Two have Taken Too many good things from our world and I hope they reconsider making such a blatant anti consumer stance on something that they have LITERALLY no right to stop

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 is a master class in world buidling design and single player open world story telling. Unfortunately GTA Online is a toxic pay to win dumpster fire. Even more unfortunate GTA 5 was originally intended to have single player story DLC. Instead of extending the excellent single player experience Rockstar decided to invest those resources in continually releasing new content for GTA Online. This wouldn't been so bad if nearly every ing thing weren't behind an in game currency paywall. In order to progress and even access most of the content you need to constantly shell out currency and lots of it. If you want you can spend an additional $40 right off to avoid a ridiculous grind in order to access a good portion of the content but even with it there's still more content to buy though you will be equipped to make in game currency much easilerIf you've interested in the single player experience which is fantastic buy this game.If you're interested in a multiplayer crime game check out Pay Day 2 or something along those lines.If you're OK with super predatory p2w mechanics and one of the most toxic communities on the internet...you'll be right at home here.Buy this game if you're interested in the single player experience.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V was one of the most influential and 'game'changing titles in recent years and it was one of the best games of all time. HowEVER as a five year old game it's been getting stale. The countlless free (but mandatory) DLC updates for Online all feel the same and make you wonder why the in game currency seems to be worth less and less each time. Obviously it's microtransactions. Don't play this game in 2018 (on second thought if you havent played it yet why not). Play Watch Dogs 2 instead that one was underplayed. Not much point to writing a review for this nowadays but it's gotten old and the DLCs aren't much but a posthumous reach for a few extra cents.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Ahh rockstar. the gaming giants creating the ultimate crime playgrounds since the 90's. Then GTA V comes out becoming one of the best selling games of all time. there was a wide world to explore 3 protagonists all with different abillities and backgrounds and some of the most beautiful graphics to exist at the time. Sadly the initial release didn't include a PC version and everyone was annoyed since a PC version means tons and tons of mods to enhance the gameplay. Then a "Next Gen" version came out with improved graphics realistic First person mode and... still no PC release. Everyone got a bit more annoyed. Finally 3 years after the initial release of GTA V the PC Version comes out and the internet Rejoices. The Community is hard at work creating new mods like the hulk a zombie apocalypse a trainer that lets you do ing anything. All is well until just today when it was revealed that the backbone of GTA modding OPENIV got a cease and desist. Everyone is going ing berserk and they have the right to. I can understand banning people for using mods in multiplayer but making it near impossible for your community to continue enjoying a game they've bought 3 ING TIMES!? While my point remains above I will keep my word and return my positive opinion of the game.Game's great just that rockstar has trouble listening to it's fans sometimes.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

There are many things to do such as stunt races heist missions CEO missions or motorcycle club missions which is mainly drug dealing and all that stuff etc. But when you want to play any of these you must join a room which is mostly formed by 4 people. Since there are many options it certainly will take a time to full all the positions. Beside the waiting for any mission this game is still a huge fun even in freemode. You can just meet with ordinary players in map and do stupid but funny things like trying to stop the train or going in military zone. By the way i should warn you about hackers. I know many people said there are modders but their number is growing everyday.

review: I have been a dedicated GTA fan buying the games on almost every platform that Rockstar has had including multiple platforms for the same game. I bought GTA V on PS3 PS4 Xbox 360 Xbox One and Twice on PC. Unfortunatly Rockstar has banned my account for no aparent reason and will not let me know why. I have not played GTA V online for almost 6 months and I have never modded the game. If I legitamatly did something to ban me I would like to know what it is and not just tell me that bans are not able to be appealed. Normally I would recommend a game that I personally bought 6 times but I was very dissapointed with Rockstar about this issue.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I love the single player mode but Online has been engineered in such a way that it favors those who buy shark cards and its hard to argue that the starter pack isn't pay to win given the instant advantage it gives over new players who would have to grind for hundreds of hours to match. This has resulted in a two tier experience online where players who paid for shark cards and the starter kits are treated favorably by other players while those who just want to play online without paying anything additionally are treated like a nusiance by the paying players. At the very beginning I've been religated to solo sessions because I can't find people who will play with me anyway and the higher level players liked to use me for target practice or killed me indirectly so their mental state would be unaffected. Overall all this has made the whole experiance sour and the atmosphere toxic when its clear there is lots of fun to be had here.... but only if you are willing to pay more for it otherwise you'll be treated like an outcast by both Rockstar and players.This definately a departure from the great experience I had with Red Dead Redemption and GTA IV online experience. Overall I am very disappointed.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's not R* banning mods and making everything obsurdly expensive it's T2 to blame. review: Oh boy the game everybody has been waiting for SURELY the newest GTA won't have ALL of the issues that GTA 4 had I mean it does NOT have GFWL it's years later so it SHOULD have better servers... the story mode SHOULD have a character creater mode (Something ALL of the Saints Row games HAVE had &amp the story mode not only did NOT suffer but was awesome for what it was I think the last 2 SR games story about Hell was/are utterly stupid )... I digress SURELY this latest GTA game will be ALL of the things a game like this SHOULD be coming from a company all of Us loyal PAYING fans made rich with so many purchases of their games over the years... SURELY this game is AWESOME SAUCE dipped in molten CHOCOLATE?!? No sorry this game is WAY worse with the idiotic ghetto trash single charcter (if you play as anybody else in story later I'll never find out I have no desire to be a ghetto trash wanna be gangsta minority in ANY game) with a playable NWA music video for a story mode one that's ridiculously perverted (h0m0s3xual dogs3x... your aunt asking for footrubs &amp other inapropriate physical attention etc.) utterly stupid in the way the games inhabitants act AND speak Oh &amp you CAN play offline with a whole bunch of characters (I can EVEN make one that looks like Me) but you'll get no weapons no missions &amp cannot save any progress dirrector mode ...I have SIXTY MB/s netspeed on a "gaming" PC that's less then a year old... I can play lagfree on MMOs with servers over 5 thousand miles accross the ocean but cannot connect to GTA's cheap 20 year old server like EVER. if you go by all the various forums around the net neither can MOST players AND the ones who can... get random lagspikes &amp disconnects for no reason what so ever EVEN playing in solo online modes...The game may LOOK nice but that's it... no matter how much in game cash you spend on the game's TOP END vehicles &amp motorcycles they ALL handle like crap which is sad because even going top speed they feel/look like you're going about 40 MPH compaired to real life driving... The one single airplane I've found to fly yet also handled like utter crud Saints row TWO (not 3 or 4 or even 5 BUT TWO) had vehicles planes &amp helecoptors that handled WAY Way way better then these do. Maybe if Rockstar cared more about gameplay &amp fun factor (a term often used in the 90s by game companies back when games actually WERE designed with FUN in mind) instead of eye candy to sell more copies to their target audience that they OBVIOUSLY hate... this game COULD have been the best all around game ever made but instead it's the last nail in Rockstar's coffin for MANY people who like Myself feel as though they've been duped.If you think playing a WAY worse story mode then GTA San andreas had (which was actually witty &amp fun despite being forced to play out an NWA video) as a ghetto trash minority in an idiotic &amp utterly repulsive version of LA &amp never want to play online or as a custom char that looks like you then by all means purchase this game if you plan on playing online go shell out 1 000 bucks for a new Playstation &amp hang online with all those mouthy kids.TWO updates later the have to turn off your video card to boot up the game error HAS been fixed but it didn't fix anything about their cheap old trashy server connectivity issues that MOST players have on PC ...I cannot believe what Microsoft &amp EA have turned the video game industry into since about Y2K but it's utterly disgusting sad that in order to play games that aren't broken &amp are still fun We have to dig out old copies of games that're a decade or more old... You broke My heart Rockstar We're through *drops mic* ###Update###Okay after playing the game online for awhile "IF" your online mode will work there's TONS of neat &amp fun stuff to do on this game... You can make a custom avatar to use online (even save more then one per profile) The editor is a little hard to figure out at 1st chose mother+ father then toggle which you look more like then chose skintone etc. After that the edit is pretty easy took Me a good hour juggling the mother/father bits to get one that even remotely looked like Me but in the end it's worth the effort I guess... Watch out for hacktool users online as there was almost always one in every session I was in but when people start mocking them they usually leave also watch for campers sitting outside places like where the tutorial ends etc. All n all if they manage to get MOST (preferably all) players to stay connected online with future updates &amp server tweeks I do highly recomend this game... the story mode is still offensive &amp ridiculously "ghetto".**Edit** "IF" you can connect &amp stay connected online want to spent an hour making your avatar &amp don't mind at least 10% of the people you encounter in freeroam &amp jobs (races deathmatch heists etc.) being hacktool users then this honestly IS an awesome game... the cars almost always spin out when you "TRY" to drift but the peddal bikes &amp motorbikes drift quite well The stats they make you build up during the game glitch out in multiplayer the custom tires glitch out on motorbikes BUT none of this is that big of deal nor does the bugs make the game unfun... the engine Saints Row 2 was made with is WAY better for the way vehicles handle across the board yet this game overall if the 1st sandbox game to top SR2 in overall "FUN" factor. Oh &amp the plane races are asinine &amp all aircraft handle like crap... Hey Rockstar go play Saints Row 2 1 000 hours for each dev then fix your planes AND car drifting. Still if you have a decent netspeed &amp 1/2 decent PC you will prob enjoy GTA Online GTA 5 storymode will always suck.

review: I've played Grand Theft Auto V for 300+ hours. Which is enough time to beat the game multiple times and enjoy a couple hundred hours of multiplayer. If you want a good review this might be it.The game is a good addition to the series. It is a great display of the newest generation of graphics and gameplay. Here is my breakdown PriceI pre ordered this game for $60.00 USD. I think it is worth that price considering how much it has to offer. I haven't seen a person play this game for less than 100 hours before moving on. And it's a game you can come back to in a couple months. It definitely isn't cheap but it was one of the biggest game releases of the year taking thousands of people to make. The price is to be expected with a game this big and this long awaited.DifficultyThe game comes with many different options to make it as enjoyable as you want it to be. It is quite customizable. Online it can be a bit challenging. You face high pressure pvp situations at times and at others you might play with hackers. The heists are also quite hard at times. It was a good time all the way through and continues to be. The only real difficulty might be running the game with lower end computers.Overview and RatingThe game is great. I would say it is worth the price for not only the campaign but also (if not mainly) the multiplayer experience. It is great to play with friends. I would recommend it to anybody that likes the older GTA's or any games of the sort. It has also had quite a few DLC updates after it's release which is great.I would give the game a 9.1/10. Here are pro's and con's Pro'sFunGreat multiplayerGreat graphicsLots of contentCon'sHigh priceRampid hackersMay be hard to runAll credits go to Rockstar. Thank you.

review: All that needs to be said has been said.ProsIt's GTA the most cutting edge game every iteration. The driving is top notch. The races are top notch. The gun play is better than orther GTAs but still not the best but fun.The missions are well designed. The map is well crafted.The performance is very good on my mid ranged rig. Cons.The characters are obnoxious and the worst of the series.The writing is garbage not smart like the previous games.The story is sloppy and the married with children angle is just dopey TV farty sitcom with more cursing and a 'edge'.Most of the jokes are just edgy to be edgy.The NPC bantar on the street is zzzzz which is very disapointing because GTA was the BEST at that. The map is small like IV.The races have a 'cheat' for the main driving character which makes it too easy. Since the driving and the driving routes are the best of the series it gets a thumbs up. It's an impressive game despite the horrible writting. At this point the price for the game is right.

review: This is a great example of how game can just turn from best game ever to a Mostly I will talk about online mod but there is something I have to say about single payer too. Single player is just great really enjoyed it. Rockstar always made sick storys of their games max pain red dead redemption and all other series of gta. This one was even better. Graphics were good for that year that it came out. Gameplay is really good in single and online mode. But when you finish the snigle player you go to online. And here where the starts. I bought this game only for online I played single player after 300 hours of gameplay. First time gta online was good enjoyed it 100%. But then people just randomly started blowing you up. Not just doing it with RPG or some other explosive guns they were just hackers. I dont know if you get banned or no but in every session there were like at least 5 hackers. Some were just getting XP or money. Ok i dont care if people use hacks to get xp or money but when i drive and randomly die thats the thing i care about. After couple years rockstar didn do with that even I think now people just hack in sessions and rockstar dont do After some couple updates we saw some flying cars and bikes with missles. Ok my question is WTF? They made this game grinding all other updates are either some cool flying with rockets machine gun and you become god inside or grinding property like office moto club and bunker. Its all about grinding money to spend on some OP Its not fun anymore. But anyways i guess I enjoyed time that i spent on this game hope rockstar know what they are doing because i cant tell if they actually do.

review: Caveat emptor. I mean this. You buy this at your own risk."A solid single player game"The story is pretty good. You switch between four people Michael Franklin Trevor and your online character."This game is like Pandora's Box " my friend Toki Zensekai says. Once you get it open NPCs won't stop calling you to spend money you don't have on things that are temporary (considering that this is being offered as a free service I believe they can take GTA Online down at any time)."GTA Online is an accurate representation of crime and capitalism America. People who cheat and build off of the hard work of others get richer and hardworking schlubs who stick it out eat ramen with no lights or running clean water and a lack of healthcare."The community is toxic and will put in misleading Steam Guides like "how to make money" and then it's contents will say "Pray for a modder to give you money."Online modding and begging modders for money is for scrubs.How to make money in GTA Do whatever the feff you like. Do you like to race cars? Do that. Heisting? Do that too. Anything you want. Just don't cheat or ruin other people's fun.However all the cool stuff is so god awfully expensive. I heard one Youtuber say "cancel your Red Dead Redemption preorder and never buy another shark card". This is the state of the gaming industry. People afraid to hold onto their money because they're afraid they'll be left out of the new cool thing.GTA does everything it can to get you to buy Shark Cards. I'm not feffing joking. Prepare for having no life because you'll spend it stealing business supplies cargo and vehicles because EVERYTHING costs money and LOTS of it.People are grinding this game because they can't afford all this expensive stuff. I stopped playing GTA because the game doesn't respect my time. Upon replaying it it still doesn't. The toxic PVP makes the grinding like pulling teeth it'll be all over soon just a few more minutes of your time. Waste your life fighting toxic edgelord e thugs so that you can spend more money on Shark Cards so you can get that weaponized vehicle to fight them with only to be blown out of the sky/water with a new thing that was released a week later.The PVPers and griefing modders want you to stick around for as long as possible and endure whatever whimsy they have. I report the modders vote to kick and move on. But for every modder I report five more show up. And the newbie players don't help in votekicking they're too busy kissing modder's ashes to get free money.I'm not saying you should not play multiplayer there are good people in this game. I've met them.They work their Vitruvian sculpted ashes off for money for things they MIGHT be able to afford.These people I love them. They make this game worth it.I will never miss the PVPers or the griefer modders or money modders. I hope they have the day they deserve. If you think that's me being polite you need to think about that statement a little further.Singleplayer is fun to play. Multiplayer with friends and productive players is fun too.The multiplayer is riddled with issues and let me explain by drawing comparisons to other "open world" games.Saints Row The Third NPCs are reasonable some even come equipped with pistols to defend themselves.GTA Pistols FEH. I have a car and no regard for the online character's life.Fallout 4 Let me compensate you for that mission you did for me.GTA Congrats you made a sale for a friend you get NO MONEY.Saints Row Congrats on taking out that Stronghold now here's the money for doing it!GTA Looks like you rolled a plane sale! But oh it bugged out! You won't be able to finish the mission or your plane blew up!GTA Online suffers from what my friend SpazzDragon calls "Mosquito bites of B.S. " basically all these little things that Jarate you off to no end that make playing the game less than enjoyable. You can't just boot it up and feff around. You have to make money the way R* wants you to. You have to fight other players like R* wants you to. All while dealing with these mosquito bites. And then maybe you can scrimp and pinch pennies until you can afford a weaponized vehicle to fight them with and maybe THEN you can feff around until the modders/greifers show up in your lobby.It's a good thing the Onlline portion is free for people who own the game because if it were a paid product I'd probably be even more angry. Category Score/Other Graphics 5 Music/Sound 4 Gameplay 3 Story 5 Customization 4 Community Toxic PVP Toxic Grind Insane

review: Source IGNFor me Grand Theft Auto V s extraordinary scope is summed up in two favourite moments. One is from a mid game mission in which I flew a plane into another plane fought the crew hijacked the thing and then parachuted out and watched it crash into the sea to escape death at the hands of incoming military fighter jets. Another time whilst driving around in an off road buggy I got distracted by something that looked like a path up one of the San Andreas mountains. Turns out it was a path and I spent 15 minutes following to the summit where I nearly ran over a group of hikers. Typical! one of them yelled at me as if he nearly gets run over by a rogue ATV on top of a mountain every time he goes on a hike.I could go on like this for ages. GTA V has an abundance of such moments big and small that make San Andreas the city of Los Santos and its surrounding areas feel like a living world where anything can happen. It both gives you tremendous freedom to explore an astonishingly well realised world and tells a story that s gripping thrilling and darkly comic. It is a leap forward in narrative sophistication for the series and there s no mechanical element of the gameplay that hasn t been improved over Grand Theft Auto IV. It s immediately noticeable that the cover system is more reliable and the auto aim less touchy. The cars handle less like their tires are made of butter and stick better to the road though their exaggerated handling still leaves plenty of room for spectacular wipeouts. And at long last Rockstar has finally slain one of its most persistent demons mission checkpointing ensuring that you never have to do a long tedious drive six times when you repeatedly fail a mission ever again. Grand Theft Auto V is also an intelligent wickedly comic and bitingly relevant commentary on contemporary post economic crisis America. Everything about it drips satire it rips into the Millennial generation celebrities the far right the far left the middle class the media... Nothing is safe from Rockstar s sharp tongue including modern video games. One prominent supporting character spends most of his time in his room shouting sexual threats at people on a headset whilst playing a first person shooter called Righteous Slaughter ( Rated PG pretty much the same as the last game. ) It s not exactly subtle he literally has the word Entitled tattooed on his neck and the in game radio and TV s outright takes don t leave much to the imagination but it is often extremely funny and sometimes provocative with it. Grand Theft Auto s San Andreas is a fantasy but the things it satirises greed corruption hypocrisy the abuse of power are all very real. If GTA IV was a targeted assassination of the American dream GTA V takes aim at the modern American reality. The attention to detail that goes into making its world feel alive and believable is also what makes its satire so biting.Grand Theft Auto V s plot happily operates at the boundaries of plausibility sending you out to ride dirt bikes along the top of trains hijack military aircraft and engage in absurd shootouts with scores of policemen but its three main characters are what keep it relatable even at its most extreme. The well written and acted interplay between them provides the biggest laughs and most affecting moments and the way that their relationships with one another developed and my opinion of them changed throughout the story gave the narrative its power. They feel like people albeit extraordinarily f***ed up people.Michael is a retired con man in his 40s filling out around the middle as he drinks beside the pool in his Vinewood mansion with a layabout son air headed daughter serially unfaithful wife and very expensive therapist all of whom hate him. Franklin is a young man from downtown Los Santos who laments the gang banger stereotype even as he s reluctantly seduced by the prospect of a bigger score. And then there s Trevor a volatile career criminal who lives in the desert selling drugs and murdering rednecks a psychopath whose bloodthirsty lunacy is fuelled by a combination of methamphetamine and a seriously messed up childhood. The missions flit between their individual stories and an overarching plotline that involves all three and it s a credit to GTA V s versatility and universal quality that each character has his share of standout missions. As their arcs developed I felt very differently about each of them at different times they re not entirely the archetypes that they seem to be.This three character structure makes for excellent pacing and great variety in the storyline but it also allows Rockstar to compartmentalise different aspects of Grand Theft Auto s personality. In doing so it sidesteps some of the troubling disconnect that arose when Niko Bellic abruptly alternated between anti violent philosophising and sociopathic killing sprees in GTA IV. Here many of Michael s missions revolve around his family and his past Franklin is usually on call for vehicular mayhem and extreme murderous rampages are left to Trevor. Each has a special ability suited to his skills Franklin can to slow time while driving for example which gives them a unique touch. Narratively it s effective even off mission I found myself playing in character acting like a mid life crisis guy with anger issues as Michael a thrill seeker as Franklin and a maniac as Trevor. The first thing I did when Franklin finally made some good money was buy him an awesome car because I felt like that s what he d want.Trevor feels a like a bit of a get out of jail free card for Rockstar providing an outlet for all the preposterous antics and murderous behaviour that otherwise might not fit in with GTA V s narrative ambitions. I found his violent insanity a little overblown and tiresome at first. As get out clauses go though it s pretty effective and Trevor s over the top missions are some of GTA V s action packed highlights. It s a successful way of solving a problem that s prevalent in open world games the tension between the story that the writers are trying to tell and the story you create yourself within its systems and its world. Grand Theft Auto V accommodates both masterfully allowing neither to undermine the other. Last but not least Grand Theft Auto V is not only a preposterously enjoyable video game but also an intelligent and sharp tongued satire of contemporary America. It represents a refinement of everything that GTA IV brought to the table five years ago. It s technically more accomplished in every conceivable way but it s also tremendously ambitious in its own right. No other world in video games comes close to this in size or scope and there is sharp intelligence behind its sense of humour and gift for mayhem. It tells a compelling unpredictable and provocative story without ever letting it get in the way of your own self directed adventures through San Andreas.It is one of the very best video games ever made.

review: So far I can say I like it. The story's good the gameplay is pretty solid the game world is highly reactive and there's a lot of options for customization. The pace of advancement on GTAO is nice.However some downsides GTA requires you to for.. Whatever reason register a second 'social club' account if you wish to play it *at all*. So keep in mind that your product is kinda held to ransom behind that. But on a personal note I really didn't care.The online servers are somewhat unreliable and i've stopped playing public sessions because I encountered hackers almost the second I was put into the game. The tutorial weirdly seems insistant on forcing you to play online with people potentially exposing a player who's trying to learn the game to players of greater skill or as in my personal experience a hacker. An experience that could prompt some people to demand an immediate refund!That being said what has irked me most is the aggrivating way that Rockstar has set up the story to online transition. If for any reason you get pushed from an invite only session to a public session you will have to wait for several loading screens because the only way to change to a private/invite session again is to load story mode and then load GTAO again. You also have to launch the game in story mode initially if you wish to play in a closed/invite only session. The missions are enjoyable i'd recommed rockstar consider adding in some basic AI for things like races and 2+ player missions so that players can choose to race against or do multi man missions with AI for lesser rewards. I understand the point of GTAO online is to play online but there's really no reason not to accomodate as many people as possible and i'd love to team up against AI with my friends in the "PVP" jobs.Just my two cents. Overall great game worth the money.EDIT 10/23/2017 Finding rockstar's servers to be incredibly unreliable. Multiple times i've been disconnected mid mission and forfeited of all my earnings as a result.I also have at least one friend who's unable to play and has found it hard to troubleshoot the issue because Rockstar makes no real effort to visibly provide fixes or tips for problems that are experienced by a *lot* of people. Rockstar's general attitude towards customer service seems to be to do as little as humanly possible.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is an incredible game with hours upon hours of entertainment. It has bucketloads of care and attention to detail for just about everything such as an informative yet simple UI extremely satisfying and consistent hitreg hyper realistic ragdoll physics semi destructible environments unique handling for different cars well designed missions easter eggs and the list goes on. The story is expertly put together with very few (if any) plotholes incredibly likeable main characters and many relateable side characters. The atmosphere is spot on where every separate area of Los Santos makes you feel like you're really there from meth farms in Blaine County to Superficial cars and people in the hills to graffiti and gangster ridden slums everything is perfect. HOWEVER GTA Online is not nearly such an instant hit. While the atmosphere is largely intact and much of the attention to detail is carried over there are a few massive problems with GTA Online that can make or break it for you. GTA Online awards players money and RP mainly for three things completing jobs completing heists and participating in freeroam activities. Even then people rarely play any jobs besides the job that gives 2x cash and RP at the time due to how over saturated the jobs list is. This also makes the create a job feature near worthless because nobody will ever want to play a street race after they do a rocket voltic stunt race. This narrows your money earning options significantly as you could imagine.Heists are incredibly fun the first time you play through them with tons of dialouge (not yours obviously) and decently entertaining setup missions. However there comes the problem that missions designed for heavy team coordination do not work well in an environment where you'd be lucky to find someone with a mic that isn't screaming epithets.This leaves what is in my opinion the best money making method freeroam activities. Owning a motorcycle club/business/corporation/gunrunning is very fun while simultaneously being tense because you're doing it in the company of people who can snatch it right from you. However this isn't as well paying as heists and getting dominated by a 6 person MC is not fun in the slightest.On the bright side there are a plethora of things to buy whether it be to expand your business or just luxury goods. However this leads to the issue where you can't buy anything because you're not earning enough. But don't worry shark cards and subliminal messaging come to save the day! With constant annoying calls from side characters telling you to buy things from all the separate expansions i feel you're being pushed to buy into the shark cards.And then the most glaring issue of them all is modders. Modders run rampant in GTA Online. In fact they run so rampant that the community got fed up of calling them hackers and began to call them modders. Half the servers you get into there will be a modder whether they're openly killing everyone or just constantly spawning in vehicles for themselves they'll be there. And on nearly every server you'll see people asking and begging modders to give them money. And the best part is that R* has employed a team of chimps to stop this from happening considering so many people have been banned for having the modded money levels and weapons that modders gave them.On a brighter note the expansions for online are free even if you probably can't afford to participate in them and playing with friends can be pretty satisfying.TL DR If you want to buy GTA 5 and feel like GTA Online is a nice bonus for the pricetag buy this game immediately. However if you want to buy GTA Online and feel like GTA 5 is a nice bonus for the pricetag go buy san andreas and play with the online mod for that game because it is ironically moderated much more and has a far less toxic community.

review: GTAV is a genre defining sandbox game I mean what game *isn't* at least partially based around mechanics forged from the series? Over the decade it has evolved and developed into a unique title with every console generation. Now for the online game. I want to like GTA Online. I really do. Since I purchased the game I have not sat down for more than an hour of online foolery with friends without at least one modder/hacker/scriptkiddie dropping in and parking a bus in my garage or insta killing my cargo shipments from across the map. Or selling off all my cars. When I do (and it's a rare occurence) manage to find a lobby that's not full of hacked cars or screaming kids I do manage to have a half decent time. Until I hit a paywall needing another 2 million dollars to progress my business. Rather than provide interesting diverse gameplay to achieve the many expensive things in the online mode (and there are a lot of expensive necesary items) Rockstar chose mircotransactions. Lots of them. For the low low price of 9.99 or so you can chop nearly a dozen hours off any grind for any item through the in game "shark cards" (aptly named payment for direct progression). "Oh but they're not necesary!" Sure. You can grind for dozens and dozens of hours for a small bit of progression and the Shark Cards get a little expensive for larger purchases. You can hit your head against that wall as long as you want. However as far as I'm concerned direct money out of your wallet for small chunks of progress undermines the entire point of the online game. TL DR The game is quite enjoyable at its core however total lack of moderation or consideration towards players spoils the online mode. Microtransactions although not totally necesary to progress ruin my enjoyment of the game by always lingering there as an easy out option.

review: GTA 5 modding has recently been declared illegal by its publisher Take Two Interactive.Take Two Interactive has sent a cease and desist letter to shut down OpenIV the biggest singleplayer modding tool for GTA games since 2008. This has effectively killed modding for GTA 4 GTA 5 and Max Payne 3 and may affect modding across the entire industry.Unfortunately Rockstar seems to be supportive of this decision to ban modding for their games as there has been no opposition on Take Two's decision from their part.I will not be buying another Rockstar or Take Two game until this is fixed. I urge you to consider doing the same if you believe in the value of the modding community not only for GTA 5 but for any game.

review: Rockstar themselves have forgotten what this franchise is about. It's a good game riddled with ridiculous weaponised vehicles and items that never needed to be added and bugs that have never been fixed some since release.Nobody ever asked for an orbital cannon either. Its literally like paid first party mods for players with actual modded money. It costs 750k to fire once. One time. One target. 4 8 hours of grinding for me and that's money wasted on something that can be done with a single sticky bomb and a 4km trip in most cases.750k can buy a top of the range sports car and all of its performance mods. 750k can buy an MC. 750k can buy like 5 high end apartments. It used to take me an entire week to grind to get the Kuruma armored on the Xbox 360 version.The base game was great. Import export was a great dlc. Gunrunning smugglers run and Doomsday DLC was some of the worst dlc to ever come to this game. These DLC's make it harder to do NORMAL CEO/MC free mode missions.The amount of bugs sometimes makes this game unplayable sometimes forcing me to restart the game and wait about 4 minutes to get back into a good low population lobby where I can be safe from modders (there's about 2 per 20 pllayers in a public session on PC)I also enjoy this game most of the time and I enjoy import/export missions and it really sucks that some idiot in a flying car or motorcycle can lock on to me and destroy 80k worth of car. The risk is too much sometimes. I've actually been so angry from playing this game sometimes. It's the masochistic sadists at rockstar to blame not my bad driving or defensive tactics or the 10 year old on the chrome oppressor it's rockstars greed. Absolute disgust for most of their employees.The thing I really enjoy though is the amount of pure vehicle customization. There's no licensing of vehicles or vehicle parts so they can literally put any (non weaponised) car in that they feel the community would enjoy. The Elegy retro is my favourite car. The manchez is my favourite motorcycle.It's like driving a really nice car covered in feces. There's something good under all of it.I hope GTA 6 does not include ANY weaponised vehicles unless they are about as powerful as a normal tank or hydra with the same Pegasus delivery style. That's how much I could tolerate. GTA 6 should ONLY be focused on what this game is about. Stealing cars and driving cars. But they let the greed take over with GTA V but only after 2 or 3 years.Would not recommend to new players. You have to be a player since release to have a good time.And the amount of time between dlc's is getting to the point where i wont touch this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I could go into details but then the review would be far too long. So Rockstar has made a game with alot of potential here but sadly Rockstar only cares for their games aslong as they can make money out of it. And in the case of GTA the only updates that are brought out are content updates so there will be more vehicles and more things the player can spend money on so that he will buy more sharkcards. There are no updates for things like bugfixes performanceimprovement or weapon and vehiclebalancing. Also there are just general gamemechanics in GTA V that are either absolutely cancerous (for example when your charackter decides to roll down a hill with 3km/h and then just ing dies and you respawn on top of the whole god ing mountain again) or just not in the game (for example crouching &amp ledgegrabbing which were both extremely helpful mechanics in GTA IV).So I would say the game is playable and you will have fun with it at some point but it's not worth the price.

review: Well looks like the Grand Theft Auto series ends here with greed from Take Two and the CEO treating customers like his personal piggy bank all whilst whining that he could monitise GTA V even more and that if he did the customer might start to notice .I never did like GTA Online with its pay to win microtransactions and sending OpenIV a cease and desist sealed the series death for me.Goodbye it was a grand old time and F YOU TAKE TWO.Update Dec 2018 They continue to add new content to online hackers and cheaters are rife still and no care for any single player DLC or extra features or missions it is all about the money that online makes.Grand Theft Auto V is probably the end of the series for many and considering RDR2 has a similar online grind that is designed to make Take Two and Rockstar as much money as possible leaves me with little hope for the next GTA game. Companies that are this large making this amount of money with a system like online and milking it for all it is worth start putting profits before game design designing games around a model that profits rather than what is good or innovative.GTA Online feels like it was designed and built from the question What can we (Take Two and Rockstar) do to maximise our gain from all the players? rather than What experience can we offer to the best of our ability to the players? .The GTA singleplayer experience now takes a back burner and is turned down to a simmer whilst online gets all the spices and heat turned up. This nelglect of GTA V's singleplayer experience is why I will no longer consider buying future GTA games.GTA is no longer the king of openworld games there are plenty of other developers who consider game making an art that is first and foremost about the players experience all whilst keeping it singleplayer cough CD PR cough.RIP Grand Theft Auto 1997 2015 Damn you DMA design you made some great games once.

review: Still a fantastic open world game. Most of the negativity comes from normies who played the multiplayer too much.The actual single player is top knotch. I have never played a game that has such good writing and characters whilst also being so insanely hilarious at times. Everything is a lot more seamless than gta 4 and the gameplay mechanics are beyond anything you could reasonably expect from a sequel. The only actual issues I have are the downgraded Physics and the overabundance of killing in the single player missions.You'll notice that the physics for enemies aren't nearly as detailed as they were in 4. Enemies aren't as reactive to getting shot at as they were in the previous game.The technological downgrades aren't a huge deal but the excessive killing can hurt the story a bit. Like I know the trio of characters are experienced but I don't really think they can down 30+ guys in the span of 15 20 minutes.However I think that's more of an issue with video games in general and not gta 5.It's just something that stuck out for me as I played.Everything else is great though lmao. Buy it

review: This game suffers from a wide range of issues HUGE grind as well as a large amount of hackers &amp toxic players. Singleplayer itself is rather alright though it's a bit lacking in activities.I'll focus on some things hurting the game (primarily Online) Possibly one of the most toxic online communities nowadays. Expect people to use the most OP / cheesy ways to kill you including a hitscan RPG. More about that later. Connection issues disconnecting game moving you to a different server and away from your friends you just played with. Very long loading times it's often faster to load into single player and then multiplayer than straight into multiplayer. Also those long loading times continue even after you got into multiplayer and are just hopping between gamemodes heck they don't have to start. All that needs to prompt a load is you accepting an invite into a game lobby (more precisely waiting room) You can't use Steam Overlay when loading because said loading will simply pause. Bad and laggy melee combat system. Hackers. There's lots of them and they have HUGE range of abilities you think an enemy constantly spawning in a jet (which normally takes time to get is very powerful and can be super difficult to take down) is annoying? Well I hope you don't meet hackers who can kick you out of the session or crash your game by spawning dozens of clothes on you. Limited clothes. Rockstar has been improving itself when it came to clothing adding some new models with every larger update (although they still never added the objects available for all three main characters in singleplayer). However those clothes are often of poor texture quality and aren't available in all colours. You like red? Well that's a shame we only have pitch black white brown navy blue camo desert camo forest camo and two hideous mixes. Also don't expect to make your entire outfit match the green you have on your sweater will most likely be different from the one on your cap. Also the game is really strict on what you can wear with what for example you can wear this jacket with these shirts but not with those shirts or you can wear a scarf with pink tanktop but not with black tanktop. Car customization is a bit eeh in the game. Many cars aren't very customizable the best thing you can do in many of them is lengthen the sides by a couple of centimeters. Some cars aren't customizable at all and you can't even put them in your normal garage. Heists are pretty damn boring. They're nothing like in Singleplayer where you have multiple approaches places to set up your escape vehicles et cetera et cetera. In GTA Online heists are pretty much standard missions with some story behind them you don't have a choice in how to go through with the mission. Also if somebody leaves during a heist everyone will drop out. Combine that with the connection issues and you'll see the possible infuriation. At least the stories and cutscenes are fun.. Things are extremely expensive (up to several millions) in order to 'encourage' people to buy Shark Cards AKA cards giving you in game currency for real money. In reality you get little currency for huge amount. You need to grind a lot for money.. or find a hacker who will simply spawn millions for you to pick up. Though you're likely to get banned even if you never intended to pick up any money that the hacker spawned on you. GTA V uses a level (rank) system for its weapons so you'll be able to unlock specific weapons at specific levels. ...Except that they added free widely available DLCs which add the best weapons (stat wise) to purchase with no rank restrictions. There's a complete lack of balance not even an attempt at it. Aside from the aforementioned nonsense with the levels Rockstar started with things like fast bullet proof vehicles and eventually reached explosive bullets which can be applied to a sniper rifle creating a hitscan RPG that I mentioned. Perfect for killing players with one shot to the big toe. Their customer support is infamous for being useless even in really urgent cases like having your account stolen. If they reply to you then their bot will copy paste you a useless response about how bans are permament when you asked for something else. Rockstar releases huge content patches which you need to pay tons of money to get into. CEO update? Pay at least a million for an office then few hundred thousand for a warehouse. You also have to pay for crates which are the main missions in this update. Oh yeah randoms can completely destroy all your progress during the final mission when you sell said crates. They're even encouraged to attack you. The recent Gunrunning upgrade allows you to conduct research in order to get things like weapon mods (including the explosive ammunition for the Hitscan RPG mentioned above). Research takes.. 4 real life hours I believe? You need to be online through it all and you need to keep your supply meter high you either buy those or steal them (AKA do a mission one that takes place in the full lobby so everyone can attack you while you're doing it other players even get a ping to let them know about you!). There are 45 research upgrades that means 7.5 days of playtime. Of course you can speed up the research with sweet $$$ and what better way to get it than with Shark Cards! Oh the research is random too you do not get to pick what you want to get next. Oh yeah Singleplayer doesn't get anything. Not even the many vehicles that appear Online. Rockstar likes to patch stuff! Especially if by 'stuff' I mean harmless glitches that for example allow you to equip a mask with a hat something you can't do normally and yet it looks perfectly fine no clipping or anything. Having lower graphics specifically ones that change the amount of nature puts you at a gigantic advantage. Having said option put to lowest absolutely removes grass which can be rather high in this game leading to situations in which you get headshotted by someone you couldn't see behind it all. There are also some facts like that Rockstar fooled customers by raising the price of GTA V when Steam Summer Sale 2015 started (so the discount it got was equivalent to its standard price of 59 99 ). Not only that they included Shark Cash Card. Said Shark Cash Card gives you in game money. Sounds pretty sweet right? Except that it counts as a redeemed DLC the moment you get it which means that you wouldn't be able to get a refund for GTA V because of it.In 2017 of course there was the fiasco with making mods illegal.All in all singleplayer which I didn't focus a lot on as it's rather okay has a nice story likeable characters although it's lacking in activities and is very unlikely to receive any sort of story enhancing DLCs. Online is terrible imbalanced toxic and Rockstar's greedy attempts at taking more money aren't helping the game as a whole. If you're not sure whether to get it or not ask yourself if you have friends to play with because trying to find yourself in the community will be problematic. Don't get it just for the singleplayer. And don't get it for full price.It's a shame really at its core GTA is a super fun game but everything Rockstar built on top of it only dragged it further down and down.

review: Review based on online play I'm a tremendous fan of the series. Had it for Xbox 360 then bought it again for PC. I've tried to defend it but I'm done.It's possibly one of the best games to have ever been released but R* insists on making it otherwise. I had my account adjusted previously because of some money a hacker spawned on everyone on the server that was fair although even the money I had made was taken. Now with this update all my money was wiped even though not a single cent came from a modder and there's nothing any of us can do about it. Each update brings ridiculously priced objects with the money making close to unbearably time consuming cashing out peanuts at a time for hours of work. For nostalgia's sake I'll probably keep playing but the disappointment of the players is loud and it's all falling in deaf ears.

review: The singleplayer is great and very fun the multiplayer however is complete crap infested with hackers tons of "free dlc" that exists to add yet another way to grind out cash slowly and a few vehicles that all normally hover around 1 2 million ingame dollars. This is to get you to buy "shark cards" with the largest being 8mil for $100 which might buy you some of the content for larger updates but often for these ones such as smuggler's run the bikers update gunrunning and the ceo updates will cost you 20 40 million dollars. You are also unable to use mod menus to spawn in multiplayer content in singleplayer with the game removing it almost instantly after spawning. Some vehicles such as the ramp buggy from gunrunning are actually buffed up for the test drive mission with the ramp buggy being near indestructible in the missions but in free roam they get destroyed after ramping 5 cars at the most. The online community is toxic and will flame you for killing them in grant theft auto a game known for massive amounts of death and destruction and especially if you do what the game tells you to do and blow up their shipments from the afformentioned updates and even more so if you use something such as the hydra VTOL jet. Some positive things now the soundtrack is pretty great and features a variety of music it's pretty decently optimized and even ran at around 30fps on low 720p on my old GT 730 and the singleplayer is very fun to play even more so with mods. However it does get old after completing the story and messing around for 10 hours or soScores Online 1/10Singleplayer 7/10Overall 4/10

review: Now I'd like to make note this isn't a critique of the actual quality of the game. The quality is wonderful. This is also not about the single player mode. This is about online play.For quite a while griefers were making this game near unplayable. From my personal experience lately this has luckily been increasingly been solved as I am experiencing it less each update. But there are still issues with the game if you're a solo player.I understand that Rockstar wants you playing with friends but that is not always an option. So you try and get in an heist or game. Some of these go pretty quick. Most of the time though if you aren't playing one of the game types that are either double xp/cash or one the game is suggesting you probably are going to be waiting a long time. It would be very nice if Rockstar would make even a couple solo heists that are either specific to 1 2 players or some that can be done with 1 4 instead of either needing 4 to even launch it.I'm glad Rockstar is still updating the game and thoroughly impressed as to how far and fun the game has came but it's definitely still a "play with friends" game and not the best game to play alone.
