review: NOT RECOMMENDING THE ONLINESINGLE PLAYER IS RECOMMENDEDBut really the online is a shameful cash grab ripe with hackers and griefers. Persue at your own risk. The singleplayer on the otherhand is handsdown one of the most fun and engaging experinces this generation. They really did a marverlous job in that department. If only Rockstar actually cared about singleplayer and expanded it with additional content more than the online. Not only did they do more for the online the singleplayer content in the base game is all your going to get. Online is the go to because that's how they are going to make the most money with the microtransactions. I would say wait until a sale just because of the shady and downright disrespectful practices Rockstar had begun to lean towards. review: Pretty good game. It requires a pretty good pc but if you have a decent pc just go into the game directory and disable shadows and put render scale on 1/2 and it will run a lot better. I went from 9 fps to 50 fps just by disabling shadows and setting render scale too 1/2.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Where do i even begin with this game. I've been playing GTA for almost 4 years (2014 2015 on Xbox One before i got banned) and i have to tell you that this game is a bittersweet pill to mei despise the fact that the online is a chaotic grindfest these days as i had seen better days when it was simple fun and rewarding but i absolutely LOVE the singleplayer i spent 300 hours on singleplayer alone just replaying the missions and having fun with mods. Everytime i get sick of it or mad at it i would still come back to it and play more GTA Now lets move on to the conflicting part of the review Online Online is flawed chaotic and hectic but it's still fun as There are still nice people online and i happen to know 30 of my friends just playing online Online is rage inducing but everytime i quit i'd still get back into the online world sure the vehicle prices are alot but who needs those to have fun you can just download singleplayer mods for those vehicles so would i recommend it? Yes
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Pros Beautiful and detailed open world from sunsets over the ocean to the busy streets of Los Santos and the moonlit mountains in Blaine County. Thousands of hours in and I am still finding small and interesting details that I have never noticed before. Engaging singleplayer with three main playable characters with their own special abilities and quirks. Wealth of free content updates for Online every year since launch adding new features heists game modes weapons vehicles properties etc. Great soundtrack including the in game radio. You have the ability to record and edit singleplayer and online gameplay clips from color filters to camera angles in the Rockstar Editor to easily produce high quality video content or screenshots. You also have a Content Creator that allows you to create your own races and deathmatches to share with the GTA Online community. Ability to use third or first person point of view. Even though the game lacks official mod support and Steam Workshop it has a massive modding community for singleplayer and third party multiplayer mods like FiveM. (This is also a con for vanilla GTA Online.) Cons Online on PC suffers from a long term toxic community and cheater epidemic. It's probably nine times out of ten that every full public lobby that you join will have some kind of cheater using mods in it and they either keep to themselves or mess with everyone spawning objects on people griefing players in weaponized god mode vehicles or kicking players instantly that they don't like from the lobby etc. (Keep in mind even with the community the way it is there is still plenty of chances to find amazing people and have epic experiences.) Shark Card microtransactions. Extensive grind in Online. Long loading times. NPCs can be a nuisance sometimes with how normal civilians drive and get in the way. Overzealous police that will stop at nothing to kill you practically driving under tank treads on purpose to perform a PIT maneuver. Some Online mission related enemies are just bullet sponges with laser like accuracy. "It's LJT ugh with some bad news..." "Hey there it's your partner LJT..." "It's LJT. Guess who I just spoke to? Hmm?..." "LJT you got a minute?..." "Just your friend LJT..." "It's LJT ugh with some bad news..." "Hey there it's your partner LJT..." "It's LJT. Guess who I just spoke to? Hmm?..." "LJT you got a minute?..." "Just your friend LJT..." Conclusion Sure Grand Theft Auto V has it's issues but overall I think it's well worth it. Just be wary of the frustrations that may come along with GTA Online like the grind and the cheaters. If you can look past that this is one of the best games ever made.

review: About GTA 5 GTA 5 also known as Grand Theft Auto V. Most people will think Freedom of wandering Freedom to pull the trigger and Freedom to violation of the law. This is a sandbox game with highly DOF! GTA 5 has two modes come with Single player (Story Mode) and Multiplayer (GTA Online) . PROS Highly DOF. (Degree of freedom) Characters of story mode have great personalities. Graphics are breathtaking. Huge map. Great story. Driving more realistic and easy to control. GTA Online will update DLC regularly. You can troll your friend in GTA Online. Compatible with controller. CONS A lot of buildings aren't accessible. Inablity to rob banks/pull off own heists in free roam. Anti Cheat Sytem of GTA Online is suck. Many Modders in GTA Online. (Modder can also be called Hacker) Easy to get mistaken ban when you play with Modder. (But Modder is safe) Rockstar will not unban for you. PRO TIPS If you saw Modder in Session GTA Online quickly change the session to prevent you getting mistake ban. Don t take Modder s money drop. Do CEO Mission in Solo public session can prevent getting griefing by other players.

review: This is a great game when it decides to workI have had this game for about 8 months or so and it installed just fine and worked fine for about a week. After that the game just randomly decides to not function for a number of various reasons that it decides are a good idea. Now this doesnt happen all the time or daily but it does happen offten enough that it has driven me to give it a negative review.Here are a list of just SOME of the problems that i have encountered while trying to use this game. Game boots up fine and boots into the story or online fine but after about 5 10 min in it crashes and give some cryptic error message about the graphics not being initiallized or something. ( i know this not to be the problem with my computer because i have had this problem happen on THREE computers all with different hardware) Game doesn't even start. Click on the GTA V icon looks normal but crashes and says it failed. Game just randomly doesn't work anymore had to reinstall twice before it worked again. deleted my clound sync data and i lose all of my progress in the game. (i had finished the game) decides not to connect to online just because (not my router as i went to youtube and it worked fine also i dont think it was there servers becaseu a friend of mine could get online just fine.) Straight up vanishes from my desktop. I'm not kidding no i didnt uninstall it was just gone one day ( The icon just vanished not the whole game. while using hardware capable or getting 60+ fps on high settings GTA decides that a solid 10 15 FPS is way more playable. (probably not my hardware as a friend had the same exact thing happen to him.)Now dont get my wrong when the game funtions it is a phenomenal game amazing graphics great story great gameplay etc. But the fact that it crashes and breaks this much is very annoying not to mention the presence of online hackers. Oh and also people seem to be getting banned for no apparent reason.

To fix you have to close game or get a program that periodically wipes your RAM... which i wouldn't recommend. ( or you could run it off a disk but come on.. we ain't console wierdos)

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I remember watching the final prerelease trailer for GTAV and preordering immediately. I showed all my gamer friends the trailer for Online it felt like the true next generation of GTA was here. Online began as a letdown missing key features and hampered by inexcusable technical problems that still persist today. Ultimately it became the force that ruined any positive future for a game that I was thrilled about on release. I wish I could return to these characters in storyline DLC. I wish I could rob that casino as Trevor Franklin and Michael. If the DLCs that were supposedly planned and leaked online are true what we got sucks even more in comparison. Oh and all that excitement was for the 360 version. I bought this ing game twice still hopeful there may be more singleplayer content someday. There's still a cool world and a great story mode in the base game but there are companies that deserve your money much more than Take Two does. I can't even fathom how much money they've made off this pig at this point. And now they've had the audacity to ban singleplayer modding tools yet this game uses peer to peer networking and is fundamentally broken from an online security standpoint. The dlc they sell for thousands of points consists of textures that take minutes for an artist to complete and recycled content from scrapped story dlc that would have turned less profit than it did nickel and dimed through shark points.

I would consider buying a shark card except for the fact that I could buy every good Bethesda game for the price of one Megaladon Card.What is the point of buying a game if you have to practically buy the game again for every DLC just to play the DLC.If they added private servers with mod compatability they could solve all of their problems but they are too busy being greedy to appeal to the customers demands. title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I'm gonna be talking about the online mode for this review because i didn't bother the single player that much. From what I've played it's pretty good but that's not the point of this review. I have mixed thoughts on GTA Online the Graphics dialog controls and presentation are all amazing but that's just the base game. The online itself is pretty fun. When you're in free mode you can alot without any money and even more with alot of money. You can run people over have gun fights steal vehicles and just mess around with your friends. It's pretty cool but you'll get tired of the stuff you have after a while and you'll need too get money too buy more guns and vehicles. This where the money making comes in. There are a couple ways of doing this such as playing online minigame type stuff doing heists or starting a buisness. Too start off you'll wanna do the heists and get the funding for them from either entering other peoples heists or minigames. There are 5 major heists in the game and 3 extra "doomsday heists" which require you own a facility. Now playing these heists with friends is extremely fun and enjoyable and it's probably my favorite aspect of the game. All the heists are extremely well designed too be fun and engaging. But the problem is the isn't alot of them too do and once you done them all you can only do them again which isn't as fun the 2nd time around. But once you done some of the heists you'll have enough money too buy a buisness which can be used to grind for alot more money. The problem is that most of the missions you do in these buinesses are extremely boring or repetitive. The only fun missions are in the bunker jobs but they don't make enough money too be a a good grinding method. But just messing around in free mode is pretty fun but here comes my next problem...This game is plauged by having a (sometimes) awful commuinity has probably the worst hacker problem i've ever seen.I've been in multiple games where everyone is trying too ruin me finishing my buisness or when I kill someone and they litterally got into my friends webcam and threatend too said they'll ruin my computer in 2 days. Nothing happended cause i'm a safe boy but my friend was affected. Too do your buiness you NEED too do the glitch where you on a server on you're own but still counts as a public server. Now the hackers they are everywhere. They will constantly blow you up drop bags of hacked money on you making this stupid menu saying that you can't receive any more money from drops keep coming up. They will teleport too you blow everything you own up making you have too call the stupid insurance company every 10 seconds and even one time they kicked me from online and it glitched my game making it so i can't join back so i had too restart my game. Some hackers aren't that bad but some can be nightmarish. I don't mind if people are hacking aslong as they don't keep screwing me over. I have alot of good friends who are hackers and they don't screw any one over so i don't mind them hacking because every thing is overpriced in this game and that brings me too my next point.Everything is too expensive. It can take a very long time too grind for money in this game and depending on how you're doing it can be insanely boring. Everything on the store can be $1 500 000 $4 500 000. The money seams realistic until you realise from one heists you can get around $70 000 $1 250 000 at max. the adverage heist payout is around $500 000. This means if you wanna get money from heists you have too repeat them alot of times. If you wanna do it from buisnesss lets take the car stealing buisness for example if you steal a top range car and pay $30 000 of for high deal you can make $100 000 but that's for 1 car so you'd have too repeat this alot of times and not all cars are top range so this process can take alot of time. The reason I think it is like this is too promote the shark card feature where if you pay $10 you can get $1 250 000. This is dumb because i don't want too pay for money i want too earn it but if earning it takes a really long time then what's the point. This is probably why alot of people resort too hacking so they can get all the cool things they want without having too do much and i can understand that in a way. Overall the online mode is fun if you're willing too put up with toxic people/hackers and spend ALOT of time grinding for cash. I'd recommend playing for the heists and then stopping once you've done everything with them. Use the money you get with it for funding the next heists with friends and for the facility too do doomsday then once you've done that buy something cool with they money you earned and then stop playing and move onto a different game too play with your friends. I'd rate the online mode a 6/10 fun but flawed. Hopefully they will improove on the problems in the future. Thanks for reading my review ) i hope i have helped some people with there choice too buy the game. I've heard alot of great things about the story any way so you'll have that too and the online minigames are pretty fun so enjoy that too. Thanks for reading )
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Let me tell you I got this game on release date on Xbox 360 again on PS4 and again on PC. I worked hard on my multiplayer character I had everything I wanted and more I was level 140 something and then I got PERMANENTLY BANNED after their stupid broken "cheater system" banned me when a modder came in dropping cash They have THE WORST support. I tried emailing AND calling them and it's like robots they just say "there are many reasons a ban can trigger we cannot reverse it". I've never hacked nor have I attempted to go to multiplayer without removing singleplayer mods. That brings me to another point singleplayer. After being permanently banned from GTA online I decided to mod the crap out of singleplayer so I can still enjoy the game. Well guess what? ITS ILLEGAL NOW! There is absolutely no reason for me to play this game anymore I can't enjoy online mode with my friends without rebuying the game first and there's absolutely nothing to do in singleplayer UNLESS they can come out with that stupid singleplayer dlc that we've been waiting for 3 years for. All rockstar and take two want is your money don't let them fool you. You'll be needing the $100 shark card to afford a single car from any dlc and fully upgrade it. This game went downhill real quick and rockstar claims they're against take two taking down OpenIV but they also lied saying it allows you to mod multiplayer when in fact openiv gives you a warning and will NOT allow you to go into multiplayer when you have mods installed So they are clearly lying but trying to seem innocent typical rockstar for you.Overall Review Terrible Support if you could even call it that.Terrible anti cheat systemTerrible banning system bans innocent players over and over againNo single player dlc and probably not comingStill no jetpack that Chiliad mystery has been on for 3 years and still nothing newNo more mod support because it's "illegal"They just want your money

review: I've enjoyed this game but only in spite of the terrible decisions made by Take Two (and to some extent R*). GTAO only exists to promote Shark Cards and removing mod support is just another move by T2 to get people to convert their real people money into fantasy money. There are items in game that end up costing either &gt $100 IRL or 20+ hours of farming but at the same time they can't up their security to prevent modders from locking you in your house blowing up your vehicles or removing your guns so you have to re purchase them. Network infrastructure is slow (5 10 minutes to connect to the server) and finicky at best constantly dropping connections and dumping you out into Single Player so you can mash buttons through a cutscene just to sit through another 10 minute load screen. The worst part about this game is that it's fun so you end up putting up with most of the t but if they're going to spit on their players that are modding their single player experience because $700 MILLION DOLLARS A YEAR IN REVENUE FOR A 4 YEAR OLD GAME isn't enough then em

review: I am unable to play this game as of this date. When I attempt to launch it I am being thrown into the Social Club login screen. Back in the day I was bypassed this section at once all thanks to good communication between Steam and Rockstar games. After the latest update you seem to have to log into your Social Club account again. Entering both e mail and passphrase correctly I am still being rejected denying me from even starting the game. Reading online there are tons of people having the same problem.I managed to find a work around but then I got prompted with an error related to my key bindings. I attempted to reset them to the default settings and I was still being bombared with "wrongly assigned" keys. Trying to shuffle them around the "Cycle Camera" assignment would freeze accordingly to other commands having the same hotkey.Look it up. I wouldn't bother purchasing this until these problems has been solved.

review: *UPDATE* Take Two the people who published GTA V have given the team of OpenIV a cease and desist letter. OpenIV was a popular modding tool for GTA. Frankly I have no ing idea why they decided to do this. Most likely they want people to shift away from singeplayer mods to Online just so they can make more money. This decision alone is going to change my review to a negative one but you can read my previous review below.I am rating this game on singleplayer alone not the terrible Online.The singleplayer consists of a engaging story of heists backstabbing or the occasional car chase. All fun in their own way. You play as three characters Michael Franklin and Trevor. Each with their own abilities and backstories though Michael is the most developed character. I don't want to spoil the story so I'll get to the mechanics of the game. From the title you could probably infer that the game is about stealing cars and you're right. The amount of cars and customization is mind boggling. Each car handles differently sounds different etc. If you like to steal cars you'll also want a gun. Maybe two. The types of guns you can purchase or steal can range from knifes all the way to a minigun. Like cars they each sound and handle differently. You can customize guns with finishes and attachments like a supressor. (Yes there is stealth.) With all of these tools at your disposal where do you use them? In San Andreas of course. The map size doesn't seem that big if you drive around. (10 minutes at max from one end to the other.) Though each little nook and cranny is filled with something to keep you exploring. The map is divided into two halves Blaine County and Los Santos. One is an open desert ripe for exploring while the other is a city good for snapping pictures. In this world citizens react believably. They talk with each other go on their daily commute which makes you feel like a gear in the machine. If you manage to kill enough people you will get a wanted system. Whilst keeping in touch with GTA IV's system it also improves. The new stealth system is now implemented meaning you can hide in places where you think cops wont find you. Each star represents a different level of response. 1 2 is easy 3 is medium 4 is hard and 5 is death. At later wanted levels NOOSE will come after you hunting you down with ruthless agression.If you combine all of these factors in to great singeplayer game you get a masterpiece worth buying. If you want GTA V for multiplayer only try to get friends with you and use multiplayer mods. Online is garbage. Buy this game for singeplayer if you like those types of games!

review: Right off the bat I am already going to state this game is a 9/10.The game has a huge world set in a modern but with a sterotypical and ironic touch. The storyline allows the older audience understand and be able to relate to the characters problems or views of the world. Each character having their own sidemissions and story arcs that is intertwined throughout till the finale.The story allows 3 switchable characters with thier own story arc A madman who runs a drug company A retired father who has family problems and social aspects coming back to haunt him from the past A gangster who wants to live without problems and move on from ''gangbanging''*Each character offers special abilities such as slowing time easier driving and even a bullet time/rage mode boosing dps.Once the player has finished the story and seen most of the world there is now a multiplayer option they can tackle.While the multiplayer is story map the game is toned down graphically when it comes to lighting or the amount of npcs roaming the streets air or ocean. Things you can do in multiplayer with friends *Start a orginization to sell cars and soon guns/cars with guns.*Bounty hunt other players for cash*Buy tanks or vehicles that have special abilities ie a car with a parachute or the rocket car.*Rob a grocery store for a small amount of cash*Buy guns ranging from pistols to miniguns*Race*Skydive*Buy a yacht and live out your days in a hottub*Buy apartments or housing for yourself*Buy cars or sell npc cars every 48 minutes*Missions from story characters *Team death matchect...The only downside is loading and server issues. The loading time is on average 3 10 minutes depending on your pc and internet. As well as the server. Portforwading for most players has become the norm when it came to this game.

review: Nominating this game for the "Game within a game" award. GTA has always been known for a ridiculous amount of things to do in the game and GTA 5 takes that to the next level along with everything else in the game. I see a lot of poor reviews for online when I did manage to play it with friends especially the heists it was simply what I dreamed off all along when I imagined GTA online. The biggest problems arrise with how hard it is to actually play online. For me it was ridiculous loading times and somewhat poor UI (at least in terms of UI on PC). For others it seems it is banning for no reason which sounds extremely infuriating. I think it is unreasonable to not recommend this game however simply because the singleplayer is amazing and already worth the price tag alone. The somewhat functioning multiplayer is the thick but crumbling icing on the cake.

review: Grand Theft Auto V has stood the test of time. Being the most recent of a series of games in the GTA series GTA V has improvements over the past games and includes more than just a story mode. Although the story mode can keep you entertained for months on end trying to collect everything and beat the game with a perfect score if you like playing with others you can try Online. Although online has its problems with cheaters overpriced cars and such it is still amazing to play with friends and meet some on GTA Online. This game is so easy to spend hours on it is no surprise how many copies of this game have sold over the past years. Rockstar is still just as hard at work as they were in 2013 now ready to push out their next game Red Dead Redemption 2. I am excited to see what the future of GTA as a series holds and will certainly buy the next game as soon as it is released.

review: I don't have much time into the game right now and i'll keep playing it just cause i need a break from my usual ARPG grind or similiar. The game does have plenty to offer. The graphics are fair. Sometimes the controls feel a tiny bit 'wonky' like.. when i press 'S' to move back no game has ever forced you to do a complete 360. Or flying the plane i feel like the controls are way harder than they need to be. Everything works fine just sometimes it kinda i dunno.. throws ya off. But i guess that's what we get for a console port.What i can't get over though? The WRITING. By god this is the WORST writing i have ever seen on ANYTHING! CSI Miami The Muppets and Teletubbies are all Grammy worthy material compared to this. For example.. .. that's all ya hear during the first couple hours. Two black guys calling each other ' ' over and over and over and over and over again. They brought to an entirely new level of context. I mean really? I know for certain that i'm sheltered up here in white suburban hell but you've got be frickin kidding me! I felt like white people wrote this thinking this was how black people talked 100% of the time. Rockstar.. are you racist? (someone please back me up here)One quest requires you to break into a place to rig a cell phone with a device. Along the way you run into this programmer and for some reason he thinks you're from tech support. The guy has a buch of viruses and literally DOESN'T know how to run a virus scan. A programmer! Can't run a virus scan! The **** kind of world do they think we live in? "Yeah i'd like to apply for the computer programming job. What? Do i KNOW how to use a computer? YOU'RE ASKING THE IMPOSSIBLE!" That's the conversation this guy had with the HR department.Later on you play a meth head that was the previous guys partner. He see's a news story and realizes it was his partner from a long time ago. What's the most logical course of action at this immediate point? Slaughter a trailer park full of bikers of course! No connection. No reasoning. Just like "Hey i bet thats my bud! I'm gunna go kill some bikers!". Bonus go back later to blow 'em up again with explosives. There's plenty more in there i'm just highlighting a few. It's so bad that i cringe every time there's dialogue. I can give a pass to some questionable graphics or less than fun music or weird mechanics.. but i just can't get past BAD WRITING. In the above examples literally a 9 year old could've written a better story. Heck i'll take NO story over a BAD story. If this were a movie it would easily and i mean EASILY be ranked as THE worst movie in all of film history GLOBALLY! And no i'm not giving a chance on 'oh well it was all tongue in cheek' kind of style. It isn't. It's just poor writing.Thank god i got this on sale. Maybe i'll just play music from here on out cause the story line isn't worth this ashtray full of cigarette butts.

It's such a big damn shame.The story is good though the offline part is very amusing but eventualy you will screw around with your friends in online but that just gets to much hassle when you run out of money.I cannot recommend the cashgrab of Rockstar on this one such a shame......

review: Most of my playtime on GTA V is from single player modding experiences and multiplayer with friends. While the story is great I have already completed it on console and I would 100% recommend playing through the whole thing before starting to play on Online. Modding on single player is very fun and it has close to Skyrim levels of moddability giving it a huge replayability. Online is a... well lets just say it isn't the worst but it definately is not the best. The pay to win factor is probably higher than that of EA. Money is basically needed to be bought to make any progress in Online which I have done and regret. The money I bought was that of the "DLC" known as the Criminal Enterprise Pack. I could not say not to buy it anymore it is not worth it at all. My Online experience was honestly not the greatest and that was with access to basic fundage to fuel my rampaging needs. I would say that this game is much more multiplayer focused although the singleplayer story mode is a lot better. I just wish Rockstar had delivered on their promises of DLC for singleplayer as they did with GTA IV paid or not. As a rating for the online side of things for GTA I will give it a measly 4/10 rating. As for story mode that is where this game really shines so I give that a 9/10.

review: Game's great. Graphics are good. Gunplay is fairly smooth. Vehicles feel pretty nice. The problem I have with it is that Rockstar took their solid gold introduced it to the playerbase and then proceeded to jam it where the sun don't shine by removing the only thing that made GTA popular on PC modding. They just don't seem to understand that one of the things most people buy GTA on PC for explicitly is to play around with mods. Using a trainer online is one thing and is certainly an issue but mods like LSPDFR mods that bring in characters like Hulk or even Harry Potter you know mods that in no way affect the multiplayer aspect of GTA 5 will probably get the boot now. Rockstar makes great games but they just don't get their playerbase it seems.

review: I have played this game snice it came out in 2013 it's a great and well developed game with a perfectly exacuted story line to enjoy ( unless u watched it on youtube but let's be real it's a 5yr old game you probaly have seen it ) however I still kinda recommend it but not really and here's why. When GTA V was first realsed yea it was a brand new and enjoyable experience it was a break and something different to do then play Battlefield CoD etc. Once you completed the campaign there was still something to do in singleplayer like side missions random events rob a store customise cars buy businesses to make money or if you liked you could reply the mission to do it again or try and complete it so you have a gold metal rating for that mission. But this ant it this is not where the problem lies it lies in GTA Online GTA Online was the best thing and it was enjoyble for most if not all people who bought or got gifted the game. Sure it didn't have a stable launch for online but Rockstar slowly fixed it's problems here and there but after the major bugs and glitch's where fixed it became a great game for me and I belive for others aswell. This is because the game is simple to understande and how the ranking and mission system worked just corralted with each other perfticaly and made it fun and enjoyble for me and ranking up or looking forward to unlock that new gun was just another leep ahead.So I will not dive into detail about what started "killing" the game there are a tone of youtubers and articals that have covered this already. But I reckon it started goning down hill when they realsed "III Gotten Gains Part 1".It didn't take a nose dive to becoming a dead game filled with cheaters. But it was aparent to many and myself that Rockstar games had started making there DLC's a cash grab the defintion of cash grab "When movie studios produce unnecessary and often poor quality sequels in order to obtain more money." review: I usually dont write any reviews and if I do I stick to positive ones however in this case no matter how painful it is I have to break a habit.Despite all the things that could make this game fantastic the following three factors steal all fun from it leaving only bad memories. A legion of modders on the loose Powerless neglecting and indifferent "support" from Rockstar and really I mean REALLY long loading times.In this order.While the game has breathtaking graphics fun game mechanics good humour and always something to do for endgame it has zero control over cheaters/modders due to its P2P nature.You are defenseless against cheating people with mod menus. With a single keystroke they can explode you stuck bulky or flaming items permanently on you which persist until you restart game put persistent objects in the game world (like cages around you) take control of your vehicle become invisible and/or invulnerable teleport you or themselves around the map or miles above the air use the new orbital cannon and destroy anything at will kill you even in passive mode by becoming invulnerable getting a 5 star police wanted level and teleporting on you constantly so when NPCs shooting them they will hit you instead.Just to name a few but the list goes on and expands every passing day.Why not reporting modders? Trust me I did. A lot of them. Heck I even reported when I got modded money Avoiding to spend it for months having trouble to keep track of the amount of cash I can safely use.In the rare occurences Rockstar answered at all it was always generic "please be patient" and "we are actively doing this and that" or "you can report modders on x forums" with no actual action or effect seemed to follow.In fact modders are so numerous that when publisher Take Two Interactive started a "cease and desist" order against the creator of OpenIV a long standing modding tool for Grand Theft Auto 5 it's users started to give so many negative reviews on steam that Rockstar asked them to back off.They stated Rockstar Games believes in reasonable fan creativity and in particular wants creators to showcase their passion for our games which would be fair enough if they were able to monitor or control if this mods effect single player mode (which is ok) or online (which interferes other player's fun). But they aren't.There is an option to play online in invite only sessions (this would solve all the problems with modders) but Rockstar disabled the best gameplay options in this mode. There were petitions in the past but nothing seemed to change.You could say ok. Let's just leave the problematic session and find another. I did countless times. Nowdays that's almost impossible. 95% of the sessions has at least 1 modder or if hasn't it will in about 20 30 mins.And with the brutal (sometimes 5 10 mins!) loading times just to get another session thats propably just as bad as the previous one it's not a temtpting option either.There would be a solution (enable all gameplay mechanics in invite only sessions) but as I see now Rockstar neglects its clean playerbase. I dont know maybe we are in minority now (?) The only way left for me to protest is a negative review and staying away from their titles as long as they wont change their politics. Until then i think the next title would be less misleading GMA 6 (Grand Modder Auto 6)

review: Pretty epic single player experience especially with mods. Would completely recommend this game especially at its current price of $30. My views on Online are currently mixed as much as I want to enjoy it I simply just can't. It's so disappointing to see what Rockstar has implented into this game. The amount of micro transactions and online DLC in Online is nothing short of ridiculous. The community is also pretty stinky. To avoid the community I would advise you find a couple of friends and play in a private session. The heists in Online are incredibly engaging when you have friends to play with. Other than the interaction of friends there really are no pros of Online. Social Club is also very stinky. Hopefully RDR2 won't have the same problems but it probably will.

review: I wish I could leave two seperate reviews for GTAV and GTAO. Lets start with GTAV. The story is decent and offers a lot of replayability. I personally have played it twice on PS4 and am working towards it on PC. There is no singleplayer DLC which is a huge bummer but the base game is still very fun. Now onto GTAO. I have almost 500 hours on my PS4 copy and have most everything. I stopped playing after the Doomsday Heist update came out. I have the best vehicles in the game and had a fun time playing with friends. I recently picked up the PC copy to play with friends and quickly found out how difficult it is to start a new character. They stopped character transfers for stupid reasons so I had to make a brand new save. I did double money modes and got up to a million dollars. I bought the cheapest cocaine warehouse and made a ltitle bit of money. One of my friends started at the same time and was a little bit behind me. We realized that in the ed up state that the game is in it was impossible to gain money as a new player without GTAO becoming a full time job. We both picked up $10 mod menus and had more fun in one day than in all the time we'd had GTA. I was finally able to afford the best of the best and I could afford to mess around with friends and have fun instead of grinding all the time. I would only reccommend this game if you have an extra $10 to rent a mod menu for a month. Free mod menus do work but they will get you banned. Just drop $10 on a mod menu and you'll have the time of your life. The issue with this is they make it so difficult to make money that your only option is to cheat. I personally don't grief randoms with the mod menu(only friends). Don't buy this game and support Rockstar because all you're doing is giving them a reward for continuing to stand behind a broken mess of a game. Only buy to meme and mess around with friends. Any attempts to play the game the way it was meant to be played will result in you getting frusturated.

review: Awesome game full of fun and action! But there is one mayor issue (this only happens in GTA Online)You can meet some very toxic people on the game. They just shoot you when they see you. And the worst they don't have a reason to do so. As an example Around 6 hours before I've wrote this comment I was in my garage (there are garages all across the map where you can store your vehicles) and I was spending some money on searching for a new offroad based vehicle. When I exited my garage and wanted to head to Los Santos customs (you can modify/upgrade your vehicles there) there was a guy infront of my garage. Before I realised what he wants to do he pulled out a rifle and shot me. I respawned and headed back to get into my vehicle. But guess what? he was sitting there jsut waiting to shoot me again when I pop up. After another 3 attempts to get back to my vehicle I just left the game and went into another lobby. You will experience this kind of scenario all across GTA Online and it will be hard to get rid of it. Mostly this are very young kids who think that this game is shooting only. I also think that there should be something to report this kind of toxic behavior (if there is any kind how to report it please write it in the comments below as I didn't find any way how to do so) If you ever meet any player like this just leave and search for another lobby as I did.

review: Edit Too many modders. It was bearable at one point to deal with them but now there are way too many. Teleporting everywhere and giving me an disconnection error if I don't treat them like king and queen. Too many military vehicles that result in GTA becoming cluttered with cancer and a fair few of the worst ones can be called back in almost immediately. Rockstar's response? None. xdA semi long pros and cons list from a player who has spent 1 200hrs on PS4 and over 420+hrs on PC who hasn't been banned/hasn't had their characters wiped. If I get banned I have my character on PS4 to play with. I don't mind that.Pros Massive fun to be had alone or with friends. PvP is really fun in freeroam or in deathmatches when there's no modders. A lot of the community are grinders and don't mind lending a hand when it comes to helping others making money. Crews and bikie gangs are a fun way to experience Online if you're into that sort of thing. Plenty of R*/community made deathmatches and races to keep you entertained. More than enough ways to make money in this game to get the things you want. DLC to keep the game fresh and alive. The world itself is nice to explore and mess around with. With friends or without. Vehicle handling is pretty nice. I consider it better than GTA IV's which some claim to be better than V's. Rockstar Editor is avaliable to those who want to make a mini movie for their 20 subscriber YouTube channel.Neutral Money. Once you obtain a bunker and a bikie drug business money is easy to get from there but it takes a bit of time to get those. You go to your bunker/business pay for supplies and wait for them to be used up by playing the game then once it's all done you sell it. Heists missions new adversary modes etc are also quick ways to obtain money. Grinding isn't all that hard nor will you have a terrible experience with it but it takes a bit of time getting the things you want. Getting targeted by griefers makes it fun as well. Rockstar's Support. I have never been banned so I cannot relate to any of the people who may have been falsely banned for nothing. In my experience I have never had an issue with R*s support when I submit a ticket. They get the job done for me. Loading Times. An average of 5+ minutes to load in from a 7200RPM 1TB WD HDD. After that loading screens are much shorter and not frequent. Unless you want to join a deathmatch through the Quick Play app on your phone. That will range from finding a deathmatch in 10 seconds or waiting 6 minutes to join a deathmatch that turns out to be a parkour map.Cons The community. Many are paranoid of modders and it makes PvP annoying since they'll accuse you of hacking report you and leave. Unbalanced. Rockstar did a great job with the Ruiner 2000 and then they gave up soon after that. Deluxo's missiles are OP the Oppressor (AKA Broomstick) is annoying and can be called to your location instantly after it gets blown up. Khanjali tank and MKII Oppressor is the go to noob vehicle for when you get dominated. The orbital cannon is perfect for people who care about 1 0s. It used to be Hydras and Lazers that were the issue but not anymore. Now it's all this P2P. Although you can play with mates that are on the other side of the world with 400 ping with no issue good luck if you anger some Chinese men and they grab your IP. Anticheat. What anticheat? Sometimes it works. Summary..I love this game but it can be pretty terrible to play. Despite that though there is a massive amount of fun to be had in this game and I do not regret the large amount of hours I've spent on this game. I'm not worried about getting falsely banned but we'll see what happens.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Picture quality aspectsThis is the next generation game in 2013. In 2015 the PC version of the screen is still amazing although not top level screen but also a super high level HD level. The overall tone of the picture is very eye catching and looks very comfortable. The models and models are in place and character modeling is good but facial modeling is not good enough. R has always suffered from bad vegetation. In the 5th generation herbaceous plants have made great progress but woody plants can still feel a strong sense of texture overlap at a glance which is very contrary to HD environment. The surface of the water is very good the touch of the water is also very good there are many kinds of surface effects of the game such as sea water River water Lake water the depth of the water is different deep water and shallow water have different feelings unlike other games all the water is almost a literary. Generally speaking the portrayal of the water body is very good rain scenery night scenery details are very good but the rendering is not strong enough rain scenery and night scenery look very real pavement water effect and rain patting do well but compared with other games the lack of enhanced rendering aesthetic feeling.lasting appealIn fact the GTA5 single player mode is not as perfect as it imagined. Because it removes many excellent settings and details. For example body size system nurturing system gang system younger brother function bodyguard function martial arts schools and gyms girlfriend system fun games (game machines and billiard halls etc.). Some details were deleted such as the mandatory non stalling of getting off the car in GTA4 (not stalling when jumping in GTA5) the setting of passers by taking umbrellas and so on while riding motorcycles the clothes of this generation can not shake with the wind but the evil city of 12 years ago portrayed this detail vividly. In particular access to buildings has been reduced. But why is it an excellent 3A masterpiece? Although it deleted many classic settings it added more interesting elements. If the single player is not playing well enough then the OL mode will refresh you. The map area is 7.2 times the size of GTA SA. The rich and colorful online tasks and game modes keep the GTA series playing well in the sand box game. Interaction with players NPCs and officials gives you a feeling of traveling through the sandbox world. I will not disclose anything specific. Only after playing. In fact GTA5 will be more powerful if you don't delete the classic settings in VC SA 4.U.S.

"Hey I want a car I'll just grind 46 hours of my life doing the same repititive procedures vigorously until I get griefed by a no life that either uses invincibility or a weaponized vehicle which I'll die to several times over and over." What if they aren't a modder and they're able to be killed you may be asking. They'll EWO (easy way out) and keep their K/D as clean as British man's accent. This game should NOT be worth what it is right now if you like grindy games don't buy this thing they call a game. Get Warframe for example because their community is actually laid back. Please DO NOT GET THIS HALF COOKED CHIMICHANGA.

review: Hands down most fun I have had in a videogame. It's been a long ride with it's hights and lows but in the end I've enjoyed it all. For five year old game it still stands out of the other "open world" games with it's still stunning visuals environment which feels alive (especially in story mode). Gta Online have been blast to play and goof around with friends and constant updates and events which the devs still are pushing out. There's something for everyone in this game someone likes driving fast cars and customize them (there's many to choose from.....you won't be disappointed) someone loves to just blow stuff up (good there's many ways to do so). These are just few things you can do but in the end the player have the freedom to choose how to play the game.I can easily recommend this game to everyone. Best game that I've paid full price from.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I like GTA i really do. But Online really needs to be fixedIt would be easy to downvote this because its a tripple A company and it deserves to be critisised for having the funds necassary. But The money issue online is extremely apparent as there seems to only be two ways to play the gameEither GrindOr ModAnd grinding would be more acceptable to accept if modding wassnt so easy and common Which kind of ruins the purpose of a grind system to work in GTA. If anyone has played GTA online from release you would understand that the main focus wasnt to try and stack as much money as possible (even though people did through glitches) but was more focused on customisation and doing events. Now gta has turned into get as much money before the next update so you can use the next OP item as much as possible Which is kind of depressing knowing there was a lack of these items during early versions of the gameIt sort of leaves the question of if GTA online can really be fixed as its already broken itself already...BTW Single player needs an actual content update rather then modding having to remedy this issue Thanks A nobody
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I have sunk countless hours into this game mainly for the singleplayer and then I found the multiplayer.I admit I was a GTA Online modder but I either used said mods for kicking malicious modders or just spawning in money due to the extremely expensive nature of it. Closing OpenIV me off but outright filing a lawsuit over all mod menus makes me more than upset. It's hard to enjoy GTA Online with how pay to win it is.Unfortunately even with the fun this game is don't touch the multiplayer anymore. The players were generally toxic anyway though I did find some cool people. Woopty doo most of them modded.

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 is not only a preposterously enjoyable video game but also an intelligent and sharp tongued satire of contemporary America. It represents a refinement of everything that GTA 4 brought to the table five years ago. It s technically more accomplished in every conceivable way but it s also tremendously ambitious in its own right. No other world in video games comes close to this in size or scope and there is sharp intelligence behind its sense of humour and gift for mayhem. It tells a compelling unpredictable and provocative story without ever letting it get in the way of your own self directed adventures through San Andreas.It is one of the very best video games ever made.

review: I've owned the game since 2013. The single player is great and the multiplayer was a fun thing to kill time with too. Now though? It is bad salesmanship that a car that has the same stats as a vanilla car costs 335x more just because it's newer (Stratum vs Fagaloa). If you're gonna buy for online then hope you run into a cheater who drops cash because even the new slow cars cost a fortune and you need at least three mil to start any lucrative buisness. Until then grind away doing missions or working for other player's companies (if they even do work and don't rtdm for fun). If you're buying it strictly for SP and modding then welcome! Have fun.

review: The Opressor MK2 is literally the most unbalanced and broken feature I have ever seen in a game. There are several vehicles and items this game has that are somewhat overpowered or have very little to no use but the Opressor MK2 stands alone in the category of ridiculous features. It needs to be nerfed or removed. It damages the community and the already questionable combat balance of the game tremendously to the point where there is literally a ing PETITION asking rockstar to nerf it. A PETITION. I would not suggest this game to anyone both in protest of the opressor mk2 and because rockstar believes in adding more content and not fixing broken and unbalanced content. If you ignore this and buy the game anyway it won't take long for you to figure out what im talking about.

I had it on the xbox 360 brfore it came out on pc and mods were the entire reason i re purchased the game on a different platform.I hope rockstar hears the backlash and understands that people want mod support in GTA games. Bethesda has nailed having mods open to the community mods are why i still play Fallout 4 and Skyrim.If GTA V could have a simlar system to fallout 4 and skyrim remastered... the amount of people who play will skyrocket as will the reviews. Although some said that there are many hackers on GTA online I don't seem to find alot of them although there are still some out there. However some hackers may be good and spawn weapons and vehicles to play with you but some just on godmode and shoots rockets everywhere. Anyways GTA 5 is a fun game for you and your friends and of course even online. However I found out that the service is not very great in fact it is really bad so if you buy the game you are taking on a great risk as if your game doesn't work you will have to refund it OR go online to search for solutions to solve the problem yourself as rockstar wont give a sh*t about you. But I would still recommend you guys to buy it for a cheaper price when there is a sale.

review: GTA Online is a griefer's paradise and was designed that way to manipulate players into buying Shark Cards for in game money. Grinding money legitimately is slow and the game almost always announces what you are doing to the whole session so that griefers can target you.Full of bugs that are never fixed. New GTA Online content is almost never patched or tuned post release. Because of this new DLC consistently makes old DLC obsolete. Rockstar is running out of ideas for new content so to lure people to buy Shark Cards new DLC mostly revolves around overpowered weaponized vehicles that turn GTA Online into a war zone. There is even an orbital cannon that allows players to kill you with just a click on the map that is mostly only used by modders.There is no functional anti cheat in this game as sessions are hosted by players instead of dedicated servers. Rarely will you encounter a populated session without modders.Once you play this game for long enough you'll realize that Rockstar has no interest in improving the player experience only in pumping out expensive overpowered Shark Card magnets for their cash cow.

review: Having played GTA V for over 350 hours here are my thoughts The storyline is well made interesting and very fun. The map is huge and extremely detailed making it always fun to explore and even after 350 hours I still discover new things. The general atmosphere of the game is very nice and charming. The game looks very good if you have the ability to put the graphics settings high enough! There is a lot but I mean a lot of things to do once you are done with the story and on the Online mode. Activities missions businesses goofing around ... Plus the Rockstar team adds frequent DLCs that are free. There are plenty of easter eggs and interesting places/things to discover! There is a huge variety of weapons and vehicles to choose from to have fun and do the missions when Online.This is overall a very good and fun game that will probably keep you busy for at least a good hundred hours!

review: Fun to play. Best since GTA VCGeneral The newest in the GTA franchise made some alterations to mix it up a bit and it has worked out well. Nice campaign/story plenty to do after and a at least ok multiplayer. Single Player For the first time GTA focusses around 3 characters instead of 1. In my opinion Micheal has been the most interesting of the three characters franklin an overal ok one (I personally cant relate to this character) and Trevor has been a sometimes funny WTF character (but a perfect match for the way anyone would play GTA).The story in general is good yet some missions and several side quests are mildly irritating (ffs tonya how about you go tow someone off instead). Also it is great you are able to choose your own ending. Still I must say I hoped for a bit more of CJ or othe GTA SA references.Multiplayer Overal OK lots of fun to play game modes both competitive and co op yet feels boring and repetitive after a while.Secret wish Rockstar please create a new GTA in the GTA1/GTA L/GTA2 style for the pc.PS Ive played this game on both the PC and xbox 360 almost have 100% on the second. Also I've been playing GTA since its original release (Yes I am talking about the original top down games).

review: Had a rocky start at launch but since the first week this game has been perfectly playable and more than enjoyable. It has solid gameplay with a large amount of things to do throughout the game both online and off. The gunplay was a bit weird going into it but after moving away from GTA IV it was much easier and I prefer it now. The online itself is a great mix of solo aspects that you can have fun with by yourself and ridiculously fun things to do with a group of friends. My one major negative is the heists in the game I wish there was a way to do them without all four people though I understand that everyone has a role and must be accounted for. Just wishing for things that can't happen. All in all great game. Would recommend to anyone.

review: I got this last year and I might get the PC of this but I ll wait to see how it works on that. Where GTA 4 was about the American Dream GTA 5 is about this economy thing. in GTA 5 you get to play not one but three characters over the course of the main story Franklin Michael and Trevor.Each one as a special ability as Franklin can slow down time while driving. Michael can slow down time on foot while Trevor can go into this rage mode and be invincible. Over the game you ll have these big heist plans and people to help you out. You need to pick some decent people and not the bare minimum since they ll get killed easely.There s also a bunch of other activities like tennis golf and other things like the stock market. As well as a bunch of collectables all over the big wide map of Los Sanotos and Blaine County. There s also this big decision at the end of the game and three endings. Two of them kinda leave a bad taste in your mouth and mess up the tone.GTA Online I only played once but it was pretty amazing and I was real nervous worried and a little excited. Since I never played online games and even my parents thought it wouldn t be a good idea. Thought there would be people razing me and mocking me when I lose too much.There s also a setting on GTA Online if it gets to hectic where you can just play with your friends. Might have to try that out next time if I ever play it again. This game is a classic in every sense of the word and should be in your library.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: If this game was VAC bannable this game would possibly be GOTY material for me. Modders are what is ruining the game. Modders has not only made you get blown up randomly in most lobbies but it has also ruined the economy. I played since release and when I first got my 1mil $ car I was proud driving around in it. Now a days if you do not have a 10$ yacht you're an outsider. Sad to see the direction of the game however I'm still recommending it. You can avoid modders mostly. If you do this and don't mod yourself I do reckon you can get a good few hours of fun out of it.

review: I cannot endorse neither the single player nor the multiplayerThe multiplayer lobby problems are already well know. Hackers in at least every lobby and most games making having fun nigh imposible. That also with the fact that i find many of the online games to be boring and repetative and made that way to get you to buy their shark cards so you can just skip the grind.The single player though is fantastic the first 5 to 10 hours are filled with amazing mechanics and story telling but it all slowly falls apart after the 2nd heist. To the point where i was only pushing myself to finish the game to see how it ends. Cops spawning infront of you automatically knowing where you are making escaping them a slog especially if a mission requires it. How is it that my super car that was outfitted to the max is unable to outrun police cars? how can enemies automatically lock onto me before i even pop a shot off? whats the point of giving experience to heist members if the expensive ones don't need it and the rookies die every time you hire them?Save your money buy yourself a Coke or some nice lunch and skip out on GTA V you aren't missing anything or atleast anything fun

review: After a few hours playing this game I have to say I just can't recommend it.If you're going to buy it for the singleplayer storyline by all means do so. But do not i repeat DO NOT sink countless hours of your life playing GTA Online. It's just not worth it.After playing 150 hours or so buying property maintaining my businesses and nightclub pulling my hair out for trying to finish the most difficult of heists selling cars every half hour just to get a minimal payout in return all the while trying to avoid multiple griefers and hackers that run rampant across the servers i decided that GTA Online is not worth your or my time. Unless you don't value your life in any way shape or form and you think its a better option than anything else you have on the table AVOID AT ALL COSTS.in case of TL DR Main game Good 9/10Online Bad 10/10

In Online after you play like every mission available and then you start do some other things it gets repetitive and boring after a while nothing to do. Also you can no longer mod the singleplayer game because they want more money from Online. After Rockstar has been very supportive of the modding community Take Two is screwing with everyone.

review: I was pondering some random aspects of life and figured it would be a good time to sit down and give off what i think of this game. I preordered GTA back on the 360. ive had it sence the start. and i have to say... it isnt worth it. baseically the entire thing is and always was a microtransaction farming scheme. (the singleplayer is baseically the best part and is worth $15 30) the entire multiplayer setup started out buggy and with inflated over the top prices. but it was managable. however after the initial updates that made it harder to actually make money in online the entire development has been a circle of hyping an update releasing said update that turns out to be a reskin of the previous updates and expansions but now with more over priced t expect you to buy the ingame currency so that you can buy a fake car for one of you fake characters or say... a fake house for a fake character... you can have multiple characters but the only shared part is your total money pool... they heists are and always were garbage. the contact missions pay like the multiplayer races deathmatches etc are ok but usually pay like its just a michro transaction farm.after making me completely reinstall the game because i used open IV to CHANGE MY LOADING SCREENS AND MUSIC... all i used it for... im kinda irritated. meanwhile hackers seem free to cause multiplayer lag by spawning hundreds of jumbojets. and s never leave you alone... why? why would hackers giving free money online be a problem why would some of my good friends in this game have their characters reset for trying to doupe cars? OHO THATS RIGHT ONLINE IS ROCKSTAR TRYING TO PUSH SHARK CARDS ludcris inflation and overpricing for simple things (back on the 360 limited time overpriced cars for "a limited time") cars that suck the release of "gun running" which is just a combo of CEO and Biker... BUT MORE EXPENSIVE AND TIME CONSUMING... im a little with them right now.meanwhile because a hacker gave me about 2mil which allowed me to spend it all on biker stuff... a long time ago... i now get to lose 4mil in online currency. then smuggler stuff comes out. and its more of the same nonsense with very little new... just pressuring everyone to buy more shark cards so they can kill themselves in online.Aug 2018 edit i saw a rockstar sale... and saw the "online premium edition"... you mean to say that after i spend how many hours grinding spent a bit on gay shark cards.. etc. now anyone can just spend extra money and get access to the i spend MILLIONS OF INGAME DOLLARS ON... they say this game is pay to win... and its true.christmas comes sale is on... HACKERS EVERYWHERE.

I regret spending the money on this game now and I will NEVER give another single penny to TakeTwo unless they reverse this immediately!If you were thinking of getting this game (whether or not you plan to mod single player) don't do it. review: You know I love Grand Theft Auto thing is I found weapon selection clunky and more complicated than it had to be... Why not buy all the guns and just equip the ones you want to use?The aiming is difficult but managable though found mouse and keyboard generally has better aim that using a controller since the controller if you didn't set to manual aiming will attempt to aim at civi's over other players that are trying to kill you.Game is overrun with hack users I mean I had six cars dropped on me from the sky... Que X Files Music...They have added quite a bit of content cars weapons clothing. However let me remind you this is when not playing single player a online game and unless you have a group of friends to play with on an every day basis you will be stuck with random players who do not know what they are doing or are happy with screwing you up for their own amusement.In game cash isn't easy to get you will be grinding away for hours to even days to buy that vehicle you always wanted or you can like Rockstar is hoping you will get frustrated and whip out that credit card and buy cash from the in game shop using your hard earned real life cash.Servers constantly crash either by internal server errors or DDOS attacks cause the local cheater is mad about something or another.I guess if you want to play this game get prepared for a love/hate relationship cause this game has one of the worst toxic communities I have come by in a long time... the 2nd worst I found was on Minecraft on a server called 2b2t my third most toxic would be APB Reloaded which I would recommend over GTAV just because combat isn't so clunky so long as you have a really good computer that can push past the poor optimization that game has to offer.I want to recommend this game but I am sorry I cannot recommend this game at this time.

review: This game has one of the most fun single player campaigns I have ever played. The story the characters the missions and the world are fantastic. The handling and damage for the vehicles is terrible but thank god for mods. Mods add unlimited replayability as you can see by the sad amount of hours I have devoted to this game. LSPDFR alone is hours and hours of enjoyment. The Online portion is okay in my opinion it gets boring after a while with everything being locked behind levels and enormous price tags plus there is an infinite amount of hackers and just all around d*uchebags. My main issue with Online though is that it is the biggest hinderance in the game's potential. Thanks to "free" DLCs for Online players began buying shark cards for in game cash so they could afford the ridiculously priced content. This led to a huge influx of wealth for Rockstar and their greedy publisher Take Two. Because of how well Online was doing all the focus was put there and taken away from single player. Because of this GTA V has zero single player DLCs which is such a shame. The Ballad of Gay Tony for GTA IV was actually better than the base game and became my preferred choice. I hate to think about the amazing ideas they had for GTA V that we will never get to see. Maybe they thought about origin stories for each of the characters. Playing each individually to see how they started. Maybe the three characters go to North Korea to rescue Dennis Rodman from the gentle caress of Kim Jong Un while simultaneously preventing a rocket launch... we'll never know. GTA Online being the cash cow it is Take Two would die before letting anyone experience their content without either grinding for hours on end or paying for it out of pocket. That means there are no dedicated servers like in GTA IV where you can play with all the fun mods with all your friends. They also went as far as blocking the content from single player requiring mods to unlock everything. THEN they went even further and tried to ban modding by going after Open IV the primary and essential tool for all modding. This act led to my initial negative review but since then Rockstar delegated a compromise between T2 and the Open IV and it looks like Open IV is back in business. Good on you Rockstar but as for the lack of single player that's a bad Rockstar BAD! Because I am such a big fan of theirs I like to think Rockstar did not have a choice in the matter that evil greedy T2 forced them to focus on GTA Online. If that's not the case then you should be ashamed of yourselves. inb4 they release GTA VI Online ONLY.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V is an open world action adventure game developed by Rockstar North. This game is the fifteenth in the series. The game was originally released on Xbox 360 and PS3 in mid 2013 and then got a remastered version on Xbox One and PS4 in late 2014 before finally being released on the PC in April 2015. The game quite rightly is a record setter selling over 11 million copies and grossing over $800 million on the release day before breaking the $1 billion marker three days afterwards. GTA V continues in tradition with the type of game play on offer. You play in third person over the shoulder view of the characters. The game has three main protagonists who each have their own story and plot to go with them somehow all three of these characters s path cross throughout the game and they soon become key to each other s story. The driving in the game has been improved over the previous versions of the game cars feel even more realistic to drive and the game s physics engine is almost perfect with figuring out how objects will react should you hit them (or they hit you!). The gun play in this game is significantly better than the previous versions also I did have issues with aiming and general fight scenes before but GTA V sets out the controls and feel of the gameplay perfectly allowing you to not run into any stumbling blocks in terms of the controls or mechanics. I did find the flying missions to be quite annoying at times since I was playing the game on mouse and keyboard I found the controls to be a bit fumbly when manning a helicopter or plane but the flying parts of the game are few and far between. The main core of the game revolves around completing story missions for each of the three main characters these can range from stealing cars for a billionaire s collection right the way to robbing banks. There is plenty of variety in the missions you can do and you will find it very difficult to find a moment in this game where you are bored. The game has gorgeous graphics no they aren t photo realistic but that s because the game s style isn t aiming for that. The PC version of this game is most certainly the pinnacle of gaming it just puts the console s version to shame when you compare the two. My rig which is a monster couldn t handle putting the game out at 60 fps at 4k resolutions but was quite happy to run every setting at maximum on 1080p and it just looks fantastic. Normally open world games try to reduce the graphics slightly just because how much is being loaded at any one time but GTA V does none of that each of the textures are all high res animation is absolutely perfect and the lighting effects are some of the best I have seen in any video game. As with all GTA games you are going to get a blockbuster style story line this is one of the best if not THE best plot to any video game and one which I will remember. All three of the character s story are so well written and perfectly intertwining with each other. The game does have a large amount of cut scenes at the beginning of each level some people may find this to be annoying as they would rather be playing the story rather than watching it but personally I found the cut scenes to be just as interesting to watch as it is to play the game. They fully immerse you into the world of Los Santos. Not only is there a captivating main story to the game there are also plenty of side missions whilst they are all quite basic tasks for you to complete they all have some sort of story behind them for each character which are all well worth your time in completing. The sound effects and voice acting goes above and beyond here as well. Every single one of the characters is so perfectly voice acted that you sometimes forget that these aren t real people in front of. The ambiance sounds of the city are all amazing too there is never a moment where there is just silence whether it is people in the street chatting to each other or someone getting road rage there is always something going on. Not to mention the game has 162 songs on the radio station so you will always find something you are in the mood for when you are traveling across the map. The game isn t exactly hard there are missions which you will probably have to do over again because of silly reasons such as crashing your plane from not being able to land it (I have had to do one of the missions way too many times to remember because of this!!) but I don t think I actually died in a gun fight or a heist of any kind since most of the time you are with one of the other characters you always have some kind of backup should things turn nasty. Los Santos is one of the biggest game worlds to ever be made it is bigger than GTA IV GTA SA and Red Dead Redemption combined. Whilst a good portion of the map is mountain ranges and open fields of emptiness in the northern regions the actual city is a bustling hive of entertainment and action. Round every corner there is something for you to do whether it be a side missions that involves you getting your mother the drugs she needs helping a young lady get her purse back after being robbed (or not?) or just earning an honest day s work by towing cars that are parked illegally. The world is your oyster in Los Santos.The main story with a good portion of side missions and extras in GTA V took me just about forty six hours to complete. Whilst the main story is complete I still have plenty of heists extra missions stunts races so much more to finish! The single player alone in this game can probably hit the heights of eighty hours if you want to complete everything and it is something I am going to be aiming to do over the course of the next few months. Never have I played a game that has made me want to do that more! Having only played the game through once I cannot be 100% sure on this but I feel there is a slight portion of the game which can change depending on what actions you take towards the latter stages of the story so if you do want to replay the game again there is going to be a bit of a different story at the end of it depending on what you choose. Technically GTA V is faultless. Many worried that the PC port would be terrible but they really knocked it out of the park here. The abundance of graphical options audio options and options in general really make this a proper PC game. The game can be played on a gamepad or a mouse and keyboard. Normally with GTA games I opt for the game pad but the game is so well optimized for the PC the mouse and keyboard feel like the only option for me it just plays so fluidly. I am going to go out on a limb here and say that GTA V is one of if not the greatest video game out there today. There is absolutely nothing wrong with the game and it excels in every area in which you will critic a game. The stellar gameplay exquisite story line and huge open world for you to explore it is hard to put this conclusion into words as to how perfect this game is it is something you really need to be experiencing for yourself as this is a piece of history right here.
