review: This game garnered enough reputation from across the internet by being an outstanding yet questionable at that. It brought up new things that made the game itself a luxury and each experience was worth taking note of. Though when I said questionable however I really meant it really is. Every aspect from GTA at this point were brought up here but like it's predecessors some of the common ways we deal through the game are lost entirely which isn't a bad thing depending on how you see it. Literally this game is well known for pushing things beyond of what people wanted to make whether it'd be a singleplayer mayhem full of mods clustering about or a multiplayer experience that's between a blender and a swimming pool.If you're going to look for my opinion about multiplayer look elsewhere. I barely have touched the darn gamemode itself as I always have enjoyed many past GTA titles alone. Although I'd be bias if this was the good old GTA San Andreas which I used SAMP to play online which it isn't. I have to say for the few hours I experienced GTA Online is the constant punishment that I'd get for not going beyond from where I start and it's completely exposed with an enormous amount of ridiculous proportions. For the meat of the game being the singleplayer my experience is a mixed bag. Now what about I said earlier about the game being amazing? Well it is that is if you are a mindless duck. Stories on these types of games aren't usually the strongest that many developers would want to take and this game tries hard to be really damn good about the storytelling portion. While I admit the characters in this story is damn amazing especially Trevor Michael and Franklin the more I replayed throughout the missions it felt like it was forced out. The story wanted to be as much favorable and interesting to the players but man does this feel like a bad kicker. I would say all the plot holes were plugged immediately with that surprising comeback and eventual endings the game have it doesn't do a whole alot to convince me that it's a really good story for the game. If you're confused about this I'm sorry I would make it simplier to say that the game's story is a good rice meal but it smells. I just don't find that interesting that much but I would honestly take note of some of the best scenes in the story at least.The gameplay is the heart of this damn game and I loved it. I damn sure do loved the gameplay while I try to choke myself in rgards to my own opinions about the story. From driving cars to shooting people for the most absolute and reasons ever are the key reasons why I kept hogging my hours on this game. The FPS mode is a winner here makes me feel like it's more than just a game but a different world of its own and goddamn would it be great to have a decent VR support to make it livable cause I would really take it. But of course as we expand to this this game got tons of mods and they're... They're pretty amazing! But how you put them in is not.See this is where I hate about the lack of the developers' respect is that anytime you wanted to twist the game out of it's fun and add some things that would extend or explode the lifetime the game has. I love putting mods on games that are definitely damn great to have but setting them up here on GTAV is such a pain in the neck. I wanted to make sure everything is placed right and man I wished there was an easier way to put the mods in like a workshop feature that could spare us alot of time. But no we have to make do with what we have I guess and I appreciate that they do make great work of this but it still sucks to spend minutes of trying to put the things on the right places. It's like picking a specific type of condom for your to put on to make sure your girlfriend doesn't get too about the risks.The technical side of this game is somewhere I'd say is just okay in my opinion. Now you might say this game is optimized and yeah it is it's really well optimized. But boy does it take a while for things to generate and you're gonna need a really good hardware to run this damn game. If you're thinking about playing it with less than four physical cores god forgive that you have to stop and actually get a CPU with four physical cores. Everything begins to go crazy when you play it with only two cores and hyperthreaded ones doesn't solve your issues with this. Everything just stutters to hell and it's not that fun. So yeah get a CPU with four cores got it? Also a decent GPU and at least 8GB of RAM should nail it.Now to wrap things up should you buy this game? Who wouldn't? You should too!. But what's with the clouds of negativity around though? That's just me talking but it's also worth noting that like many other great triple a games out there GTA V nails the cake for a great experience but you need to take watch of the developers though. Not the game the developers. The DEVELOPERS.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

But now Rockstar has made a comeback with new jaw dropping whopping no scoping breath taking a llama sitting on top of a red panda that is eating a banana DLC's!!!! review: Story Mode is incredible fell in love with it for hours until I ve beaten this great game. However my reason for this negative review is pretty obvious as it s related to Online Mode. Online Mode is very creative and has a great story to it with their interesting heists but the cons with this game I m about to say should let buyers not play Online Mode.Cons Massively toxic playerbase/community. This is mainly involving K/D warriors and Griefers who get on only to cause havoc and pain to Grinders and even your friends. Next one is Modders/hackers these guys are the worst as they ruin anyone s gameplay with various things such as freezing trapping sends rockets at anyone and setting everyone on fire until everyone leaves. The worst part is receiving unwanted goods from them which I will explain later down below.The game and even the shark cards are priced so ludicrously high that s not even worth looking into getting one. Now these are designed so that Rock* farms money from raging players who get griefed so that they buy money to try and pay those bad players back. Nice one Rock* for being so low.Next one is their support they WILL not talk to you or anyone once when you create a thread for them you will receive an reply from a bot thus completely ignoring you the same also goes for Live Chat you receive automated responses based on what you say which is very low. So if a player wants to report a bug/player or appeal their bans then you re out of luck buddy.The Ban Bot for GTA Online got updated and now bans players 30 days after they ve touched illegal items such as modded money. The ban length is 30 days + character reset which is very bad. So if you re a modder you got 30 days of tormenting players until you end up getting banned along with all of the other players who get unjustly banned and you got two characters so even if you permanently lose one of them they will continue on their second account then repeat the process which is why this game is turning into a ghost lobby. I even got evidence that this has happened to me and a few mates of mine. Grinded 400 hours of my time to get toys to have some fun with my mates only to get banned by the Ban Bot from receiving unwanted money from a modder I reported but got ignored.Buy it for Story Mode if you re into that but avoid their Online mode as it s invested with issues that it isn t even fun to play there anymore.Thanks for reading my long review on this mess of a game and hope anyone who reads this to avoid Online Mode. (I m going to expect a lot of negative feedback after posting this review and am going to receive a perma ban as I heard that they perma ban players who gives negative reviews on this game because Rock* is very immature).

review: I gave this game a thumbs down simply because for me the negatives out do the postives. It's not a horrible game infact there is very little wrong with it.. But the few things that are wrong don't seem to be getting fixed and they bother me enough that i don't really enjoy playing it anymore. If you own the game already or have played the game before I'd reccomend to skip it. If you have never played the game before I'd cautiously reccomend it when it's on sale. Pros +great graphics+vivid world +addictive gameplay+lots to do online and in story mode +pretty good storyCons Online is full of hackers and nothing seems to be done about it. I just played the game again today to try the yacht update and within about 10 mins I had a pink sticking out the side of my head.. I typed a message asking other players about it and was then turned into a pot plant lol Social and political commentary is very in your face and gets old rather quickly some of the "jokes" are funny the first time but none of them are funny the 150th time.. And some of the "jokes" are more like rants posted in a comments section by an angry far left millennial. Definitely not what i'm looking for when i play a video game... Dispite all their anticapitalist political commentary bad business practices are all over the place rockstar has been the center of countless controversies since gta v came out microtransactions overly pricey cars houses and gear and under paying online missions to encourage the buying of ingame money that summer sale thing ect. Game seems to be becoming less and less optimized with each update..

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I first bought this game on the ps3. I waited a long time for this game and wasn't disapointed with my experience on the ps3. Then I got it on the ps4. Again I was greatly pleased the already amazing story line was only enhaced by better graphics more populated streets more emersives features such as the long awaited first person mode.About a year ago when I build my first trully gaming pc I fell I love with so many things that I regreted ever leaving the beloved pc for the console. I still use my console but mostly for sports and couch gaming with friend But the pc is so emersive and the community much more friendly and stimulating.After buying two installments of the same game I told myself it would be stupid to waste my money on an third one. Was I so wrong! finally breaking under the pressure I did it I bought a third version of the same game. Waited a few long hours to download it boot it up perfected the settings and started a new story.I was totally blown away. The experience was amazing. The same game yes but more in every way. The upgraded from ps3 to ps4 was great but this was on an other level. The responsiveness of mouse and key board felt amazing. The first mission in north yankton was the eye opener to the precission of mouse aim making you feel like a true criminal and dead eye marksman. No more lock on just pure fluid movement moving to one head to the other dealing massive dammage and trully satisfying bodies falling as you walk trough the snow parking.Once the prelude done Los Santos came to life. The intro video gave a preview of what was to come. The same great game plus some. If you read all the way to here fist off congratulation for tolarating my pationate and distracted mind but mostly you can understand that this game is truly good and even considering that you might have played on another platform if you enjoyed it you will the same on pc. I won't start on modding beacause I could write pages after pages about this experience but I you have the patient and the will to make mods work you will discover a whole new world making the price tag laughable.in short If you can get it on sale I would recommended this game without a doubt!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game in it's current state is more wrecked than Syria right now.Before the Gun Running update me and a few friends were playing gta online for a bit doing CEO missions because one of us could actually get an office. One of my friends tells us about an injector script that gives you $5 million every second. I downloaded it (reluctantly thinking this was another virus or shutdown script prank) to my surprise it worked and before I knew it I had the maze bank tower and 30 x80s (in case they did a money purge it was only a rumor at the time but I hardly believed it would happen). 'About a week after using it we're playing around with the new I got. going around either killing random players we come across or doing pvp fights with eachother. One of my friends buys an OPENIV mod menu the day before the cease and desist and we were all on a flying yacht for the next 20 minutes.The next day back on online mode I spawn in my office and get on a call with friends only to hear that they were all perma banned everyone but me and the guy with the now useless mod menu ( he got banned a few hours later). What the rockstar? I am still not banned and I still have about 5 x80s left (they even patched the injector script so don't get any ideas) but the point is that I hacked money in game and Im still not banned yet while my friends that haven't modded or gotten any large sums of money from drops. Now I'm going to touch on something else overpriced DLC items.Im going to be really brief but unless you are able to shell up $100 to buy the cheapest hangar with one of the new $50 planes your out of luck. Go play some other good game like one of the Fallout games or maybe KSP before its destroyed by T2.Fix your Rockstar/Take Two. Unless you fix your game Im not planning on changing this review or playing your games.

Driving is so satifsing and what's even better is the first person. Played the whole game in first person. Amazing. However the only way to play with friends is online. This sucks. No mods or your banned. Thats not fun. I want to be able to host a session for me and my friends to join spawn some tanks in and just drive around having fun. Sadly the only way to do this is with mods. That is not how a game should be. Rockstar can have their online multiplayer but there should be a seperate way to host a session where you can use mods and cheats without the fear of being banned. Over all still a good game.

review: Pros *Lot of content *Good selection of vehicles *Fun to play with friends*Single player mods (no major game changing mods yet but they are coming)*Cons*Hackers although they are becoming less and less they came in waves as soon as trainers are patched and cycle repeats. *Cant buy everything. Pretty impossible to own everything in the game without buying sharkcards (ingame money) *Payouts during most missions are pointless. Heist are only way to make money now and can get boring as there is only handful and become grinding expirence. *There is currently no visable way to pick your country server so you easily can stubble upon lobby of french speaking people (which I just go find new session). Final thoughts I think the game is pretty good for what it is and rockstar did a pretty well job in porting this game to PC I do not have any issue running this on GTX 780 on high and get always above 60fps. Lowering things easily puts me in 100 150 fps range. Only thing I would say after playing this game it is good game to meet people in. Just takes time to find people as many people in the GTA community are and are sometimes just rude. GTA community on pc is mainly men but quite a few girls play GTA and the have entire girl only crews that women can join to play with other girls which is always nice thing to so in the gaming community. So definatly a diverse game with lot to offer.

review: Disclaimer I played only the single player so my review won't mention anything about the online component of the game.TL DR Even though the story is considerably weaker than both GTA IV and San Andreas GTA V is still a brilliant masterpiece and definitely recommended.Now here are the positives and negatives + The story doesn't have the impact of GTA IV or San Andreas but it still has enough depth to be engaging. Going through the story mode with three different protagonists is a somewhat unique experience as not many games do that.+ The graphics are incredible for a 3 year old game. And I didn't even install any graphic enhancers. I have a GTX 1080 and with everything max'd the visuals are breath taking. What impressed me most is how real how life like everything looked. It enhances the atmosphere greatly.+ Speaking of atmosphere Rockstar does it again. They have created a masterfully crafted mind blowingly detailed living breathing world. From the sound of cooling metal after you drive a vehicle for a long time to the customisation options in your cell phone the world is full of details. I can't even begin to guess how much time they spent designing Los Santos.+ Incredible top notch voice acting. Every single person in the game even the pedestrians will make you feel like you are listening to actual human beings talking real time instead of studio recorded voice files. No other game I've played has this level of quality voice acting.+ The radio and TV shows. You can spend hours listening to/watching them. They are that good.+ The game offers so many options that you can tweak almost every aspect of the game. The Settings menu is just huge.+ The game doesn't just consist of the story mode. There are tons of activities you can do all around Los Santos. Even after you finish the story you can keep playing for at least 50 60 hours. The story lacks the impact of both GTA IV (and its superb DLC The Ballad of Gay Tony) and San Andreas. It lacks the personal touch those games had. I couldn't really care about either Michael or Trevor (I actually hated every minute we played as Trevor). The only person I was interested in was Franklin and he is the least focused on protagonist. Niko's past haunted him all throughout the game and CJ had an odyssey filled with loss grief betrayal and twists of luck. There is no deep story here. We just follow a "from rags to riches" story with no special twists or surprises. The end of the story was definitely not cathartic like GTA IV or San Andreas was. Hell even Vice City had a more impactful ending. There isn't enough information about some of the missions before you start them and you get bad results that you could've easily avoided if you read a walkthrough. For example whatever you do leave the Lester assassination missions after the main storyline or you won't be able to 100% the game because you won't have enough money to buy all the properties. Those missions can earn you enormous amounts of cash IF you finish the main story first. Also towards the end of the main story there is a mission during which a wrong decision may cost you almost 20 million dollars. There are a few other missions like this where you have no warning whatsoever and the wrong choice creates a lot of headache for you down the road. There are some optimization problems. Even with a i7 8700 16 GB DDR4 RAM and a GTX 1080 I had FPS drops more often than I'd tolerate. The problem seemed to get better after a driver update but still persisted.All in all this is one of the best games to come out in the last 5 years. I definitely recommend it. Even though the story feels a little lacklustre compared to the previous games in the franchise it's still a masterpiece.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Don't even kid yourself this is the best sandbox game ever made to date. This is one of the few games I felt was worth the full 60 bucks. Taking your motorcycle cross country or stunt jumping through the city is an entirely different game. The potential for messing around and having fun is pretty great and this game looks amazing for its scale and for being an open world game.That said the single player felt a little short and a little boring at times. Specifically the missions. All the characters were interesting enough and had great voice acting except for Franklin. I felt the writing was slightly too serious and gritty this time around but I could just be biased from liking San Andreas the most.Online is still riddled with hackers with no end in sight. Custom races and missions are pretty fun if it's worth your time. It's also a pain to use cheats in single player since they wanted to prevent online hacking (didn't work out too well) which makes me think they should have just made it a seperate game for online and they could have focused more on single player missions.Overall great game get it on a sale though and make sure you can run it first.

review: When people complain about this game I feel as if they're trying to prove why a 5 star game isn't a 5 star game. But maybe a 4 star game. It feels like they rate it negativley to be contrarian or they rate if by a different standard that they would rate other games. This game is so huge so real so beautiful that we still see it as the gold standard to which open world games need to look up to 4 years later. This game is so extrodinary and mindblowing that it's difficult too say why somebody wouldn't like it. I have a couple of friends who don't and they say that it just didn't feel good to control which I kind of understand. Kind of. Multiplayer has turned into it's huge money maker but even if you don't like it (which I can see why with the average GTA V player) the story just by itself is enough for it to be outstanding. The voice acting in this is so great as well that it feels so real but self aware that it's silly at the same time. If you want a game with a South Park vibe that isn't kinda crappy like the actual South Park game get this.

review: An epic adventure of 3 men bound by their destiny to stick together through thin and thick. Rockstar have absolutely outdone themselves with this amazing title.The game is superbly optimized and even with a simple 3 year old laptop connected to a 32" TV I can enjoy it without any lag with all the options turned on ( i5 6200U SSD 8 Gig RAM Built in Intel HD 520 )I own 6 GTA titles being an avid fan of the series and having been playing since 1989 this is by far the best game I have played taking all genres into account. The map is vast and the graphic engine on which the game is based is simply supreme and able to deliver superbly realistic world.The ability to operate cars boats helicopters planes submarine bikes and quads is so involving.The world is rich with a vast variety of secondary characters and animals such as rabbits deer cows wild cats and others is truly overwhelming at times. The world is simply sublime with every single detail such as lighting though through and delivered to a player.Weather changes and times of day are amazing and really draw the player into the the whole experience.The world is amazingly colourful and vibrant.The upgrade ability and customization of vehicles is by far better than NFS series...And of course the story line is absolutely mind blowing wanting the player to continue without stopping...This is an absolute maverick of a title and I will be replaying it time and time again just like previous titles...Thank you very much Rockstar for your wonderful hard work to get this title ready and huge thumbs up to all the people involved including a vast array of voice over actors..You are the best guys!!!!Love and respect x

review: Well after 450 Hours of playing so far it's time to make a honest review about this game.First of. i would recommend the game for the singleplayer yes cuz i really love the singleplayer and the story.but to come to the online mode. . . i dont even know where to start with so i gonna put pros and cons into a list insteed.SingleplayerPros good ambients good story line nice details enjoyable gameplayCons not much activitys (mostly the same destroying and killing things) Cops can be a pain in the butt sometimes cars break down to quick (without armor upgrade) some missions are really hard sometimes mostly almost impossible to not die ones.GTA v OnlinePros lots of choices of cars aircrafts etc. nice heists you can perform nice conzept (actually no but i will explain later)Cons way to many cheaters in seasons sometimes overprices stuff and upgrades if you're new it's almost impossible to play with all the unfair vehicles sometimes you cannot perform some heist and missions while being in a friends only sessions (you're forced to go on a puplic online session) some glitching and bugging things as example put back the avenger into the base manualy. (will result in endless loading screen) getting money is really a slow progress if you dont have much people to do heists with. heavy armor is a joke. dont even bother to buy one.in short. there are waaaaaaaay more things i encountered while playing but the list will go on forever so i just put the most important things.I dont recomment the game if you plan on playing the online mode. stay away from it as far as possible. but if you are interested into singleplayer i would recomment it.so up to you to waste money for a online mode or spend the money to enjoy a great story mode

review: I have bought this game three times (XB 360 One and now PC) and I love it.The content added to the game over the years has been great and it's been very generous for Rockstar to hand out DLC for free. The game has its flaws but that's perfectly ok as long as the developers try to make your gaming experience better. As my frien put it "I would happily spend $100 on GTA with all the content is has now." And so would I.Modding a game for the most part is almost entirely benefitial to the game. You've seen it with Bethesda titles such as Skyrim and Fallout and was very true for even GTA VI. Modding allows for communities to form and interact with one another to find ways to make a game even better. It's a passion and it takes hard work and dedication to create custom content for the games we already love. We do it not to insult the creators but to make our own stories and discover our own artistic interests. If the creators of a game refuses to improve their games then the community will. Plain and simple.Games such as GTA V that are more susceptible to alterations and modifications only entice players to jump on the creative train and take their shot at making something wonderful. If the game one makes is easily manipulated then one cannot complain that people take advantage of it. It's better to encourage modding than to spend thousands of dollars to prevent it something Rockstar clearly has not done. There will always be someone willing to change the code and enter a section of the game's engine that was never inteded to be breached.Singleplayer is a portion of ther game entirely different from its multiplayer countrpart. Taking away modding from a singleplayer game serves absolutely no purpose and should never be done. That's why people mod singleplayer sections of game to not ruin the multiplayer experience.Take Two this was a huge mistake and it should be considered fraud. Thousands of players have purchased GTA V multiple times and you should have no right to ban players based on your speculations of cheating. People who have spent $180 on your game should not be banned because of a flaw in your game design. No one asked you to create a currency in your game and no one said you had to create free DLC. You could have simply left the game alone and let the communty imprive it. Banning players for singleplayer modding is a great way to kill a game you spent millions on developing. Stop acting like you're underpayed and underappreciated. These reviews should have been the first thing you thought about when making this decision. Modding is an art form it's the same reason people become game developers. You can't just hinder someone's want for creativity. Next time think with your brain instead of your wallet.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Update I have been playing this game for a bit mostly for the multiplayer. However my opinion has changed and NO it is not about the stupid OpenIV boycott that everyone is doing. This is my own opinion.Firstly the positives. The story is good and the chemistry between the three characters are great. each character's abilities are unique where it would represent their speciality and don't have a copy + paste ability. Michael's ability is like a bullet time effect where you can shoot enemies in slow motion and his speciality of precision and use of weapons Franklin's ability is a driving ability and allows him to turn corners or dodge vehicles easier and represents his passion for boosting cars and street racing (my favourite) and Trevor's rage ability where he resists most of the damage taken by enemies which represents his psychopathic behaviours. Seeing each character have its own banter together and disagreements can make you laugh or possibly think about who you like/dislike. personally I like all of the characters and it doesn't seem to be a problem because it all goes with the flow even if there is some beef between the characters.Another positive I found is that the game is well optimised. For me running an AMD FX 4350 processor and ASUS' AMD R9 270 on medium settings makes me manage the single player easily but there can be some difficulties for the multiplayer some few FPS drops here and there other than that the game feels easy to run.However the negatives I find are mostly on the multiplayer grand theft auto online. I'm sorry more like "Grind Theft Auto Online". It is a mess. Rockstar I know you want to add new content into the game that experienced players can have but the problem is having to be forced with Pay to win elements in a game (shark cards) makes free to play games feel embarrassed. Why are you putting a pay to win element in a game that already costs 20 (or 40 without discount). I mean yeah people will just go and grind their way to get the vehicles and the stuff they want but honestly having to grind for 3 Million for a CEO office (which is completely useless on its own) and a bunker or one of those import/export garages disgusts me. I even had to be given money just to enjoy the things I wanted to play with which is 10x more fun than actually grinding the same missions over and over again.Another negative is that the multiplayer is boring. As if playing for hours and hours would be boring enough the payouts in missions is basically slave money. you are forced to grind the missions either way unless you do the hiests (which I didn't do in the end because of how much a chore it is). The activities are bland there is no point in doing races or anything that relies on PVP as people that you face against on GTA O have a significantly stupid advantage over you just because they managed to win several races or have almost everything in the game including custom vehicles with the highest upgrades. People on GTA O also have almost everything that you can imagine e.g the new gun running vehicles and weapons that can be used as personal vehicles which defeats the purpose of having pegesus vehicles. You can have more stuff to do on a serious RP server on Multi Theft Auto than playing on GTA O without being maimed constantly by a person that has everything from shark cards. I mean come on where is the Single player DLC that they promised us for years and still haven't delivered it to us. Looks like they're too busy on trying to make a lot of money on GTA O and possibly developing GTA 6 like those lying and illiterate GTA youtubers who are discussing about and trying to find substance to fool many 8 year olds who love the game too much.Oh yeah another thing I wanted to add is that there are not many hiests only 5 (Fleeca job Prison Break Humane Labs The trevor hiest (don't know the name) and the Pacific rim job hiest). And also playing these hiests are also a pain unless you have friends to help you. the randoms make it more aggrovating than it sounds and you can't even control their incompetence. The payment is... ok I guess but generally when they had 2 3 years making these hiests I felt a bit disappointed because there were a lot of things they could've done but didn't because they want to make the experience of the game more stale than a piece of bread.Lastly the final thing I want to discuss are the servers. Sorry I mean Peer to peer connection they have for GTA O. Well considering that Rockstar got massive amount of profit for the initial release of GTA it would make sense of having server's right? well not on their business model. I remembered playing with an irish friend of mine that couldn't play because of Peer to peer connection which is stupid and disappointing because of how much the friend wanted to play GTA O and join in the adventures with me yeah sure there can be some things Rockstar is developing other games and representing them elsewhere but surely a AAA title that runs Peer to peer connection is questioning the overall quality of the execution they made on GTA O Overall If you want to get the game for the single player and for its mods then this game is for you. However I find that the multiplayer is too grindy too boring and represents a F2P stereotype that we know and hate. Of all of the games I was surprised that Rockstar is one of the culprits of having F2P elements in the game. For anyone that defends this sort of sellout stratergy I say no to that. Telling me to grind missions or get good at the game is literally not even an argument that overtakes my point if I'm going to play a multiplayer game I'd expect the opposing team or players in the game to have beaten me or play against me fair and square without the use of pay to win elements I am against microtransactions because it just makes the progression of the game meaningless to an extent where you would be dominating people just because the developer's patted you on the back for giving them your cash.

What's that? Did you use the self radio? Prepare for "funny" breaks inbetween your custom songs when they rag on you for playing your own songs instead of listening to their soundtrack!Though I hope you brought your friends if you want to play online because they'll constantly recommend 2 player minimum missions to the point you'll do ANY 1 player mission even if it's the only one recommended because it's HARD AS BALLS.Also for you few that use DS3/SCP Server controller support for PS3/PS4 controllers it has great controller support all until the point where the controller disconnects for a second forcing you to either use keyboard and mouse or quit the game to restart so you can use your controller in game again!

review: The single player mode is fine but GTA Online is horrible and that is where you will spend all your time once you complete the story mode. A year ago the game was so filled with hackers that you couldn't even play GTA Online without being assaulted by a never ending stream of cheaters and hackers it was horrible. So I waited for a year thinking that after that long surely Rockstar had the game functioning properly. Well the hackers aren't as abundant but now the game if full of glitches that render the game unplayable. First problem I noticed was half of my map icons didn't exist anymore. I could not see clothing stores garages barber shops etc. So I completely reinstalled the game which takes forever with a game this size and now my map icons are back but I keep getting stuck on loading screens when I enter or exit missions. I sent a support ticket to Rockstar which they are not responding to so I tried to talk to Steam about the problem but the only way I found to communicate with them was to send a refund request which of course they denied because I have had the game for over a year. Rockstar does not deserve anymore money for this incomplete product we aren't talking about an early access game this is supposed to be the final version of the game which means it should be fully functional. Rockstar does not care if it's customers are satisfied once they have your money they leave you hanging with no options. I am seriously considering filing a report with the federal trade comission they have gotten rich off of this game the least they could do is make it actually playable.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is a game of (unlimited mode) of unlimited possibilities but there is no doubt what's really great about the latest GTA? I will try to summarize the following in the following rows.. . The story of the latest big car robbery could be summed up into one single sentence "You You Become a Boss" as in any GTA ... but since the game has up to three playable characters (Ku which we get later) each has its own problems dependencies and this is also the focus of missions ... so the psychopathic Trevor (T) has the best and most mission critical missions because he has to take care of his company "Trevor Philips Industries" (If you run drugs to Blaine County behind Trevorov).. . On the other hand such a 40 year old Michael has his family which consists of a fat / ungrateful son a wife and daughter in law who apparently would like to get into the TV and do anything (He has no problem with ). So it follows that Michael (Only M) does not only have time for various illegal activities but must protect his family honestly ... not to mention that he will later get into the movie business.. . And we get to the character whose first mission is to steal the car ... yes it is the last character of Franklin. The whole game I could not get rid of the feeling that Franklin (already only F) is actually CJ just lives in 2014. But even so his missions have from the beginning (Nechem to express racist) "black" content or you will steal cars and more than half the attempt you will not get rich.. . When you know F M T you can imagine what happens when these 3 elements meet and you can believe that it will be a really rough ride.. . . The big plus is of course the Dialogues that are the best Rockstar Games ever offered and with a good knowledge of English you will be laughing at each sentence as they are really Perfect. I can only talk about dialogues.. . The end of the story however is based on you and you can either be spoiled or take care of all your problems and decide whether you will live or die in Los Santos.. . The city is indeed as vast as everyone says. But the question remains whether or not to do it? The answer is definitely yes. In the city there are many races minigames or mini missions in the form of adrenaline jumps from parachutes from huge buildings and of course not to forget there are walkers strip clubs and of course Rampage (But you can play only for T and unfortunately there are only 5 is quite a disappointment).. . But personally the city has been hurt by the lack of strength and the impossibility of buying Safe Houss (Buildings You Can Buy). What the previous GTA did not have is a triathlon (I do not have to explain what is going on) which is fairly enjoyable and confiscated about a bit (They are 3 and the last one is less than 40 minutes to go). Of course everyone who wants to enjoy a good adrenaline action will take a mountain bike turn on First Person and go from Mount Chilliad.. . I would like to get to the best of my PC and PS4 versions. This is of course the above mentioned FPS mode. He has his flies for example that the character in the FPS fashion can not use his hands and so in the door just bluntly. One more thing (As I like the movie feeling of the game) which is more than a matter of fact is that the character does not know how to walk slowly in the FPS fashion and so it still escapes and it spoils the impression of some scenes.. . The action is on the other hand in FPS fashion perfect and weapon details to experience a more realistic action and to feel like you were a real psychopathic T like killing brothers O Neils so FPS mode is right for you (I spent more than 17 h).. . On the contrary driving a car is much harder as sparse mirrors are absolutely nothing to you and you can not even see them in Highest details (which is quite sad for such a game).. . That's how we get to the graphics that were perfect at the time of release on the PS3 and now after the release of the next gen and the PC is fairly decently transformed ... as soon as the sledge does not fall out of it but you still scare off the perfectly processed water perfectly crafted faces of the main characters and of course you have the famous 60 FPS.. . There is no need to comment on the graphic because it is still more than good but as long as I was waiting on the PC version it could be even better for two.. . Missions unlike previous parts of the GTA series have relatively long quests and that means you just have to move from A to B and mash everything you can but this time you have to go to buy weapons first then a journey full of great dialogues awaits you then a massive shootout some cut scenes the way home and if you're lucky enough to have another massive shotgun (such as Mr. T).. . Okay but that's not something that makes the new GTA much better than the previous ones. But you have not yet heard about HEISTOS ... ask yourself what it is? These are the best missions that GTA offers. Robbery. Of course such a robbery of the World Bank requires some planning ... so you have to get some fire fighting cars then you have to cover up your crutch take the guys to this lucrative JOB and then choose the procedure.. . After this long and difficult planning however waiting for you to deserve robbery where despite the very good planning something always goes wrong (I'm talking about Palleto Bay) ... but the catch up to the last heist is never worth the trouble. And that's what GTA V is different from the previous ones.. . Multiplayer is so sweet from the main part of these heistov where you play with your friends on the NPC eckok and it's more fun I personally uploaded it for about 20 25 hours with my friend and it's incredible fun. Of course it's not just about the Heats there are races (All Kinds) DeadMatch fights those heistas and I do not forget the missions and you can rob the stores and it all bears that in the classic GTA story and completes the overall impression from GTA.. . GTA V is therefore a good game like everyone else and although the basic story goes for about 40 50 hours Multiplayer bonus activity and overall openness can confuse you for the next 150 hours.. . 9.5/10.

review: I briefly played Grand Theft Auto 4 and felt amused and intrigued by the game but unfortunately I never finished the game. I didnt even get past 10% on the game im sure but as soon as I started playing GTA 5 I was hooked. This game is well worth the hours spent on it. Story is great Visuals side missions extra added missions cars weapons and just about everything else is so well done. Not to mention the music is great as well. Im probably more biased on this game than some of the other GTA games but this has to be my favorite so far. Granted my all time favorite is still Vice city stories but only based on story and nostalgia. I just like the whole 80's theme/tony montana vibe. Nevertheless GTA 5 is loads of fun to play and has lots of comedic undertones in it that make it enjoyable throughout the game. I love games that also have replayability value and this is definitely one of them. Good job guys.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I used to play this on the 360 i can say that the singleplayer is quite good but i prefer the story of GTA IV because it was more focus in one chacarter instead 3 i found to be more easy to relate to 1 protagonist instead of 3 still though mods are a plus in pc gaming and this franchise it's no stranger when it comes to modding. As for the online part it's bad for the most part. It can be fun at first but after 100 hours into and still grinding my off it start to get boring. After a while you don't get the feel that you're progressing in anyway it feels more like im doing this for nothing trying to get a bunch of fast cars and crazy vehicles just to amuse me for mere hours/minutes. Sure they drop alot of ''free'' updates but then again... it's the same thing all over it you grind alot you get what you want and after some hours/minutes you're done. As for the grinding it's ridiculous this is a AAA game that you pay $60USD and it feels like a mobile game in the sense that you must have the patience of a virtue to earn such item if you do buy this game soley for the online... well then prepare yourself to redo alot of heists vip/ceo/biker bussines and 2xRP/Money events or pay real money just to get something that feels overpriced. Another problem with the online aspect it's Hackers i can assume that 80% of the freemode servers it's bond to have at least 1 hacker and it's even sad when half of the lobby ask the hacker for in game cash... or even worse when the hacker starts to ''play'' with your account. Overall GTA V it is a fun game at most but i think it is somewhat overpriced because of the multiplayer. I think Gta online should turn into a F2P or something like that while we pay $30USD just for the singleplayer.

This game has by far the worst loading times in any game I've ever played and because of that I would rate GTA V 6/10tl dr good game but loading screens last extremely long

review: Here's an honest review over GTAV. I only have 4.5 Hours currently on the PC Version but i can tell you alot about the core game i have played GTA V since its release in September 2013 yeah this game is over two years old now and just released this April on the PC.So first off why everyone comes to reviews is to look at the Cons ill start with those.CONS This game is a Cash Cow. R* Doesn't give a flying flip about you unless your spending money on their shark cards (in game currecy). A good example if you wanted to buy all the cars from the last DLC drop with real money you would spend nearly $450 buying the cars and upgrading them all the way this is only like 7 cars mind you and doesn't include any of the houses guns clothing. R* Support/Servers both suck. R* doesn't really care to help you with any problems unless its just a connection problem but even then you will more than likely will get a automated message about 3 4 days after submitting a ticket you're better off trying to talk to other players on the forums. Secondly the servers tend to drop out alot ive tried this from my own home to my friends house in the city who has a 1GB internet speed its the servers problem. With that said you will also drop in and out of ghost lobbies too (by yourself) or just experince lag in a lobby with 10 15 people in it. Hackers/Modders. Their everywhere. First lobby i joined on PC had a hacker who dropped me 300k. I submitted a ticket which im still waiting for to get taken care of to remove it so i dont get banned. *Fingers crossed*. Then i hopped around found a couple good lobbies found one with a few guys where we went to the airport and started racing. This one kid shows up (literal kid 13 year old squeaker) with a T20 while were all in muscle cars he destroys us obviously and we told him he's being a brat and needs to get the same class car he ends up overclocking all of our characters (hacking) and made all 4 of our games crash just because we "told him to get a different car". From stories i hear theres even hackers that can get you banned by putting your name as theirs and they go on killing sprees blowing up peoples cars and placing you in the bad sport lobbies. Everything is overpriced. As i said ealier this game is a cash cow and they want your real life money. EVERY DLC the cars just get more and more expensive. Like recently in this low rider DLC you can get a car for 30 000 (previously the DLC before this the cheapest car was 400k). This isn't too bad for a lowrider but when you take it to the shop to "upgrade" it to become a low rider custom you have to drop 350k just to unlock the parts then 75 150k each part for hydralics dash interior wheels etc etc. You'll easily spend 2m on the most recent DLC on just one car. Mind you 1.2m is $20 real life money and it is stupid hard to actually earn money in game unless you spend 15 hours a day grinding heists to afford ONE car in a few days (45 hours total). Limited Customization. This game has been out for two years and theres SO MANY faults in this game. Theres no black or white backwards hats but there sure is green and purple. You cant have a regular ol bent foward hat but you can have the swag flat bills. Theres tons of cars that have no modifications cant put a cowl hood on a el camino. Theres no body work out system where you can tone your apperance or get fat everyone is slimmed. The Apartments are a joke once you buy a "High" Apartment you pretty much own them all and the only reason why you would buy any of the others aside from the cheapest one is for location or just to have another garage for more cars. Everyone is an . You will just be cruising along on your street bike jamming to your own self playlist just to have a tryhard in a zentorno come flying at you knock you off and throw a sticky bomb at you and drive away... They will repeat this 5x till you blow them up (which costs you money for destroying another players vehicle and since zentornos are super cars thats 25k outa your pocket just for the car) then they will go into passive mode (cant kill them) call in their car again that you paid to replace and start repeating. Theres at least 2 people like this in every server. Who at the first sign of losing will go get a tank/jet and ruin everyones fun. Can't tell you how many times ive tried to hold a car show on the XB1 with easily 20 people show up and get all parked looking fancy just for a guy to fly by in a jet and kill everyone till we all leave/hide underground. The game is unfinished. Yes it is i don't care what anyone says. Theres literally dozens of locations you can glitch into that have no purpose (yet). Good examples are how you could glitch into some of the prisons buildings into the Labs or the banks because they were intended to be opened up later as DLC. Yes people all the DLC you get is already in the game that their just "unlocking". R* is just milking this game for your money.Now with this down let me tell you why i do recommend this game. Pros You will never have a experince like this on any other game. I have lead a crew on GTA since the release "Player Killers" i started out small and grew the crew into 600+ People we were ranked #16 on the leader boards for TDM we were a force. Slowly tho the crew died out as the game got repeatative and i ended up joining a MC(Motocylce club) Bound By Blood and i stayed with them for over a year it was really neat playing with 60 or so other players in the same crew who role played as a biker club and we would all ride in formation it was something else alot of memories and drama was made on this game as also finding brothers who were passionate about the same things i was. You can practically do anything and go to anywhere you see. Want to sky glide from the mountain to the ocean? Do it. You want to fly that jet upside down in that tunnel? Good luck but do it. You want to ruin everyones car show by taking a Monster Truck through it? Do it. You want to go stunt biking in the city? Do it. You want to be an and ruin everyones day? Do it. Aside from R* obvious money hungry strategy they do keep adding more DLC to the game (unlocking) areas clothes and cars about every 2 3 months keeping the game fresh. You can make your own playlist on the radio from your own music folders i currently have 150 songs in game on one radio station on repeat sadly other people cant hear it but its really refreshing to listen to your own tunes in game. The Graphics are one of the best even if its built on a older gen system and just upped for PC its still amazing and you can download mods to make it even better (offline only).Final Verdict 8/10.Other than the outstanding flaws in this game from R* being greedy bad support and the player base full of hackers the core game itself is pretty fun and you can easily grind out 500+ hours from this game 200+ from the story alone if you want to complete everything and take your time.

review: I really really hate what Rockstar decided for GTA V that is putting all the additional content into the online mode and make the single player empty. To this point there's no necessity for me to right yet another critical review of GTA V's story mode. So I'm gonna recommend the story mode. The online mode is fun with friends for maybe dozens of hours. What after that is mindless grind or challenges with no real story. Since how much content was cut for microtransaction items the city is hardly immersive when comparing it to the previous titles. There are many good game modes when playing online but never have they become truly memorable since in the essence they are only chores for leveling up and gain cash. The character creation is... you can only create 2 characters and never get the chance to change anything about them after creation. For a game like GTA V shouldn't customization being a priority? Besides that Rockstar expect everyone to be the same person the same criminal boss or robots who have hardly any motivations for doing things. You get to get the cash the cars and weapons and houses and other stuff but never a character development. Character development should not be a thing to care about in GTA online originally. However like I said after updates and updates the game promotes the idea that you should make your criminal business bigger like you are some somebody that the whole city should reckon but in the end you are not. That creates a conflict between new gameplay and the reason to experience new things... There are many other flaws but these are what I care about the most.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Hands down one of the greatest games ever made. Rockstar the developer has been making GTA games for two decades and Grand Theft Auto V is their masterpiece. It is has more attention to detail than any other game I've ever played. The story is unique well written hilarious shocking and heart breaking all at the same time. If that's not enough there is an online mode that has been supported with updates and new content for years. This game offers hundreds &amp hundreds of hours of some of the best content in video games. If you haven't played this stop what you are doing and start GTA 5 now.

review: I bought this game in 2015 and it was the standalone version. I had alot of trouble getting it to work due to my slow internet connection and there were constant server errors while updating the game. Once I've started playing I forgot all the hard times I had getting the game to work cause this is a phenomenal game. The environment and atmosphere is like no other.The story is intense and there are alot of references to pop culture and previous Grand Theft Auto games. Finishing the missions in story mode only contributes to around 50% of total game completion then there are alot of activities in and around Los Santos which will keep us entertained and we'll be able to spend many hours on the game without getting bored.Then there is Gta Online at first it was boring then due to the constant updates and DLC's introduced by Rockstar it is one of the best open world online games out there.So to conclude if you are a game enthusiast and haven't played this amazing game yet then I have only one thing to say "Go for it" cause it's worth every penny you spend.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I bought GTA V with high hopes as I had greatly enjoyed playing it on the Xbox 360. I create my online character and begin to enjoy the game.The game itself? Phenominal. Just a masterpiece. It is hard to get started with money and all but once you do it is easy.Then 3 days after getting the game I encounter a hacker. He had given everyone in the lobby rank 150 and 400 mil. Me not wanting to get banned called Rockstar support. I simply told them that I wished to have my money and rank put back to where it was.They told me that the hack was coming from my computer and was not given to me by someone else. I am given a supsension and my progress will be reset. I wouldn't have been too mad except I had spent money on the criminal enterprise starter pack and was told it would not be refunded or given to me again.Basically Rockstar support sucks. This game is good if you can manage to not get banned for something you didn't do.2/10 DO NOT buy this game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V is a very good game No question about it.GTA O on the other hand is the worst experience you can get from any open world multiplayer Hackers Banned without reason ( seriously ) Need to clock in several days worth of hours to buy good stuff. ( not always but getting businesses to get money fast requires lots of grinding in the first place ) Useless support contact The economy is inflated ( stuff now cost millions ) Economy that suits Shark Cards ( which isn't worth it since you can't buy that much stuff from a Megalodon SC ) etcThey cut the price of the game in half because less people are playing it and to attract new people to buy the game. They also added the "Guest List" as an incentive to play online (which is absolutely worthless $100K may seem alot but it really isn't). If you've seen reviews some new players (not even 9 hours in) have gotten banned for no reason. The Ban system of GTA O is random. It doesnt always target hackers and legit players have been caught in the crossfire.I've been banned recently for no reason and I get the SAME copy+paste NO REPLY email from R* saying that "i violated"(which i didn't i always grind) their terms and service.They say their bans are FINAL which i call t. You can't appeal a ban to restore your character. no no no. You can get banned for no reason and show proof and they still won't believe you.GTA O has been riddled with bugs since launch. R* cares more about making money from Shark Cards instead of fixing their bugs. The occasional updates that cause bugs that are exploited by players get patched quickly ( deluxo superspeed ) but bugs that happen to businesses and bunker research ( researching the same item twice ) hasn't been patched yet.I'm actually happy from getting the ban from R* I can now freely mod singleplayer without any risks of getting banned in Online. It is a online ban (which is worthless) so it doesn't affect me much (though i lost my progress).If you're buying GTA V for the story and action Go ahead and buy it. It's a blast to play.If you're buying GTA V for the Online. Just Dont. It isn't even worth it.Note GTA Online is fun to play if you have friends and a blast to play on heists. Playing Online alone is like a survival game. Alone and everyone wants to kill you (especially those tryhards and griefers).
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V I am writing this review only for the main story because Online personally is not GTA V. Story You take three roles Trevor's Michael's and Franklin's. It begins with Trevor Michael and Brad (which is dead) robbing a bank. That's it! Robbing a bank. When the heist is over you take control over Franklin with his friend Lamar repossesing two cars for Simeon. As Franklin is doing a mission for Simeon his is almost done by taking a car from a rich house something happens that takes you to the beautiful story of Grand Theft Auto V. When all the characters meet the star thinking about the big heist something big that will get them retired for the rest of their lives but to reach their goal they will have to pass some very big obstacles. Character description Michael He is my favorite character. He is a rich guy with two children Tracey and Jim and a stripper for wife Amanda. He is the serious man with some obstacles in his life. Michael's story centers around how his seemingly idyllic and halcyon lifestyle is brought to a halt as his past demons and morally compromising mistakes come back to haunt him. Meanwhile his midlife crisis pushes him to his ultimate snapping point. Trevor Trevor is my second favorite character being a very vrazy guy with a lot of power to kill you. Seriously. Trevor has been described as a difficult person to deal with extreme impetuous vengeful psychopathic unhinged unpredictable untamed infamous homicidal and prone to violent outbursts and destructive rampages. He does everything in a sociopathic and relentless manner (much different from Michael). Although Trevor is like this he is honest about it and will never show hypocrisy. He has his own charm along with his own principles.Franklin If Franklin was a little more like Michael he would be my favorite character meaning I would not have had Michael and Trevor at these positions. Franklin is described as ambitious but perhaps to a fault and very eager to take on new illegal challenges. He is also described as calm smart rational and a logical way of showing a young man with a lot of hope with Dan Houser claiming that this would be a nice contrast from Michael. He is also a person that even though he's being mentored by Michael in crime mentors Michael in life. My rate 8 5/10

review: First I want to say buy this when it's on Sale for $30 or less it's not worth $60 if you are like me and already own it on a PS3 and PS4 yes the PC port is good but not great. The pause menu has some lag here and there it's not a big deal but still noteworthy also at the moment there is a memory leak in this game meaning it's not taking full advantage of the hardware so it doesn't matter if you have a GTX 770 or a GTX 1080 ti this game will punish any card if you crank up the settings and resoultion up it's one of those games like Crysis that just is crazy taxing on any system as of Q4 of 2017 maybe one day not so much The Story is great and has multi endings depending on your choice near the end of the story driving is very nice also too many games try hard to be this game and most fail compared to this Watch Dogs 1 &amp 2 Mafia 3 and Tom Clancy Ghost Recon Wildlands all have nothing on GTA 5 this game puts all of them to shame hands down the driving is better in this game than all of those I mentioned also you can mod the hell out of it in single player or in FiveM I don't like GTA Online that much but I'm sure there's people that will love and enjoy the grind or have tons of real money to blow on the Online The gunplay is good but feels cluncky and akward at times I would stay in 3rd person most of the time 1st person is cool but gets old fast so your mileage will very on that end of things Trevor is by far the best one out of 3 characters you play and is the most fun to run around as Micheal is a train wreck at the start of the game and he always finds a way to be up to creek and is very cringey of a person all around and last also least Franklin is the most Sterotypical lame and boring out of all three of them Trevor when you switch to him is throwing a bike gang member off a edge of a bringe Micheal Either Crying inside his car or driving one of his family members around in his ride Franklin is Ironing his shirt or typing on his Laptop lame asf they could've made Franklin way more intresting but played it safe the Cars go anywhere from a smart car to a Bugatti Veyron but they renamed it Adder prob to save money also you can Drive Tanks Fighter Jets Monster trucks ATV's Dirt Bikes normal bicycles just like in San Andreas mopeds To BMW Motorcyles look alikes Lambo's Ferrari's GT R look alikes and Muscles Cars all USA ones you can pimp your ride at any chop shop buy guns go hunting go swiming or in a submarine fly a chopper crop duster have a yachet own a garage full of cars own houses own an airport steal a commerical plane have a dune buggie those are fun have a mad max looking muscle car change from many outfits and shoes and hats get tattto's buy local buisness around the area have make $ on the side from that rob a store or help stop a robbery course steal cars duh and shoot a ton of gang members law enforment and miltary than I can remember and anyone else that stands in your way in this game it's about 4 times bigger than GTA 4 i'm guessing maybe more or less depending on who you ask the support characters are very cringey all of them and live up to the streoyptes you'd expect and the cutscences are some of the best all around in short this game had a massive budget and they def messed up here or there but still a solid game overall

review: Grand Theft Auto 5 is not only a preposterously enjoyable video game but also an intelligent and sharp tongued satire of contemporary America. It represents a refinement of everything that GTA 4 brought to the table five years ago. It s technically more accomplished in every conceivable way but it s also tremendously ambitious in its own right. No other world in video games comes close to this in size or scope and there is sharp intelligence behind its sense of humour and gift for mayhem. It tells a compelling unpredictable and provocative story without ever letting it get in the way of your own self directed adventures through San Andreas.

review: I'll try to put this as simple as possible.Single PlayerSingle player in this game is an example of developers having no ideas for storyline and just came up with something that they thought it would be extremely appealing. It's short and not very interesting at all.Online Note There's nothing else to say about Single player since this game is intended to be an online game and that is exactly one of the reasons why single player was massively neglected.GTA Online started off very good actually but soon Rockstar realized that it's not the best way for them to make money off players. So that's when carefully calculated misproportion arrived on the scene. It's sole intention was to make Online experience as hard as possible. Prices of GTA Online in game purchasables are way up (millions) compared to what you earn from Missions/Heists. * Properties have to be "maintained" meaning in game currency is deducted for certain ammount to "try and make it more realistic" when at the same time flying cars and bikes are available for purchase (again millions).* Random wanted levels for no reason usually resolved by dialing in game contact Lester who would take off the wanted level for in game price.This might not seem as much but slowly over time it affects in game money massively it's is created so you hardly notice an obvious impact on the player's money.Comparing Single player prices to Online prices makes it really obvious. You don't pay utilities in Single player nor you pay dozens of thousands for car wheels but in Online this "realism" steps in.This whole idea of "trying to be realistic" ended up being very obvious intention. Shark Cards.This carefully constructed system of GTA Online is made so the players spend money really fast and earn it really hard and entire system so "innocently" leans towards an option to buy Shark Cards for in game currency. Yes you can do mission/heists indeed you can. What players call grinding in this game is more of exhausting waste of time. You want to skip meaningless heist repeating over over and over again just so you can earn few millions? Buy Shark Cards. Example 80 for 8M in game money gets you few properties not to mention that you need much more to fully "upgrade" cars which are few millions also and upgrades are around additional million. New players stand no chance against other players everything comes down to Shark Cards or playing for thousands of hours untill you're exhausted from it or just give up. But there's a solution yes Shark Cards.In addition Online is known to have long loading problems and even very often "disconnected from online session" problems. This was just an experimental phase for Rockstar as they are known for not being able to create functional multiplayer. Altering the course from what they did the best (Single Player/ Storylines) to Online "experience" mixing it up with Micro Transactions ended up as a disaster.And now the real stuff. Lobbies lobbies full of hackers/cheaters who intentionally ruin fun for others by trolling. Freezing trapping in cages setting on fire god modes exploding other players kicking out of lobbies and much more.So what do you do in this fabricated chaos? Nothing. Surely nobody would buy 80 Shark Card that is 30 more expensive than the GAME ITSELF. Fake reports that can get you mic muted when you don't even have a mic. How to resolve that? Contact support? Yes that's an option and it could take a long time. It all came down to Modder VS Modder experience.The only reason the anti cheat exists in this game is because of Shark Cards. They don't care about destroying the lobbies with trolling mods no primary intention is to "hunt down" the accounts that used the mods to add the money to avoid buying Shark Cards.But they add free content what about that?Free content is there to keep the game going so the players have something to latch on to the content that brings more overpriced purchasables.ConclusionGTA 5 can be described in 3 words Buy Shark Cards.If you are planing on buying this game because of Online or Single player Do NOT. Save your money and save your TIME.Mark 0/10 The worst GTA so far.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've been playing this game for months and I consistently tell my friends that it's the best "MMO" I've ever played (not strictly true but you get the point). This christmas I was ready to pony up and buy three of my friends the game so I could finally have a steady heist crew to get the consecutive bonuses but after reading the reviews of false bans I'm not going to do that. In fact I'm terrified to log back into online for fear of having some random stranger get me banned for something that's not my fault. I'm writing this review in hopes that people see this and act in kind. I would have bought 3 more copies of this game but now I think i'll take my time and money somewhere else until this is fixed.

review: To start ill quickly go over the single player since everything about it you can say has already been said The singleplayer is pretty fun experience that has an absolute ton of content to enjoy and will allow for hours of fun the characters are decent though using a single protagonist like previous GTA games would've been better in my opinion. Overall youre looking at a great singleplayer experience that is worth a look on sale espcially. However this game has an online component which is objectively the defining feature of the game in general and what R* games really want you to play and espcially spend money on(more on this later).I luckily got the game for christmas as a gift on PS4 originally moving into the year the heists update came out which gave me ample time to learn the game and get really invested in it. I had a blast playing it made a couple of friends on the way and we were hyped when heists came out and earned a good paycheck but sadly it wasnt enough for the dlc that came after and this is where the great gta grind begins. I drifted away from the game after heists discouraged by the grinding needed to acquire new items in the update and I eventually purchased the game on PC. By this point two new updates were out Finance and Felony and the Bikers update which introduced a new business element to the game which admittedly was cool to begin with and could be used as a long term consistent source of finance needed for new items. Problem with this was it was still the repetitive gameplay id quit GTA for previously grinding. It gets worse as Gunrunning releases which like previous updates introduced new meta defining items such as the Oppressor which griefers use to blow up business supplies and products of rivals in freemode sessions. So now you have items which cost an absurd amount to begin with and money making is made extremely difficult due to presence of other players. So one would seek other sources of cash injection because the need for money in GTA is now so great just so you can fight back against other players. From Gunrunning to present day all R* have done is keep introducing content which redefines the meta so money making is more difficult and prices of items are so ridiculous you either have to play the game like its your daily ing job or purchase sharkcards.GTA V is the finest example of how corporate greed ruins great games. My final statement about this game is Singleplayer is worth it on sale if you plan to play the multiplayer component use mods to inject cash into your account to save weeks of grinding or cashing out on over 100 of real money for single items. Without cash the online mode is not fun.Whatever you choose to do do not support Rockstars' anti consumer practices in any way as they do not deserve your money for making their best selling game a pay to play grind online
title: Grand Theft Auto V
