review: WARNING LONG REVIEW IS LONG And pretty well detailed in my not really that humble opinion (Psst spoiler free) )First a little bit sidetrack let's go back to the launch i was surprised when rockstar said it would run on a gt9800 i was amazed i had a gtx520 at the time and i was really happy because i was broke and that was what i had bought it at pre order played it on day 1...it was barely f*cking running now before one of you s start ranting about "hurr it's an old gpu what did you expect?" i expected it to RUN since the minimum was a goddamn 9800 i was playing it on full minimum and couldn't get a stable fps out of it they straight up LIED about it and no one seemed to notice maybe you can just save a quarter or half a salary and buy a evga 1080 but i live in Brazil here that costs nearly FOUR minimum wages and that nearly is my monthly house income. Probably it doesn't affect you but i bet more people were unable to play it because of this straight up lie.Now onto the game the campaign had nearly no REAL addition to even the 360 and ps3 versions it's just the same campaign same missions same cars just the same thing all over again it had some additions in purchase options some new buyable cars and a couple of side quests but that's about it for all these years singleplayer is a remaster AT BEST.However it's still a great experience if you never played it before i would surely reccomend it it's not THE best experience out there but that is up to you that is just opinion based it has some reasonably deep characters a good plot pretty different from what you would expect from the GTA franchise the dialogues are well written the pacing is good the gameplay is simple and satisfactory and the map is quite lively and fun to explore every other aspect is at least above average the only thing that kinda sets off the pace are the overuse of chase sequences using rigs and heavy vehicles that make the chase just depressing no car chase is fun at 65km/h.The main thing of this game is the "constant expanding" massive multiplayer now it's gut wrenching hard to talk about this without letting my TERRIBLE experience get in the way but i'll try at first it's relly fun even by yourself you'll see how many things you can do how many things you can buy you can buy houses exclusive cars exclusive jets VTOL jets russian hinds rocket cars private jets made of gold limos with miniguns lowriders racecars yachts bunkers clubs even car tuning has some depth and it's a blast getting your first houses and cars i would say the first 15 25 hours give or take wich let's be honest it's quite alright i remember that i had so much fun earning my money with street races and starting and customizing my garage but comes a point when you're already kinda entrenched in the game that you realize that making some real money in the game is f*cking IMPOSSIBLE you see that the races and survival missions you were doing have absolutely no value since everything cool costs at least a million there are sadly only two things you can do to earn money the public organization missions wich i will talk more later and heists.Heists are probably what you will be doing after a good couple of hours since it's more accessible then the organization missions all you need is a high end apartment wich can be bought easily enough even solo this is when it goes in a scary downward spiral it is a PAIN to find random people to do heists that won't up the whole thing you'll easily restart the same heist over 15 times because of a single dumbass if you're solo now with a team it's still fun as you'll have the designated driver pilot and stick together to pull off some pretty creative missions a quick tip if you make all heists in sequence with the same people you'll earn two achievements wich will grant you around 2 million each that plus the money from the heists wich might amass to a whooping 8 million on your bank account now if you're REALLY good at this game and finish the elite challenges also you'll be injected with so much f*cking money you'll feel like one of those middle eastern billionaires riding on golden bugattis and throwing cash at strippers but don't get your hopes up since the challenges are pretty insaneNow the REAL way to make money are organization missions wich compile CEO MC and now apparently gunrunning those will be your #1 and sometimes only hope of getting some meaningful money but there is a twist they can only be done on public lobbies you know the one filled with hackers trolls and armoured kurumas gunning down people with an uzi because they didn't even care to get a real car and a real weapon not even to troll.They are basically the same collect goods from spot A bring them to spot B to store and then take them to spot C to sell it ranges from crates to cars and drugs you will get marked on the map as a big red target for EVERYONE in the lobby everytime you pick up the goods if it gets destroyed game over try again however it requires a reaaaally big upfront pay making it ridiculously risky and nearly impossible to make a reasonable profit out of it.Another tip the vehicle CEO missions are the safest you don't need to pay to source a vehicle you'll only lose money if you up the delivery plus it's easy to run away from most trolls on highly tuned hypercarsThen your cousing "D*ckhead" comes in "Ey there has to be some way to overcome it...right?" and the answer is NO....not oficially *wink* (shoutout to grade)I'll let you guys in some juicy secret props for reading my t so far you can block UDP ports on your firewall to bug the servers and spawn you on a public lobby on your own i have been doing this for countless patches you won't get banned from it and even if for some REALLY harsh luck you get any kind of penalty for it (wich let's get real if that level 963 guy teleporting players to buildings and gunning them down doesn't get the hammer you won't for doing just this) just blame your ISP for blocking ports wich is a thing most ISPs do the UPD ports are 61457 61458 61456 6672 61455If you're familiar with firewall it shouldn't be too hard if you didn't get a single thing i said google "how to block udp ports on firewall" or "blocking udp ports gta v" search a little and you'll find out howSumming it up i wouldn't reccomend you to buy it AT ALL but i wouldn't dare to say it isn't worth a shot either maybe you have a taste for these types of games or you didn't get to play GTA V and want to just experience it once i would say give it a shot if you have some spare time and money try to get it on a sale or sweet talk your girl or boy into getting you a copy but DO NOT put it high on your list give priority to other better balanced gamesCheers mateEDIT Smuggler's run update made making money EVEN HARDER every freaking month they release something that gives more guns to people that screw your deliveries the UDP port blocking does not work as before i am uninstalling and giving up on this completely every day that passes the modders earn more and the rest gets a huge F* YOU from rockstar it's blatant how rockstar is going corporate commander on players and it pains me to see people turning a blind eye to it if this is a high standart for a multiplayer open world game sign me out right away as someone who had already played the hell out of the singleplayer campaign on console i kinda regret my purchase nowEDIT 2 Doomsday dlc is up trolls and toxic players have even more ridiculous weapons at their disposal but with the new heist wich you can do with just a friend makes earning money just a tiny tiny bit easier (props for the mental additions tho batmobiles orbital cannons and stealth choppers holy single mother of three some of those are awesome)

review: First off I am not a huge gamer so my expectations are not well developed as others. GTA has great visuals story telling and voice acting. There is plenty to do in GTA multiplayer from cooperative tasks to PVP and they are quite fun. The game is constantly updated and the activities you can do is getting more diverse. There are many downsides of the game. The main one being it requires too much grinding for cash and levels. Levels unlock much better weapons. Cash allows you to buy properties which unlock missions and to buy various vehicles which is essential for open world PVP. You can pay real cash to get in game currency but its just a rip off. Due to the grinding nature of the game certain activities are rarely done as the payout is way too low which reduces variety of the game. Other problems include connections/game loading issues and excessive modders (cheaters). I have in the past spent 20 minutes of the hour just waiting for the game to connect (not just joining the game but within the game) and spending 10 minutes out of 1 hour waiting is common. Getting kicked out of the online session and having to restart the game is really common. As for the cheaters there are plenty of them and from what i read online its been an issue since GTA came to PC and has never been addressed well. Cheaters make PVP impossible and can also interfere with your missions. Overall if businesses weren't so focused on maximising profits this would have been an excellent game.

review: Yeah let's face the fact that if they didn't fear a financial burden they wouldn't be apologizing to anyone. They're not "listening to the community" or "doing what's right". They're protecting their product. GTA online is designed for money completely and utterly. It is completely pay to win and everything else is a grind. You can blame the company but the consumer is the reason this stupid bullsh*t keeps occuring all over the gaming industry. They wouldn't be making money if you didn't waste your time buying fictional shark cards. After the story I don't play this game online unless it's a private lobby with friends.Rockstar and Take Two are not holding a good ratio of income VS output. Online mode is very basic it is extremely boring. It is not what we were promised. Also the DLC they've released is the most basic BS I've seen more impressive stuff made in garry's mod. This reminds me of the morons who sh*t their pants over Valve's CS GO update where they added "defuse wires". It's easy to make and computer illiterate people get excited because they have no idea how little effort it took to create.When you support malformed business practices you're making a statement that they will be tolerated. It is successful and will continue to be successful as long as the idiot consumer lets it occur.As for the hackers you get the free money scripts from the same websites you get Godlike cheats from. Put 2 and 2 together.

review: Bought this version because I was convinced by my friends. Would be a fun game if Rockstar actually wanted people to be able to buy or do anything other than the same missions over and over and over and over and over and over and then someone blows up your stuff and then over and over.... you get the idea. Let's face it everybody now who buys this game buys it for the online. The story mode isn't the problem but Rockstar and the community itself is. If you think you can suck up the grind that Rockstar made so that you can actually enjoy the game itself I'm here to tell you that won't happen. I've owned the game on 360 since the very first online update and trust when I say that the grind I'm talking about will never end. Quite literally because by the time you start to buy something from four updates ago they release something different that costs even more than the last. Don't even think of buying shark cards. You'd have to pay $1 300 extra because the scumbags never updated the shark cards so that they suffice some of the updates. It's still the same price and worth that it was when online first started and they kept it the same because they know people will be dumb enough to just buy them over and over.Then maybe you might think ok well maybe Rockstar doesn't care about modders anymore and I'll just mod my account and get some money. Nope. I recieved money from a modder once then got banned for a month happened a second time except I was afk and it was literally out of my hands then they permanently banned me. To top that off I know friends who have modded accounts and they typically don't last longer than a month and then you get reset.All the content that they add becomes so much less appealing when you realize how much you have to grind to be able to buy it. Hell I even bothered doing the math once and if you want to make let's say $100M which by the way isn't even equivalent to what you see typical let's players or what people think the average account is like. That's about one month of grind IN HOURS not in the actual rate and that was if you literally had every single business fully upgraded and three people who work with you perfectly all those hours with their own equipment. To own the businesses themselves also takes about a month in hours because you have basically next to nothing to get money in the start to top that off nobody will take you into any missions when your low rank because you won't have any body armor guns or experience which by itself adds an extra week before your able to buy the businesses.Every single complaint about Rockstar support I can promise you is true. They do absolutely no work in reviewing reports. You get reported? Your emblem get reported? Then you can't do a single thing. That combined with one of the absolute worst player bases I've ever seen will eventually net you trouble because even if you didn't do anything to them they still can and will just report you without reason. Not to mention the modders that haven't been banned yet breaking servers and possible resetting your character too. So you know. That's fun.Alright maybe you figure that you don't need the money or any of the content you'll just mess around with friends. Yeah that's not going to happen either. As soon as a jet or player comes remotely close then you already have become a part of a pointless fight with a random. Even half of all the content is locked whenever you try to go into a private lobby so even then your taking it with a grain of salt.If you ever consider buying this game don't ever bother creating and online account. It's way more painful than it is fun.Story mode wise it's ok. Don't get me wrong it's fun but I owned the game for 5 years and never felt motivated to finish the story. Not to mention nearly every time they update the game almost nothing from that update transfers to story mode aside from some of the cars but that's it. I honestly would just recommend saving your money and getting something you can get more of your money's worth like The Witcher 3 or something like that.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

With that said i have friends who have had issues with the banning. Along with any friends i bring on to the game for the first time its always boring because they dont have money and while you can do jobs to get money the money you get wont ever add up to what you need to have any sort of fun with the game almost forcing you to pay for the 'shark cards'. This game would only be worth getting on or during a major sale on steam not full price. Along with i wish they would have some sort of online that was seperate from normal online but for people wanting to mod (even make it a private session) or have some way to make the game disable mods you have for single player and just run base game when you go onto online. Next is the loading screen even on an SSD i could have lunch go shopping and come home and still be loading (sarcastic) while the game runs fine and i have a good computer the loading screen will kill your mood to play if you're really not that in the mood to play to start witht hat said i ONLY recommend this is you can get a good deal

review: A great game that's been and keeps being ruined by bad decisions. This one was one of them. A big one to say the least.Take Two is not only anymore a subsidiary to Rockstar Games. They have taken big control over the company as Rockstar Games keeps bringing other parties to compose the name of the company and letting them take control over it and their products. Take Two is making some bad decisions over the actions they are taking against their games and their communities management. The poor and almost (if not) null feedback to the community and the over all mediocre management of the decisions to be made over the games in this case Grand Theft Auto V (not to mention the amount of micro transactions and the subtle "pay to win/pay to enjoy" bases that the game now has over its dominant online interface) are really taking the experience and enjoyment of the game down the cliff thinking only with their wallets and not with their heads for what the customers deserve and want leaving regular players fans and long time followers of the Rockstar Games long history to just drop their forehead and eyes looking to the ground in sigh. Its one of the reasons I'm putting a vote for the OpenIV petition to bring it back.Take Two needs to see that their feet are tapping over the line and its not something the community is going to tolerate anymore. OpenIV as well as many other projects that don't infringe with their policies are been attacked with legal threats making it a direct hit to the fans. OpenIV was one important pillar for a very very BIG amount of people to be dropped to the dust because of this threats from Take Two. Its really sad and just frustrating to see this type of things happen all the time over the gaming world but one thing its just not caring about your customers opinions and another is to demolish their works time and efforts to make their product feel more enjoyable open and alive after fans getting no real support or reply on the communities desires and needs. They decided to take the jobs for themselves and make it real as the producers wouldn't. Rockstar Games and Take Two need to see that the fans wont keep tolerating this type of actions over them anymore. 𝐖𝐞'𝐯𝐞 𝐡𝐚𝐝 𝐞𝐧𝐨𝐮𝐠𝐡Petition to bring OpenIV back https //www.change.org/p/rockstar games save openiv

review: DO NOT SUPPORT THIS. They let hackers run free ban legit players and BAN the moding which actually gave a fresh breath in the singleplayer since their focus is on ONLINE which you have to spend large ammount of time griding or buy shark cards to get more useless stuff..Now T2 is shutting down modding...P.s. forgot to mention they raised the price before the sale/////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////////Well more than a year has passed for this game on PC *Alot more was added like freemode events stunt series &amp tons of cars.*Alot less hackers than before there are some but no obvious hacker insanity cluster like before.*People alot less lively nobody speaks that much via microphone no more but servers are always populated.*Heists are harder to complete because not many want to waste time and patience for them since they can farm freemode and other events*Missions &amp heists still have long loading times (thank god for free mode events)*Heist leavers are unpunished there is no way to just go back and find one player after someone leaves you are just thrown back into free mode again and have to invite everyone again which is pain in the and time consuming*Last heist (pacific bank) is abused with kuruma which makes things too easy and people still fail*Online mode is less lively some of the pedestrians missing in certain places no wildlife some aircrafts/vehicles are gated or not available online*Some car upgrades are unlocked by winning races.. And i don't mean top 3 or anything you have to finish first which is hard if you're matched up with players of same skill so many people abuse it by purposely losing races for each other*Upgrades cost more than in singleplayer. And sometimes you get unreasonable fees fixing the car from a small bump*Vip work and CEO organisation work gave mayhem some kind of purpose*Highly customisable cars (benny's) upgrades costs alot so you either farm cash or buy shark cards(don't buy shark cards)*Yachts are basically static waste of money with few mini events and cost alot so Rockstar really wants you to buy shark cards. Basically your e p*nis..*No more content for singleplayer (sad)*Kuruma still has insurance for some reason. I mean come on if someone gangs up on you with it it's damn hard to kill them without blowing up the car and paying their insurance.*Weapon wheel is a mess. You have to cycle through all of the weapon types and cannot remove certain weapons so it makes it harder to fight sometimes*Major shuttering issues are fixed although there some texture popping issues specialy on windows 10*For some reason Online works worse then singleplayer with shutters texture pop ins and other weird stuff*Input lag. Sometime this thing happens out of nowhere.*Community is kind of toxic but that is expected for this satire game. Even the game is built in such way so people could screw over each other so expect players talking respawn camping you chasing all over the map just for killing them that one times or bumping into their vehicle*Customer support is non existent you have better luck searching the forums for help from other players or googling going on youtube to find solutions for your issues.This game is worth it's price even for just it's singleplayer witch is about 30 50 hours depending on your playstyle . Story is weaker than IV's in my opinion but still awesome. One of the few games I bought at full price and the only game i pre ordered got my moneys worth.ps. don't waste money on shark cards.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Fantastic game absolutely love it but it has performance issues. I have an i7 4790 12gb ram and a gtx 970 I can run this game at a high framerate on my 144hz monitor but it doesn't utilize the gpu properly. I can max out the in game settings and be running the game at say 40fps but gpu utilization will be like 70%. I was also inside the shooting range getting 144fps but then I walk outside and fps and gpu usage drops. I monitor using msi ab and my cpu is not bottlenecking my card. You can google gta 5 low gpu usage and see for yourselves that it is a problem. Also fps gets pegged at 70 unless I turn vsync off then on again. I do recommend this game because the game is fantastic but it's performance is not perfect on PC had no issues playing on consoles. So buyer beware.

review: The game is okay had some installation issues. Currently am reinstalling this game just in time for Xmas as well as other games too. Don't really bother to play GTA Online much spent most of my time in offline mode most of the time. Singleplayer mode hasn't got much to offer in terms of content &amp story the story wasn't that great anyway i found it way too boring. The only aspect i liked about the game was the singleplayer missions but not the story. I hated the online portion of the game just like any other MMO game too grindy structured to force players to take out thier wallet in order to even make any decent cash. I played this previously on my PS4 online with a lobby hack where i got into lobbies on my own where i did crates all by myself. I did fine then but on PC? Forget it its even worse. I'm guessing Rockstar will want to make the next GTA game Online only going by the way GTA V turned out. Looks like i won't be buying another GTA game in a while until they change their sales tactic. One bad gripe i have with this game is the internet connection. Why the hell do i need to have internet in order to play offline with this game because most of the patches is nothing to do with offline mode only online mode wtf rockstar? Its not enough that customers leagally buy your game from steam or retail then have those same customers jump through stupid hoops just in order to play the stupid dam game all because you release some stupid dam patch for GTAV online which prevents players who actually want to play this game in OFFLINE SINGLEPLAYER mode. Wrong move Rockstar that was a pretty stupid move Rockstar. I won't be buying GTA VI.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: TLDR I can't recommend you get this game even when it's super cheap. The single player isn't worth it and you run the risk of losing all your online progress when their bot screws up with no recourse.Like so many others I was suspended and all my online progress whipped out through no fault of my own and Rockstar will not hear any appeal. I spent months grinding away to get where I was online and I just lost it all. This is not the first time Rockstar has had this problem where they suspend/ban innocent players. Having a no appeal policy in place for an automated process is completely unreasonable given how many bugs are in the game. They obviously don't know how to test their code properly.The online game has some very fun aspects to it but there is a very tedious grind to it as well. There are a limited number of heists you can participate in and other ways to earn money mainly involve diving/flying to some location retrieve some item/vehicle and return it to some location. Frequently doing the latter mission type you'll be accosted by bored teenagers who just kill you for the lolz. Not to mention running into actual modders who will teleport you out of your building and kill you.The single player story was no where near as good as other GTAs. I've played them all starting with 3 and this one just felt to fragmented. You play as three different characters which you can switch between. To me it really felt like the stories of each character were too shallow and overall the game was missing something.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: ban for no reason anti cheat system really suck. Don't waste your money

review: The game could be good fun. The online mode has a lot of content however the anti cheat system is terrible. 90% of the servers have hackers in them while at the same time people are getting banned for using discord or having someone drop them money. You can no appeal bans and they never tell you why you got banned in the first place. Many people are sceptical about false bans even exist but sadly it s a fact. Even if Rockstar realizes that there s not a reason for you to be banned and that it s a problem on their side it s still game over. Investing money and time in this game is risking having them stolen from you. At this point and time I strongly recommend not buying the game until rockstar changes their policy fixes their anticheat and stop braking their own rules.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: What I have to say here likely has been said. It's been a slice getting into GTA online a slice of barely strung together content marred by the icing of griefers general jerks and modders and thats not even mentioning all of the strange and frustrating programming choices that Rockstar have made. I've spent about a hundred hours working my way through the new content and for a while it was fun to look forward to getting a bunker set up and having all of those side businesses set up and making some money for all the new toys that Rockstar adds. After a while it got old the double RP and cash bonus changed to missions and activities that I didn't care for the constant badgering phone calls from NPc's about spending millions more on the next best thing to unlock more carelessly planned out content and missions. The most irksome thing was feeling punished for trying to complete some of these missions solo like if I dont have a group of four players with me I was playing the game wrong and it must therefore be especially difficult to maintain these businesses. Therin is the biggest issue I have had with the whole of GTA Online it seems to me that a group of economists got together and made sure that the game would constantly motivate you to need more in game currency than you ever have or are able to make. The heist payouts are laughable for the amount of work coordination and money spent on ammo and armour the side mission payouts are also half what they should/could be and all to encourage the player to fork over more real world cash to get anywhere in the game. Games are games not jobs I don't think they should be tedious frustrating excercises in ocasional futility. Games have so much potential for good and having the bottom line of profit at any cost and underwritten on every programming decision sours the expereience for me personally. Greed has taken what could have been amazing and made it into a steaming pile of aggravating garbage. Do what you like but I am pulling the plug on my GTA Online career.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player is nice funny story. Except that controles are optimised for console so M&amp K support is quirky that makes some tasks frustratingly hard. Multiplayer is just plain bad playing heists with randoms is almost impossible when someone quits the whole heists ends and everyone is returned to the game (not even the lobby)To join friends you need to start the game wait for it to load start the online part wait for it to load select a friend and choose the join option and wait for it to load again. Lots of hackers doing all kinds of redicious (being spawned on fire in a cage spawning planes on a deadmatch map that doesnt have planes aimbots etc etc)Menus are non intuitive and you need to press a lot of buttons to get to somewhere. setting up a crew and inviting people is just way to vague. Did not like the online experiance.

review: TL DR They will inevitably suspend and then ban you. Period. RockStar has made 3 billion dollars off of selling this game NOT INCLUDING ALL THE EXTRA STUFF YOU PAY FOR AFTER PURCHASING IT.For those who will actually read The following is a request/support ticket I've submitted to the Rockstar social club (but the text limit for a request description is too short so I had to type it in Microsoft paint and submit the rest of it in an image which I didn't include here) (NOTE The included screenshots of the conversation with the person trolling me are out of context due to not taking enough screenshots frequently enough.)http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 1341155039http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 1341155182http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 1341155258Screenshot 4 http //steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id 1341155350The 'social club' account is currently suspended from being able to access the online portion of "grand theft auto".I have eventually come to the realization that I have payed actual real life money/currency to interact with pixels and sound effects/etc. on a computer monitor/speakers only to be 'suspended' from being allowed to continue to play the game.However even if you basically the company (miraculously somehow...) agreed to refund the money I've spent to purchase the ability to play the game I no longer have the pre paid visa gift card I used to buy it over a year before the day I'm typing this... (the game was purchased by myself on the date of Feb 18th 2017)Even when my account is eventually unsuspended a month from now I will barely be motivated to play GTA Online anymore due to being suspended under absolutely unreasonable circumstances and then basically becoming totally outraged over the entirely obscene situation obviously getting angry that it ever happened.I could give several points and reasons why I shouldn't be suspended but instead am breaking the 4th wall on the the fact that I payed real life money to be able to play this game and now I can't play this game...To whatever employee is reading this there is honestly nothing you can do and nothing I can do and I think we both realize that this world is not a perfect place and is actually very screwed up.I am just bothering to send this ticket because a friend of mine urged me to repeatedly and even though I told him it'd make no difference I'm sending it in anyway. I have no idea if this will make any difference involving how the company treats or provides services to those who pay for those services and my common sense tells me this will just be another insignificant message which makes no actual difference.Basically the purpose of this message is I've genuinely gotten very emotionally upset angry frustrated from this experience. I am not even getting what I really payed for unless I ironically considered that I was 'paying' for the terms of service and stuff which sort of came with the game so I legally in a twisted way payed to agree to have myself suspended etc.UPDATE I received a reply "Hello Insane_David40 Your account is temporarily suspended from GTA Online. Your suspension expiration date is shown on the splash screen after being returned to Story Mode following an attempt to play online. In addition to being suspended all GTA Online characters progress and inventory on PC will be reset. Any funds purchased via Shark Cards have been preserved and are still available on your account.The next infraction on your account will result in a permanent ban from GTA Online.GTA Online bans are triggered by a number of factors including modding in GTA Online exploiting or abusing game mechanics manipulating protected game data and code or otherwise interfering with other players gameplay experience.All GTA Online suspension and banning decisions are final and may not be appealed. For more information on the GTA Online Suspension and Ban Policy please see https //support.rockstargames.com/hc/articles/229514247.Best regards Tessa H. Rockstar Support"

review: My updated final review can come in a single word ED. I used to regularly play this game with my friends... now I can hardly bear playing about 15 minutes of it before leaving and waiting to load into jobs that require 4 people.This game has become so broken in the 5.5 years it has been out so many of the mechanics absolute garbage and the overall design of the game itself while breathtaking in visuals and having great depth in character is so graphically demanding that half the time the goddamn world doesn't load and there are lag spikes every half second when playing on the lowest resolution and lowest graphic settings. Good lord Rockstar updates their game with amazing multiplayer content that allows you to play this game with all your friends... if they are all able to stay connected and not DC in the middle of a job rendering you all stuck until they can take 10 minutes to load back in or god forbid you have to rely on randos to fill your heist or 4 player job. Another thing heists in this game are literally broken. Arguably one of the best ways to get money in game absolutely requiring 4 players to complete each and every heist after the Fleeca job is literally so. goddamn. stupid. Go the Payday route. Although it is another broken as all hell game at least the heist mechanics make some sense you can solo any job you want or have up to 4 players who can come and go at will. Seriously fix some of the core problems of the game that have existed SINCE LAUNCH. Stop adding new content that requires millions upon millions of dollars in game money that does nothing except pressure people into wasting their money on Shark Cards to afford "The Hip and Cool in game features" and causes up to 10 minute loading screens for just OPENING the game. That's another thing. Hackers. Admittedly I used mods for about one week in an attempt to get a vehicle I could only access from transitioning from standard to enhanced edition of GTA Online... until I started playing again about a couple months ago. These people are so rampant and hell bent on making the game miserable for everyone except themselves and yet it continues to make the already existing problem of lag spikes and unsuccessful rendering of textures worse than can imagine.I used to love playing this game but good lord. Rockstar needs to get their act together. You can't make everything better in a game just by adding new content that makes people forget about the broken core problems of a game. It's called REWORKING. Finding the underlying issue and making it right. Even when Rockstar attempts to patch the game "one thing is fixed and about 10 new things are broken" as one of my old crew friends would say.3/10. Amazing visuals music characters and some mechanics of the game itself. Everything else is ed. Stay away unless you already own it or have a ton of disposable income for shark cards or time to grind your life away trying to own the best things in game.Lastly been getting EA Star Wars Battlefrontish vibes akin to loot boxes when it comes to shark cards and other players having advantages in online freeroam.Broken game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I truely enjoy GTA V but lately Rockstar/Take Two have done some seriously anti consumer things. 1) They have prevented usage of the newly added cars in single player after the PS3 version. This is bad because you can't try them out in single player but only buy them on multi player. 2) They have yet to release or even hint at a single player expansion which would be an instabuy from me (screw online). 3) Online really sucks atleast on PC. Nice idea but the amount of hackers and grind that you need to go through is just ridiculous. 4) Finally recently June 2017 Take Two sent a cease and desist to OpenVI developers. This mod was the basic building block for most other mods thereby they have effectively destroyed modding in this game including being able to "mod" in the DLC cars into single player. Rockstar then released a t statement which pushed me over the edge to actually leave this review.Don't buy this game until Take Two/Rockstar get their act together and start understanding that gamers are not cash cows and having a loyal fanbase is worth a lot more than microtransaction hell that is GTA Online.

review: This game is absolute trash. The community is the most toxic I've ever seen and the game is nothing but griefing jerks. Stick to single player Rockstar has ZERO knowledge of running online games and it's painfully obvious. They do absolutely NOTHING to stop the blatant hacking and cheating. The world record on ALL races in the game is between 5 and 10 seconds. These are races in which normal players take 2 3 minutes to finish. It's been this way since launch and NOTHING is done to stop it. Rockstar should be absolutely ashamed of themselves for releasing a game like this. Not to mention since it's P2P multiplayer your IP address isn't hidden at all and gives script kiddies easy access to kicking you offline. This game SUCKS and has made me seriously question if I'll play RDR2 if/when it comes to PC.TL DR this game is a dumpster fire. Stay far away from multiplayer there's nothing but cheaters hackers and griefers.

review: Great single player campaign one of the best however once you have finished this the replayability has becomes pretty much non existent unless you want to just replay the exact same campaign for the following reasons1. They have gotten rid of all single player mods due to their unparalleled greed. They don't want you playing single player because their is no need for shark cards there..at least not yet but I wouldn't be surprised if that happens too.2. GTA online was a good mode that was turned to trash and in my opinion is not worth playing. They have turned it into a grindfest in order to sell shark cards it's totally unbalanced and reminds me of fifa online absolute trash. They purposely hugely increased the grind to force people to buy shark cards3. Game is filled with hackers and even without hackers if your not pumping in real world cash it's going to be pretty unbalanced with you on the wrong end. 4. Unlikely ever to make single player expansions because they don't want you playing single player because it competes with online shark cards and why would they want to pay people to make content for your mone when they can sell you shark cards which cost zero dollars to produce an infinite quantity of5. They can ban you and reset all your progress if they "suspect" you have cheated and you are not allowed to appeal. So even if you grind like crazy or by your shark cards all your stuff can be taken off you even if you do nothing wrong.I have low playtime as I owned this previously on ps4 and re bought but with the grinding being increased exponentially what I once though was a great game has become unplayable garbage because rockstar on take 2 believe they are under monitoring lolThis companys behaviour reminds me of the behaviour of Pablo escobar in the TV show narcosShark cards should be boycott

review: The story is okay. Single player is pretty fun but gets boring quick. That's all I have to say about single player because it's not as intensive as online is.**LONG RANT AHEAD**Online blows for the most part if you plan on buying this game to play online go buy something else not worth your money.The controls are very unresponsive in third person. Walking around it like being drunk on a pogo stick and trying to perform combat in third person is even worse especially when you're trying to roll and end up climbing up the side of the wall for no reason. third person in vehicles is okay the vehicle mechanics are fine until Rockstar feels the need to mess around with the range of the weapons. First person is almost as bad so don't let that feature give you any impressions either. First person is very responsive to your mouse. You can look/aim where ever you want without hassle. Moving forward and backward is no problem either. Strafing however tends to lag behind and get you killed. Maneuvering any vehicle in first person is bound to get you killed or stuck. First person in cars is the easiest looking around is a bit overreactive but that's it. When you start actually driving though you're stuck looking forward almost always with like a 30 degree view so checking where the rest of your car is in comparison to the environment might get you into trouble. Shooting inside a car in first person is broken simply to say. You lose a large portion of area to shoot through and are limited in accuracy. First person in aero vehicles is odd as well. Helicopters act like they did in GTA 4 and it's difficult to see out of a cockpit in a plane. Planes are also overreactive on the control scheme so simple adjusting the yaw might send you spiraling into the ground.Combat is okay in certain aspects and utterly horrid in others. As I mentioned above about the combat in vehicles it's not that great unless you're in third person. Combat against other players is clean and accurate everythings works just nicely. Combat against AI however is pure Whenever you fight AI your chances of survival greatly diminish than that against players as the AI is more powerful (somehow) and more accurate. There's also significant delay behind the AI when they actually shoot at you so you'll be getting damaged a half second or so after the AI actually shoots you. Moving around during combat is hectic too I've had too many experiences trying to roll and then climbing up something and dying immediately afterwards (roll and climb are the same button space bar.) A slightly insigifnicant problem I've had too is getting sniper shots. Sometimes when I shoot someone far away with the sniper it'll tell me I hit them but they won't take any damage. It happens much more sparingly with other weapons. Combat in vehicles is junk. Helicopters use the same firing mechanics are GTA 4 so basically no practical aim (unless the AI has a helicopter in which case they'll shoot you through the ing fender of their own heli) so you have to use missiles most often. Helicopters are also incredibly weak so it's near pointless to use them unless you're killing low level players or the AI. All jets have explosive rounds so there is still some use to using bullets instead of missiles like strafing a tank. Jet's are probably the most defined and well worked combat mechanic in the game. Using mounted guns on vehicles like the tank insurgent or technical are decent as well.Activities in GTA 5 are always combat related. There's rarely any races anymore and and even more sparse are the sports activities like tennis arm wrestling or darts. Did I mention there's no pool? Yeah no pool super disappointed in that. If you want to play any of these other activities you'll have to get with some close friends because random players won't play them as often. The activities work well and are pretty even. I wish there a bit more player creativity in them because I'd like to see players actually make Survival's or Contact Missions.Online connectivity is also super terrible. The most hated thing about GTA5 is the connection issues. I've played indie games from 2006 with better connection than this. A lot of times I'll be playing and I time out of the lobby (when you time out everyone else in the lobby leaves except you.) Sometimes when I get mission requests in my phone on the game I'll join them only for GTA to tell me that I can't connect for miscellaneous reasons. I serious pet peeve of mine when I do join a request from my phone it tells me the mission is full and then sends me too a new lobby back at my house. Everything takes about 2 3 minutes to load so getting in and out isn't actually possible.I'll be editing this later to rant more.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Of course I don't want to leave this review. I've been a fan of Grand Theft Auto since the release of 3. Hell I'm going to college for programming now because of all that I've learned from the game and tools that allow me to see how the game is structured. I understand that as a company you have every right to do this but you just don't understand what you're doing. Maybe you think you do but take a second look please. Thanks to you there are many young adults like me that have overstepped their bounds and learned how to do various things such as 3DModelling Software Engineering Programming and loads of other things that wouldn't have been possible without such an amazing platform that RAGE provides. To take down the *only* tool we have (for editing game files) that has been worked on for 9 10 years is like spitting in our faces. I feel ashamed to be a fan of Rockstar Games because they're just giving in to the monsters that are TakeTwo Interactive. I will no longer support or purchase your games until you work with your own community to bring back everything we've worked to hard to build. You may think "Oh who cares we have millions of other customers." but I'm not sure if you've read the reviews seen the petitions or watched YouTube but there are millions of us too. I feel bad for you R* you've come so far. Don't let T2 destroy everything you've worked so hard on.

review: The issue with modding has been resolved and Open IV is back (and restricted moreso than before granted but still back) so I will be only reviewing the game here since I've been satisfied with the PR resolution. I do wish Open IV would be allowed to create Liberty City still but I understand Rockstar's policy on that.Grand Theft Auto V is in my opinion the best game ever made. It is incredible the graphical quiality in the game truly takes my breath away the work in the little details that I still find everywhere in this game. The level of thought and work that went into this is astounding and Rockstar did an incredible job of it. I cannot wait for the release of Grand Theft Auto VI though I know I'll have to since that is most likely 3 or so years out from when I'm writing this review perhaps more. And the reason I want another game to follow this isn't because I'm sick of this one it's because I cannot wait to see what else Rockstar is capapble of what other places I'll eventually be able to roam around wreaking havoc and joining others in doing so. Kudos Rockstar.

review: I came from the PS3 version where it was EXTREMELY hard to earn money. I know Rockstar have made it easier to make money now and so on...but it's still t to me. The cars events &amp buildings just costs so ing much...even more than you can afford or even grab onto through your lifetime in there without hacking. I've been perm banned and I knew what I was doing D So I don't complain there. But I have friends who have been banned for just being in a lobby with a hacker who dropped money on them. Why do you get a penalty for recieving money from a hacker? Why don't they just wipe your money and say "Well that's it" or just take all the money you earned in that little time you recieved anything from the hacker. I love GTA 5 don't get me wrong D I've been playing it since Online was released on the PS3 and I would love to keep on playing it XD. I would rate the singleplayer a 10/10 and the MP a 2/10. It's all too hard to earn cash and it's all too hard to even modify your car once you get your money to buy one. Take this from a Veteran of the game...it's a good game D If you're willing to grind or find a hacker lobby.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The seventh game in the Grand Theft Auto series brings back Los Santos and San Andreas(though greatly overhauled). It also brings a fair amount of new stuff to do compared to its lackluster predecessor as well as a fleshed out online component. Unfortunately it also comes with its share of issues.For one it's an incredibly hardware intensive game and while you can run most of the settings at High or Very High if you don't have a 3/4GB VRAM card you're not going to be able to run textures on anything higher than Normal. It's also plagued by a few persistent issues such as the custom radio causing stutter for many and performance drops where they really shouldn't occur. Issues with shadows either not appearing or bugging out have also been reported (and experienced by myself).Those issues aside it's a better port than the previous games and the online component works much better on a good desktop than it does on consoles. Loading times are good and the new Director Mode allows you to unleash your inner Spielberg. If you've already played the console version you know what to expect. If you're new to the game you'll be in for a treat.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: *DISCLAIMER* I WAS NOT ONE OF THE PEOPLE BANNED RECENTLY MY ACCOUNT IS STILL UP &amp IS HEALTHY SO THAT DOESNT SWAY MY REVIEW! I've had this game since launch day 2013 I've got about 1500 hours. I ported over my character from PS3 and started playing on pc as the 30fps on last gen gave me Aids. Anyways the singleplayer is great it was really a blast and gameplay was truly incredible. *BUY IT IF YOU LIKE SINGLEPLAYER GAMES WITH A GREAT STORY VOICE ACTING CHARACTER DEVELOPMENT AND MISSIONS*Online is a different story its terrible. Filled with hackers little kids who constantly kill you and Rockstar has milked this game dry with their silly little "FREE DLC's" (What a great company everyone is thinking.) that would actually cost $200 to purchase everything included (All of the DLC combined would probably cost close to $1500 give or take Im just guesstimating.) Not to mention its repetitive as hell and gets boring in about 30 hours if you have no friends to play with (All of my friends have stopped playing) I think the reason it gets boring so fast is due to the fact that I have pretty much everything (bought all of the items when everyone was a billionaire back on PS3 and Xbox hehe) However even if you're the poorest of poor in this game its still boring due to the missions that give you no cash nor reward.Pros Great Singleplayer story Amazing voice acting &amp memorable characters Fun singleplayer missions Cons Multiplayer... I guess the flying is too easy but its still fun.

review: Arguments are debatable about this release because a lot of people aren t able to log into the game due to crashes steam problems and in game issues that are disrupting individual s gameplay. Also there are individuals playing this game without the actual requirements needed and some who have those requirements are having issues. So far I have not passed the Social club and don t know if there is an option to click to play or if the game runs after you login it s been over 5 6 hours. Currently I wouldn t by this game yet until they fix these issues or you can and just download it and wait until everything is available. In this technological era and with all the orders they received through steam their sites as well as other sites they should have been prepared and being unprepared damages the fun and hype of the game and its community. Currently I give this game a 5/10 due to their lack of communication and their lack in preparation. I m very patient however so I will wait until they fix these issues. Once I m able to log into the game and see what is out there I will change my opinion on it. There are other issues many individuals are reporting through the discussion boards about logins and crashes and etc. those could be helpful to anyone who are interested in the release. Regardless of these issues I hear a lot of positive feedback about the game which is definitely worth waiting.

review: Drove a car for 317 hours time well spent. But no seriously the customer support over at the rockstar games website is horrible and the communication is minimal and mostly automated. The servers of GTA online are filled with hackers to the brim and there is nothing anyone can do to stop them. I regularly get shot with money teleported around and killed even when in passive mode. I have objects spawn in my body and stuff showing up in my garage.... the use of trainers and script hooks in this game is pathetic and laughable and almost every other game in the world with an online function prevents this type of bulls***. This game needs alot of work for the online sections and rockstar needs to start doing something about their horrible customer service.The game is great despite all of the above flaws and you should definately pick it up if you have some spare steam wallet currency. Everything works as it should 60 FPS gameplay (if your PC is worth around 1.2k+) free DLC every so often for the online multiplayer and the amount of content will keep you busy for well over 300+ hours.

review: Just... Awesome. It's a must have to play it even playing the Online version. Visuals are so realistic I can't believe what it'll be with a mod that enhances it even farther. I would recommend ALL my friends to buy and play this game it is worth it. This'll be the next Skyrim if mods ever come out I can't wait for those mods. Best game I've ever played in a really long time. The Storyline of GTA V is awesome and hilarious at the same time. GTA Online is even better when you play with your friends the downside of this is some players that are in the session may just come and murder you for no reason. review: So I assume you're reading this because you're playing with the thought to buy the game. You want to play around with all the cool mods that make you a drag racer police officer or Thomas the Tankengine in Singleplayer and then head over to the Multiplayer to race against your friends in supercars and compete in challenging deathmatches right?Forget it.To the Singleplayer Mods used to be possible and they enhanced the game in a great way only now the publisher of GTA 5 sent out a Cease and Desist to mod developers threatening to sue them if they don't stop producing mods. So why did they do it? I hear you asking. Let's first head to the Multiplayer Rockstar offers ingame purchases where you exchange your real money for a fake currency. And this is where Rockstar makes most of its money. GTA Online features a bride range of cars that are unattainable through playing the Online mode since they cost tens of millions (usual payout for a race 5.000$) these cars are completely overpowered. So don't expect to win anything if you just buy the game you need around 50$ (of your real life money of course) for a decent car and another 50$ to upgrade it. Then you probably use it for a month until the next DLC is announced featuring an even better car that is even more expensive.But what does that have to do with GTA's publisher sueing mod developers? Well Rockstar and Take Two didn't like that a modded Singleplayer used to be much more fun then their very own Multiplayer. Why would players bother with their Multiplayer? Why would they spend their real life money on horrendously expensive cars if they can try out way more interesting ones in the Singleplayer? Well money must sure be honey in the rich publisher's game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

The CEO of T2 has said that he doesn't think they're "making enough money" off GTAV now to put that in perspective it's one of the top five best selling games of all time and still sells at 40 so it is by far the highest grossing game ever made.(T2 is the parent company of Rockstar)EDIT 2 T2 recently announced that with future games they're going to heavily increase the amount of micro transactions. Seeing as I have no way of spreading this info because GTA6 doesn't exist yet I just thought I'd let you know. Oh and also this game has become a pathetic grind with each update as things are more and more expensive for no good reason other than to encourage the purchase of Shark Cards. As a result the hacking on servers is rife because people are desperate for money hacks Rockstar is at hack proofing.TL DR Don't buy the game. It's a cashgrab which deteriorates each day.

review: I bought this game on the Xbox 360 and on the Xbox One. I was one of the first people to connect to GTA Online on Xbox One the moment it launched. I did enjoy the game very much on Xbox platforms.I recently purchased GTA V on PC (Steam) for $30 and I was very happy at first. The single player has better graphics and the framerate is smooth with my i5 4690k and 1050 ti but THE ONLINE EXPERIENCE IS EXTREMELY FLAWED.The amount of hackers and modded accounts on GTA ONLINE (STEAM) is completely unacceptable I have encountered a hacker or modded account on every day I have played for two weeks going. And today Saturday September 2 I have encountered over 10 hacked accounts during my 2 1/2 hours of gameplay today. This is completely unnacceptable I am a very good player but against a hacker with modded levels and weapons it is not a fair fight. Although I do find it quite enertaining that unless the hacker is using infinite health that I will usually still school them with my low level character weapons and vehicles.The report function is probably like most games abused to hell and against players that have not actually done anything wrong. I really hope that Rockstar gets it together but I know it's not going to happen.I sent Rockstar an email requesting a full refund of $30 for the game with continued access to the game not this t where Steam removes the game from my account. I still can play the singleplayer and have fun.

review: Ok well this really is a game of two halves the online version (multiplayer) is based arounf free roaming selling one car every 48 minutes (a pointless restriction) coop or multiplayer missions and hackers (theres loads of them). The online experience whilst I did some cool stuff I must say I was very disappointed the missions lack any real depth. The single player version has a fairly good storyline some good missions and actually isnt bad. The one thing that really is missing is being able to steal cars and sell them like noones business you cant do that in single player unless its part of the mission to do that (I really dont understand that at all!!!). I mean for me that was the thing that made grand theft auto truely awesome so for me whilst this has some good bits its pretty mediocre and not worth more than 10 15 in my opinion.

review: Having already played this on both Xbox 360 and Xbox One and putting in a combined total of about 200 hours this was already a guaranteed purchase and I must say Rockstar have outdone themselves with this PC release.Coming from the atrocity that was the GTA IV PC port I was extremely skeptical of their release of GTA V and if like me were hesitent on it as well put your fears to rest.+ Consistent 60 fps on high settings with not a sign of drop stutter or lag+ Online servers seem to be running perfectly fine (Something that couldn't be said when released on Xbox 360/PS3)+ Extremely optimized and a bevy of graphical options to change and enhance+ One of the greatest open world games to come out in the past several years is finally on PC+ Modding support and PC exclusive Rockstar editor will allow for a lot of replayability in the futureAll in all Rockstar have outdone themselves and this is probably their best release to date.

review: As a singleplayer game 10/10 or as close to a 10/10 as one can reasonably expect from a game.As a multiplayer game 4/10.Multiplayer for this game is phenomenal with the continued updates. Why is it only a 4/10 then? The continued updates do absolutely NOTHING to address the chronic problem of "hackers" and modders online. Chances are you'll get put into a lobby where you get randomly instantly blown up or there's an invincible naked stripper walking around with a minigun. It might sound like a good time but it gets boring incredibly quickly. The laziness of the devs to address such playability issues online makes this very hard to deal with. They seem more interested in selling their in game currency for real world money than actually making the online fair.Wouldn't recommend for multiplayer would definitely recommend for singleplayer.

review: 6 5/10 I like the game. Even online sometimes SOMETIMES. In online its really hard to get money even when you spend MORE money on this game. I found the way how to enjoy online DON'T focus on the bank balance. Just dont the game is about having fun. Not on having the biggest cash! First fun and if the fun pays (mostly it does) then its good. And i also like(d) the story mode. When its hit 100% you cant really do something fun anymore. You are just sitting there with 20 mil in your hands and you cant do anything. There is where the online mode comes in hand! Cons Its hard to gain money in online mode. I personnely think the community is far from good the only thing you SEE is 10 year old that stole moms credit's card. ( And they just fly around in that one fliying car and they grief you every second. When the story mode is done there is almost nothing to do in ofline. The combat feels pretty hard out of place i think. Long loading screen and if you AFK for a sec you get kicked PLS ficks rockstar! Pro's Driving and cars are very ncie! You can customise a lot in your car and every car feels different and fun. The story mode is very fun. The graphics are pretty nice and the game is good made. it doesn't take that mutch CPU i think But its also a older game its makes sence i geus. Sorry for my bad english.

review: While the game is fun and playing with friends is awesome the game has too many issues. I can't even count all of them.The loading screens are everywhere and take a lot of time even on high end PC.The game doesn't use VAC instead relying on Rockstar's own auto ban algorithm which is pure bullcrap. If you enter the online game or switch session you basically have over 3 4 chance to get a lobby with a hacker.Even if your not hacking or modding yourself you can get banned for being in lobby with a hacker.Reporting a hacker doesn't help.Rockstar's client support doesn't really want to help you with any kind of issues. They don't even have a visible button to create a petiton on their website. Most of their answers are pure copy paste from already visible info on their page.The game STILL has memory leak problems that some people experience even on high end PC and some don't experience on low end.The updates require you a lot of in game currency to buy new stuff or anything while the payouts from anything is really small. They just want you to buy their fancy Shark cards for real money. If you are looking to just cause mayhem with friends there are other games that are a lot cheaper and have better relationship with community.

review: Do not buy this game. Why? Two reasons GTA Online and Take Two's anti modding stance.GTA Online is completely awful. It has ceased being fun and has devolved into a grindfest filled with hackers as everything is stupidly expensive. Not to mention Shark Cards are stupidly overpriced for how much value you get out of them.As for the other thing Take Two recently shut down all modding for GTAV despite Rockstar saying that modding is okay. Do not buy this or any of Take Two's games.EDIT Another factor for this negative review is a new weapon that was added in the Gunrunning update The Explosive Rounds attachment for the Heavy Sniper. This turns the sniper rifle into a Railgun that one shots cars and players on foot and two shots planes. You don't even need to hit them since it's an explosion radius so you just need to hit near them. It's R8 Revolver level of broken and has made the game pay to win.

TBH Would be nice if there was more dress options or hair style options Ongoing to car customization New cars are constantly being added into the game but some are often released too early so they take the car down from the game causing it to disappear never happened to me but rumours . You can also add some mad rims spoilers skirts and neon kits for the car to make the ultimate ricer Ricer Good Some of the "pearl" touch paint is beautiful when mixed ontop of the right colour but you could just get a metallic paint job instead of all that if your not too bothered with how the paint is.Cons Some modders can be annoying but this is rare by annoying I mean freezing people for no reason and etc. which is avoidable just by going into another lobby so it doesn't affect the gameplay too much.Once again would like more options that are new.overall Sexy game would recommend.

review: IntroductionWhether you are purchasing GTAV for single player or online the most fun to be had in GTAV comes mostly from free roam breaking away from the various missions and modes to enjoy the world GTAV have to offer without worrying about the context of its plot. If you're still contemplating on whether to buy GTAV i will be highlighting significant pros and cons below. On a side note don't let the possibility of false ban deter you from playing GTAV. happens but you'll mostly be fine as long as you stay away from hacks and mods.Cons Long online loading screen (Ranging from 2 5minutes) Occassional modders in public free roam mode (Extremely annoying. They can temporarily alter your character without your acknowledgement if they wish to) Overpriced vehicles reaching 3m. (You earn an average of 10 20k per heist setup. But to be honest 1 kuruma is all you need) Cloud save errors once in a while. (Causes you to be unable to play online mode. If you encounter this look up for quickfix on google) Horrible support from Rockstar. (I've never actually submitted a support ticket but this is what most GTAV player feels) Having multiple expensive high end apartment is useless apart from the extra garage space. Repetitive online gameplays. (Grind heist non stop &gt Spend &gt Repeat because heist generates money fastest) Annoying free roam player killers. (Go passive mode to avoid them)Pros Amazing pacing of story and character development. Superb character customization. (I'm not kidding) Great all round control Stunning scenary Extremely impressive single player. (The single player alone is enough reason for you to buy GTAV)Value For Money?Yes definitely.ConclusionAll in all the game isn't as bad as what the negative reviews are saying. It should minimally provide you 100hours of immersive online gameplay and single player gameplay respectively.Overall Score77/100 (Pretty Mind Blowing)

review: Mods were like 60% of the game. They know that Open IV had nothing to do with online hackers and they were not ashamed to lie to us with straight face about this. GTA online is boring frustrating grindy piece of game that forces players to spend irl cash on in game currency since the ingame payouts are pretty much non existent compared to what the released content costs. Take2 and R have figured that mods are about 10 billion times better than their lazy cashgrab GTAO can ever be with its skewed up anti consumer business model (i.e. shark cards). Therefore they had to shut the mods down just to get people to play GTAO and buy shark cards.Imo tho they are shooting themselves in the leg in the long term. R had reputation of beeing one of the last really good and honest big companies in the gaming industry but they showed their true colours. They are no better than likes of EA Activision Ubisoft and all the others. Just a bunch of cashgrabing walking suits. But at the end of the day its gamer s fault. We cant fault a company for wanting to make more money. We are feeding them billions for their lazy overhyped and overpriced online DLC s and even when they do something like this there is an army of mindless fanboys to defend them. No wonder they think they can bend us over at their will.There is only one thing we can do to reverse this the only thing they will ever listen to their wallets. STOP feeding them cash stop buying shark cards it ruined GTAO and now it ruined mods too. And dont buy their games cancel the pre orders. Hit them where it hurts them. Thats the only way they will ever care what we have to say.

review: This is a GTA main title.. that should say enough. This is an awesome game and it is amazingly ported to PC especially compared to 4. Rockstar stepped their game up for this port and it was working right out of the box for me. The 3 main characters are all likable in their individual ways and make for a really interesting story. Switching between all of them makes for a fun and unique gameplay experience since each character has a special ability that they can utilize in different situations. The world map is really big and has a lot of things to do and find even though it doesn't sprawl across the entire state like San Andreas did. Recommended to anyone who likes open world games or anyone who has played previous GTA games. The graphics look really great and there are mods online that allow you to crank them up even higher. The gameplay is also great it feels engaging and always keeps you finding more things to do especially if you play GTA Online. I recommend using a controller to play since driving is much cleaner with one but mouse and keyboard work fine as well.

review: I delayed my review because I didn't want to review a game which I had only played for a few hours. This is all MY opinion and experiences with the game others may differ.1. PerformanceIn my 40+ hours of playing the game at max settings with a EVGA GeForce GTX 980 SC I have been able to run at 60 FPS with drops to 50 every once in a while when either in the middle of the city or around some parts of Trevors area. If I were to lower some settings which I have tested I would have a constant 60 FPS however the drops don't bother me that much. Other people have had issues with performance with the game and to my knowledge it seems to be random and not a certain combination between hardware. The only problem I have had with the games performance was crashing now and then which has since been fixed for me in the latest patch.2. GraphicsThe game is beautiful. The detail in the game is amazing in my opinion. I have had issues with textures loading slowly roads becoming invisible and textures popping in but this will hopefully be fixed in future patches and luckily it doesn't happen that often for me to get frustrated with it. Overall the graphics are great and this is how GTA should look.3. ControlsThis game has amazing KB/M optimization. Since it was launched on Tuesday I have had my Xbox 360 controller plugged in and next to my keyboard and since then I have picked it up once and that was when I was doing a mission where I had to fly and I didn't have time to learn the controls since then I have learnt all of the controls for flying driving and walking and they feel great. People are complaining with the controls for flying with the numpad but I think it works great yeah it's not as good as games like Battlefield but it is playable and there is always the option to have the Xbox controller plugged in and you can pick it up and start using it without having to change any settings.4. OnlineThis is probably where most people will get gametime out of. After completing the singleplayer there is so much to do in the Online that gives even more hours. The online is great. There is text and voice chat for in the lobbies and when you're doing missions and heists I didn't play GTA IV online so I don't know if that had this but the sound quality for voice chat is very good and you can change settings which lowers the game volume when someone speaks which is very helpful. Missions and Heists are in my opinion the best part of Online. The Heists are fun yet hard. There are many Elite challenges to complete to get bonus cash from Heists which gives a lot of replayability. Rockstar have implemented the singleplayer characters you meet into Online to give you Missions to do for cash and RP (exp). There are so many things to buy Online that it would probably take quite a while to build up the cash to buy them all the bonus cash for pre ordering was definitely a big help for me. Overall I think Online is probably the most appealing part of GTA V for some people and I would personally spend 40 just for GTA Online.5. SingleplayerI will update this when I have fully complete the singleplayer.In my opinion GTA V on PC is the way it is meant to be played. 60 FPS great graphics great KB/M support and mods in the future. If you are on the fence of buying this I recommend it. Many friends have asked me if it is worth it and I have said "If you are someone who buys one game a year this should be that one game."10/10

review: Normally I would highly recommend this game. It has a constantly expanding Online diverse gameplay an engaging Single Player and an amazing modding community that has tons of creativity.Now I don't recommend it because Take Two has officially stopped an important modding tool called OpenIV which practically makes almost every amazig mod for this game work as well as GTA IV/EFLC. Practically the whole concept of GTA Online came from modding. Many of the things Rockstar used for the ingame TV content included mods from GTA IV. I suppose that this is their way to say thank you. GTA modding is a fun hobby but this took a lot of that away.If Take Two changes their policy and corrects this I will change this review.

review: TLDR The online is not something I recommend unless you have way to much money to just throw away. The single player was good until they screwed over basically the whole modding community. I can't recommend gta V. Gta V is one of the top 5 best selling games of all time and it made about one billion dollars in its first three days. So it is an ok game and I like(ed) the single player because of all of the modability. But the online is honestly just a money generator and a bad one at that. They have dulled it down so it's just a grind where you can't realistically have fun unless you spend real money. It's just an excuse for micro transactions. But they still think that they don't make enough money so what they do is they ruin the single player so that they can force more people on to the multiplayer where they can make you spend even more money to have some fun. Their last move to ruin single player was to send a cease and desist to OpenIV which basically every mod is based on and makes them possible. This was obviously done only to send more people to the multiplayer.

review: Well... I bought the game on the weekend it came out and only played online for my first 165ish hours. I decided a couple days ago that I should probably play the story at some point and now that I had a computer that could run it better than when I first bought it I set in to the story of GTA V. The story was so great that I stayed up really late and got up early to play this game as if it was a novel I couldn't put down. After playing through the entire story I felt like I got the 60 dollars I dropped on this game over a year ago without thinking about all the fun I had had previously with friends in the online mode. I would 100% recommend this game for the story alone and online is an amazing bonus in my opinion. Let's see how long it takes me until restart the story just to play it a couple more times!

review: Awesome game but like many of the reviews here I also have had massive trouble with Rockstar Support.I got the game in April of 2015 when it came out on PC. I wasn't able to run it on my computer until July 3rd when my Dad brought home a new processor for me to play with. After that I played it almost every day. It was fun and super addictive. Then one day I picked up modding. I lasted a couple of months without being banned until January earlier this year. i was banned for ten days. Ok fair I WAS modding. But after that I decided "Ok well modding was fun but let's just play the game normally from now on." So I did. The day I was unbanned I returned with my friends to GTA Online and played for a few hours. Then as we went to a private session to have a melee battle I was without reason banned again. I was randomly banned without a reason the exact same day as getting unbanned. I had to wait an additional 30 days to play again. I submitted a ticket to Rockstar Support and was given an automated reply. Then they ignored me for the remaining time period. After the thirty days had ended I continued to play until June when (About a week or two from the release of "Further Adventures in Finance and Felony") I was banned AGAIN. Permenantly and once again without reason. I have submitted three requests since my ban two months ago. The first two were ignored by the Support team and the third one was DELETED from their forums. As of now I'm condemned to Single Player while my friends are free to have fun with the new DLCs.Overall I would recommend the game. It's fun and addictive and there's tons to do.But at the same time with Rockstar's awful support team it almost isn't worth it.EDIT BTW I have maxed over 1000 hours on this game which goes to show just how much I liked it before my experience with R* Support.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Awesome game! I recommend that you get it because it is (at the date of this post) still being updated with the newest dlc's and is an online multiplayer which means that you can play online!Better than the console versions because you can mod it. Also you need a decent pc to play it check the system requirements before you buy this game and make sure your pc can run it. Hope this review helped! DD

Not to mention people causing all mayhem right at you when you are minding your own business mixed with hacking airplanes and dead bodies wrapped in plastic inside of your character or turning you into a boulder until you change servers which wastes time and which causes you to lose job points.EXPECT HACKING ON EVERY SERVER!EXPECT TO GET BANNED AT SOME POINT 3 TIMES AND YOU ARE NOT ALLOWED INTO ONLINE GAMEPLAY AGAIN (which has plenty of obvious hacking).
