review: The singleplayer is good if you have not played the game yet so if you plan to JUST play singleplayer then go for it.If you plan to play online or buy just for online change your plans.The new update gives us a new heist called the doomsday heist with 3 acts each about 4 5 hours long. The heists are fun the first time round as you get to use flying cars jetpacks and more. With good dialog and a somewhat amusing story to follow. Sounds good right? Nope.To play the heist you must buy a Facility. $1.25 Million to play the ing thing. Pay setup costs then do prep missions before you can do the setups and main heist with are not in freeroam. Preps are ONLY allowed to be done in public freeroam lobbies with people trying to destroy your stuff for a bit of cash. You can skip them however so that good for only $95 000! It gets better trust me. No one makes money doing the prep mission everyone but the host makes money on the setups and for the host you must complete every act to make your money back from buying the CHEAPIST facility with NO extra features. The new vehicles are about $2 million $3 million each + the cost of upgrading them AND needing to own a facility with the cheapest being on the opposite end of the map from the city. The heists don t give that much money in comparison to other heists warehouses and the cost of entry to play them. And the laser beam of death? $900 000 to buy then $500 000 $750 000 each time to use it once.This is not just the heist. This problem is everywhere you go in the game. Bunkers are over $1 million without any upgrades. CEO offices and $1 million then you have to pay more for warehouses for cargo ($250 000 for 16 spaces a pain to complete with the biggest killer being boredom) and to steal + sell cars ($1.6 million cheapest + tons of time to set up to earn maximum money). Same problem for hangers same problem for any vehicle that does something more than move and researching upgrades in your $1 million + bunker has the same system as a free to play mobile game like clash of clans.The grind at this point is too much if you don t play this all the time as a new player don t even brother. Tons of better games out to buy and play that and I would go as far to say that MMO s past and present are less grindy than GTA online now to get all the different buildings and decent vehicles. Even on sale at 20 it only worth it for SP this game is not worth more than that. Over 20 for GTA is a scam and at that price it still a rip off in terms of value for money

review: The single player is pretty good. Standard GTA fair. Now I must rant about online.Rockstar has the gall to keep this game at retail price 4 years after the game's release and charge microtransactions to such an extent that there is no way to keep up with all the cool stuff in the game.Every 3 months or so a big update happens where in order to use any of the stuff you need to buy in a couple million dollars or around 5 months of your life constantly grinding. Then it makes using the cool stuff you bought tedious by using bunkers garages and pegasus vehicles which operate on a timer.The worst part is the hacking. Rockstar does less than nothing to monitor people spawning in tanks and teleporting all over the map to troll you while you grind away to get a car that isn't very good. Then they spawn a guitar shoved directly up your that launches you into space. Guess what? That one follows you to other sessions. Meaning you have to completely leave and reenter online (a 10 minute process due to abysmal load times) only to get in a server with another hacker.

review: Single player is great so far from what I've been able to complete when I need to take a break from GTA Online. The attention to detail put into the game world is impressive. I'm kind of glad I didn't play the original versions on a console and held out for 2 years to have my first experience with the game as it was intended to be played. On the other hand I feel that people who have proverbial dusty PS3 or 360 copies sitting on a shelf would definitely be able to appreciate the visual upgrade compared to the last time they remember playing.I had an issue with my online account missing a vehicle and Rockstar support was great in resolving it and compensating me so they've earned my respect there as well. Online is pretty addicting but once you're high level there's really not a lot to do. After you do all the heists twice you get sick of them pretty quick and they turn into a money grind. More end game content for people who already have the best properties and vehicles would be interesting to see. The matchmaking system is still really bad though so try to play with friends.

review: I buy this game a year ago but rarely play it ever since. I think it's best to separate the online and the offline story mode to give you better insight about where is the strongest point of the game and what could hold you off from buying it.STORY MODE (Offline) + Game PerformancesThe story mode is good but not great since the main missions are easy to finish. Contentwise it has plenty of things to explore with. Considering how big this game is the performance of this game is good when paired with a stronger PC. Graphically it looks good even though it's aging. I have to praise the devs effort for optimizing this game. It's one of the most optimized game. It still retains the classic GTA gameplay even though some cheats and features aren't as fun as GTA SA. The selection of music is like most of the time good. Instead of just one protagonist you had three here each with a different talents. And if you like mods or even modding this game is for you. The only negative is you should keep your internet alive at least when signing in for the rockstar account. They have some sort of DRM which is annoying. Bottom line is if you buy this for the story mode (offline) then it's good. Whether it's worth or not buying it for this sole purpose is up to you to rethink about it.ONLINEIt has the same city and anything inside is more or less the same with the story mode. But this time you are playing as your own character. You do jobs to earn money (beside thrifting at shops). The idea itself is perfectly executed but the implementation is lacklustre. First of all connecting to online server takes forever if you dont have good connection (which in my country Indonesia we have sluggish internet here). And it's more becoming a pay to win game because most of the time the gap of the levels in the server is too high and these powerful old players have a way too far advantage which can be used to abuse new players. For example they can withstand more damage and have a more powerful weapon. Some of these players are either toxic (like killing newbies whenever they found one) or they dont want to give the job to the new players because they didnt trust them. So yes it hurts to be a newcomer here unless you got money to spend or you cheat. And now words spread that the devs are hunting on innocent people to ban (alongside cheaters and abusers of course). Bottom line the environment isn't good if you're new here without the shark cards and even for the older players you can still get banned for doing nothing wrong. I don't reccomend playing this on online mode it's not that fun unless you have people to play with and to protect each other.CONCLUSIONI wanted to reccomend this but the plus side isn't really justifying enough to say so. It's good to play it offline in a story mode but yet you still have to sign in because of DRM. It seems the main features are the online one as devs wanted to push it that way but meh. I kinda regret it somehow even though i like the game.

review: As someone who played loads of GTA 4 and loved watching stuff from the previous installments I can totally recommend this game for anyone looking for a fun single player experience.I can't however recommend the multiplayer unless you play privately with several of your friends. Playing in a lobby full of randoms can be one of the most boring/infuriatinly stupid experiences you can have with this game.I personally haven't run into any hackers during my time playing but I've seen quite a bit of it captured for videos and such. but my limited knowledge on hackers aside you either leave your house to get immedietly gunned down chased down after you spawn again to get gunned down again if you don't have a quick enough reaction time and then once you finally kill them and or go into passive to do go where you wanted to go in the first place they continue to chase you around for about 20 minutes.Not to mention everybody buys the same apartment so it can end up being an absolute cluster on a very populated server.Now if it were just bad player experiences that would be one thing but the point of GTA online is to make money pimp out your favorite car get an outfit that you really like have a garage full of your favorite cars maybe and have loads of other expensive things that fill the empty void you have in your actual life and the systems they have in place to make sed money are mostly utter ing trash. Between getting kicked from missions and hiests for a number of different reasons to connection errors the host has it's pretty limited what you can do to make a reasonable amount of money. Now I know there's plenty of new ways to make money since the game first came out but between the sparce VIP body guard invites or missions that get really boring after a while that usually end up getting their payout reduced by more than half there's way too much tedium that goes into making a meagre amount of cash.Hopefully the update that comes out on the 7th of June will be something fun and fresh to make a more substancial amount of money if not well then nothing really changed I guess.oh yea and sharkcards are ing stupid and make me dislike microtransactions even more.I would say if you want this game for the single player and or multiplayer please wait for a decent sale.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is one of the greatest open world games ever made. It is a testament to how video games can be just as culturally relevant as films and music as the entire game is simultaneously a remarkable piece of entertainment and a scathing satire of the modern American way of life. If only for the wealth of customizable settings and constant stream of free updates the PC version exceeds its console counterparts and should be your platform of choice however GTA online is still an unoptimized frustrating mess that is enjoyable with friends but an exercise in unenjoyable gameplay otherwise.PROS + Breathtaking visuals that have been significantly upgraded from the 2013 release+ A deep intriguing story spanning three very unique characters+ Some of the best voice acting I've ever heard in a game+ Dozens of hours of side missions and activities separate from the main story missions+ Significantly improved gunplay and cover mechanics from GTA IV+ A large detailed map that feels alive+ Heist missions+ Challenging and fun to battle police unitsCONS Painfully long loading times Playing GTA Online solo GTA Online hackers GTA Online connectivity issues GTA Online in general unless you're playing with friends Game affecting microtransactions in the form of Shark CardsOVERALL SCORE 8.5/10 GTA Online can largely be avoided unless you play it as it should be played with a group of your friends in a private session where you rampage through Los Santos and tackle the heists. The Single Player totally makes up for GTA Online's shortcomings and is a gaming masterpiece as far as I'm concerned.

review: An insanely good game the story is impeccable as it is entwined with 3 different you can play as you progress through the game. Make them look how you want and do what you want progress through the story in any degree of depth and you will definitely enjoy it. It's got the classic features you expect from the modern GTA games the ability to go on an endless siren filled rampage to the ability to do a triathalon (that is 30 RL minutes long).GTA Online is where I spend most of my time however as it opens the game to a 4th character YOU. You enter Los Santos (the game's main city) and progress as a master criminal completeing missions and heists and looking away from explosions. Beware the trolls hackers though they tend to just kill you mercilessly to enlarge their e peen. Don't fret just go passive mode you can ignore it or find a new sessions for you and your pals. If you want to completely lock out anyone from your session except your mates you can just start a private session from the single player side of the game.It's an amazing game that gets content updates every so often that are quite in depth especially the heist update (heavily delayed but ultimately worth it much like GTA V on PC). I definitely recommend it everyone who likes the GTA style of gaming.

review: (This is a GTA V Online review)GTA V Online is a fun game and you will have many hours of the game before it gets boring. One of the great things about the game is everything you can do! There are so many options. You can buy cars (huge range of cars) you can buy clothes (huge range of clothes) and you can become a ceo or a motorcycle club President. BUT there is a very bad thing there is a lot of hacks to the game that rockstar isn't patching (A LOT). I have meet a lot of hackers who just kill you for 30 min or spawn planes to get everything laggy. Another bad thing is the waiting time. The waiting time is long when you enter GTA V Online. When you enter online you have to wait when you enter a heist you have to wait when your done with the heist you have to wait or if you quit the heist before it's done you have to wait. The waiting time with medium internet (it's longer to enter gta v online then joining a heist or leaving a finished heist) so i would have to say entering online would be minimum 10 minutes and leaving a finished (or unfinished) heist would be minimum 3 4 minutes.Rating 7 10 8 10

review: I used to love GTA V. The open world interesting story and free multiplayer DLC were great. The game isn't perfect and by removing modding from single player I can't recommend this game. Modding is my favorite part about GTA it adds so much to the game and removing that is a slap in the face to PC gamers many of which bought the game for this reason and want to continue playing single player for the mods. Further the DLC they keep releasing is great but it's obvious they don't care about single player and haven't added any single player updates. It's sad that rockstar cares more about money than what their players want and until they bring back modding in single player I am giving this game a huge thumbs down.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Excellent game even in late 2017! The story is superb and even the multiplayer makes me constantly want to return for more.However for multiplayer keep in mind this 1. There will be a lot of waiting on loading screens when connecting to different activities!2. Main currency dollars can be bought for real money for very large sums of real money. It DOES NOT make a game p2w but prices are a bit higher then in f2p games.3. If you are not buying shark cards (real money &gt in game dollars) getting all of the cars you want (even if you want just a fraction of what is there for sale) will take A LOT of grinding meaning CRAZY amount of solo grinding.4. Game is most fun when you have a stable group of 4 friends always playing together you can play solo and with randoms but it is definitely LESS fun.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The singleplayer game itself is fantastic one of the best I've played. However the multiplayer is one of the worst microtransaction laden grind fest hellholes in a full priced game. This multiplayer mode has limited singleplayer already because new DLC vehicles no longer get added and you have to mod to spawn in the cars if you want to test them out. Because of GTA Online there won't be any singleplayer DLC that was promised. All of that would be easily ignorable because of the large modding community largely possible due to OpenIV. However Take Two have sent a cease and desist to OpenIV which would effectively kill all modding for GTA V including singleplayer. Because of this I cannot recommend this game.Edit after OpenIV's return still keeping it at negative because of the multiplayer being a grindy pay to win .
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V is fairly good as long as you're playing the singleplayer story but after you're done with that Take Two's recent actions against OpenIV and the rampant cheating online has made this game lose quite a lot of its value and fun over the last few years.

review: If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan Romano &amp Asiago)Note grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling. In a small mixing bowl add the ricotta and mash with a fork. Add in the 3 cheese blend Cheddar cheese eggs salt and pepper. Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth paste like consistency. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough. Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water oil and salt. Mix. Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs water oil and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed. Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough. Take the dough out of the mixing bowl shape it into a ball and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic. Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters. With a cookie cutter or upside down water glass cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15 20 dough circles). Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells. Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough. Fill a small bowl with water dip your fingers in and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle. Fold the dough in half over the filling making a half moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a homemade touch as well. Repeat this process for all your dough circles. Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker. Roll the dough into two sheets Place one sheet on the ravioli maker and form the filling cups. Fill with the ravioli mixture. Lay the second sheet of dough on top and roll it out. This will seal in the filling. Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli. Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5 6 minutes or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test. If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time you can freeze the rest Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce grate some fresh cheese over it and enjoy!

review: I will make it short First of all THE ENGINE This time the "RAGE" game engine (witch GTA V uses) is realy optimised nothing to do with the bad perfomance in GTA IV.Rockstar have made a lot to ensure smooth and beautiful game.Almost Constant 60FPS covering the recomendet requirements.Also a big list of options are added in the game menu for precise tweaking.Some bugs are not fixed a few moths after the game release like the memory leak that many players experience but aside from this the game runs very good even excellent for a game of such a scale THE WORLD The World is impressive Huge Detailed and Beautiful.I am fascinated with the Rockstar's almost maniacally compulsive obsession with the details. GTA IV had it too but in V it is on new higher level.I am not going to waste my time to give examples because they are so much and most of them people would not even notice.In the spirit of the previous parts of the series Rockstar creates a world with its own spirit and atmosphere copletley coherent with the story of the game.THE STORY The story reminds of big movie titles like "HEAT" "Ocean's Eleven" and "The Score" Tense action crazy heists and big scores. In contrast with GTA IV the story is way less dramatic.As opposing to dark tale of IV here we have one more light and simple story fitting the bright atmosphere of the game.The main characters are one of the best in GTA series even one of the best in world's gaming industry.I like the idea that You as a player can find yourself in one of the 3 main characters.THE GAMEPLAY As usual GTA V have simple and easy gameplay.Here we have a lot customizations and things to spend money for.And e missions... THEY ARE THE BEST in all GTA seryes.THE MULTIPLAYER It is all about the money.Missions Heists Races and more with the simple idea to make you rich and richer.Lots of content to spend money for and a lot to do in this big world.Of corse in multiplayer we have simple storyes with the missions and the heists and some of the characters of the main game story witch make things more real.ALL IN ALL Every cent and all those 6 years of waiting was worth it.The game is a masterpiece deserving the "GOTY" title.If You are fan or even not of GTA seryes I believe that You gonna love this game.

The Biker DLC is my favorite so far.I'd like to see some more downtime activity the main part of the game is makingmoney to buy more stuff at the moment but I would like to have some more to doin my "crime free time". Well to be fair you can fill days with just doing t withyour friends you just need to be a little creative.That's all I got to say for now the Game is definitely worth the 30 it costs with a 50% discount.

review: It seems like the general consensus for this game is pretty good (at the time of this review it is 81% positive review) so that being said it is apparent this is a good game. However I think it is definitely getting the short end of the stick on some reviews. I have 20 hours on the PC version but I also owned this game the day it came out on Xbox 360 and spent countless hours on it. I intend to put many more on PC. People complain about the online (which is actually pretty poor I cannot lie) but it is still a ridiculously solid game. The single player alone is worth MUCH more than $60. You will get hours of well written story great cinematics beautiful looking gameplay and countless other things. The mod support (https //www.gta5 mods.com/ is a great site for mods) is very good and the modders are constantly adding new things. One thing that cannot be understated is the optimization of GTA V. Some reviewers must have been running this on a potato if they think it is poorly optimized. I have a fairly weak PC and get 50 FPS on high. This is a masterpiece of a game and would most definitely recommend it to anyone.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This is my one of the most exciting and thrilling open world game that I ever experienced. And there's three reasons. First you can go wherever you want to go in Los Santos. Open world game usually makes you boring because there's not many contents but this is not. This game has not only open world but also lots of contents. Second it has great storylines. Many people think that GTA series' single player is boring but it is not. In this game three characters are assembled and they solve the problems among them. Third you can enjoy this game with your friends. There are many contents you can enjoy with your friends. For example you can do heist drive through Los Santos kill each other fight against the cops etc. Although this game is 69$ you won't regret of buying this game. Thank you.

review: I enjoy this game tremendously. However I cannot recommend it. Rockstar while a company that needs to turn a profit have failed to support and expand this game in a manner which expresses good faith to their player base. The have failed to create any meaningful single player DLC to police their servers or to provide for a complete player experience. They've engaged in price gouging for in game good to push their shark card horse And they've progressively locked the playing experience behind pay to play given the amount of time investment it would require to access in game content which is futher inhibited by the fact that many content items give those willing to spend the money an measurable advantage. I bought the game at full price I expect the full product. Rockstar have failed to deliver that.

The game is riddled with hackers and it honestly feels like a grind to earn a meager amount of money to spend. There is so much you can buy but the amount of time you would have to grind for it is just staggering. Online just feels disorganized and disjointed. It does soo many things but it doesnt do any of them particularly well. It has been a couple years out on PC and the fact that they keep adding new stuff to buy but dont bother to fix and hone the already exisiting problems is what makes me not reccomend this game. It really does feel like they are just creating more stuff so people spend IRL money to buy it.

review: I've played every Grand Theft Auto since the PSX releases. I even had the GBC version at one point. GTA5 is the most fully realized entry to date. The scope of the game although not as big as GTA San Andreas still contains a lot of depth and detail that I didn't realize was lacking in previous entries. Both the single player and online component includes a lot of different activities to get into and there's never a shortage of mayhem to engage in considering the creator mode's inclusion. Highly recommend.Update 11/23 I'm hearing of a few people getting permabanned for things beyond players control. This is NOT good Rockstar.

review: This game used to be great. I remeber first playing GTA online with my buddies in middle school on my xbox 360. The first time I logged in nobody had a super garage with 64 vehicles stored inside. it was survival in the streets of Los Santos everyone was scrambling to create their gangs and there was a mad rush to get the more powerful vehicles in the game (buzzard rhino tank etc..) It was an environment unlike any other I had ever seen in the gaming world It was amazing. But alas all good things must come to an end. Once they started coming out with these ridiculous DLC's with blatantly op weapons guns vehicles and so on it really ruined the game. And now they outlawed our mods? these guys. They dont deserve any of the money they've earned and I have no clue why this game is #2 on global top sellers in 2017. Very sad. Pirate this game to play the single player but please dont pay any amount of money for this monstrocity of a video game its not worth it.

review: GTA5 is possble one of the best games I have ever played and one of the best open world games I have ever played as well because there is so much to do and so much to see. The game lets you play as 3 characters Michael a man who wants to retire Franklin a gangster who wants to live the big life and Tervor a man who is crazy and is an old friend of Michael who finds out he is alive. The 3 team up and perform certain missions to fufill their goals and their needs ot to help the FIB to keep them alive and out of trouble the 3 characters have special abilty's with them Michael has the abilty which I did not used at all it can slow down time to get a better aim Franklin's abilty is that he can slow down time to get a better grip when driving which is very useful when ity comes to racing and driving as a whole and Trevor's is the one I used the most as he can go into a rage that makes him do double the damage and he can tank more hits. When you are not doing missions you can come across the many stranges and freaks throughout Los Santos as they have things for you too do and such. The world if Los Santos is big and there is lots to do in it you can go biking buy a boat to ride them get nice cars and so much more there is a lot to do in GTYA5 and that is why I like it since the freedom it gives you hell if you want to go and get the cops on you start a rampage. Now as for online I have played it a bit on PC but I did manage to play a lot of it at a friends house on his Xbox one and it was good on the there but on the PC is another story as there are a lot of hackers and most of the modding is now gone due to Rock Star and Take Two due to legal actions taken on them. All in all GTA5 is a great game single player wise and good mutilplayer when the hackers are not out to ruin your fun and such I recommend this game to anyone who wants a great open world game and the freedom to do what ever they want in the world of GTA5.

review: I will start off by saying that the single player is fantastic and I clearly love the game based on my time played but I do not recommend purchasing this game or its microtransactions.Take Two Interactive the owners of Rockstar Entertainment are a bunch of greedy s. For those of you that do not follow gaming news Take Two recently filed a Cease and Decist against the developers of OpenIV a modding tool for GTA V. This is an issue. Modding has kept these GTA games alive between updates. Sure you are not supposed to use them in the Online but that's where private servers come in. If Take Two is going to tell people they cannot mod this game and would rather flex it's legal muscles than look at their policies then who are we to support them? Not to mention at a conference not too long ago the CEO of Take Two Interactive essentially called the consumers freeloaders.tl dr Fantastic game if you can get past the microtransactions but the companies shady practices as well as refusal to allow modding even for singleplayer should not be supported.

review: Before I begin this review let me clarify this I bought this game to play online with my friend. I have NOT played the campaign. This is a big long complaint about the issues in GTA Online. I suggest you read this before buying if you're here to play online and don't want to be taken by surprise by the grind and savagery of the online.Now I absolutely love GTA online. I'm able to experience the joy of mass crime in the comfort of my computer chair and home without any real world consequences with other people.Currently I'm around level 40 with a good $3 000 000 in my bank. This is not just from being rich. This is about two week's worth of money which I have strictly ordered myself not to spend until I get enough to buy the thing(s) that I really want. Good vehicles.The game is chock full of cars bikes choppers and planes. And even submarines and boats are plenty. But a lot of these are standard civvie cars. The big boy cars are armored have a high seat count have weapons and/or can do something fancy and unique. Take the Stromberg for example. It's a regular fast car but it can go underwater firing torpedoes or missiles and machine guns on land. This car as of writing costs $3.1 MILLION undiscounted and without the special trade price. And even with the trade price it's ungodly expensive.Prices wouldn't be a problem if money was fun and easy to get. But getting money is a grind. Not quite Clash of Clans level as I can actually bear it to an extent but close enough.I'll find myself logging onto GTA Online and frantically scrambling to do the Doomsday Heist the highest paid heist currently in the game on Quick Job. I stare impatiently at the corner of my screen as the game searches for a lobby and then will immediately look for another lobby if it comes up with a setup. Setups are required before a heist as they're a (somewhat) fun in game way of collecting the things needed to act out a heist. But setups get tedious and uncreative as all the interesting bits are in the heist itself. And even the interesting setups though there aren't too many as most are just run in shoot and go or grab this and come back or a mix of those have basically no pay. Say $40 000 at most. That's a lot in real life but it's pocket change in the game.When you finally get to the heist there's a required feature. CUTS. This is a way to decide who gets however much money from doing the heist. Usually the leader will get 55% and the rest of the players will get 15% each on average though this varies sometimes due to player numbers how fair the heist leader is etc.I honestly hate this feature. I will admit I get a power rush deciding how poorly paid the snobby level 100 players get though it IS unfair on everyone including the leader. I get it it puts you into the mindset of a master criminal. Plotting how much money each member of the crew gets giving yourself way more because you need it to get that sweet car. It's realism and immersion. But do we need realism and immersion in a game with a flying car an amphibious muscle car and a bloody rocket powered motorbike? Yes obviously but not to the extent of making players' moneymaking endeavours tedious. It would be much better if heist payment was improved. And yes I'm aware of Shark Card purchases. Rockstar need money and they want money. Shark Cards are a core way to do that. But it's horrific how many players rely on them to get what they want to play with. Even my friend who is heavily against microtransactions (as am I) decided he should use a month's hard earned savings to buy a bit of dosh to buy a bunker to progress in the online game.Additionally the pricing is there for longevity in the game. It's hard to go from rich boy number one to a regular level 1 peasant if you're getting bored of having everything and Rockstar know this. But a fun longlasting game shouldn't be composed of grinding. It should be composed of a plethora of fun exciting ways to progress rather than one straight path of battling for the most money and the biggest cut and trying not to get bored doing so. Let's go over a few ways to get money and review their pros and cons.Heists the already mentioned primary way of earning money. A few hundred thousand at minimum as a final pay comes from these unless you're doing the Fleeca Job on easy. These payments as I have said are controlled by cuts which the host and leader of a heist session is able to control. This is to make up for the fact they get NO money from the setups (or preps in the Doomsday Heist.) and they will generally give themselves at least 40% of the total earnings. On top of this. there are NOT enough heists. I know full and well it takes time and effort lots of those to make things like this but I'm going to be blunt. Doing the same 10 15 heists over and over gets tedious especially when a lot of them barely have a good pay which then has to be cut down to even LESS. Heists are also impossible to get into as a low level player looking for quick money. Since I've started the game I've joined the heists of players level 100 and up and have been instantly kicked for my level effectively throwing me out of getting good pays until I myself can afford the facilities items and setup costs (Yes they exist) to host a heist myself. This isn't bad on the players. A lot of lower levels are incompetent. It's a flawed broken system to get players to buy Shark Cards.Next jobs. Jobs are small but fun little minigames such as battling it out with cars and powerups in the street or the sky or doing 3 lap races. But these are tediously long and give you a maximum of $20 000 and that's only on the highest paid ones if you play well. Jobs work like heists in that you can be kicked for your level too though thankfully the system to get to play these is less brutal. But that's only because of the peasant tier payment for it. I have played about three jobs in my time on GTA Online because I quickly learned they aren't worth the hassle at all.Next and most annoying. Killing. This is a realistic system designed to get players more engaged in PvP. If a player is carrying money in their pocket rather than in their Maze Bank account they can drop it on death and it can be picked up by other players. However this has caused the game to go south as now basically every player is hostile or paranoid as everyone wants each other's money. And I have seen on numerous occasions players being killed in the open seconds after loading back into Freemode after a heist. This can only be circumvented via Passive Mode essentially a no weapons godmode which is commonly seen as a cowardly thing to use as it breaks the flow of the gameplay and renders you invincible to the firepower of others' hard earned war machines. Additionally you can kill civilians and cops to get money but they only drop a tiny miniscule amount of money which isn't worth it.And finally the dreaded microtransactions. Also known as Shark Cards these are Rockstar's secondary source of money from GTAV the primary being game purchases. Shark Cards allow players to get in game money for ludicrous amounts of real money so that they can speed up their moneymaking. Want the Deluxo but don't want to spend a week grinding Doomsday? Shark Cards! Want to become a CEO gunrunner and motorcycle club president all at the same time but don't want to throw away loads of time? Shark Cards! Wave goodbye to your real money you don't need it when you have GTA Online's one and only grind prevention system!In conclusion I do enjoy this game's online mode but I'm going to rate negative due to the ungodly grinding. I won't get into the community whose toxicity can be compared to the Chernobyl reactor as that's nothing on Rockstar. The grind of this game ruins it. If it was more fun and/or less grindy I'd be voting this positive easily. I'd rate GTA Online 6/10.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It used to be good and story is still fun but online is just grinding now they don't care about you they only care about the money. They have a clever system in which you'd need hundreds of hours to actually have a good car a high end apartment and atleast a hydra it's getting annoying because this system unless you like grinding makes you wanna buy a shark card which is incredibly expensive especially for digital currency (no bitcoin go away this is a game you're actual currency). Since I've played the entire story twice I am now modding (singleplayer I don't wanna ruin other player's experience) and it's quite fun to be a police too. Other than that I do not recommend it if you're in for the multiplayer which suprise surprise is the only thing getting updated now.On singleplayer Rockstar has this damned feature that despawns all multiplayer cars such as the Deluxo if you're modding singleplayer it's as if they really want you to buy sharkcards to actually use the cars and the features.Another thing is balance recently in the Doomsday update (the heist is annoying btw i dont suggest you do it enemies constantly spawn and and it's infuriating if you're doing 3 players or less.) they added the orbital satellite thing in order to use it to kill people you must pay in game currency there is an auto lock way too which just aims at the target constantly assuring the target's death which by surprise costs more. There is no way of knowing if you're getting targeted and it's annoying since by experience I don't think destroying personal vehicles even costs you that way. It's basically like the tool that modders use on online you can kill anyone with mods (video as I said I don't mod online) and now they made it possible to the non modding community too. Sure you could make a private lobby and limit the things you do and also not have anyone to interact with and also the bad sport/good sport lobby seriously? In a game where all you do is crimes and killing you get into a bad sport lobby if you kill too many people/destroy too many personal vehicles it's a game where you're normally doing that for sakes! I really don't recommend this game if you're an online dude.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Since I (mostly) don't much care about multiplayer 'new content' or whatever excuse companies make up to charge an extra buck GTA V was a solid though a bit disappointing experience. I felt GTA SA for one had a much more interesting world. GTA V is gorgeous and plays smoothly but there isn't much going on once you get tired of trivialities like investing in the stock market. For such a detailed world there's a suprisingly low number of places and people to interact with so this is definitely a step back in relation to SA (I never played GTA IV to tell). Doing missions I felt annoying spending a lot of the time simply going from one place to the next. To be sure a lot of what's fun in GTA is the little comic things in it but I think this game lacks depth despite the gorgeous layer (characters voice acting and so on). The radio frustrated me as well. I had great memories of San Andrea's talk shows (''poor people stop complaining start living!") and had similar expectations for this one. In short my main problem with GTA V is that there isn't too much to it in the end and the world is actually quite boring since you can only interact with 1/100 of it. If you don't care much for analyzing things and really just want to have fun by all means buy it. If you're a sticker for details like me I don't recommend it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Honestly just don't get it. Really not worth it anymore. The single player is fun but it gets repetitive quick around the time Trevor gets to Los Santos. The switching mechanic is slow and unintuitive on keyboard and mouse. Not only that but the game is frankly unoptimized especially for how ugly the game looks (at least in my opinion). For reference I have an i5 and MSI R9 390X. Not the best system but still there shouldn't be a reason for this game to be playing at 30 50 FPS (yes it is THAT inconsistent) on medium high. Now onto Multiplayer. Holy balls are the character models ugly. Mind you when GTA Online first got released the character customization was even WORSE. People looked like a mix between a crack addicted Ork from Warhammer and Gollum. it was bad. Now to their credit it *is* better now but it is still an excercise in patience trying to make your character even remotely attractive. I only put this first because character customization is a huge thing for me. I love spending time to make my character look awesome. It's almost impossible to do that here with the combination of ugly character models bad customization for the ugly character models and ugly fashion choices. There aren't a whole lot of clothing options that I can really guarantee will look good on anyone (why do the fitted suit pants make your character's feet look freaking massive???). Overall character customization is a HUGE minus. Gameplay is...meh. Honestly unimpressed. I honestly think Ubisoft (even though they have their own gameplay issues...) mastered 3rd Person shooting. Ghost Reco Wildlands and Watch_Dogs 2 have MUCH better shooting and movement mechanics compared to this and Watch_Dogs 2 has at least in my opinion better driving than this game. But that stuff isn't the focus of the multiplayer no.The focus of the multiplayer is actually an MMO style grind. Now personally I was never really into grinding. It just seemed tedious and boring to me. And this game proves no different. EVERYTHING is expensive. You get a car a 2 car garage a pistol and the clothes on your back for free but everything has else needs to be bought. This might sound easy but mind you the early game missions pay out maybe a couple grand. The less expensive houses (the next step up from your 2 car garage) are still around $35 000. That's 17 missions if you're lucky and those missions take up to half an hour at a time. It's probably not going to be 17 missions though seeing as you're probably going to be spending your money between missions either on ammo armor or character customization.Going back to the first point about character customization I have a HUGE problem with character customization being tied to level. It seems like a really stupid decision. Why limit what I can make my character look like? I can understand making certain clothing more expensive so you can't get it right away like making a 3 piece suit more expensive than sweatpants and a t shirt but the game doesn't do that at least not with base game clothing. No the grind really comes to a head with the free DLC. The DLC adds a lot of kind of cool stuff! Like a CEO office new houses (including mansions!) new cars and clothes biker clubhouses and more! Too bad most of it is $1 million+. If you buy now you are NOT going to be able to do that stuff even though it adds a couple of gigs onto the already monstrous 50 gigabyte install. It's not like you're missing out on much anyway. The new clothing options are still ugly the new cars are frankly underwhelming (even the ones with guns) and the CEO office clubhouse new garages and now the bunker ONLY add new missions. Missions which get you more money. Which you inevitably use to buy an office/clubhouse/garage/bunker. Which you'll do more missions for. To get more money. And the cycle repeats. The missions aren't fun either. No they're honestly quite boring and worst of all some are almost impossible without either a helping hand or a full crew. "Fun" for the whole family I guess. So you obviously want money becuase really those guns and cars *do* look *really* fun....so what do you do? Speaking from experience? Find a hacker. A lot of the hackers in GTA give you money and it's awesome. They're really the best part of the game and community because they let you bypass the slog that is the GTA Online experience. Best part is? Rockstar put an end to OpenIV which couldn't do anything to multiplayer...and did basically nothing to the trainers that *do* let you hack multiplayer. If you still buy this game you still stand a good chance to find a hacker or become one so go ahead and do that. Overall I'd say the main draw to this game for me was a game where I'd get to around an open world with a character I made. Go on road trips get into scraps basically what Final Fantasy XV is. So yeah go buy that instead. Or anything else really.TL DR Go find a better MMO.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game itself is nice and I like it. The developers though do not care about it at all. There are two main issues 1) Hackers in online mode. They can instant kill whole session. Lock your client so you cannot change session. They can kill other players in your name. This has been continuing for a long time and Rockstar pretends nothing is happening.2) Stutter after a few hours of playing. This is also a known issue and has been for a long time. No fix available. It doesn't affect all systems so maybe you will be lucky and don't have this problem.In both cases Rockstar does not care or does not even acknowledge there is an issue. After they take your money they don't give a s**t so do not expect it to become better anytime soon.

review: An utterly fantastic and monumental achievement a huge landscape that faithfully recreates and improves on GTA San Andreas and scope characters and gameplay that outdo every game beforehand. I've found it to be a great PC port although there are some that have had some issues starting the game. But once you're in it plays very well all things considered. Make no mistake though they've made this game customisable for all rigs and running this on absolute max settings requires a beast of a computer in order to get a steady 60fps. You will have to tinker with the many many graphics options as well as perhaps sacrifice quality in some areas in order to get a relatively steady frame rate and hitching and dropped frames are common if your settings are too high given that there are so many diverse areas with many different levels of complex objects to render.But that being said in my opinion it's by far the best of the GTA games and it seems the most suited to PC in terms of the quality of the upgrade from console to PC versions and the sheer amount of options regarding visual fidelity available. The attention to detail is stunning and finding little things like where to shoot a vehicle to make it leak gas is so much fun. On top of this GTA Online is well populated and balanced and really really fun when you get a good team of people working together. An absolute must own.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: There isn't much to say since the title of the game speaks for itself. Basically GTA 5 is the GTA that we wanted for the next gen and the amount of things added makes it have a lot of replay especially for those who enjoy exploring and finding little easter eggs and things. I know I typically do longer reviews but for a game like this there is no need to really do one.If you enjoy GTA as a game then you will like this. The only things to keep into consideration si that the Online version where you play with other people is sometimes plagued with hackers and that is annoying. Also make sure your rig can handle this. The graphics are demanding and I can see its effects on my machine. If you can't run games like Skyrim at ultra without lag then you won't be able to handle this. Even on low the graphics while still good are demanding.Overall fun game so many things to do so many GTA things present and um yeah. Good game.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: First of all I have to say I loved the game when it came out in 2013 and I love it even more now! I played the Xbox 360 version for a while till the Xbox one came with GTA V so i had 2 copies of the game loved the detail in the next gen version! but was still waiting for the PC release! Its finally here Sadly my current build crashes a lot on the PC so I'm buying parts to Max it out and be able to play it. When the game was first released it had a lot of errors (Stuttering Crashing Low Fps etc) After 2 3 Patches everything seems to have been cleared up and it is very playable with drivers from both AMD and Nvidia. I Actually Rate this game as 9/10 because it is very different than GTA IV to mod (Somewhat). The game is fun Online and Offline (Mods) So you will never be bored of the game. If you have a console and just got a PC this would be a great game to buy! The Graphics are stunning and you do not need much VRAM (Graphics Memory to max out the game or even run it) for 720p you need around 3GB to max out the game and 850MB to run it at 1080p you need 3.5GB to max it and 1 GB to run it then at 4K it becomes hardcore 14GB to max it and i think 4 6 GB to run it. Anyway great game looks great in all resolutions Worth buying!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Do not buy this game if you intend to play offline it's the worst experience I've had so far! Not only do you have to "Go Offline" through Steam you also have to do it through the game's "Rockstar Social Club". It constantly lets me down. I played yesterday while Offline now I get up this morning didnt even reboot or connect to the internet (Nothing changed in my pc status) yet the game wont launch. Seriously? I'd get a refund but it's too late for that now!To add insult to injury YOU HAVE to create a "Social Club" account to access the game and you constantly have to launch their "Social Club" launcher through Steam. Despicable!I've moved 99% of my business to GOG and DRM Free releases because of this twisted mentality. If you think that this practice is "common" and therefore "to be expected" you are what's wrong with the industry. Boycott your oppressors don't embrace them! Just stop!

review: It was great until they descided unilateral to ban modding. It was a fun thing to do and it could bypass some of the issues the game had. Certain lags other bugs etc. I know my account says "19 hours playes" but in reality it is more like 500 hours becaue i have this game on ps 3 and ps 4. So it used to be fun but now it isn't anymore. thanks take two!As for the online version it is utter snot. You get soooo many cheaters on it it isn't fun. It seems the only reason these cheaters are playing this is to agrivate other people getting some perverse pleasure out of it because their real life isn't worth all that much or isn't interesting enough. Thus they want to spread the hate a bit around....Now for the game itself 1) graphics ok BUT there are some nasty bugs in it that the devs havent addressed ( even though it has been reported since day one)2) great story line but a bit predictable.3) sometimes it just feels like grinding grinding and more grinding.4) fun level Not so much anymore.5) GTA online is utter guano. Ifyou want to have a MMORPG with action elements go to old republic LOTHRO or some other massive multiplayer. Either you make a fully operational MMO or a singleplay with co op not something half baked in betweenDo i recommend this game to others? In this current state seeing they devs haven't put in the effort to fix their broken game having a lot of difficulties with the bugs and the fact that they want to monetise their game more with micro transactions ( planned to be put in from what my sources say) taking away the mod oportunities etc I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND IT TO SNYONE IN THIS STATE! You want to play MMO's there are hundreds way better ones out there.You wanna play GTA game? Go for the GTA IV. You don't want to see this again? GREAT VOTE WITH YOUR WALLET AND DON'T SPEND YOUR MONEY ON GAMES LIKE THIS!

review: Let's be clear. I was NOT banned. Hell I even received a significant amount of illegal money which I personally view as making up for millions of in game $ being irreversibly squandered on things I could only describe as deliberately useless cash sink traps. But I wasn't banned. I quit for other reasons.Before we continue I will point out that the single player game is very good. It will never ever see an update because Rockstore wouldn't get a cashflow from it but if you want a solid SP game this one is pretty damn great.Reason GTA Online is trash #1 The game is deliberately balanced horrifyingly against the players in terms of time to payoff ratio. Look at my hour count. Even with that many hours I still only ranked about "Upper middle" as far as how much stuff I had compared to other players. Why? An economic system centered around getting players to buy into their shockingly expensive shark cards. Buy fake money with real money. And Rockstore has done an amazing job of making sure the things you want require ten to fifty hours of committed playtime to get them wihtout spending real money on fake money.Reason GTA Online is trash #2 Disastrously imbalanced weaponized vehicles and its only getting worse. You want to play with your freinds in relative peace? Or at the very least have a vaguely fair fight in the event someone wants to interfere? Too bad. Somone has a fliying motorcycle with front mounted homing missiles and there is little if anything you can do about it. I just fired up GTAO again for the first time in two months yesterday only to be relentlessly killed by one of these jackasses. What can you do about it? Nothing. you.Reason GTA Online is trash #3 The non free world missions are dead. Lobbies are empty. The free world missions are pretty lacking extremely repetitive and a favorite target for the jerks from reason #2.Reason GTA Online is trash #4 Cheaters. If you've been reading other reviews you already know about the cheaters. Moving on.Reason GTA Online is trash #5 Hearkens back to #1 With every new update comes out everything gets much MUCH more expensive. About two years ago an update released a car called the Warrener. It was a very regular car no batmobile bullshot cost $120 000 (Prices were already bloating at that point) Anyway a few months ago in a newer update they put out a new car that is basically the EXACT SAME car again only its a two door version and has a few race car looking liveries. The performance is about the same. This one costs well over $600 000. A new player couldn't make that much scratch in a whole 12 hour day of playtime. Holy ship guys. And thats for a basic useless car that isn't even fast.Reason GTA Online is trash #6 The free play shared world which has become the only way you can feasibly play with others online. New business option are touted like they're this big amazing thing but they aren't they're dirty math tricks. They're all reskinned versions of the first one which was terrible from the start. They cost extraordinary amounts of money to get started money you will never likely recover enough to justify. There is no winning. It's rigged against you forever. Even the businesses which can turn a viable profit take so long to do it that you will spend hundreds of hours just.... basically grinding. Every mission is shallow repetitive and either far too easy or just plain needlessly long. There is only one mission that has anything faintly resembling depth and that is Los Santos Connection in the contact missions which is among the non free world dead lobbies I mentioned earlier.I hate that I am becoming one of those people who has to regularly leave terrible negative reviews but the things these companies are doing is becoming disgusting and offensive. I've played every GTA title there is and loved them all. There is a very real possibility I won't play the next one. Rockstore has made it very clear what they have in mind for the future and I want no part of it.

review: This is purely for the Single player side of the game. I did not touch the Multiplayer because I've heard it's pretty much a giant cesspit.The Pros +Controls are pretty responsive.+Allows for seamless switching between controller and keyboard and updates actions based on that.+pretty good graphics wise+you can do all the fun GTA stuff in this game+Weasel NewsThe Neutral Don't really care for the map layout size is fine. It's just where things are and how you have to get there. Hard to keep car speed at the "speed limit." Yeah I like driving normally sometimes. Keyboard is nearly impossible controller is spotty at best.The Bad Story sucks in my opinion ending left tons of questions felt rushed. Character switching doesn't really help the game Heists seem random you plan for it and the game takes a **** all over your plan. Keybinds are easily forgettable Half the radio stations are rap/hip hop. Spice it up a bit I know it's "LA" but come on. Seems like focus is completely on Online.Honestly I much prefer GTA IV for PS3. I liked the layout better the story had better closure and there was DLC afterwards. Overall I don't really recommend this game. It...just seems...lacking..

review: The game starts very strongly and especially shines when we do our first heist and are then introduced to Trevor because Trevor is a such a strong character.However after Trevor learns the spoiler the game just disintergrates. The team constantly bickers and the plot becomes aimless. The ending of the game could've happened right at that point without having the characters go through all the trouble of catering to those who try to control them and considering just how easy the ending was the player is left wondering why the heck it wasn't done right away in the first place. It feels like the writers came up with this idea of ridiculously twisted plot and they sacrificed everything just to have those twists. The game ends with a foul aftertaste. You're happy that you don't have to endure the characters fighting with each other anymore not that the characters defeat their enemies.A lot of the missions in the game are poorly thought through and simply make you move from one map marker to another without letting you stray from the course. You do a lot of the things that don't make any sense just because the game forces you to do them. The game's controls are clunky and constantly get in the way especially when you're flying or swimming. The gun choice is inconsequential. I played the entire game with the same weapons. At the end I bought all my characters a minigun but the game actually disables it in many missions because... you're not allowed to play the game the way you want to.Another annoying thing is cars your characters are forced to drive the same beaters they were driving at the start of the game. Any new car you get you lose during missions because... you're not allowed to play the game the way you want to. After the mission you have to drive to the cop station to retrieve your last nice car but you lose it again the next mission you start. It's bloody annoying.There's great voice acting and the world is pleasantly varied. However the game seems to constantly strive to interfere with your enjoyment of those things.I wish Steam had a "meh" button as this is what this game is but lacking that choice I'm going with a "No" for recommendation.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V. Absolutely ridiculous loading times often not even loading at all. I waited half an hour multiple times with no result having to force close the game in the task manager and on the one occasion that it actually let me play it was a stuttering mess of unloaded textures with a framerate consistently below 30 fps.Another issue with GTA V is the whole Rockstar Social club . I already had an account and it did not let me connect it to my Steam account until I separately launched the RS social club and reset all details. I should mention that this account is required even for single player so the issue was unavoidable. It also added an extra few minutes to the loading times because it always said "Taking longer than usual to verify game ownership" or something along those lines.I was looking forward very much to playing this game with my friends but thanks to what seemed like endless bugs loading times and DRM t I won't be doing that in this game.

review: Disregarding all political aspects of Rockstar and Take Two.+Best City Open World Gameplay+Awesome Editor to create Cinematics+Fun online multiplayer with enough content to keep you busy for new players+Pure GTA Mayhem Long Loading Times Common Event Cancellations Respectable community but some immature players Gindfest for cash and very expensive items Frequent server/cloud errors and crashes Dull content for long time players with nothing much new to interest youThat being said it really depends on what you enjoy or the level of immersion you like with RP elements and action preferences.8/10

review: There was a time when I loved this game more than any other. So much has changed since then.Beyond the fact that I have been unable to log in since late August (It's now mid OCtober) when I could get on the hacking and modding was a nightmare. My crew and I often needed to use Net Limiter to try and keep the s away but after awhile even that didn't work. You cannot enjoy the add ons because people would rather screw up your business rather than build their own. I recommend this game to you the who loves to do nothing more than ruin everyone else's day. I recommend this game to you you masochists who love nothing more than to be hacked countless times and you you sadists who love to give the masochists exactly what they want. Someday I might actually get online again if the impotent tech support can ever get their nose out of the teir 1 support guide book where they copy and paste everything into the email they send you. Until then take my advice and spend your hard earned money elsewhere. This one is NOT worth the aggrivation.Love and Enemas to Rockstar

review: Where can I start? Probably one of the most greedy games of all times it live up to the "Los Santos" culture and ignorance. The game by itself is fine fun and addictive but what really it up is the way Rockstart have decided to handle everything just to play the game. The single player of the game for example is not even called "single player" but "Story mode" this may seem like nothing to you but the point is that they pretty much haven't changed the single player since release while they keep updating the online with overpriced vehicles houses bunkers and more trying to force people to spend money on the game or grind for 100 hours just to buy the "good stuff" and did I say this things are only available online? Yes online because everything in the game require's online even if you want to play single player have a slow connection? Well I have bad news for you but you may not be able to play the game at all because you're forced to sign in to Rockstart social club just to play. The game by itself is good everything else isn't.

review: Playing this game since day one on the 360 I can say that this was one of my favorite games the story was fun to play and interesting.I would reccomend this game for its single player 100% But for online it's a little different.Playing online back in the old days was fun everything was fairly priced and atleast achievable by new players now adays everything is in the millions range Starting this game on pc as a level 1 with nothing and getting all the way back up there is a absoulute grind not saying that its bad but it get's a bit repetitive.You could sit there grinding all day while someone can go out and buy a shark card or the new bundle.I understand that buisness and game developers need money but come on 100 for 8 Million Dollars!?Thats a absoulte rip off regarding the prices of everything now a days. I haven't had many expirence with modders so i'm a bit bias on this but I haven't seen any modders at all in all my hours of online so far maybe i'm just lucky.To sum it up The single player is great i would reccomend it but the online mode... Eh It's fun for a little bit but then you realize how much you have to do to catch up with everyone. If you don't agree with something I said tell me. I love constructive criticism I know I made some grammar and spelling errors so grammar nazis be easy on me.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The single player story is great and everyone should enjoy it.But the online component of the game is 98% of the content and unless you're willing to shell out literall hundreds of dollars on shark cards the grind in this game is terrible. There is no joy in the grind the missions avalible are a chore every thing you do outside of a mission or race is draining money like you'd never belive. Just loitering in free roam will cost you some amount of cash every in game day depending not how many and how big each of your garages or houses are. You can not sell a house you no longer use you can only replace it with a smaller one which will drain less money over time. I only play for the online racing and that is a chore as well unless you shell out a few million every time they add a new car you will not stand a chance. That's not to meantion all the trolls and hackers who will ram and intterupt the race just for the lulz. The online community is pure toxic hate you can't go for a bicycle ride without being gunned down by some pay to win kiddo in a super tank thing. The lovely world the original devs have created have been completely ignored with the commedically over powered weaponiezed everything with everyone with rocket launchers and explosive round guns. This game is a toxic mess. If you have to have it buy it on sale Rockstar does not deserve any money off of this penny pinching greedy fingired company's money vaccume.

review: The Good Excellent story mode Seemless swap between first and third person Online has its moments (seeing a big payday playing with a decent team)The Bad Inflated prices online for everything Unbalanced online play Long loading timesThe Ugly Pay to win microtransactions Faulty anti cheat system and incompetent support C&amp D orders for mod makers no single player modsThere are two parts to this game GTAV and GTAOnline. GTAV consists of the single player story with Franklin Michel and Trevor with their adventures in Los Santos and Blane County and is an excellent game. It works if you want a open world crime sandbox this is a great choice. I can ONLY recommend the game if you just want the single player.HOWEVER the biggest problem with this product is the part Rockstar have been devoting all their time to GTAOnline an interesting idea that almost works but the developers have utterly ruined.First off the economy is weighted in favor of purchacing Shark Cards the microtransactions everything is overly expencive. Add on that most things can be purchaced regardless of level if you can affoard the Shark Cards you can start with jet bikes tanks super cars and the best properties around it's pay to win at its worst.Next Rockstar forces players to depend on their anti cheat which on one hand fails to get rid of cheaters and on the other bans innocent players whom these cheaters have screwed with. Rockstar also fails to give any form of appeals system or any chance to recover your account once banned once you get the boot you could only buy the game again.And lastly Rockstar and their parent company Take Two Interactive have entirely shut down the modding scene for GTA as in all of them declairing GTA modding illegal. This includes single player GTAV which would be a very sketchy move in the best of times right now it shows how greedy they are. As far as I understand the matter anyway it seems they (being Rockstar and Take Two ) know how lucrative the Shark Cards are and they don't want anything infringing on that. To them any player having fun with mods on their own is a player who isn't spending money on cards. There is also talk about how Take Two want to have microtransactions in all of their future games but I can't cite this rather I'm too lazy right now.Ether way this paints a very bleak picture for the future of the gaming industry but that isn't relevent to this review. At the end of it get it for the single player and don't touch the online. If Rockstar and Take Two's caustic business practices don't turn you off then the mostly caustic players will. It is kinda to be expected GTA games have always been about toying with the helpless NPCs so given the chance to do so to actual people the expected result of course happened. But if you have some friends then it may be fun but I wouldn't get invested.I do suggest you take a look in to all the controversy Rockstar and Take Two are stiring up regardless of if you decide to get the game or not you know what they say about trainwrecks.TL DR Read the points at the top you nancy that's what they're for!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: garbage in general starting form the very beginning. your thrown into a situation where somebody is introduced then killed 15 minutes later as if you had formed some sort of bond before this the tutorial itself never mentions half the keybinds for doing things (ie jumping to cover) instead you have to pause the game and take a read in the tab menu. im all for getting people to read to figure out quests but this isnt a puzzle in some demonic crypt abandoned long ago this is the damn tutorial.shortly after this cover fiasco the game transitions into a very linear corridor shooter dont let the openness of the map fool you if you take two steps in the wrong direction the mission instantly fails. after fighting theough a few waves of cops you seize a car and it controls like its on an ice skating rink this may have been fine in this particular area as it was snowy and roads may have iced over but all the cars in the entire game control like this its as if friction doesnt exist anymore.then a cutscene plays the dude with a beard starts acting crazy pulls out his gun as swarms of cop cars come from all directions you think "oh finally excitement" and shoot three after which another cutscene starts and ends.the game then transitions over to a black player charechter this is fine the problem is his only defining trait seems to be that he says slurs non stop and generally cusses rather than having any interesting linesits also at about this point you notice this character's friend's voice acting seems to have been recorded on a ds in a cave that is to say the voice quality is garbage. your told to race him but the objective is on his car and not at a destination so you have no damn clue where to go. eventually i finished this and roamed around a little even with max settings and population density/diversity the world was emptier then this games soul.at about this point i stopped playing so that i could still get a refundavoid this game it is a steaming pile of trash. spend your money somewhere better go buy a present or something.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: tl dr Fun game with the same old GTA pitfalls polished to a mirror sheen this time. Online is 100% hot garbage unless played with friends in private sessions.GTA 5 Single Player+ Great set pieces+ Fun mechanics (driving shooting movement is all real solid)+ One of the most "alive" worlds I've seen in a video game+ First person mode is fun and is more than just attaching the camera to the face+ Acting is spot on! Writing is real spotty sometimes right on the nose other times just offensive (and not in any way that could be construed as "smart") Big game in all meanings of the word. Huge download bad performance. 45 minutes unskippable ending creditsGTA 5 Multiplayer+ Fun with friends really fun with friends!+ VOIP Absolutely 100% hot garbage on the sidewalk in summer when playing in public servers. 100% chance you'll be running into numerous hackers and exploiters in Free Play and in missions. This really does ruin the entire online experience and Rockstar has no intention of making it any better.
