review: This Game is probably the greatest game I have ever played in my life. It keeps you coming back for more and the new updates get lots of hype and never disappoint. I have lots of fun both online and offline. The only problem I have with this game is online is to much of a grind and a cash grab. If you don t have any real world money to spend on gta you cannot get anything new and you would have to spend hours grinding for cash. People who can spend money just sail right through everything. anytime something new arrives they can just buy it while regular players have to spend months or days. Aside from that this game is very good. I would give it a 9/10 if I was a critic and that is what most critics gave it. This game feels very real and that is why players keep coming back for more fun.

review: My grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him "if you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate you have to stop immediately." Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28 I have never touched a cigarette. I must say I feel a very slight sense of regret never having done it because this ing game gave me cancer anyways....
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Tl Dr Same old story of Singleplayer mode being great and GTAO being wackGTAO is hands down either the worst online multiplayer game (from technical not gameplay standpoint) or it is an alpha/beta stage game in disguise here's why (+ some other nuisances) 1. Sharkcards (ding!)2. Can get stuck during shoppingMost likely being caused by online service being temporarily down. Still for an AAA Rockstar game that's indie level game issues.3. People leaving during heistsPerhaps trolls but most likely victims of GTAO general connectivity issues which apparently will never get sorted out. Never. Truly a horrible practise. Apparently Rockstar doesn't know how it is to play with random people. No activity should end due to some player leaving the game. If the activity will prove too difficult/lame without the players who have left then the rest of players will decide by themselves whether they want to stay or not... But yeah let's keep slowing player's progress boyos. Gotta sell them Scamcards! 4. People can get stuck during heist setupsEspecially at the end cutscene of Pacific Standard Job forcing people to quit which MAY not reward the player. Happened to one of my buddy during the 12 000 000 challenge. Fortunately we've sorted it out by replaying PSJ which was the best thing we could have done...5. Strong emphasis on realism sacrifice of fun of certain elements.It's apparent that Rockstar wants to make GTA games seem realistic and that's generally not a bad thing but in Online it gets really tiresome fast.This also results in sluggish character movement Not actually speaking about the speed at which your character moves but all the "realistic" events like turning around climbing climbing ladders etc. Me no likey this in Online at all.Entering a narrow spaces like a doorway does prove difficult at times especially when turning around is involved.6. civilian AIThe highly unrealistic driving experience AI drivers provide is nowhere as bad as in this GTA instalment. NPCs' mind turns to the one of a scared deer upon gunshot. This results in NPCs running into everything even doing U turns to follow their threat (instead of escaping it duh). Undoubtedly a game mechanic for making player's life harder but a really stupid looking one.7. Inventory messThere is too many guns that act very much the same (ARs pistols SMGs in particular) which only makes a huge mess in inventory. This can be sorted out by having a. CEO officeb. A Gunlocker...which would cost roughly GTAO$ 1.500.000 and doesn't seem to work in Missions and Heists.8. NPC immunity to headshots after being bodyshotOnce you bodyshot an NPC headshot damage no one shot kills them. If they hide behind an obstacle it may take even a minute to kill someone. Have I mentioned this game is slow?9. Broken progress trackingManaged to accomplish Criminal Mastermind challenge twice but received $10 000 000 instead of $12 000 000. The reason behind this is (according to the game) that I haven't done All in Order and Loyalty challenges which is IMPOSSIBLE TO MISS while attempting Criminal Mastermind. Out of all people I've managed to accomplish the challenge with only I was met with yet another of Noobstar's result of incompetent programming for their ever broken online service. They're like DarkSydePhil of programming "There was nothing we could do"10. Long loading timesStarting the game joining online joining most of majority online activities cutscenes... and eventually some stupid glitch prolonging even more. Have I mentioned this game is slow as ?11. Soon after finishing a heist setup an online error occurred which put me back to singleplayer. On top of that I was no longer able to open main menu resulting in qutting and wasting time on loading even more. Happened once though.12. Unnecessary AFK counter in certain activitiesThat's an ok practise in particular activities but why in freemode and activities done solo? Also why kicking from online is even faster when one minimizes the game?13. Unexplainable temporary game freezing during online (lasting 1 5 secs up to a minute). Supposedly caused by having custom soundtracks but I've learned that's not actually the case. The game runs at 80 100 fps for me so it is not an performance issue. It's just programming again. No other game I own has such a thing not even a GTA game not even GTA4/ELFC which supposedly runs on the same/similar game engine.14. Heists are randomly unavailableSometimes when you want to launch a heist as a leader you simply can't. Either join somebody's heist or restart the darn game AGAIN. Happened numerous times for me and my buddies.15. Cargobob may drop a carried tank (usually when a player is inside it) during resupply missions in Gunrunning which may result in failure.16. Lazy attempt at saving GTAO from cheaters by shutting down OpenIV. Fortunately TakeTwoMiddleFingerUpTheAss and OpenIV devs came to some sort of agreement which is a ing miracle.17. Joining GTAO directly instead of going into singleplayer first takes much much longer to load. Personally it never loaded into GTAO for me. Gotta take the longer path but longer path also means a longer path to Scamcards. Rock$tar you better fix this.18. During Pacific Standard Job finale the job randomly fails right upon entering the bank quite often. Not a biggie but it still delays stuff and simply shouldn't be present by now.19. All Cunning Stunt vehicles performance has been lowered significantly in order for Fraudstar to sell whatever new is added which after a while will be nerfed once again (obviously) to sell newer models. What a shameless dishonest practise you got there Jewstar. Granted you want people to pay the full game price + 15 euro for $GTAO 8 000 000 this shouldn't be surprising to anyone. 20. Entering warehouse while requesting your personal car won't be delivered however the cooldown will still apply. Not a biggie. You just gotta wait. Did I mentioned this game tries to be the slowest AAA action game on the market?21. Sometimes NPCs armed with assault rifles can occasionally shoot in bursts with much increased rate of fire usually resulting in cheap deaths if not behind a cover. Homage to cheaters? Perhaps...22. During Import/Export if your game will hang for mere seconds your car that is being imported to the warehouse may simply go off for no reason at all. Oh I know why to hinder player's progress that's why... Happened twice so far23. GTAO service may be down for a moment which is something that has right to happen. What shouldn't happen is the money player is earning that moment that MAY be completely void. Happened twice during car export. $GTAO 160 000 down the . This is an equivalent of one day of work and all you get at the end is a middle finger.24. Ruiner 2000 can't be used in Missions and Heists but a more lethal Weaponized Tampa can. Unexplainable.25. Whatever Rockstar's result of incompetence will show as next. Stay tuned for more.Conclusion It all points out toward the fact that Rockstar is either highly incompetent when it comes to online games or GTAO is at alpha/beta stage of development. There's no other reasonable explanation for this. And they expect people to buy Scamcards for online quality this pathetic? Seriously. Cease the idea of including multiplayer in your games and stick to what you guys truly prow at. If people want online they will make one themselves. Look at SAMP MTA or even FiveM which all provide a complete freedom unlike your grindy embarrassing mess. Ever wondered why people tend to cheat $GTAO? Because GTAO's premise was a mistake from the very start...I shouldn't really have given this review a negative review since it's "roughly half of the content" that blows so so much but the level of ttery present in it is in inacceptable level.

review: This game has some serious issues with the online. You're forced to be in an open session with a bunch of idiots if you want to earn some money and a fair amount of those idiots are PayToWin. So in order to make money you have to try to avoid people who spent actual money to get items to with people trying to grind up money in a long and not so fun way. Rockstar keeps adding more and more crazy to the only online. That's good but the fact that akmost every new item always costs somewhere above one million is insane and just plain stupid. Not to mention the horrible ceo work. Go fetch this package far at sea while getting shot at by a helicopter while you're trying to fetch just one package so you can go put that in your storage. Then sit through two loading screens as you need to go both in and out of the storage. Then go do the same with the other packages but beware there might be a flying delorean out to get you because some PayToWin doesn't have anything better to do. Won't be starting up this game again or use any more money on it.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is a sequel to the masterpiece known as Shaq Fu for the Sega Genesis and Super NES in 1994. It expanded on the wonderlustful gameplay of the original and has added wonderful additions to the combat system such as the contriversal L button targetting system originating from the Zelda video game series. I especially love the new gamemodes such as the turn based strategy sections of the game that give me fond callbacks of the Fire emblem series or the puzzle game sections reminicient of Huniepop for the Vitual Boy. And man the online mode for GTA5 is without a doubt the best online that has ever existed in a video game not including the online mode for Matrix Online because of its godlike exclusive tier in the brilliance of server technology. The story mode of Grand Theft Auto V is lacking in areas and i feel could have touched more on the size of franklins massive dong however i feel that because of the lack of such the game stops itself from being a 10/10.8/10 needs more franklin dong

review: Rockstar Games has had a successful Grand Theft Auto franchise for over a decade. With the release of Grand Theft Auto V the franchise became an international phenomena. Featuring Online play Heists and the most ambitious storyline/gameplay experience yet Grand Theft Auto V has shattered all expectations and raised the bar for the future of the series.In Grand Theft Auto V you play as several different characters transferring between them to accomplish various tasks. Each Character has their own storyline side quests and contribution to the over arching story within Grand Theft Auto V. Familiar features such as Flying Lung Capacity Stamina Strength Driving Skill all make a return requiring you to manage each characters individual traits. Heists are performed using a combination of player characters whom you switch between for various tasks within the Heist as well as an NPC Crew you must select based on their skill and/or share of the profit their assistance will cost. An Active stock market manipulated through various side quests will grow your bank and let you live in the lap of luxury.Grand Theft Auto V also had a complete online setup allowing players to create their own Avatars who can do Missions Heists and Challenges with other online players. Owning Property vehicles and more allows players to customize their Grand Theft Auto Online experience and while there occasional problems with other players online using cheats/hacks the overall experience can be enjoyable. Even 2 years after it's release Grand Theft Auto V is still a fun dynamic game offering hours of enjoyable gameplay. For those who wish to experience 100% completion you will find the sheer amount of content to be more than adequate. If you haven't played this Grand Theft Auto V you haven't fully experienced the Grand Theft Auto Franchise to it's full potential.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

Even new players are getting banned so I suggest you don't buy this game yet and wait for Rockstar to fix that. (Unless you're looking for singleplayer).7 GTA 5 has thousands of mods available all around the internet so it's a great game if you're looking to play modded singleplayer.So after all if you're looking for singleplayer you'll enjoy this game a lot. If you're looking to play online it's better to have some friends to play with.

review: All Rockstar and Take Two care about is getting into your wallet. As a veteran of this game being Suspended once and having my Level 130 Character Office MC Garages Properties Etc. wiped thanks to Hackers and Online Modders once due to no fault of my own and having to build one back up all over again once this game really isn't all that fun to play anymore. Recently since the update all the MCs are buggy and you WILL LOSE your product if you sell due to some random game glitch or session error or the like. Import Export will also give you issues when trying to sell getting stuck and forcing you to close the game. The Game Randomly Crashes a lot also. Coupled with the fact that they at any time can do as they please without you having any recourse just goes to show how much they care about the players. Open up a ticket in support and they will tell you to restart your connection or provide a video of the already occurred issue. Or better yet waste your time again to satisfy them that the problem is with the game only for them to say we are looking into the issue further as a result and never contact you back secretly closing the ticket. I have lost personal vehicles product items etc. and if you dare ask them for compensation their response is we need a verified loss Really? This was the last straw GREED is what Rockstar and Take Two are all about I am done with them and any future games.UPDATE 7/11/17 So it turns out the MC missions glitch is acutally a failure of Rockstar Quality Control when they released this new DLC update. Apparently its received the name Paleto Bay Triangle. Check it out on YouTube. Don't pass this area if you are doing a sale or you will loose a portion or even all of your product being sold as I have twice.Something New I sucessfully completed the Storm Drain time trial with the Drag Bike and never got the award. Opened up a ticket and their response was typical we were unable to verify the claim and closed the ticket. A Big Shout out To Rockstar Support For their Terrible Support.In time i will post up all of my Rockstar Failures. This game is absolutely Terrrible now. Don't say I didn't warn you about wasting your time and money on it. I will say at one point in time this game was acceptable but it seems that time is long gone.

review: I wasn't going to follow in the trend of leaving a negative review on behalf of OpenIV. In fact but I've found more reason to dislike Take Two. This began when Take Two announced that they thought GTA 5 was undermonetised. Anyone who has visited the store page can tell this is false and anyone who has played knows this is outrageous. It pisses me off more than it should because the existing (and extreme) monetisation is for GTA Online which is why I haven't seen story mode updates that I've been wishing for since Day 1. On top of this the game is four years old and is still generating income from the current monetisation which is of course orchestrated with their outrageous pricing and constant introduction of even more expensive content. To declare this undermonetisation is ridiculous. Skyrim is only two years older than GTA 5. I guarantee Take Two has received more money from the current monetisation than Bethesda has seen from the Special Edition or any sales in a while for that matter. Now is this the result of greed or just a stupid person in a position to make decisions? I got my answer when Take Two attacked OpenIV. There is no possible way an intelligent person would make such an advance on the very community that generates the constant flow of income. And so maybe when Take Two notices the drop in sales they will realise that this will not just blow over. But even when that happens I'm not going to forgive Take Two.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 9lztUvZHlsEJust like most people on the planet I really like GTA 5 and not only because it happens to be an incredibly fun video game. No Grand Theft Auto 5 is more than that it is a game which creates a huge expansive open world for the player to explore a game that is both funny enjoyable and excruciatingly brutal. A game which manages to be an amazingly entertaining parody of not only other games but also movies consumerism social media conflicting ideologies government and much more. Grand Theft Auto 5 is not just a video game. No. This is the single greatest parody of modern day America found within the interactive medium. And as of now it is finally available in its most definitive form. My original written review is apparently too long for Steam so here is a breakdown +Huge beautiful open world +First person mode adds to the immersion +Generally good PC port+Superb missions +Brilliant satirical humour +The world is your playground +Enormous amount of content +Simply put it's really f*****g fun Online bugs and glitches No proximity voice chat Long loading times Narrow FOV (also Rockstar seems to ban people using FOV mods)

review: I'll continue to play this game off and on but I can't recommend it to new players because their "free" DLC is about as free as Cheez Its are made of real cheese.I'll explain the microtransaction problem using their Gunrunner's DLC...To participate in gunrunners you need to buy a bunker (starts at $1.16mil). This will let you sell guns and unlock parts for the other DLC in the set. However they've come up with a new discount mechanic where if you do the gunrunning missions you get a $500k $1mil price break on the vehicles (which seems nice until you realize the new vehidles are $500k $1mil more expensive than previous dlc). Except to do those missions you'll need a moblie operations center which is another $1.25mil. Oh and if you want to actually use any of the extra unlocks you've been researching expect to pay another $995k for the weapon+vehicle workshop (you could pay just $245k for the weapon workshop but then you'd lose out on half the unlocks).All told it's a minimum $3.41mil to get up and running with the DLC and that's before you've bought any of the new weapons or vehicles. Now while you *could* grind for in game cash that usually averages around $200k/hr so you're looking at 17hrs of grinding (this assumes you're stuck in public lobbies. the only way to get those numbers up without cheating is to find a gang that only does missions). Orrr you could get a whale shark card for USD$49.99 that (conveniently) gets you $3.5mil. Is that worth it? Well even if you make minimum wage ($7.25 in the US) you'd still gross $123.25 in 17hrs so technically yes. Then again the game itself is $59.99 so you're also practially buying the game all over again.At any rate now that you've gotten it all setup here's where the real kicking begins. Even after doing the missions and getting the discounts you're still looking at $800k to $2.6mil EACH to buy the new vehicles and that doesn't include any of their upgrades. Not only that but you only get the discount if you started the mission. Did the mission as an associate? Too bad. You've got to pony up the bunker money and run the mission again yourself. Oh any don't expect a heist style payout either. These missions pay the same $10 $20k as as any other mission. (and one more little poke in the eye is that the bunker's daily maintenance fee is over $9k.)Unfortunately their newest Smuggler's Run dlc is shaping up to be the exact same thing and I don't expect them to move away from this model going forward. The finance and felony dlc started the trend with adding ceos then the import/export and biker dlcs each expanded on it with the need for buying new separate bases to access new dlc features and now with "discount" vehicle prices the push for microtransactions is getting worse and worse.When you add this to the fact that hacking is still rampant and the public lobbies are like walking face first into a hornet's nest the time you have to invest just isn't worth it. It's a shame because the game is a hell of a lot of fun to play when it's not comlpletely ing you over.

review: If your looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place but if your looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients 1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter2. 1/2 cup white sugar3. 1/2 cup brown sugar4. 1/4 cup water5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon6. 1 pinch salt7. 5 apples peeled cored and sliced8. 1 pastry for double crust pie Directions 1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).2. Combine butter white sugar brown sugar water cinnamon and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil remove from heat and set aside.3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9 inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate pour in apple slices.4. Roll out top crust into a 10 inch circle. Cut into 8 (1 inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips one at a time into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.5. Pour butter sugar mixture over top of pie coating the lattice and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the crust is golden brown the caramel on the top crust is set and the apple filling is bubbling 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

review: Product received for free. GTA V is a child of a society of pop culture and the popular media. And Rockstar knows about all kinds of pop culture. And with their budget and the massive franchise that is GTA they've given themselves a real wide pallette to play with. It's all over this game. There are moments of greatness and even beauty in this game and then some of it is the same old same old. But the game really really really is fun. Rockstar are trying to raise the bar. No one's near what they are doing other open world games aren't even on the same planet.People look at this game as a kind of playground and yeah that's right. But playing it feels like more. Take the first open world mission you steal a car drive it to a parking lot the same old. You get in the car drive forward and the sense of open world freedom is familiar. But while you drive towards that lot you look around and see a world which truly does feel alive. Such an enormous amount of work went into creating the game's environment. Each street is alive.Actually that first drive is only a taste. Los Santos is like an actual city teeming with detail the world feels real. This is not like other open worlds lifeless and lazy.Very often the crowd of people forming outside a building will make you wonder what's going on inside. You walk through a shopping street and suddenly you're biking in Vinewood Hills. Then night comes and the game feels new and absolutely incredible. That's design that's effort Rockstar seriously polished this world beyond any other world I've seen so far in games. Each district feels different and each building has a place. Each house road even ing lampposts are meticulously crafted. That's what I call an open "world"."Look here go there come here look around". That's all over this game. And then flying a helicopter as high as you can just to see what happens then jumping out for the first time all of Los Santos thousands of yards beneath you it's devastating. Absolutely majestic.It's as great a playground as any.I have never thought of games as stories some games can be story focused some are about setting high scores gaming is a medium not a scripture. When I played Uncharted 2 I was impressed by the set pieces and couldn't put it down. I thought of it like a type of movie/game hybrid. GTA has a story behind it and the 3 characters are brought to life yes. There are some moments that make you laugh some spectacular ones too. But make no mistake the star of this game is the world.That explains the simple gameplay. Ammo is plentiful guns are easy to aim and everything feels easy crisp and effortless. It's well designed and never challenging. Rockstar didn't make this game to challenge. I think of it like "let's just create an amazing living world and give players freedom. They can do whatever they want and we'll make it easy for them". Everything from the ground up feels simple and intuitive I was never puzzled or frustrated with game mechanics for a second. Everything Rockstar made in this game feels like they did it because it's what they do and they love it.Many of the side missions seem like the same old BS. Maybe because they were tacked on who knows. But it's the game behind it the craft. Usually the side missions I like are funny and some are very funny here. Although there are the obligatory filler missions which make you feel like an errand boy but they have nothing to do with me. You can brush them over when the world's this well made.Gameplay wise Rockstar nails it beyond belief with the driving. Arcadey enough for the casual gamer to like there's enough depth and realism in the way every vehicle feels to keep players wanting to try different ones. Often I would see a car which I wanted to try driving or a plane which I would want to fly just to see how it "felt". It literally is addictive. It's gameplay in it's simplest most endearing form just overwhelmingly playable. I drove with no destination for hours and hours. (A side note here the Stinger GT sometimes makes me want to fire up the game only to drive it around just the way it handles is gold).At so many points in this game something happens and grabs your attention. And I mean grabs. Rockstar has to know that why else would they do it? They aren't just churning out installments in the "GTA franchise" but they don't care. There's a love and a craft behind this game which could be precious and pretentious but instead Rockstar just aimed for quality.And sometimes you wish every game had this much freedom. I've never played a game like it I've played a lot games which try to do it but no way it just comes out lazy and dead. GTAV is there. It's like the mission where Michael goes for a bike ride with his son on the beach it's like look out this beach feels alive. The graphics aren't great but functional. You could make a beautiful beach with amazing graphics but what makes it feel alive is how the NPCs move act what they're doing a set of shopfronts which wouldn't look out of place in LA and Rockstar knew that and prioritised it. They obviously spent their budget in the right places the parts which aren't as flashy but on a deeper level are more important. It's still GTA it's still a game and that's what makes Rockstar's titles great. If you like games play what they've made. Majestic and captivating.

review: Single player is great but forget about even trying to enjoy multiplayer. GTA V single player takes the formula they've had since GTA III and fleshes it out with better graphics storytelling and gameplay. If you're looking for this type of solo experience and will be satisfied with just that go ahead and get it.HOWEVER if you are considering for the online aspect don't buy. Here are just a few of the issues that make it a terrible idea Toxic online community Rampant and unchecked cheating / modding to the point where modders have openly admitted during gameplay they were cheating and said there was nothing anyone could do about it even threatening to report a player who called them out on it and get them banned instead Griefers and trolls in every form imaginable No real storyline to speak of Not enough willing players for missions Customer support that only exists to give you the middle finger Greedy company that promises to stop online support as soon as it's not as disgustingly profitable as it is now Delayed (or cancelled?) DLC in favor of "double $ &amp RP" events that get players doing the same boring races over and over Rules that actively support unfair advantages like using custom cars in racesThere have been brief enjoyable experiences in the online portion but nothing even close to what it should be and easily could be if R* spent as much time making the community better as they do promoting pointless new cars to buy.TL DR Buy for single player only. Multiplayer full of cheaters trolls and griefers.

review: Not recommended not because this is not a good game but ths is NOT a good GTA game. GTA V is a brilliant open world game but somewhere in the amazing graphics it lacks the spirit of grand theft auto. Note I only play single player.1.The missions feel the same. It did not provide the feeling of apprehension at the beginning and neither any form of satisfaction at the end. Secondly it lacked variety. While playing this game i was remembering all the unique missions from san andreas vice city and gta IV and thinking where are all those missions.2. Though the three characer switching was innovative and i did enjoy each of their storyline but I did not feel attached to any of the characters since i was not playing with any of them for long.3. The game lacked a sense of progression. I believe this is the biggest flaw in the game maybe because of the above mentioned problem.I wanted to like this game so bad but was left deeply sad and underwhelmed. I have been waiting for this game on PC since i do not play on consoles. After reading all the overwhelmingly positive reviews I am left shocked. How did people find this so good.This is a very good game if it did not have GTA on it. Maybe its just me. I just feel so sad after playing the game. My apologies.

Cheaters only get banned because they don't want to see their income dropping from overprice 'sharkcards' Their whole business model is a scandal Automated messages on questions at supportWhat have they been doing for the PC release after the console versions were already released?The late release was probably only to sell more console versions and hype up the PC relase with all the teasers they showed.Disappointing experience as a GTA fan.

review: GTA V is an alright game at first it seems almost limitless the first time you get to do heists and stuff it's loads of fun don't get me wrong but to get almost anything you want in the game it's nothing but grinding that will get you burned out really fast I chose simply not to play anymore since I have pretty much everything I wanted in the game. They would have to change a lot in GTA VI for me to play it whenever it comes out but until then no more GTA V for me. I guess while i'm writing a review ontop of that the community is super cancerous but that's with most games with a lot of players. You're forced to play with other people and with a lot of missions you have to move crates or planes you sink money into that can be potentially blow up there's a way to disconnect your internet when loading into a session that puts you in a "private public" session where you can still do missions and not worry about people blowing up your sh!t but other than doing that you're probably going to have a bad time.If you want this short and simple Pros Amazing Graphics Can be fun fighting other people Good car customization you can make some pretty sick rides. Cons The game is a grind fest and you can get burned out fast Toxic community lots of hackers Money can potentially be dropped on you by hackers when you don't want it and you can get suspended and lose your character progress Money sinks can be blown up by other characters easily

review: Arguably the best PC port rockstar has done. It runs surprisingly well.. and I'm on a laptop. Occasional frame drops during cut scenes but other than that mostly smooth frame rate. Driving with a mouse and keyboard feels fine and somewhat weighted minus sports cars. Gamepad recommended for aircraft. The FOV for FPS mode requires a gander at but I wouldn't recommend it if you are susceptible to nausea or motion sickness.Overall a solid port minus low res textures during FPS mode. This is arguably the BEST in the franchise.

review: I had this day 1 release for xbox 360 and was there for day 1 release of GTA Online back then I had a lot of fun playing it but now on pc I have a ton. Yes there maybe hackers on lobbies but whilst they do f up all the stuff on the server if you got friends you can go into private games honestly I've only recently got this but everything has been amazingly fun and worth the money I fear that I will spend far too much time on this game but it's a fear I'm willing to accept.Singleplayer is just damn straight fun and if you've completed it on console no need to mope about how you got to "re do all the campaign" there are save files out there which are like 98.83% complete and all you have to do is do 1 easy stunt jump to get 100% it's really damn simple! Modding singleplayer is just insane.. I thought it would be a little "meh" and somewhat fun but after spending 90% of my singleplayer game time just messing round with mods I've found so much fun in them however I do still enjoy just being a taxi driver.. It's rather sad.Multiplayer is just far too much fun if you got friends then time flies! 2 of my friends made new characters (I ported mine from xbox) and honestly it has taken them very little time to get the money they need for a high end house and a few other things Heisting is so much fun it's honestly worth trying it out it's even more of a blast with friends however just becareful.. some of your "friends" will turn out to be thieves and take most of the money from heists! But hey.. that's just Grand Theft Auto for you. The recent patch has caused a lot of bugs but putting them a side it's been extremely fun playing on PC and honestly this PC port is just damn amazing I'm still breath taken by the damn puddles.. also to add the controls aren't as bad as I thought they would've been I thought it would be clunky and stupid to try but honestly? It's simple and fun my only problem is flying.. You have to use Numpad 8 5 4 and 6 to pitch the plane / helicopter.. which is a little annoying but honestly.. the rest of this game just makes me over look it when playing if you got friends this is a great game if you want to make friends of be a trolly person going round shooting everyone multiplayer is the damn way to go or just do it all in one. )
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTAV is still a very fun game online is great fun as well (minus the absurdly priced shark cards).Although the singleplayer hasn't been updated it's still fun to play to this da (Especially with mods).Online has lots of fun activities to participate with friends. review: The most brilliant downfall of a triple A title I've seen in quite some time Take Two made a huge mistake threatening law suits against those creating mods for the single player experience and one can only assume that the monkey who made this decision has very little to do with the creation and development of anything under him and is most certainly "just a businessman." Rockstar did try to diffuse the situation and has gotten Take Two to agree that it "generally will not take legal action against third party projects involving Rockstar s PC games that are single player non commercial and respect the intellectual property (IP) rights of third parties " but it's far too late and the damage is well said and done.What a shame I can no longer in good faith recommend this game to anyone (not that there isn't anyone left who hasn't played the thing). Moving forward best we can hope for is less involvement from Take Two in future Rockstar games.

review: This game is essentially Pay to Play.If you want this game for the story Go For It! The lore is vast and the story is amazing. Complete with 69 story missions (yes it is actually 69..)The graphics are beautiful they run smooth and they look amazing.But the Online portion of the game is sometimes unsatisfying.There can be connection issues for instance several people in one server (session) could leave not because they want to but because the servers sometimes are wonky.And the Online portion of the game also boasts with hundreds of things to buy.. from apartments to forclosures to cars to guns to offices to bikes to FLYING CARS litterally.This game has Micro Transactions. These micro transactions are called "Shark cards" these cards can give you in game money for real money although this game might be playable without buying any it is hard to do so.I have had this game on a last generation console before it was released for pc before shark cards where a thing and when the shark cards where released i find it hard not to pay up cash in real life to get that dream car i always wanted or to buy that Drug manufacturing place i always wanted or that garage that can store 50+ cars.I do reccomend this game but if you hate micro transactions good luck having to play Gta Online!
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The negative reviews are mostly complaints about Online and they do make valid points but if you're considering not buying the game because of the reviews about Online please do know that you can create private sessions to play with friends.The Main Story // Single Player"When a young street hustler a retired bank robber and a terrifying psychopath find themselves entangled with some of the most frightening and deranged elements of the criminal underworld the U.S. government and the entertainment industry they must pull off a series of dangerous heists to survive in a ruthless city in which they can trust nobody least of all each other."What the main story has to offer + 69 Unique Missions (actually 79 but they used 69 to make the lame 69 reference) which is around 30 40 hours of gameplay+ Strangers &amp Freaks+ Heists+ Many Easter Eggs and References+ Amazingly directed+ Humorous and amusing+ Great voice acting+ Trevor PhilipsGameplay (Single Player and Online)The Gameplay has greatly improved from the past games adding some nice new features but sadly also removing some nice features.+ A beautiful immersive open world to explore.+ A much less complicated driving system compared to GTA 4's+ Optional First Person View you can use for a whole new experience+ Nice Vehicle Customization+ Great Character Customization+ Realistic character movement+ Great Physics They completely removed Euphoria Lack of interior+ A vast range of activities you can do in the game+ Many vehicles and weapons Lack of fighting styles.+ You can talk to pedestrians and cops (Single Player) The missions aren't really that hard Rude cops Crappy AI most of them just walk away or even call the cops on you for standing next to them or staring at them You can't really shape your Online character+ Strip Club in which you can look at uncensored female nipples+ Cool Transition when you switch characters (Single Player)+ Plug and Play controller support. You can literally plug your controller in and instantly play the game with it.Graphics and Performance+ Great Graphics+ Supports 4K resolution in 60 fps+ I wasn't really expecting my PC to run this game well as it's a next generation game but suprisingly enough it did. A few graphical errors Misleading Minimum Requirements you need atleast 6 GB of RAM in order to make sure that this game runs smoothlyOnlineOnline is basically the multiplayer mode of GTA V and is also the reason why most people are buying the game though if you're planning to play the game only for its Online mode you should really consider playing Single Player too.+ It's fun messing around with people in free roam+ 4 game modes Missions Heists Versus Races and Adversary Modes (excluding Freemode events and VIP Work since they're both in free roam) Repetitive missions+ Adversary Modes has a variety of different PvP modes which are all enjoyable It's full of Hackers who ruin the game. They strip your weapons money and kill you. There are some nice hackers out there who give you free money but where's the fun in that? Online servers occasionally go on maintainence but I'm fine with it. Long loading time compared to Single Player. I usually go to Single Player first and switch to Online after.In ConclusionThe game is a fantastic game but it does not live up to its name. It's called Grand Theft Auto but most missions do not involve stealing cars and there's also a chance of getting a bounty on your head for stealing cars off NPC's Online. I do recommend this game but you're better off buying this game during a sale.Story Mode 9/10Graphics 9.5/10Optimization 10/10Soundtrack 9/10Gameplay 8/10Online 7/10Overall 8/10

standard finale they fixed the kuruma glitch 3 4 years later after it came out and now its the heli glitch that its even FASTER and SAFER like... rockstar pls xdand the endless list of bugs this game The story and the way you can change between characters is clever but so far there isn't a likebale character in the roster. I know its GTA but it all just seems so familiar. I'm not looking forward to replaying the missions that I've already completed mainly because they weren't that entertaining to beging with but so far I'm going to with a no on the recommendation on this one. I know I'm probably in the minorty but that's how it is.

review: I have well over 3 000 hours in this game split up across Xbox 360 Steam and the retail versions. So I think I can say from an objective point of view this game is dead and modders killed it.If your idea of fun is having millions of dollars deposited into your bank against your will ruining any sense of achievement you've ever held I recommend this game. However if you want to be able to look at your 60 car garage filled with super cars and sports cars and your motorcycle club and your yacht with a sense of pride and be able to say "I worked for this" do not buy this game.It is literally impossible to have fun in a public session. You will be frozen and spawnkilled by modders you'll have modded cash dropped on you or deposited into your bank the whole lobby will disconnect for no reason your freeroam missions will be griefed by kids with godmode and teleport mods your weapons and ammo will be taken from you.This game is no longer fun. This game is dead and modders killed it.

review: If you've read my past review of Max Payne 3 you probably know what I think of Rockstar recent streak of games.For those among you who don't let's just say I've been waiting since Bully or San Andreas if you prefer for Rockstar to actually produce a quality game which isn't about the american dream AGAIN.And so far my expectations have been met with disappointement a fact GTA V certainly couldn't manage to change.GTA V is I have to admit it a bad game.Let's start with the controls and initial feel. The first thing you immediatly notice is the driving controls are bad. They basically slightly improved the controls from GTA IV which were absolutely terrible and a huge disappointement literally forcing you to use cabs to go anywhere because driving was such a pain. GTA V driving is at least mediocre but it goes from a faux realist style of driving where most cars handle like huge boxes of mass on wheels over or underturning sliding spinning flipping and overall making the driving disappointing.On foot they kept the "realist" animations which makes you go at a crawling pace when you climb or go down stairs or when you bonk into a car even slightly moving. Ennemies you shoot when not killed by a headshot tend to fall down and proceed to take an incredible amount of bullets to die if you don't hit the head. Gunfights in general tend to be extremely lethal for you ennemies tend to have pinpoint accuracy and bullets hurt like hell.While airplane controls are correct helicopters controls are downward attrocious and feel like they obviously were made with a controller scheme in mind meaning when the game was ported on PC artefact of that control scheme remained and helicopters controls are a nightmare.So as far as gameplay goes it's not fully enjoyable like Saints Row games are. Ergonomy is mostly ignored which means in some cases fighting the controls and the animations. Plus you have this stupid cellphone system which comes back with a vengeance and is an annoyance to use. The cellphone is used for far too much gimmicky things and of course lock you into an animation of using it when you do.Now let's move to the main story. Main characters are overall pretty good in their own styles. I won't jump on the bandwagon who think Trevor is the best thing since sliced bread. Trevor is a correct quirky character but he often goes in the "too much" in a way which isn't funny. We are far from the humor of the old GTAs giving you the feeling they weren't taking themselves seriously and were in the parody. Here the humor is more about making political and social statements and badmouthing groups of types of people. And it's done in such a way which is just not funny. It's not handled with tact it's not handled in a childish way. It's handled like it would be in say a Family Guy episode. Overly gross and provocative made only to shock without even the comedy.Then you have the secondary characters... It takes a very very short amount of time to want to kill the vast majority of them. Lamar is a terrible gangstah wannabe which can't even be a Ryder. Franklyn's aunt is ignoble. Michael's entire family is a torture. Trevor's friends are mostly annoying. I think Lester is probably the only major secondary character which is kinda nice.As if it wasn't enough the game is unrewarding as hell. In past GTA(3 Vice City San Andreas) you got rewarded with a nice sum of money after each mission. Here? You barely get paid anything when you do get paid. The game throws a lot of goodies and customisations options for you to buy... Well when I mean a lot it's relative. Saints Rows 2 this game is not. At least a decent amount of them. But without money? You don't even get to mess with them. While Vice City and San Andreas had properties which generated money over time here most properties don't do that. They only generate money under certain precises circumstances and for some only offer you the capacity to make some extra cash by grinding repetitive and unrewarding tasks. And you can also get phone calls asking you to drop everything to accomplish said tasks or you don't get paid at all!So what does that leave you heists of which there are 5 in the whole game one of them not giving any money at all an other only giving money to one character and the last one being at the complete end of the game. And there is also stock market rigging and profiting but well... That takes a lot of save scumming even if let's face it it will be how most of your money will be made.And the whole not getting rewarded for what you do is a constant theme of the story. Which is pretty much a lot of jumping in hoops doing nothing of consequences and making lot of errors the final morale of the story being it would have been a LOT easier if they had killed everyone looking at them the wrong way from the start.Lot of side missions are incredibly annoying to boot. For me the kicker was the submarine collectibles which have you spend a lot of time in a mini sub going aaaaall over the playing zone to pick up underwater crates. All that for after hours of tedious boredom being paid 1000 dollars by the person who gave you the task... The real reward being her car when you kill her which is a pretty bad one anyway and one which even if rare can be found in traffic.As for missions themselves some of them are legitimately hard for the wrong reasons like terrible controls time limits escort missions killzones placed around the area making you fail if you go too far from the railroads the game want you to follow etc. An other review said things well writing "For every time you feel like fist pumping because of how great the situation is you have 10 which make you want to scream at your computer". That's pretty much GTA V story in a nutshell.The soundtrack is overall bad. After the pleasure that were GTA 3 Vice City in particular and San Andreas sountrack GTA V is a huge letdown. You have maybe 4 5 good songs and the enjoyable funk radio maybe and that's it pretty much. So of course you mostly use your own music because you can't really trust the game to give you quality. Then you have the multiplayer... Ooooooh boy...A lot have already been said about it. It's full of hackers. Rockstar does very little to punish them. Mistakes have been made punishing people who got victims of hackers and did nothing wrong. It's full PVP on open servers meaning you will usually get shot at just for crossing the street unless you wall yourself on a private server with friends. There is no real Grand Theft Auto. All the cars a little good must be purchased. Same for planes helicopters and boats. The reason given is that they have a GPS tracker preventing you from keeping them.Truth is Rockstar sells multiplayer money for real money and at a very high price I must add. Therefore they made everything interesting locked behind money requirement and made money very hard and grindy to get. It's either some very precise coop missions or the hardest heists. Heists which like coops missions will fail if someone die or get disconnected for any reason forcing you to restart from last checkpoint in the first case or have to restart them in the second. Others activities are midly amusing. Races can be legitimately fun. PVP activities on the other hand are pretty bad. In some cases spawning positions are fixed with all the problems it can cause when one team must find the other for exemple.I could go on but I've reached character limit. Avoid yourself the frustration and boredom. Don't get it.

review: Day 3 of launch I've adapted to sleeping during respawn times and loading screens every few hours my mom slides a piece of bread and an icecube under my bedroom door. Since day one I've called in "sick" to work my boss wishes me well and has no suspicion of my absense. Little does he know I'm murdering hookers at every corner of the city and stealing military jets to destroy any other player who crosses my path. My friends text me for plans I tell them I'm busy doing jobs for a man named Lester. They think nothing of my excuse while I'm robbing banks and gas stations just to spend my earnings at the nearby strip club. I'm beginning to accept my new life here in Los Santos the graphics are better than real life anyways.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The single player game is fairly good for a GTA game. Worth $30 40 and your time I'd say. The world itself is fun to explore and the typical GTA shenanigans are as ever a staple to laugh yourself silly with. The driving fighting and gunning are all satisfying. The single player falls flat when it comes to the characters. They are all hateful spiteful human garbage. That wouldn't be so bad but this game feels too over the top in terms of the humour. There are no sympathetic characters there are no grounded interactions and the entirety of the world itself is one giant sardonic orifice raining down diatribes of hate and sarcastic drivel on your head. In past games we've had anchors (straight men) to help us realise the audacity of our characters as well as the lunacy of some of our friends. But this game is missing any sense of the mundane in favour of the constantly ridiculous. This feels more like a Saints Row game than a GTA game. I still mostly enjoyed the single player experience even if the game was trying to constantly cut me with it's supposedly sharp socioeconomic and political mini rants. I got tired of the writing and the characters but I was still (mostly) interested to see their stories pan out. That's the single player. The online or GTA Online is a mess. The loads are ludicrous even on a fast connection and the game installed on an SSD and are a near constant issue with jobs/missions often requiring a load. If you're not waiting for your own game to load then you're likely waiting for someone else to load into the mission. It feels like you spend more time waiting for things to happen than you do making things happen. The online economy is a heavy grind. It would be considered a heavy grind in a free to play game. But it's not a free to play game it is a full price game that demands that you either play dozens of hours to achieve the tiniest of gains or to pay real money for shark cards. Poorly named. They ought to be named whale cards. The game demands an extreme amount of grinding to achieve much of anything. Dozens of hours are a drop in the bucket for this grind. The game does not respect your time and is balanced around you buying in game cash with real money. Surely for all that grind you have some assurances of a stable cheat free product? Nope. The game is riddled with hackers who will kill everyone in a match with the stroke of a button or they'll lock your character so you cannot move they'll empty your inventory of all of your hard earned weapons and such they'll crash the server or they'll crash your game or they'll shower your character with items or money in such a way that they'll get you banned for a few days or weeks. That's right the greedy publisher and devs of this game have offloaded most of the stress of the multiplayer onto their customers without sufficient checks to keep the integrity of the game itself secure and so have rendered the experience moot. When hackers can permanently ruin a character you've made leaving you with no recourse what are you supposed to do? The PR and marketing for this game avoids the tough questions while shoving more micro transactions down your throat. GTA Online is a disgrace. I reinstalled for the first time since release and played some hours to see what was new. I had missed most of the new content 'till now and was curious to see if the game had finally reached a worthwhile state. As you can tell from my above comments I am not pleased. Things are worse. The lobbies always have a few cheaters in them about half of the remaining players will hunt you without reason and the remainder will keep to themselves. Rarely you'll meet some nice seeming folks but any crew will quickly fall apart as the missions require a high degree of coordination. Unless you have friends to play with don't waste your time. The online is a mish mash of ideas but none are very well implemented. GTA Online is the fixture of GTA V. There are no expansions or DLC coming for the single player game. If you can find the game for cheap buy it and play the campaign.Ignore the online component it exists to part you from your cash. All of the added content in GTA Online is grind heavy expensive and ultimately not worthy of your time. Play a game that respects your time and isn't just trying to get into your wallet.

review: After 1500 hours of playing this game I think I am able to do a review on it.Firstly I would like to start on the gameplay itself. The game is pretty basic when it comes to gameplay as it should be for every GTA game out there. It comes down to three different gameplay characteristics Character movement Driving and Shooting.The Character movement is not bad it's pretty decent. Using third person gives you that authentic GTA feeling to it but first person is a new addition to the GTA universe which at the moment is very broken. The mobility is way faster for a player in first person compared to one in third person but the first person player has a worse surroundings aware compared to the third person. The difference can be seen during combat however.The Driving is basic it's for the casual player not very difficult to control compared to previous games.The Shooting is very easy the guns almost have no recoil whatsoever and they're not difficult to use. Sadly the main thing about being better is having the gun with the faster fire rate. The weapon selection is pretty big but in the end it comes down to few weapons such as the Special Carbine Heavy Sniper AP Pistol and Heavy Revolver. The melee system is very broken and except the Knuckle Duster the melee weapons are just for the giggles not for efficiency. The shooting becomes more broken when a player is using first person because it gives him a huge mobility advantage over the other player if he would be in third person. Due to the easy shooting mechanics the game is having a community of players formed of people killing other players for no reason and resorting to scummy tactics called "Tryhards".Secondly I would like to have my own opinion on the community playing the game.It's no secret the game is dying at the moment because of the prices or the game's age so the players are separated in groups Tryhards Modders Bikers etcetera. If you want to start playing the game now you should be prepared to be a target for every player looking to boost their Kill/Death Ratio because for some people that actually matters.Unless you have a group of friends to play with or find as quick as possible a community to join I'd say it's pretty pointless to start playing now because of the prices in game which is a topic I will get on now.The prices have suddenly increased since the VIP DLC which was after the Heists DLC. People used to have in game currency back then due to the Heists being new and people used to grind them for currency.After that R* has used the same strategy for future DLCs such as the Biker DLC. It feels like R* has turned lazy which it did a long time ago.Throught the months the DLCs' content was more focused on militarized vehicles which are expensive not fun and it takes away from the core gameplay GTA used to be about. Long have past the days where you were just a criminal stealing cars for a living now R* has offered us militarized vehicles and nuclear missiles to fight each other which in the end benefits them if you think about it.Thirdly I would like to talk about the story line. The story line was very blank compared to the previous games and it's pretty stupid. It was also easy.Since 2013 this story line never got any updates as well. The online is infested with DLCs' which are adding stuff the game didn't need and the story was the same for ever no one is even playing it anymore unless they use mods to customize their single player experience.To end it I'm not recommanding the game for anyone who wants to start now because it would turn out in a waste of time because you would need a lot of grinding for basic needs such as the Bunker the Clubhouse decent vehicles and what not and all of this just so you can add a few bucks in R*'s pocket.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: If you're looking at buying this game for the Story Mode gameplay I would kinda sorta recommend it. They have definately met or exceeded previous titles but it's still GTA it's only going to take you so far. However if you are interested in getting into online play I would absolutle not recommend it. The number one reason would be "modders" or "hackers". Considering the amount of money Rockstar has made off this game let alone the amount loyal fans like myself have paid them over the years having purhased ALL of the previous titles the lack of actual moderation in online sessions allows hackers to basically get away with ruining entire sessions for thousands of players everyday. If I had known how rampant this issue was I would not have bought the game initially. While there are improvements in the Story Mode it's GTA... I was interested in online. Now TBF there are ways of working around some of the hacking issues but they also block off access to money making missions or include running a "glitch" session which I'm sure at any point Rockstar is going to try and do away with even if it's the only way to ensure you can play the game fairly without hackers. DO NOT BUY SHARKCARDS I was foolish enough to do so myself and it was the ONLY reason I kept coming back for more punishment from the hackers I had more than just the price of the game into it so I convinced myself to get my moneys worth. I still feel like I have not despite 100's of hours into the game... Simply due to the hacking issue and Rockstars absolute lack of dealing with it. At least with "DayZ Mod" I could excuse it coming from the server side they didn't get paid by players they were running a game that they didn't develop using mods they didn't write. And yet they STILL managed to have an active system that dealt with hackers...

review: Many questioned if Rockstar would be up to the task with this release given how GTA IV turned out.I am happy to report that Rockstar nailed it. Yes there were launch day issues but what game doesn't have those?EDIT Okay lets take this a bit more seriously.If you've watched TB's Port Report on GTA V then you already know what to expect as far as options go so anything I say would be redundent. If you haven't watched that video go do so.Gameplay wise running on my rig (i5 4670 8GB DDR3 R9 270X) and the settings mostly on normal/high I get 60fps 90% of the time. Again as TB said in his video there are times when the FPS drops to 40 in large areas because of everything that's loading. This has yet to cause problems when on heists or jobs so I generally ignore it.As far as controls go usualy with this type of game I'll use a controller as driving with the keyboard is often hampered by shoddy controls. Thankfully that doesn't seem to be the case here as I have no issue driving with the keyboard outside of how long the camera takes to recenter when the mouse moves so I drive in 1st person (which is honestly kinda fun).There's a level of detail here that is really impressive to behold. Get into a car in 1st person mode and hit that gas. The tac and spedo needles move. Change the radio station and most will show which station you're on and sometimes what song is playing.If I have one gripe it's one that I've had with games like GTA for years now and that's how it handles the music. I'm all for all those stations and GabeN knows I take full advantage when a game lets me use my own music collection in place of whatever they provide. But we've had smart phones for years now and many people use them as music players either with apps like Spotify or just putting their own music on them so why not take advantage of that? Put in a small animation of the player puting on headphones and just let the phone be the radio/music player.Other than that the game is a gem. Being able to switch between the main game and GTA Online at will without needing to exit is perfect (although the load times are annoying).

review: Single Player Campaign is shallow clique and boring. The first hour or two of single player is really fun and then it becomes a boring repeatitive and overly dull grind. For an RPG game you don't find yourself getting around much in the shell of an "open world" in comparision to GTA IV where there was many side missions and random events as well as activities. This game is lifeless filled with characters and story that have comprehensive ideas built into them but with no build up you will rarely care about the characters making this playthrough beyong boring since there is no fun things like side missions and activities as with the previous title in the series. The lack of money you will make in the short campaign means buying weaponry or doing the 'online' activities and even car customization are impossible though the story is that short you wont find yourself with much time or need to do any of this. So then the single player sucks and is a shell of what GTA IV offered that must mean that GTA Online got all the attention from developers. Well let me tell you if you weren't in it since day 1 + you don't have 3 other friends with the game around the same level as you + you don't plan on buying any of the microtransaction in game currency then you're gonna have a bad time. This game is nothing without 3 friends to play with you and any online interaction with random people is going to make your day or you off completely. Also you should really read through the entire wiki if you wanna have any idea of how to get around and make any money so you can buy the ridiculously over priced garbage they have to offer. Literally all the clothing cars and property/bussinesses are so unaffordable that Online isn't worth a dime of your time. I'd rather invest in World of Warcraft than this sadness. I do not recommend this game. Go buy GTA IV and watch some guides on how to mod that game and it'll be much more value for this money. Online isn't worth buying this game for. Online gets out dated way too fast their events and additions give no traction to the landslide this game is taking down the toilet.

review: In short Campaign mode well worth it. The game itself is incredible even nearly 5 years after being published has a vast open world that will keep giving after hundreds of hours of gameplay. I currently have 100 hours on record and still feel like I've nearly begun playing. The storyline is brilliant missions that are unrivaled by V's predecessors. The little details will surprise you over and over again the places you can find Mike Trevor and Franklin at the diallogues that you will wait to be over with even though you have basically reached your destination. The game really is a gem and it's well worth the money.Why it's currently got lots of negative reviews is well explained by the people who put them.The online mode is... Horrendous. I guarantee you half the time in online you'll spend enjoying it and using the most of it it has even more missions great stunt races heists even more things to do than in story mode. However the other half the time spent (and I'm not even kidding if you're lucky it will be less than 50% of the time) will be either on loading screens to and from sessions disconnecting from sessions which will make it very frustrating if you are looking to buy the top vehicles a yacht or even a decent property that would be only half a million. It will take you ages just because of it. On some occasions I spend up to 2 hours in this game trying to do a single heist but being unable to because of people disconnecting (then having to do the loading screen again) and only get to spend 30 minutes out of it playing the game itself. Also the community is beginning to be You will need to be coordinated most of the time (and have a great knowledge in English that most people seem to neglect) and it's really hard once a Russian 13 year olds join you in your missions. (don't mean to be racist nearly all the kids in this game will be the same spoiled brats. Make them non english speaking spoiled brats in an English game a +18 one... You won't have a good time.)So should you or should you not buy this game?Absolutely. Grand Theft Auto V is a piece of art that you really need to experience. It will provide you with lots of hours of pure fun and enjoyment if you're gonna stick with the exploring and storyline. You will feel the game paying off in the first 5 10 hours of playing.However unless you have a *really* good internet you're near to wherever the servers are and have some real life friends you think you can enjoy the online part with I don't think you should feel much of the Online mode. In years time the servers have (from what I could feel) only gotten worse which is an indicator they probably won't do much about it any time soon (if ever that is.) You shouldn't completely neglect it but do have low expectations on it. You'll either have quite a fun time or quite a frustrating one the later mostly. Unless you have A LOT of the time in your hands don't expect to grind much.And grinding is not an important part of the game. There is literally so much to do don't let the frustrating online mode occasionally stop you in it.TLDR Online not worth. If you're someone who will appreciate the online most of the time this isn't a game for you.Offline must buy. Details the story the message it sends etc. Enjoy it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I have this game on Playstation 3 Xbox 360 Xbox One and PC and yet today I received a permanent ban on PC with no way of appealling.I have worked extremely hard to get the money that I had earned ingame saving each and every dollar I earned to buy a hangar an office and the garages that go with it. Whenever there has been discussion regarding modding/money drops/cheats/hacks etc I have gone straight to "Find New Session" regardless of what I was doing at the time even if I was in a mission. I have been banned previously even on console I was accused by Rockstar of modding yet this was not possible.I do not understand how or why this has happened as Rockstar would be able to look at someones account and see exactly what has been done if not then their system is flawed because every other developer with a multiplayer aspect to their game can see what someone has done....I have continued to support Rockstar Games for many years and would not want my account associated with any kind of cheating. I don't even use Single Player mods which includes the many vehicles trainers and other things that change the game entirely.I have now uninstalled the game and if you are reading this and thinking about playing the game legitimately then by all means go ahead and do that but you will be banned so you best look for some of those modding menu's that all the cool kids seem to be able to use spoiling everyone else's fun.....it seems to be the only way to remain unbanned.

review: DO NOT BUY GTA 5.i never thought i would be writing this review for the fact that i love grand theft auto as a series.however i will write this review and say that GTA 5 is the most tremendous failure of a game and I hope the devs die just like all of the idiots who work for take two.here let me explain why concisely pros of this game virtually none but i'll list the few obvious onesthis is a good sandbox game.this game is good with mods. you can mod the singleplayer game and it will become good.you can mess around in single player. online is sort of fun to mess around in (until you get banned)cons of this game the story is terrible.the 3 playable characters in singleplayer are stupid.michael is a spineless moron trevor is a stupid sociopath and franklin is only there to be the token black guy and say hoodlum things.the story is terrible.the graphics are mediocre and the game handles like crap.the story is terrible.the game takes forever to load both in offline and online.its a cash grab not a real game with love.online is extremely expensive to play so people will buy microtransactions. its a cash grab.everything about this game sucks in comparison to older GTAs.also you get banned for playing online. some people might doubt that but its true you get banned by the faulty anti cheat.seriously go out and buy GTA IV if you haven't and play it. with or without mods i don't care because GTA IV is and will always be exponentially better than this pile of trash.if you really want to play gta v DON'T PLAY ONLINE. PLAY SINGLEPLAYER WITH MODS. its the only way to make this game SOMEWHAT enjoyable inbetween the constant crashing.i cannot voice just exactly how much this game is the worst thing to come from rockstar or literally any big game developer of all time and i hate it so much. its the worst game i've ever played and the only reason i STILL play it to this day is because i have a bunch of mods installed. without the mods i would NEVER come back to this PoS again.DO NOT BUY GTA 5.
