review: OMFG What is wrong with you people. Rockstar may have taken some unethical steps during the summer sale but why aren't you guys seeing the bigger picture here ? They made a WELL OPTIMIZED GAME! Which is VERY VERY RARE in todays gaming generation. That being said the graphics are FREAKING AMAZING for this level of optimization. They made an amazing campaign and havent priced it 99999999999999 bucks like Call of duty and BF franchise. Don't get me wrong I am a hardcore BF Fan.Best of all they keep rolling out FREE ONLINE DLC's contrary to other games where we have to buy base game for 60$ + Expansion pack 50$ *Cough Cough* EA *cough*.Sure they did screw up online big time and it could have been way better. I too have 2 minutes+ loading times but the good thing is R* is working on it. It's true that people only notice negative things and blantly ignore the positive things. Human Nature I Guess.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: What can I say that hasn't already been said? I'm going to review the Story Mode as I have yet to play the Multiplayer functionality. This game is fantasticly well done. Even with my less than ideal GPU I can run the game on ultra settings at 45FPS as the game is so well optimized that my CPU and RAM can pick up any of the slack.It is beautiful the story is exceptional thus far the characters feel real and their emotions and tibulations carry over to your own state of mind and the weapons enemies buildings planes trains and automobiles are so very well designed and balanced. Every weapon is viable in the field and the first person modes available make this game feel not only like an RPG but an FPS as well with elements of racing an track games.To put it bluntly Rockstar has released one of the most balanced and well thought out and executed games of all time. Add the fact that it is balanced and feels like you're actually in that reality at some points and you've got yourself a classic people will still be referencing in 10 20 even 30 years. Grandparents will be telling their grandchildren how they slew a horde of psychadelic aliens with a minigun in a city park. That alone makes this worth the expense and time. Thank you Rockstar.

review: Rockstar went full r*tard by creating a primarily client side multiplayer game with peer to peer sessions instead of a primarily server side game. PROTIP 1997 is long long passed. Rockstar then refused to stop rampant modding in online play that ravaged the player base for more than a year. The situation metastasized to the point that modders took control of the Rockstar servers and backend database thus making Rockstar the biggest laughing stock of the game development community for all time. Now with the new Gun Gunning DLC Take Two has decided to declare single player mods "illegal" yet online modding still exists. So the good guy single player mod makers are suffering the players are certainly suffering but the modders are casually creating new mod menus and will be back to obliterating the online experience in a few days. Take Two and Rockstar walk away with their $3 BILLION in profits. My nightmare vision goggles are working perfectly.

If the developers would just put a little more effort into fixing bugs and reducing loading time this would be one of the greatest games. I've tried several important heists with sudden bugs or close of the game. In ing HEISTS? Like heists are supposed to have been tested several times how can you NOT have fixed bugs yet? It seems like you have 2 3 developers in the company who needs to do everything because you never get anything fixed. It's actually oblivious.Man I love this game but it can just destroy so much in GTA Online when the game crashes. Please man focus more on this.

review: Non stop flickering GPU usage all over the shop. Running this travesty of a game on an asus strix 1080Ti SLI and i7 6900k combo. Getting erratic performance with frame rates jumping all over the place. That in isolation could be forgiven if not for the constant blinking screen...it is as if the system is doing a GPU driver update every few seconds. All in all expectations were high and the game failed to deliver as far as the technical aspect was concerned. Did not have much of a chance to expereince the gameplay as most of the time spent on the game was dedicated to troubleshooting.

If I could get a refund and just play GTA on my console I would seeing as I just wanted open world fun and be able to mess around with the product I own without a company pestering me to use GTA online and in turn micro transactions I have no interest in. You want to mod this games single player and enjoy it? you can't. don't buy this game with that idea in mind.

review: Game is a terrible console port. For example in single player if you steel several cars and start to block the road or form a barrier once you turn the camera away and back again the vehicles just vanish in the space of 1 second.If you are chasing a NPC that is not part of the main story say a car that beeped at you or someone that offended you in some way... if you are chasing a car one that is distinctive say you shot out a window or something down a country or mountain road with no turn off so its not possible the car took a turn you did not notice when the car leaves your view or gets a certain distance ahead it just vanishes removed from the game so its not possible to catch up to it.Its like the game is a mini verse (sorry tiny verse) that just renders this tiny little moving circle around your character. all the bollox about a simulated city living around you is just not true.Oh and GTA online is not enjoyable Over the top grind &amp buggy

review: I am so ing angry right now The only reason why I have so much playtime in GTA V is because of mods. If there were no mods I would have stopped playing a long time ago. As Nerd3 said in his video "Take Two have this massive throbbing erection for microtransactions." Which has completly ruined GTA Online. Which could have been so much more than it is (See FiveM for example.) But the greed of Take Two didn't let that happen. GTA is honetly one of my favourite games ever but I am slowly losing respect for Rockstar as they turned a masterpiece of a game into a microtransaction laiden cesspit from hell. GTA Online plays more like a Free to Play. Since GTA V has been released in 2013 (Xbox 360 and PS3) 2014 (Xbox One and PS4) and 2015 (PC) the only reason why a lot of people picked up the PC version is to mod it. I know I did. Another thing thats annoying about this is the fact that the victim of this OpenIV which not only has it been around for 10 years but it also has absolutly NOTHING I repeat NOTHING to do with Online. Which is filled with modders everywhere. And it's not just me. Check out the current reviews on Steam. All negitive. Paid mods were bad enough but taking them away all together? IMO its worse.I know this review may have seemed a bit like a rant and thats because it was. We cannot let Take Two and Rockstar to get away with this. If you aree thinking of buying this game. Don't. Pirate it and mod the crap out of it. Online isn't worth it. Thank you for reading and leave a negitive review explaing your feelings. Now excuse me whilest I create a Rockstar Editor movie about this. With mods of course.https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 0gKlBIPR_okEDIT Have they forgot about this http //steamcommunity.com/app/271590/discussions/0/613957600530473810/

review: you take two. Modding is a staple of the PC gaming community. Back in the 90's through early 2000s most devs were cool with modding and the ones that were cooler about modding encouraged it. The coolest of the cool handed the keys to the game the tools or even the source to the community. Notice how the franchises that did that are still celebrated and loved today. Just look at the original Doom. Look at the Unreal franchise. The community was the lifeblood and that's no different for you. Unfortunately we all saw your money grubbing with GTA Online but passively put up with it. If you can't respect your players then we cannot respect you. We should boycott your company into the ground but you're lucky that the general public are saps. You won't get my money but that's a drop in the bucket.

review: After a few hundred hours in the console version i just bought this on PC so i could finally play GTA V with mods. Now i just read you took down OpenIV the program essential to modding and essentially made modding forbidden. Screw you i just want to play some fun modded GTA V at the end of the day when im tired as hell. What i don't want to do is grind for hours to play with the fun content that is now also restricted from the single player and only available in the terrible grindy microtransaction filled multiplayer. I can't mod in the multiplayer stuff into the singleplayer anymore and this right after a new bunch of vehicles got released in multiplayer.Let me make a list of all the things i cant to anymore now that mods are forbidden. Play with multiplayer vehicles without grinding for hours upon hours which is time spent on the multiplayer content i DONT enjoy playing. Play with a decent first person FOV remove noise and chromattic abbaration two effects i think are really really ugly and only can be removed through modding Become a police officer Become The Hulk Rico Rodriguez or any other fun modded character Shoot cars out of my gun Have a gravity gun Spawn in vehicles guns and object to play around with in the great sandbox world Turn my character into any NPC in the game Play with brand new cars made by the community Make it snow just like the christmas event without having to play this game when i want to be with my family Make the game look better through graphics mods Make cars jump Remove all water for east exploration of the big ocean floor of Los Santos Make it so animals can't call the police (i am sirious they ed that up) Give my character telekenetic powers CARMAGEDDON Create a tsunami/flooding Give the vehicles more realistic/simulator like handling and much much moreScrew you Take Two.

review: So take two you kill the most major tool to get SINGLE PLAYER ONLY note the capitalized words to work but you still leave it as easy as ever for hackers in multiplayer. Not only that but you set this heinous precident because you "need more money from your consumers" even though this game has alone turned no doubt 400%+ profit and is on record as 4th best saleing game of all time honestly 2nd because wii sports was a packaged in game and tetris has infinite amounts of remakes. You ban single player modding to try to push players who want more content to multiplayer because you refuse to make single player content/ DLC preferring to instead make the multiplayer even more of a grindfest so people buy your Shark Cards just so they can have an excessively overpriced virtual car. Your business practices are at best completely unforgivable and at worst actively attempting to harm the players and push away those that are "only" willing to pay full price for the game. OpenIV was in no way a direct threat to your game but you still attacked the center of not only GTAV modding but GTA IV modding aswell just to try to squeeze more money I honestly hope this plan backfires in your face and costs you millions because this cannot be allowed to be a precident for other publishers to follow.

review: Do not buy this game at all if you're planning on playing multiplayer. It's the worst piece of crap i have ever seen. review: Before the Gunrunning update all you had to worry about were modders flying on bikes with missiles ruining your fun. After the update EVERYONE has flying bikes with missiles ruining your fun.The online has become horribly bloated with heavily armed vehicles. Take Two could ban all the modders now and it wouldn't change a thing. New/poor/lone players don't stand a chance in the online community with veteran/rich/grouped players running rampant with APCs and heavy snipers with exploding rounds. Selling product and cars successfully have become a distant memory requiring convoys consisting of the same vehicles you're defending against. Offensive players who used to be a nuisance have become a nightmare now that they have fast moving heavily armored SAM spamming vehicles. If someone decides to focus you have fun dying repeatedly as you try to navigate the menus and find a new session before dying again.The game is no longer fun. Don't get it for multiplayer.

review: I've been playing Grand Theft Auto V for nearly 4 years now. Originally on Xbox 360 upgraded to Xbox One then finally upgraded to PC when it was released. The 484 hours I have currently are just a fraction of the time I've put into the game between both single player and multiplayer.GTAV has been one of the most interactive and compelling games I've played ever. Free content drops on a fairly regular basis keep the game alive and keep me and my friends coming back. The single player experience was fantastic but wasn't without it's faults. The 3 character story was interesting but I feel like it forced the story to be split up too much. I did come to enjoy Trevor Michael and Franklin as characters but I never felt as connected to them as I did with Tommy Vercetti CJ and definitely not as much as Niko Bellic. I do REALLY wish there was single player DLC but It doesn't bother me too much.GTA Online is fantastic. You may get the occasional hacker or two that can ruin the experience but you can always just find a new session. Over the years R* has released huge updates adding new missions adding to the "story" of Online. New cars new guns and new ways to play make this one of consistently fresh games I've been able to experience. I don't feel like the game is meant for super casual players though. The people who complain about shark cards existing and feel like they don't have enough money for anything either don't play enough or they want too much and aren't willing to actually play for it.My one real advice for people to have the most fun is to give yourself a goal in Online. It's easy to make money but you need to decide on what you want. The game is fun enough just messing around with friends but I feel like aiming for a certain apartment or car betters the experience. You can always play one of the hundreds of gamemodes that R* has created OR you can play any of the game modes community members have made and posted onto Social Club.The game has gotten a whole lot of flack because of Take Two's actions but it really speaks for itself. While I do think it's still worth $60 because of all the content added over the years you might now so I'd suggest waiting for sales.

review: This game is probably my favorite game of all time. After buying it for the 360 I bought it again for PC.First this game looks amazing. I've yet to see any textures that look out of place or too blurry in my 135 hours of play time. Plus the world is absolutely huge so theres always something new to see. There are tons of hidden easter eggs put in by the developers to find especially in the ocean.Second the single player/campaign is really fun. All the missions are very entertaining and enjoyable. The diolague for the characters is absolutely genius especially Trevor's witty remarks. Since the world is so big the only way to run out of things to do is if you actually try to complete every single one of them. In single player you may randomly run in to a character who will send you on a mission not related to the main storyline. These are very fun too and keep you from finishing the game's main story too fast. Third online can be fun but I prefer the single player. Everything on online is far more expensive than anything in the single player game. This means you need to do a lot of missions or the heists to be able to afford you. If you don't want to do that you can purchase in game cash with real money. Although the heists don't have much of a story to them they can be especially fun playing through one for a few hours with your friends. My favorite part of online is probably the community made maps. Theres plenty of insane races with loops deathmatches on sky platforms and unique player made games. If you can afford this game buy it. I didn't particularly like a few of the other games in the series but this is by far is the best one. Although mods are just starting be created a few months from now I can imagine there will be plenty of high quality ones.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So In light of the recent crap thats went on in regards with OpenIV Take 2/ R* have really lost my respect as of right now and a reason only now as to why I'm writing a review after nearly 900 hours on PC.First off OpenIV was made for singleplayer modding in mind and was not meant for use in Online. So before you even remotely say its going to stop Script kiddies in Online don't bother even replying that it will. The mod menus like Menyoo and Force Mod are still around causing havoc because I /STILL/ see them after the Gunrunning update dropping dirty money. Its a scumbag move on their part and R*'s damage control statment is not enough of a good reason.My overall review however of the game besides modding is as this however.Single Player I have played this on both 360 and PC and the story is pretty good for to keep you playing at the start but once you get into it it becomes pretty generic Old fart who done bad stuff wondering what to do while dealing with a pretty crazy family. A gangbanger who wants to be different and gets along with old fart to pull off a heist in a jewelery store to pay off some russian drug guy and a crazy motherf***er who is pretty much every GTA player gets wiff of his old fart friend and finds him and the 3 team up and you get the rest at this point because spoilers n stuff.The real fun is the world itself and the many little details that R* have put into this fantastic game without it being modded to begin with the cars for instance shoot the gas tank and it leaks fuel until it runs out and the car is done. Peds comment if you drive past in a fancy car cops drag eachother to safety when they are downed and there is wildlife that either kill you or avoid you as well as the many side activitys present in the game. Compared to GTA4 however there are some dumbed down things Paramedics don't revive anyone who was killed. The car handling is too goddamm grippy and the roll over thing is stupid. Oh and if you get rammed by cops your steering automatically jerks to the side even if they didn't bother pitting you which is lazy. There are many more but these are some examples.I rate this a 8/10 since you HAVE to play it for the single player because they did an amazing job at it at least.Online NOW the more worser experience with GTAV is its multiplayer and I've been playing GTA O since November 2013 and it has pretty much gone down hill in its quality. For one this game is NOT a F2P. You have to own GTAV before you can even access it and it is not a MMO since it does NOT use servers(Except for Cloud save data thats it) they cheaped out and used P2P meaning you will see laggy players cheesing headshots from a .50 cal from time to time and it has very annoying load times where you'll get stuck in the "clouds" often(I would have rathered a goddamm loading screen at least instead of the annoying skycam).GTA O is more dumbed down from Single player and has less world details such as the gas tank leak as I mentioned earlier oh and no animals. Besides that the main problems with GTA O stems from its playerbase microtransactions and freemode itself.These problems are due to the following K/D ratio counting in freeroam instead of the PVP jobs like it is supposed to meaning players out to kill have a reason to do it to an exessive extent at some points. Weapons are unbalanced and every freemode battle is revolved around long range sniping RPG's and general spam of explosives that insta kill within a certian radius compared to GTA4 where you could survive in some cases but with little health depending on where the splash damage hit. Certian activities and jobs are really underplayed now and they are never really endorsed and have very very VERY low pay out for its worth. An example of this is parachute jobs which are fun but pay absolute crap.The recent updates STINK of moblie game like waiting times for your freeroam businesses. Why I say this? After you collect Cargo/Car/Supplies you have a wait timer. Sold your stuff? Gotta wait another while before you can sell again. On top of that it resorts to "go here shoot people steal this" every goddamm resupply which only makes it more boring as you play them.On the topic of freeroam businesses they are pretty much moneysinks and take a long while to get money back off them once you invest in them. And it doesn't help when the game automatically shows you on radar when you do a sell or resupply. Because that draws in every annoying person to just blast your into next century with an unbalanced jet with cannons or again cheap out by using explosives and that makes the taking the risk more irritating than a fair chase that makes that risk more rewarding.Shark cards are badly priced for its worth since the "free" extras have inflated prices the most expensive Shark Card will get you a glorified boat appartment that gives you one crappy freeroam mission and thats $8 000 000 GTA Dollars the "free" content is a grindfest to get to if you are a completely new player who doesn't know what they're doing + at this point they aren't even hiding the fact that they are shoving them in peoples faces with ingame advertisements and special one time offers to selected player to entice you to buy them. (Please don't for the love of god it is not worth your time wasting money on them.)The Playerbase is often a toxic mess at times where its practically shoot everything going on even when there are people having a meet up for a car meet for instance at any point there is always one person/group who just want to start trouble and ruin others fun. Passive mode does nothing to prevent this really and is often abused by those same people. And for nearly 4 years there has been no map expansion to freshen the experience and barely any game changers relating to Online's "Story".Oh and uh patching harmless glitches when they said they wouldn't. (RIP Cop Outfit glitch because no fun allowed. &lt )To be honest I would not recommend playing Online in its current state its a solid 3/10 from me.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player +ve Stunning graphics Interesting storyline Very immersive heist missions ve Some missions are quite boring as it requires you to travel far distances on a helicopter. Get this game on a sale!!!

review: Play a Saint's Row game instead. Sadly Rockstar seems to be forgetting what makes games like GTA fun. Each version they seem to want to make it harder and harder to go around and cause havoc and instead focus on more irrelevant crap and putting more things in the game to interrupt your fun. For example in GTA 5 your characters are usually too stupid to put on their seatbelts. So if you get in an accident which you will since driving like a maniac is half the fun you often go flying through the windshield and die instantly. Likewise the police have been way beefed up and are widely regarded to be an "anti fun patrol" to the point one of the top mods is to nerf them.So save yourself the money and get one of the many Saint's Row titles instead. They understand that the proper application of a sandbox game is to let the player run around and cause havoc to their heart's content.It's sad since tehcnially GTA 5 is great. It runs well looks beautiful and has good voice acting. However it just isn't near as much fun as other games of its type. It has too many "realistic" features that get in the way.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Everything worked fine for me on both my laptop and desktop. Great FPS on high or highest settings made some great online friends to do all the heists. Life was a dream.Then the nightmare began once I started single player. After investing hours and getting quite far. I'm stuck as Trevor and the character wheel has disappeared. There are no missions so I can't progress. Searching online this is quite a common bug that has been there since the consoles and Rockstar still haven't fixed it.I opened a support ticket through the social club but they have simply ignored it. Therefore I can't recommend this game as for me I suffered a game breaking bug. UPDATE Fixed the bug by just leaving Trevor idle for about an hour whilst I did other stuff. Come back and missions had popped up as had the character wheel.

review: Mods are an interwoven part of GTA's DNA. When Take Two decided to force OpenIV to cease and desist they literally damaged a part of their own product. Yes multiplayer online without mods can be fun and single player without mods can be fun. But neither of those is as fun and enjoyable as being able to use mods in single player. Mods expand the scope of the game infinitely limited only by the imaginations of the mod community. Take Two just eliminated that option from GTA V this week. If you still want to buy this game be prepared to miss out on the VAST majority of what used to be possible.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I love this game.It's a great game.Countless hours of fun from launch until now If you were going to buy this game you would buy it on PC.Why is that? Why PC over other consoles?Because what made this game great was the modding community.I remember at launch mods were still allowed online with a simple file swap everyone was using trainers and no one in any lobby ever died because they were all immortal. The reason I have so many hours on this game is not because I enjoyed grinding out heists and/or buying shark cards so that I could have a baller car It was because when we were broke we'd spawn more cash. When our car got scuffed we'd fix it with one button. When we were behind in a bike race we'd hold NUMPAD_9 and zoom off into the sunset.Once they took mods away from online I took a ban (or two) and moved to the other fun modding adventures.GTA RP was really fun and absorbed quite a few hours of my time.LSPDFR showed a lot of promise and I followed that mod from square one until a few months back.Single player was also a ton of fun with all sorts of sandbox type adventures to be had.Then they do this.They discontinue support for OpenIV and deem it illegal.This not only ruins the chances that future PC gamers have to enjoy the sandbox that GTAV was but it also means that OpenIV needs to shut the doors on their whole operation.This is a great game and hell it might even be fun without mods but if we let Take Two get away with this it hurts other games too.Do the right thing.Vote on the petition here.https //www.change.org/p/rockstar games save openiv
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Take Two just killed off single player modding (Not the multiplayer modding thats been plaguing the game since launch)"But why would they do that?" Because you can't buy shark cards for single player. They are making another money grab at one of the best selling games of all time and sending a message to the community that "Hey We don't care" I would not support this game under current leadership.

review: Product received for free. 300+ hours on this game on the xbox 360/one and it was one of the highlights of owning those consoles. Halo series aside This game without doubt was a fantastic play. It's story is original and unique in its concept and execution. It was a joy getting to know each characters hardships and backstory. Multiplayer however Is a festival of insecurities and immaturity.You can be having a good time with your friends to suddenly being attacked by a Hydra only for when you finally blow it out of the sky the man child goes into passive mode runs away gets another hydra and continues the stupidity. Of course we decided to just follow him and blow up his hydra each time eventually he left but of course. The point stands the community is full of toxicity and immaturity which is a shame really.Bottom line +Get The game to play with friends+Get the game to experience a great story+Get the game to experience fantastic graphics Dont get the game to experience community7/10 Great single player experience coupled with great design and the occasional friend for multiplayer and the game is king.EDIT Money got dropped on me in a lobby i randomly got put into and my entire character got deleted gg rockstarEDIT (14/09/2017) For every 10 12 players in a free roam lobby atleast 1 will be a modder.

review: I saw all the reviews about people getting banned for nothing. So I decided to compile a list of all of the completely reasonable things that you have to do to not get banned from online that you totally have to do in pretty much every other game that has multiplayer. This list was taken from my post asking for help from /r/GTAV.1. Don't have Discord open.2. Avoid any graphics card overlays (IE. AMD gaming evolved or geforce experience)3. Don't mod your singleplayer. (even your UI)4. Don't mod your multiplayer. (even your UI)5. If there is a person on a multiplayer server who might be cheating leave that server.6. Get goat blood.7. Get virgin soul.8. Get chicken.9. Climb to the top of Mt. Everest until you lose consciousness due to lack of oxygen.10. Speak to the mountain spirits while you are close to death.11. If they deem you worthy they will resurrect you.12. They will also tell you to draw a pentagram with the goat blood and to spill the guts of the chicken out into the center.13. Flay your own wrist open and allow your blood to quench the chicken guts.14. Release the virgin soul from your unholy vessel of choice.15. Now you have a chance of not getting banned if you can make it back down the mountain.Totally reasonable no idea why everyone is complaining.Edit I left a negative review on GTA V before it was cool.

review: The long wait has been worth it. If you re a PC gamer who s spent the last eighteen months envying the console crowd while they all got stuck into the latest greatest GTA then rest assured that you can now play the definitive version. Sure the Xbox One and PS4 versions were amazing delivering GTA 5 at higher resolutions with more detailed textures smoother surfaces better lighting and cool depth of field effects (see our full review below) but the PC version offers even more enhancements plus a couple of additional features that play to the PC s strengths. In doing so it adds a few more metres to one of gaming s towering achievements.Having covered the game twice already we won t go too far into the detail of what makes GTA 5 so good. Partly it s a question of experience. With four previous 3D GTAs under its belt plus Red Dead Redemption Bully and assorted DLC packs Rockstar has had time to refine its vision for open world gameplay and its systems and GTA 5 has the best driving the best shooting and some of the best mission design of the series.It s also a question of structure. Dividing the action amongst three protagonists with three interlocking storylines and three distinctive flavours means you nearly always have the option to flick from Michael s ageing career criminal saga to Franklin s ambitious hoodlum story to Trevor s crazed amoral brand of mayhem where the dumb cathartic slapstick violence we all deep down love GTA for finds its natural home. With repeated play it only becomes clearer how well all three tales mesh thematically with Rockstar s savage satirical take on the Californian dream.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The pinnacle of the series. GTA V is a solid game in every respect. Seamlessly ported from console on to PC (1.5 Years later) it provides the player with an extension of the GTA franchise' unique gameplay. This title in particular is potentially the GTA series at its finest. The game has at least 70 hours playability in the Single Player campaign not to mention the countless more to be found in its MP mode. One unique feature in GTA V is the ability to control 3 main characters (one at a time) and play through an interweaving storyline... This is both unique to the series and I haven't seen it in too many other titles.The vehicle mechanics have since improved from the disastrous feel of GTA IV's cars. First person driving has since been added. The quality of the dash graphically varies from car to car I have found. No doubt this will be fixed in future patches.Flight plays a bigger role in this game which is also a redeeming feature for those who were fond of its prevalence in San Andreas. The game also introduced Heists where players can target particular buildings and choose from a number of options of attack when conducting heists in the main story line. Property is of course back and each character is able to purchase properties unique to them. I found great humour in being able to purchase a medicinal marijuana dispensary. Also stock trading has made an appearance via the characters mobile phone. The markets change throughout the story dependant on what events have occured. You can also trade within a global network with other GTA V players. The Engine of GTA V is Rockstars greatest to date. Never before have you been able to interact with the world in such a way as GTA V. GTA V has more complexities than if you were to merge the last few games in this regard. The architecture and level design is second to none. It is probably the most dynamic engine Rockstar have created in terms of character design and acting processes as well. The cutscenes are done beautifully throughout the game with humour as a constant companion to dialogue. The game is quite deep and it can at times be slow moving disengaging the player and making them want to alt tab and play something else in between. Besides this it is the greatest GTA V to have come yet!I highly recommend a play.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game used to be fun. But then I got banned for a week because some random hacker/modder gave me money. Then about 2 months later I got perma banned from online for the exact same thing. review: Given that the Grand Theft auto series is my namesake my recommendation of the game should be a surprise. Let me explain I was on strike 2 of 3 for modding online which is fair enough the game had little content at the time and I had done everything there was to do so I was a little bored of GTA V at the time but after that 2nd ban I come completely clean given that the game had a lot more new things to do and I enjoyed the game as is once more.Suddenly I discovered that shader mods were a thing and I decided to try one out being careful to not even begin loading Online while having this shader mod installed. I decided that it was hindering my performance too much so I got rid of the mod and decided to completely reinstall GTA V and proceed to play Online. I was met with a screen that informed me that I was permanently banned from playing Online. Because of a SHADER MOD. ON SINGLE PLAYER.And now reading more recent reviews it seems Rockstar and Take Two have banned modding in the game as a whole. Including single player. I simply cannot recommend a game that doesn't even allow modding single player.I'm no longer going to support Rockstar or Take Two. This is an astronimical let down for me.Go ahead and tell me I deserve my ban considering I modded in Online before but that still doesn't excuse Rockstar and Take Two's decision to put an end to all modding.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

I wasted $30 on a game with no support once so ever.Update 6/19 Rock* has not banned mods even for story mode and is suing everyone making them. What a shame. The storymode moding community was amazing and is what kept the game together...

review: Up until about 2 weeks ago I would have had positive things to say for GTA. The SP campaign is fun there's cool easter eggs and despite godawful loading times a terrible p2p design and hackers galore due to a fairly shoddy anti cheat (zeroing your bank accounts and seizing all your ammunition) Online was still a pretty fun way to spend an evening with your buds.However in light of this OpenIV debacle which struck me as a poorly thought out attempt to fix the hacker issue and the massive banwave on the 25th which resulted in a lot of unmerited bans suspensions and account resets (myself included in the latter despite having never modded my install and having bought over 16M in shark cards) it is painfully obvious that the team behind this game has management that would make Pierre Beaudoin look good in comparison. TL DR buy the game for it's singleplayer if anything you can sink countless hours into it and still find new stuff. Online mode is an absolute trainwreck and it now appears that Rockstar will ban you for landing in the same lobby as an active hacker as such definitely make sure you don't pay full retail if you do buy it for multiplayer and be ready to get destroyed by teleporting and aimbotting godmode hackers...

review: The foundations of this game are amazing and I've spent countless hours playing and enjoying it. However.As it always does the ugly ing mug that is corporate t reared its head on GTA. The online multiplayer is nothing short of pants on your head rage inducing gameplay of walking around Los Santos and being repeatedly murdered by people who have spent hundreds of dollars to buy their new dildocycle and mount a you to common decency on the steering wheel. The game is at this point defined by microtransactions to the point where the original promised singleplayer DLC was never released because the studio wanted more money off its players.Quick Fun Fact Take Two has said that they're unsatisfied with the game because they're "undermonetizing" their players.It's the fourth best selling game of all time.Let that sink in for a second.Anyways up to this point all that has been bearable. So what if there's no new content for singleplayer? It's still an enjoyable game especially with mods Oh wait. Scratch that off the ing list because Take Two has decided to give the middle finger to its customer base and has effectively banned mods for the game. Why? you that's why.Don't support this piece of company's buisiness practices. Use the money this game'd scrape off you on a developer that deserves it.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I loved playing this game on the Xbox but always wanted to play it on the PC so I can play with mods and make the game just a bit more fun.I'm not big on playing games online (A bit old school I guess). But when I did play online for a total of 10 hours I gave up because there is no place for broke people like myself that just want to have fun playing a game but don't have cash to waist on digital currency. So after 10 hours of online play I have the following opinions 1) The amount of money you earn online is so little that it is a pointless waist of your time to play legitimately. Buying in game cash is not an option for me and will never happen so this breaks the game for me.2) During my time online I was unnecessarily targeted over and over and over again for the amusement of a bully again breaking the game for me. This happened nearly every time I chose to participate online so I found myself playing most of the time in passive mode making the whole online thing a nullified and useless endeavor.3) The only reason I chose to play online was so I could play with the content that is ONLY available when playing online. Which is not achievable unless you buy the in game currency because everything online is 2 4x the price of the exact same thing in single player mode which being as I can t afford that will never happen. So again useless.4) And for the final nail in the coffin. When I am playing the single player mode I like to mod so I can enjoy the entire game when I do actually choose to play. Since RockStar has banned the use of these modding tools it has broken the game and will no longer let me play while I have modified files in the game folder the entire reason for me even getting this game on my PC has been destroyed.No more fun for those of us that could care less for the unfair online gameplay.Over all I think my biggest disappointment has to be that I will never be able to play with any of the awesome online content because I can t afford to play ball with RockStar and I really don t like playing with people because they ruin everything.So big waste of time and money but at least I get better graphics so that s a plus I guess.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Not only GTA Online is filled with hackers and pieces of Take Two decided it would officially tell the community to themselves. Don't think Rockstar isn't ok with this though because they've been banning single player modders and people who HAD to mod the game in order to run it on their PC's since launch the OpenIV cease and desist was probably welcomed in the R* offices.Don't support this t don't buy this game.

review: Review update 5/16/15The game has changed and Rockstar Games has cleared up confusion on mods on GTA V pc i assure you SP mods work fine and will NOT get you banned however ANY mods in multiplayer will get you banned from the game(i still think this is bad but i can see where they are coming from) anyways i have been a big gta fan since early 2003 and cannot fathom anymore at how great the series is i have played all including gta 5 on XB360 XB1 and now at glorious 60FPS 1080p on my pc i will recommend this game to anybody looking for a sick game to do fun things in and very fun to play with friends.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V My Experrience So first off all i need to say that's the best OPEN WORLD game that i played and if you gonna read this review probably you'll buy this game too ! So let's begin with the MOST FREQUENTLY questions from people who want to buy this game ! DOES IT WORK ON MY PC !? You can see the minimun requirements here www.systemrequirementslab.com but belive me if you have a low medium PC it will work because New updates and patches almost every day and that's why GTA ( Online ) is never boring ! This game is the most optimized game that i've ever seen so you don't need to worry about your PC specifications ! Summary You don't need to have a good PC to play this game because it's optimized and Updates/Patches almost every day ! IT IS BORING AFTER I PLAY MORE THAN 100 HOURS !? Even if i didn't play that much ( 100 hours ) i'm always find a way to JUST PLAY IT . This game is never boring you have so much to do in it like Heists Steal money / cars / planes and it's necessary to be 2 or 4 online players . Missions Something like heists but more shortly . Races Race with cars planes boats ( etc .. ) and it can be played even with 30 players . Deathmatch Need to kill everyone from a MAP ( Something like Team Deathmatch ) . There are the most importants game modes in the GTA ( Online ) but there are others custom game modes more funny like Cops vs Robbers . Truck ramp jumping race . Zombies mode . ( here www.gta5 mods.com ) This game modes are much more than that and are downloadable here www.gta5 mods.com ! Summary You'll not be bored even after 100 hours of gameplay and you have so much things to play ! ) IT IS FUNNY IF I PLAY ALONE !? I guess i played this game 10/20 hours alone and it can't be more great . You can find FAST JOBS from your phone ( On GTA Online ) and play Races Heists Missons ( etc .. ) and you won't regret it ! Also if you are bored off missions and just want to relex you just can put some music and drive something it's really relaxing especially if you have a steering wheel and First Person activated .Summary If you don't have friends who play this game ( GTA Online ) it's not a problem because it's funny even if you are alone but belive me you can make new friends on GTA i already did three ! DOES IT WORTH !? I don't know when you watch this review but in the period of 25 december 4 january this game is 36$ ! But anyway even if it's 60$ it's worth ! This game is the best game ever from Rockstar and when i have free time i'm just playing it with some friends and relax ! THE BIG SUMMARY This game doesn't have big requirements so you can play it easy with a low medium PC ! This game is not boring with every new patch and challanges almost every day ! This game is not boring if you don't have friends who have it so you can play it alone ! This game is the most optimized game ever from Rockstar so it's worth all the money ! This game is the best . Just buy it already ! )

review: I'm back again writing another review. I warn you ahead of time most of this review is based upon my own experience and should not be taken into by your view under any comments stating to and I do quote many steam users "git gooder" like the 12 year old you may or may not be. I have 274.5 hours on record and I love GTA V. However I must do the right thing by making my voice heard. If you are a YouTuber don't do modding videos where you showcase mods and joke about GTA V and Rockstar Games North or San Diego. I was in single player and for no reason had recieved a pop up under my Rockstar Games Social Club Panel after pressing my Home key I had been perma banned. Mind you I don't even use mods. I did once and had done a fresh install. Yet all this ban hammer t came about from a joke I had made and I will now quote my joke from a video of which I have already taken down. "I am starting to think that Rockstar is biased towards any and all Americans." Now surely if you weren't born yesterday or haven't played GTA ever you might believe this statement however you might also believe that guns kill people and spoons make people fat. Grand Theft Auto Five is a good time waster but no one truly needs to know how long someones stared at pixelated That's just too much information of what thirteen year olds do. I haven't launched GTA Online in a good while only for the reason everytime I do I get banned within a matter of hours. None of that started until after my brief statemental joke towards Rockstar. I know the GTA Franchise is supposed to make America and it's protagonists look like psychotic s who would shag a corpse of a hooker after killing half the police department with a knife because we farted the wrong way within twenty centimeters of a fire hydrant after dropping a cheap beer in front of a store. Or on the complete opposite end of the spectrum of which is coherent stupid as Anyone who is twelve with access to an adults credit card or cash knows this. It isn't hard to comprehend. The bottom line is that I must veto this . DO NOT BUY THIS AT ALL IF YOU VALUE YOUR MONEY! I have put WELL OVER FIVE HUNDRED DOLLARS (USD) INTO ROCKSTAR AND THIS IS WHAT I GET AFTER SUPPORT?! A YOU AND UH HAVE A NICE DAY!? Under what grounds must I be banned? Over a joke. Sketch Scale 20/10. Would not play again.

review: They totally ed up in the last 2 weeks.First they got rid of OpenIV which was a great thing for Singleplayer modding. Now they banned and resetted a huge amount of innocent online players without giving any reason but the real hackers? Hell no. Seriously I called their support hotline not expecting to unban me but atleast hear that THEY MADE A MISTAKE or give me a good reason for my ban. They can't tell you what you've been banned for because of "security reasons" it's not even a punishment because you can't learn anything from it and in case they banned me for abusing a bug Go yourself Rockstar you let the "Pacific Standard run" bug in the game for nearly 3 years and now you ban me and thousands of other players for it and reset ALL their progress? Go yourself I paid twice for your game and if you don't start to regret it I'll burn all game copies i own from you never buy another game from you and make sure everyone I know will know about what kind of assaholics you're.They argued both times with "fighting cheaters" in GTA Online but guess what? There are still a lot of hackers around but a lot of honest players and Rockstar supporters are sitting in front of their PC disappointed and off as you can see in the reviews. Don't buy the game there is nothing to play for you can't modify the Singleplayer neither play online because Rockstar will ban you Temporarily and reset your 650 Hour progress completly for absolutly no good nor fair reason.

review: This game is the ultimate adult sandbox shooter. There is something for the selfish player the group player the leader the follower the money mongering fiends the car loving players people who want to senselessly go about slaughtering everything in sight yup this game is for you too.in spite of all the carnage this game allows it has an outstanding amount of detail and beauty that even non PvPers can appreciate just driving walking running flying peddling around Los Santos you can literally lose yourself doing random things for hours. If you have friends bring them along too the fun just gets that much better the more creative you and your friends are.single player is a completely different experience than multiplayer and I recommend newcomers to GTA put some hours into single player to get familiar with this virtual world prior to exposure with the crazy in GTA online.GTA online is best played with friends. I say this because although there are ways to play alone someone at some point will give you a hard time for the sake of it so share the misery with your friends and shoot that bastard causing you grief )

review: You know I've wanted to like this game so much since its release but I honestly just can't recommend it to just about anyone at this point. With constant errors hindering me in singleplayer and online hackers in every lobby a hostile community and the summer sale fiasco I find it extremely difficult to recommend. I want to give this game a good review but with all this I find it hard to even enjoy the game. If all the hackers and glitches and whatnot were to dissappear tomorrow I'd give it an 8/10.But given that these things still haven't been fixed 6/10 a great game ruined by poor business practices glitches and hackers everywhere making it merely above average in my eyes.

review: Pros Great single player campaign. Lots of great Cars. Beautiful graphics. Heists. Lots of fun activity.Cons Hackers. Hackers. Hackers. I wish They could permanently get banned for cheating temporary bans just aren't doing it. Loading times (applies mostly to GTA Online). Frame rate issues/lag ( My specs i7 4790K 16.0GB RAM 4GB GeForce GTX 970). Connection issues/ server time out. Everything in the game is ridiculously expensive (i.e. A haircut costs about $200) Rockstar still treating PC gamers like second class citizen (Still waiting for Red Dead Redemption).The game in general is really fun especially when playing with friends (on a private server on which you're still not safe from server time out and random disconnects) but after what Rockstar tried to pull this past summer sale I'd say pick the game up when it's at least below $15.

review: Don't buy this game. The online is a microtransaction riddled hellhole and the devs have litterally sent a Cease and Desist to the main modding tool so modding is litteraly illegal now. Take 2 are a bunch of money grabbers who I have no intentions of buying from again.I haven't played this game in ages and as a quick summery I think the game is fun but the online is a microtransaction hell where most of the fun vehicles are locked behind massive amounts of grinding or real world cash. But this isn't why im giving this game a no in recommendation.One of the fun things this game had going for it was the mods. I liked to hop into single player and mess around with mods. Maybe i'll turn on god mode and throw cars around. Maybe I'll spawn a Hydra and try to survive with 5 stars. Maybe I'll try one of the game changing mods like LSPDFR and become a cop. Doesn't that sound fun?Well guess what that's no longer possible. Because Take 2 have officially sent a Cease and Desist to the developers of the main mod loading tool meaning they have deemed modding ILLEGAL!Basically don't support this game! Take 2 have turned this game into nothing more than a cash grab. They were once litteraly quoted as saying the players of the game are 'wood waiting to be cut ' because the only thing they are interested in is profit.

review: What I talk about after this paragraph has happened a while ago since then Rockstar and Take Two have retracted their decision and Open IV still lives. I personally would say that the game is definitely worth it even without the mods that are offered by Open IV but removing them is a low blow and this is why I can't push myself to recommend this game because this decision might come back later to haunt the player in the GTA V universe. Lucky for us that day is not today.Open IV was a popular tool that a lot of modders used to make their mods for GTA V. Note that the developer of Open IV himself had to confirm that the mod/tweak DOESN'T allow you to CHEAT online. If the game was modded GTA ONLINE simply WOULDN'T LAUNCH.Both Take Two and Rockstar used cheaters as an excuse for taking down this tool because it is bad for their shark card business. If you have a game that is modded to why would you play online? You have fun in single player so you won't get into the grindfest that is GTA online. Take Two and Rockstar know that and they have excuse to ban the tool.TotalBiscuit made a great video talking about this and even comparing the decision to Bethesda's creator club.https //youtu.be/8hLmM6pK0wg?t 28m33s

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: It's great to know that a company values money over the satisfaction of their customers (sarcasm). It was a blast to play through the singleplayer mode bacause it offered a cool storyline. What made singleplayer even better was the ability to add mods to the game that basically just continued the game past its storymode whether it be adding cool new cars that the COMMUNITY has taken the time to make or even just messing around with a menu that can change the gravity change the playermodel and do many other things. Recently I have been playing online with my friends and I am just amazed at how each update added to multiplayer includes cars or property that is well over 2 million in game dollars. When you complete all of the heists you can get up to around 3 million as long as it's your first time. That sounds like a lot of cash until you see the reveal of a new update that introduces trucks with guns and supercars that are priced at over 2 mil. Or you could spend your money on some of the new ways to make money through dlc such as exporting cars or gunrunning. Through many weeks of grinding to make money you can finally purchase just one of the things that allow you to purchase something along the lines of a rocket bike. You could easily feel proud of your progress or you could also come to the realization that all of those weeks of grinding gave you absolutely no entertainment but rather just stress. What many people have already done inside of Grand Theft Auto V is cheat in cash online just so they can keep up with the numerous updates. It was understandable that Rockstar has tried their best to remove modders and hackers in ONLINE mode but removing mods in singleplayer? That's just taking it too far. What I have come to realize about this game is that it is fun only if you have money. Call me poor but Rockstar seriously needs to come out with a update that improves the game itself by adding abilities and usefulness of the iFruit phone apps that is of no cost to the player for example the kicking and melee feature in the biker update. We need more updates and less DLC.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The legend of Grand Theft Auto V. Where do I begin?let's start with the storyline I won't spoil anything but it is great. Especially if you have some fun with various PC mods. It doesn't have that endless grind feel that other games have either. It is very well thought out and it is easy to tell that a lot of time effort and money went into this game. Graphics Very good if your PC can handle the stress. The amount of customization is amazing as well allowing less than legendary computers attempt to tackle the game.The M Rating Despite what many would tell you you can play the game without getting too deep into the graphic content. If you only play in online mode you will occasionally have the choice to participate in the form of the strip clubs but it is completely unecessary. There is a lot of killing however. Most of the online mode revolves around hunting down other players and other game modes. I first got this game about 2 years ago on the Xbox 360 when I was 11 and I only wanted it because of the car customization. If that is all you want to do there will be extremely rare graphic content. Overall I would definitely recommend this game. The graphics storyline and overall feel just can't be beat by other similar games.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Single player One of the best storytelling games that a Grand Theft Auto has done. With multiple main characters Rockstar have managed to tell individual characters stories whilst having the main plot which links them all together. It has a long story mode which is good because it means that there are a lot of gameplay hours to be played. However it can be said that a reasonable amount is filler moments. This is due to driving from point A to B especially if you don't have a fast car and enemies that keep spawning in only for you to easily shoot them as they basically run into your line of fire. There are so many side activities which can be played such as tennis golf races movies robbing trucks and even investing in a stock market. These activities are lots of fun to play and it adds to the overall experience of the game in a positive way. If you take the time to fully explore the world of Los Santos then it can be found to be very atmospheric. The cover system has been redone and it plays a big part in the combat mechanics of the game which is a nice addition.Multi player It is great fun to play with friends. The new addition of heists mode is a great way to add to the game and when a heist is completed there is a good level of satisfaction upon completing it. The free roam is great fun as you can cause a lot of chaos There is a huge range of customizable options for your character as well as the vehicles that you own.OverallBoth the single player and multi player experiences are great fun for their own reasons and if you get bored of one you can always flip over to the other as they are both awesome!

review: this game eats system ram for breakfast i recommend 16gb for this game.(had an issue with stuttering and it turned out to be my 8gb DDR4 others with same specs as I with 16gb have no issues the game uses around 8 10gb at very high settings) But thats not a big deal really because most games dont use resources as well as this game does. It has got to be the most amazing pc port....... neh pc game ever optimized. yeah you heard me PC GAME. the scaling and smoothness was worth the delay and def huge leaps in looks from its console counterparts. I can not even beleive im saying this but Rockstar nailed it. Regardless the story is fun and endulging and exciting theres LOADS and i do mean loads of graphics settings to cator to your systems needs. The graphics scaling and resource handling is out of this world!!....This is literally the most my PC's hardware has ever been used! and efficiently and responsibly as well. The games detail is just out of this world! Walking around the city every nook and crany is filled with random detail and the roads are just spectacular makes the city seem so real how used the roads are and thats just a small part. I am just incredibly mindblown how Rockstar was able to pull this off....now I will be BEGGING for Red Dead even more!!!just to give some facts for a few people maybe wondering theres no mouse acceleration the controls are seemless controller support (if wierdly you want that) is seemlessly there. FOV is decently implemented (not perfect in FPS but im sure mods will change that) it supports ultra widescreen (most cutscenes were made at 16 9 though). the First person functions perfectly. all controls are customizable. and based on low graphics settings most peoples systems will probably run it well and low settings still look pretty decent. oh and NO FRAME RATE CAP! YAY! PROPER ADS! (aim down sights)

review: GTA 5 Online makes me think it must be designed by malicious or mentally challenged farm animals and it is by far the worst large scale online game I have ever played (I've played lots of games.) I dont recommend anyone buying *anything* from rockstar games at this rate they deserve to go out of business.The game has a story mode and an online mode. Story mode should take you about a week to finish I guess and it's fun but if you feel the need to do more together with intelligent beings prepare to get annoyed. Its online mode is by far the worst online game I have ever played not because it's not fun to play but many mechanics leading to having a good time in this game is so terribly designed it wastes more than half your game time. You'll be cursing its developers a lot if you buy this like I did. Also the way the game deals with leavers griefers cheaters and other plainly unintelligent ppl is... well the game doesn't deal with them. You do. You'll have to sort through hundreds of undesirables to find a handful you can play with.Some problems with GTA5 Online 1) There are some types of instances you can join public / friends only / crew only. When you first boot up the game it either loads into story mode or an online public instance. If you want to join a private instance you can only do that after it loads into story mode. I prefer loading crew only instances in online mode loads fast. In there after you accept a job invitation and finish the job the game usually puts you in a public instance with murderous characters and cheaters instead of the type of *private* instance you were in. (I've seen 20 players getting continuously teleported to a spot and getting bombed continuously which is not something a player can normally do btw and makes the user interface just block your controls and you won't even be able to report anything. What's *cheating* in an online game anyway right? Rockstar allows it. They suck.)Instead it should put you back in the type of instance it took you from while you joined others to do a job. Or it should ask you wth you want to do now. So what ends up happening is it tries to put you in an instance with 20 people in it which takes way longer to load than your solo instance then you quit online mode to be able to select an instance type again then it says "Leaving instance.." you wait then it loads into story mode automatically then you select the type of instance you wanna get into in the online mode again and finally go back to where the game should have sent you in the first place after wasting like 3 4 mins every ffing time (unless it even fails at that saying "failed to find a suitable instance" and loads back into story mode again.)All this unnecessary and outrageously long loading business eats up all your game time. It could easily be avoided by letting the users decide what to load.2) In the online part first you appear in the same world that's in story mode with some minor changes. That's called "free mode". You may do some stuff in free mode steal cars drive around rob shops beat up pedestrians take your shiny new tank for a test drive start a 5 star cop chase / rampage etc. The point is you may be doing something there. While in free mode you get job invitations to your phone from other players and npcs. You try to join those and most of the time it just unloads your current freemode instance without checking if you can actually join that (yes "most of the time" because sometimes it even fails at that after making you wait for about a minute) The game immediately takes you to loading screens saying "Leaving instance..." "Joining instance..." "That job is now full of players" "Loading..." "Loading..." And then you watch your apartment building's side wall for 10 secs and then you finally appear in your apartment and watch useless game notifications (which block your ability to start a heist btw) saying "You can redesign your interior decorations" etc every time before you can restart a heist.Instead it could and should first check if the job you're trying to join is full or not before jumping to all those needless loading screens then reserve a place for you there and only then make your game client leave the game instance you're in to safely join that other one.3) In the online part jobs/heists/races etc have a *number of players* restriction. For instance for a typical heist you need 4 people and if one of them leaves while you're in there the game disbands the whole team even if you're 5 seconds away from success. And the game automatically takes you back to free mode where you can start from the beginning finding people.If there aren't any mission specific tasks left that the leaver still has to accomplish it should just let you go on instead. Or in any case it should at least take you back to the part where you're just about to start the mission. Then you'd only be looking for one more player instead of 3 more which usually takes forever mind you. It has so much good and fun content (voice actored characters stories cutscenes land water and air vehicles jobs etc) which would put this game in the definitely buy list if it wasn't for the numerous design problems about which I can almost say "show me something in there I'll tell you something wrong with it" Ofc I don't care to explain everything while Rockstar apparently isn't even in the business of fixing stuff (years old bugs still there) or doing things correctly in the first place so there isn't much point in hoping it'll ever get better either.So long story short in the online mode 1) Your 20 mins of perfect runs or any other effort will get wasted because someone leaves intentionally or due to server issues *so many times* that you'll give up looking for people.2) You'll end up watching the game waste your time with needless loading screens making you try to join jobs you cannot taking you places which you'll leave.Obviously this game's developers are as malicious or as stupid as they come making such game breaking simple design mistakes... You'll end up trying to join jobs you actually can't hundreds of times and waste many hours looking at stupid loading screens. Anyone with mediocre intelligence would think of the design faults that lead to the above mentioned problems and correct them before even publishing them. So don't buy this cr p if you're buying for online play and you don't have a bunch of guys from irl you can play with.Oh yea btw currently the game doesn't let you play the offline "story" mode unless you have an internet connection you can connect to steam with. It used to let you play offline in story mode with steam in offline mode but now it says it cant connect to rockstar servers you need an internet connection to "activate" your product. You used to only need to activate it once to play offline later on but they apparently changed that now. Totally sux balls.

review: First off I just want to say that the multiplayer in this game has some problems subjectivly they could be major problems for some that could ruin the experience completely 1. The load times for every thing you do races heists missions loading into a different online session. Its all in the same world space yet you get over 2 minute loads sometimes longer than that.2. The community is toxic as all hell with name calling racial slurs weird threats trolls (everywhere). It's like the perfect place for these things to fester and grow.3. The slow grind to make money. In this game everything is expensive as And you make money so slow that you end up doing the same over and over and over and over and over just to get a car or an apartment things you need to make more money at a slightly "faster" pace.4.The fact that the "success" of the multiplayer drained all future plans to add anything to the singleplayer. You go onto the multiplayer and theres cool cars and planes with people shooting at you from them around every corner but none of these cool things had been added to the singleplayer! None of them! You had to mod just to spawn them (using by chance the mod that is now illegal by the way) like for example the Hydra a VTOL jet aircraft. Not in the SP. A cool super car that had a rocket engine strapped to the back of it. Not in the SP. You get the gist of it.Now that I've said that the singleplayer is exceptional. The story the characters how the characters change and adapt to each other. It is one of the best narratives i've had the pleasure to play through and is better than a lot of films I have seen (I mean the game is an actually interactive movie that you get to play through with three characters). On the topic of modding it would seem that Take two has relaxed on the matter and OpenIV is back up.If you are looking for an exceptional singleplayer and a somewhat large modding scene then I can say go for it but the multiplayer is shockingly bad.

review: GTA V was an awesome game in it's prime fun with friends alone and even with strangers. When I say "in it's prime" I mean the classic console versions not this PC version.Multiplayer There are many aspects I would talk about like the long long loading screens or the non existent balancing between high levels and low levels. But the problem that made me stop playing is that the concentration of cheaters is embarrassingly high I would join a open world server and I would say there's a 50/50 chance to meet a cheater. They would often be invincible and once in a while the cheater would annihilate EVERYBODY at the same time which could be up to 30 players depending if the server was full. Sometimes you would get lucky and get a friendly cheater who gives free money but that ruins the whole point of the game to earn money by doing jobs and spend it on upgrading your stuff. Now I also hear the game's developer firm "Rockstar" is trying to get rid of cheaters and removing "illegitimately" obtained money by going on a banning spree which resulted in innocent players getting banned as well as their in game money. Online GTA on PC is just unplayable.Singleplayer The singleplayer is what the past GTA games were but better. Big open world to explore with several different environments long and entertaining story to play through. But this is no where worth the 59.99 $ with that money you can buy two good games like PUB G &amp CS GO and still have left over money. I do NOT recommend this game on PC just stick to the console version.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: very good game with nice cars
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Disclaimer My review is mostly about my grievances with GTA Online and how Rockstar/Take Two is handling this game if you want to play the singleplayer campaign just go torrent the game this is not worth $60. If you're upset that this is a review is for Online and not for the Singleplayer campaign your anger is misguided. They dropped any and all interest in Singleplayer when they ported this over. This game has had a massive amount of support from its fans and Rockstar/Take Two continues to ignore the communities' response to the b*llshit they continue to shell out. Really shoddy business practices including bypassing the ability to refund the game after you bought it during the 2015 Summer Sale by including a manditory Shark CardConstant pushing of Shark Cards in general and clear nods toward monetary gain being the main focusConstantly pushing GTA Online and forgetting about people who wanted to play the singleplayer campaign and any DLC it would getPsuedo blacklist of all mods and the cease &amp desist sent to the developers of OpenIV a modification tool for Grand Theft Auto IV/V And of course the problems Online is plauged with...Most obviously the fact that every lobby you join will tend to be filled with modders script kiddies and the like no matter how many times Rockstar changes the anti cheatRockstar/Take Two's solution to this is "just join your own lobbies" so you're f*cked if you don't have any friends to play missions essensial to leveling up at all.Putting people in "Bad Sport" lobbies for doing what anyone does and then adding time if you continue to do so Instead of allowing the creation of custom servers and support for lobby leaders Rockstar makes more refined mistakes from their GFWL days.Continued refusal to add things the community would enjoy and dumbing down the content to seem more "kid friendly"Without support for server creation where people who want to mod can and people who want to have a "legitimate experience" can Rockstar continues to hurt everyone by removing game mechanics and features people liked trying to please everyone$23 000 steering wheels and in general really moronic in game pricestl dr please don't buy this game

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: After so many hours in this game I've come to the conclussion that without a moder giving you money or buying shark cards the grind you have to go through in order to get a CEO office a (at least) medium Warehouse a vehicle warehouse a Bunker and a Coccaine lab is literally H E L L. It is a gigantic enormous tremendous grind. Until you get those the only option you have for making money is to spam the pacific Standard heist as the host over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over and over again. It is an absolutely terrible experience with random people. The heist as well as the setups take around 2 hours to finish regularly but with randoms...no no no...forget about it. You'll just sit there all day and do a couple setups.However after you get all the businesses I mentioned above everything becomes so much more easier and actually fun. You do resupply and crate missions which can be done on your own and the only times when you might need help is when you're about to sell or if you want to get more supplies out of 1 resupply mission (more people more supplies in one run).Obviously everything new that comes out is overpriced as hell. You will soon realise that most of the cool new vehicles and new armed vehicles that get released with every DLC are pretty much useless since they cannot be used in heists just freemode. Unless you find griefing useful then all the new stuff that gets released is useless. On second thought the only use they might have is when you use those vehicles to protect your cargo when selling or resupplying but for that to happen you need at least 2 more people to operate the vehicle.The anti cheat is dreadful an utter disaster bans innocent players removes legitimate money and when it comes to bans and other similar stuff R* support is as supportive as.....emmmm......something not supportive at all.The only reason I'm giving this a thumbs up is because it is very fun with friends. Like I said above if you are playing on your own you will soon realise that since the new vehicles that are being released are pretty much useless then so are your grinding efforts. Unless of course you grind just for the fun of it (which I do which means that it's not a grind at that point just missions for fun).Finally a word about the story mode It s amazing!!P.S. Buy this only on sale.

review: I thought the story mode for this game was absolutely amazing but the online unfortunately ruined it. The online is basically like story mode except with other players and some additional features. Everything is overpriced so 3 options apply. You grind your existance out to make some money (still not enough) buy shark cards (Rockstar's cash grab) or get (intentionally or unintentionally) modded money. None of are 'good'. The third may well get you banned. The online community is toxic and full of cheaters. The security measures rockstar has implemented has unfortunately banned innocent players myself included. My first ban was permanent. FIRST BAN. Not even a suspension. Just a permanent game ending ban. I picked up modded money unintentionally. Given their security measures are nowhere near perfect you also can't appeal bans. Awful support too when it comes to bans. If you don't get banned congratulations! You'll enjoy more sessions full of cheaters and awful players who (with or without cheats) will try to ruin your game. I mean creds for beautiful graphics but the online gameplay is absolutely awful.

review: What's not to love about GTA V? The sheer scale of the game packed with so much minute detail it makes the mind boggle with how much effort and co ordination must have been requried to complete this masterpiece. And it's apparently never complete with continuous updates for GTA Online. Single player gives you many hours of great story telling and unique experiences. GTA Online is where the beauty of co operative team play shines. Missions are great but GTA Online's brilliance is bound by the amazing story driven Heists. Forced co op where multiple players usually performing different tasks either in pairs or alone with the succesful outcome dependent on all parties. It's just incredible occasionally frustrating and all together great fun. There's some other modes I've barely played any I'm sure they could be fun too...
