review: The fact that any PC version is sold later than the console counter does not surprise anyone today. It's the case that consoles often take precedence. However the game is getting old very quickly even in terms of technical advancement. A few months' delay is not yet a reason for pouring tears but when it comes to games a year and a half ago it may be different. However theoretically the long publishing process allows us to hope that the PC version will be improved. The title of the title which due to its popularity however hit the tins is Grand Theft Auto V. Rockstar Games crew is not a skin to share information about their products. It is not known whether the PC version was in the plan from the beginning or whether the decision was made only after some time in any case we have finally waited. What's more the very high notes they've received from the console versions even for a moment did not let GTA V forget about it and they even tightened their appetite for the series.Unlike previous Grand Theft Auto parts in GTA V you can control not one character and three different ones. They are diametrically different and perfectly complement each other. Franklin is a young black street thief who along with a friend works for a certain Armenian owner of several car dealerships. Michael in turn is a retired thief who has already earned his living. Now instead of robbing banks he faces the problem of a faithful wife and a pair of non living offspring. Apparently it goes hand in hand with the crisis of middle age in signs also gives him an all encompassing boredom. The last character is Trevor a true psychopath unpredictable man. He used to work with Michael and their paths were split in unfavorable circumstances. Now he is trying to trade with metaamfetamine in one of the deadly holes in the desert inhabited by gangsters and a variety of suspicious elements. Even in such an environment people are genuinely afraid of Trevor. But he is not afraid of anyone and nothing. I do not want to give too much detail but I will say that this peculiar three will finally meet and will have full hands.ust Grand Theft Auto V is a mole. Rockstar puts the bar high for other studios doing action games. After this game nothing from this shelf will taste the same. Anyone who has a console and has not bought GTA V must fix this bug. Who does not have a console he has to expect that the port on the PC will leave the team with R * better than last ... Its just the best game D
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The game is still not dead you guys will see "Overwhelmingly Negative" on the store page but this is how we see this game Pros Simple Every little kid's to adult's dream Each mission has it's unique taste in the world that the characters live in LSPD FR Fast cars and futuristic looking cars Real songs like "Only Girl" "Umbrella" by Rihanna "Danger Zone" by Kenny Loggins etc. New SH*T AFTER GUNRUNNING UPDATE Free stuff for logging in Great story Good graphics (if you have a good GPU) Cons Best loading Simulator since the release date to 2019 A few less missions than GTAIV R* support (Online) Hackers/ or modders (Online) They will spawn anything from a fire around your character's hip to a ship in your garage... Money It's annoying to have everything so expensive in the game it's always going to be a problem... After Gunrunning came out a bunch of money was taken away After Gunrunning a modding tool was removed from "service" (But was resumed on June 23rd 2017)OVERALL This game is still not dead R* will come in once in a while to fix/ sdjust the game with its own updates the "Festive Surprise" update is here as of the Christmas break and a lot of people would enjoy this. The game yes will eventually become dead but its still going strong. Only problem is the loading time this needs to be fixed in RDR2 (when and if it comes to PC and GTAVI (6) if it comes out. According to R8 it will not come out if the 45th is in office so the game will NOT release until the term(s) are over.

Where were you when people were being harassed in online games? As long as we're buying shark cards you guys are all nice and dandy. I honestly regret buying those 2 or 3 $200.000 shark cards. I would even say that I regret buying this game but I was gifted it and I feel like it was the biggest curse ever. I wish I would spend those 70 hours on doing something more productive. Rockstar think about how you treat people. You're no better than EA Ubisoft and newly even Valve. Shame on you I once really adored your games.

After playing online alot and enjoying it with friends... once u reach the end of the "new" quests it becomes the same ol rubbish... free expansions usually are pvp which is mostly unplayable thanks to hackers and idiots... and a bunch of overpriced fun toys a casual player can hope to afford one day... as example a good missi rewards us around 20k in 15 mins ... these fun toys start at around 2 mills each and usually have between 5 and 10 mills prerequisite buildings/offices and so on u have to get before ur even able to buy these toys lolSadly an otherwise great online game I would have loved to enjoy with friends in closed lobbies and with affordable new releases. review: I've been a fan of the series especially for Grand Theft Auto V but ever since Take Two decided to illegalize modding I've been starting to loose respect for them as this massively affects player freedom as even I personally spent both a lot of time in Story Mode and Online but Story Mode gets bland after you achieve the 100% complention rate so I resorted to mods to get a ton of more fun from the game such as the LSPDFR mod as an example. Rockstar's explanation regarding OpenIV was that the software was used to cheat in GTA Online which is a huge false statement. OpenIV is only able to modify things within Story Mode what cheaters use for GTA Online is .DLL INJECTORS which inject the cheating scripts directly into the game as you load into GTA Online no Open IV involved.To me what this looks like is Rockstar Games being desperate for money as they want as many players to play GTA Online 24/7 as possible to get all of the Sharkcard microtrans cash they can which is really to the average consumer so they attempt to make singleplayer as boring as possible another key sign of that being the fact that most of the newer DLCs don't have their content in Story Mode.

review: I have been playing this game since it's original launch I went to the midnight release for the 360 and powered through story mode/single player and all it had to offer it for nearly a week. I played online mode the minute it was released suffering through the crippling server issues that it had. With all of the problems during it's launch aside I had an amazing experience. I felt this was really the first "next gen" game that I had the chance to play. The PS4 had launched shortly after in November and I awaited its release. Again I played this game religiously on the PS4 during it's debut.With all of the being said I pre ordered this game for the PC (the third time for me) and patiently awaited it's release. Thus far I am having an amazing time. The game is polished great fun and runs flawlessly on my setup. The heists are amazing and social club is integrated nicely into the game. My only complaint would be that I wish there would have been a small tutorial or side note stating how to access the social club menu and that friends/crews can be modified only via the social club menu.A note for the people giving it negative reviews For the people who cannot run this due to your hardware not being able to handle the game. Plain and simple you should have read the requirements. This game is graphics intensive and requires a PC that can handle it. I personally would not try to run this game on laptop unless I was running an i7 with dedicated video cards. For the people who are complaining about the crappy community. This is GTA. If you are looking for a peaceful hand holding experience there are many casual and team oriented games on steam that might suit you better. You can also trigger online solo play via the single player online options.For the people who simply cannot play this game due to crashes and other things that are beyond your control. I can understand your frustration and hope that the game will be able to be ran for you in the future. It really is a great experience and it would be shame that a rocky launch would sully the potential experience.Thank you Rockstar for another great game in a franchise that has kept me entertained since 2001. (GTA 3)
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Grand Theft Auto V is probably the most realistic and superb "open world" game there is right now. The world is filled with amazing environments that never seem to fail. The mountains for example are amazing and graphically pleasing. Playing with friends especially in an 'Invite only session' is truely a great way to avoid any trolls wanting to ruin your experience. Definitely the best open world game there is and multiplayer experience. Thought I've heard many negative reviews of the online community and Rockstar's banning system I can say that if you're hesistant towards GTA 5 Online and you're reluctant on the constant banning I definitely suggest going on a 'Solo session' or if you have some buddies a 'Invite only session'. An awesome game with the best adventure experience and the substantial amount of detail. As well really fun to play with buddies )

But the way it's looking at the moment don't even think about buying this for the online play.

review: A complete shambles from Rockstar games. You would expect a lot more from Rockstar. I thought they would have planned for success for this title on the PC but instead we are left with thousands of people being unable to play the game. My particular case is due to Rockstar having force linked my steam account that is linked to an incorrect social club account.I created a brand new account because I was having trouble retrieving my old social club details and was given a warning that if I tick the box that there will be no return. I decided to wait and try to gather my old details. I got my old details yay! But guess what!? I DIDN'T EVEN CLICK THE BOX and it has been linked to the wrong account... "Clap clap clap" Sarcasm? You're god damn right. Well done to whomever came up with the perma link steam CD key idea... Pffft I think you should at least receive a written warning from your employer.Now give me my 39.99 back so I can buy another copy and moan about it all again. P.S. DO NOT BUY THIS GAME GUYS they have completely screwed around with the background infrastructure and you will lose your 39.99... Technically fraud as you aren't receving anything useable...

review: Grand Theft Auto V is not only a preposterously enjoyable video game but also an intelligent and sharp tongued satire of contemporary America. It represents a refinement of everything that GTA IV brought to the table five years ago. It s technically more accomplished in every conceivable way but it s also tremendously ambitious in its own right. No other world in video games comes close to this in size or scope and there is sharp intelligence behind its sense of humour and gift for mayhem. It tells a compelling unpredictable and provocative story without ever letting it get in the way of your own self directed adventures through San Andreas.In my opinion it is one of the very best video games ever made.

review: The game has a superb singleplayer and an alright multiplayer mode to play with friends. Its well made and I had tons of fun with it in the past but I can't see myself telling others to purchase this game. The way the online mode is made to either make you farm money for hours in order to buy anything remotly fun is comletely insane. the game hopes that you will give in to the microtransactions. Furthermore the recent actions that the publisher has taken against the modding community combined with what was said in a recent interview with their CEO is insulting to the people who purchased their game we aren't meant to have fun we are a product and they want our money if we dont give them more money after the initial purchase then we can off. This kind of mentality ruins games (as shown by their god awful boring grindy online mode) and shouldnt be accepted especially in a game where people have already paid full price initially. It is purely unethical from them to treat gamers this way and to actively try and stop fun things just so they may have more microtransaction money. Dont buy this game.

review: TL DR I think this is a very good game imo though I believe in order to unlock the full potential of fun in this game you need to have friends to interact and play with.I first got this game on the xbox 360 and was amazed at the time as I have never seen anything quite like. Rockstar blew my socks off. As time passed I got it on the Xbox One and then finally once I joined the master race I was absolutley stunned. (2560x1080 with a 980ti) This game is absolutley beatiful and it is one of my favorite games in my library. The Storyline is one of great detail that kept me intertained for a long time. I personally enjoy to play online more but it is nice to go back to storymode every once in a while. The way that Rockstar have implemented characters from the campaign into online is another thing I love making the game not feel so different in online mode. As with most open world games you have the potential to do anything. And trust me everytime you log in it will be something different. While I do think the game is enriched when you are with freinds as almost everything it is better with freinds. The game although has included ways to stay intrigued playing solo and I often play by myself. The two problems or gripes I have with this game is one the evident problem of modders. Whenever you are in an online lobby (public) there is a pretty substantial chance that you will come in contact with a modder. This is kind of a double edged sword though and some modders are cool and will make it a fun time with them. On the other hand though some modders ruin the experience for others by killing them all and making the game literally unplayable where you cannot move your character. The one other problem I have is that Rockstar has made this game so based around moneywhere players who buy sharkcards have in an advantage in certain things. While others have the ability to buy those things it would take a ridicously long amount of time. Overall I love this game dearly and I would not trade it for anything. I have learned to deal with the inconviences and once you are able to do that you are able to enjoy a wicked game that will continue to make you smile for hours on end.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V... One of the best games of the past 5 years and is greatly enjoyed by many. But like most games people find ways to tarnish and ruin players experiences. I myself feel that my gameplay mainly online has been comprimised not just by players but by rockstar itself. Rockstar has done a great job at packaging and delivering GTA V and GTA Online for the last 4 years or so but I now feel that they have become slack and sloppy with their newer updates. For example the Executives and other Criminals update has added exciting new items and modes into what was already a well planed game. However it also brought with it some major set backs. In game $$$ is the first one that comes to mind. Everything added is just a way for those select players who dedicate hours of time playing the game. This has made it extremely hard for new players to make their way up the ranks as VIPs have now got personal bodygaurds and heavily defended vehicles. Having these over powered and expensive items has also brought in a huge amount of hacking and cheating. Some new players or players who have been playing GTA Online for some time and are not earning the big ones have turned to hacking as a way to get these luxurious items that everyone wants. Players are now also using hacks like God mode and teleportation to troll and grief other players. Dont get me wrong the storymode of GTA V is well planned and the featuers that have been added to the game have made it the biggest GTA Franchise yet. But if you are planing on purchasing this game prepare yourself for living hell when it comes to multiplayer.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

I feel ripped off honestly... it was a fun game...

review: I didn't originally want to get this game but was strongly urged by my friend to get it when it came out on the PC. I'd never played a Grand Theft Auto game before but had definitely seen gameplay before and had been interested in the series. Ended up putting 100 hours into online the first week I had it. It was such a great open world experience with friends. Alone however the game ends up stale and with not much to do. I wasn't a fan of the single player in this game. I'm sure the story is great but after playing 100+ hours of online the story mode just felt too lonely and empty for me so I couldn't get into it. Even with friends though the game certainly gets boring after a while when all you do is the same set of stuff over and over. The game doesn't get nearly as many content updates as it should have and that to me is enough to make the game feel slightly half even though they did a phenomenal job with the rest of the game. I definitely recommend this game though.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Despite me not recommending this game I do love it very much. Probably my favorite video game of all time I have close to 980 hours on xbox 360 and over a thousand hour on xbox one. I recently got my new graphics card and got GTA for PC. It's a great game I have quite a bit of time put into it on PC as well but it has SO MANY PROBLEMS.If you want to play GTAV go for console. I know you can't get mods and all that but seriously you're only going to regret getting it on PC. I've had to reinstall it at least 4 times due to errors that kept me from behind able to play the game at all. This wouldn't be a problem if I had standard internet and GTAV is a game that's over 60GB in size. Taking nearly 2 3 days to install it's the most aggravating feeling when you find an unfixable error.Rockstar Games has awful support I have a lot of respect for them but honestly they're technical support is just dreadful. I had one error with the game at one point where I reinstalled the game reinstalled rockstar social club nothing would work. I actually REINSTALLED WINDOWS just to play GTA and again I'm already having errors and what does Rockstar Games tell me? They say "Pleasae reinstall the game to get rid of these errors".It really is a great game but you're just going to end up beating your head against your keyboard until you slowly die from internal bleeding. I have never EVER been more frustrated with a video game in my entire life.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I've been playing and enjoying this game for more than few months on and off finished main story and some side missions I am glad that I've bought this game.So I've tried GTA online for like a week and so completed every heist and some mini games it was the best and worst moments because you do get loading screens often I mean you'll have to wait about 3 5mins to GTA online then if you're playing with someone you will be leaving the session which mean loading again then again to rejoin one of the friend's session. Therefore everytime you join a heist or mini game it takes about 2 4mins depending on the server and players bad thing is you will back to loading screen again once a player left the heist that's what annoys me because you have to literally drive back to your apartment and start a new heist you know invite people again and wait for it to load again! Shouldn't be like that it has no or little help with good system great SSD and CPU won't get faster loading time.What's breaking the game is when you're trying to do your progress hackers will come on and kill the game what I've seen so far hackers drop booms to everyone money hack god mode teleport hack etc..I would still recommend this game on single player mode which is finest game they've made by Rockstar although I hope they will fix or change something on online mode matter of loading moments or hacks. 9/10

review: To start with I'll say the only reason I'm not recommending this game right now is because it crashes consistently on Windows 10. Otherwise it's a great game and I suggest picking it up once Rockstar gets off their asses and fixes this. I'll also update my review at that point too.The game starts and runs really well but will eventually crash within 5 30 mins. I've tried compatibility mode for Win7 and Win8 and running as admin with and without compatibility. The bigger issue is Rockstar's response to this problem is that they don't support Win10 and to roll back your OS. Now I agree installing to a brand new OS on release isn't a great idea but the preview ISO was available for nearly half a year and all my other games run fine on Win10. It's ridiculous this is still an issue after so many have reported it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: 10/10This game is amazing this "PC Port" is worth every penny I spend on it.I see a lot of negative reviews here and I really don't get why.The performance is amazing it runs many times better then GTA4 did and it looks astonishing.After playing only a few hours I must admit that Rocktstar did a really good job on the graphics and the optimization.It may have been delayed a couple of times the end result is worth all the waiting.Sure there are a couple of people with problems performance wise and the online servers are crowded right now but this will all pass in the coming weeks.You know the story the gameplay etc. but most people want to know how this game runs on the PC and so far it runs excellent better then any tripple A title I have seen in the last couple of months.I could write a long story on how amazing this game is but I really want to play more at this point )Thank you rockstar for making this game the experience I could have only dreamed for on the PC.Maybe at some point in the future I will include more info here for now all I can say is I recommend this game more then most other games for this price tag you are missing out on a amazing adventure otherwise.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Even though the game was released a couple years ago to me it still one of the best game ever. I recommend everyone to buy and get this game. I have finished the single player story once now I have started a new single player game again and it didn't bored me even a bit.GameplayGTA series were well known by their freedom of gameplay in the big open world. GTA V get it to the next level great crafted world lively city and the beautiful ocean everything is so great. GTA is the mixture of different game types open world action game is the best description of it but it still create a great racing experience flying experience and interesting minigames. It also introduce the new 3 main characters system that work so great.CharactersAll the 3 main characters are so great. However I have to give the award of the greatest character to Trevor. The design of Trevor character is so interesting and make me feel so excited. His unpredictable actions with such a sensitive heart were a wierd but strangely harnomized combination. The other two are also great I love playing as Franklin he really remind me of CJ from GTA San Andres. Michael is also interesting.

review: I didn't think I'd enjoy this game much as I was thinking it was going to be another flop fail like APB was. Granted most games fail due to cheaters and toxic community. Anyways I am very much enjoying the game GTA Online I havn't played the solo part at all as I'm not really into Single player games unless its gamecube. The only complaint I think I have is the party system theres no way to make a group or party and thats really annoying when the load times are forever then you have to re load forever again to get on the same session with your crew or friends. If they had a good grouping up option this game would be so great and I'd probably play it way more then I do. Due to the long loading and the frusterating group setup I can't give this game 10/10. It gets 7/10 from me. The community is only so so its full of idiots who try and act tough but seem to forget that its a game and acting tough online is about as logical as well lets put it this way acting mean and rude dosn't make anyone look cool makes em look stupid and pathetic. Community for the most part is stupid and pathetic. Every once in a while you meet someone worth gaming with though and it's really fun. I recomment playing with friends as its very fun that way. There is alot to do and things to interact with. Humor in the game is great. Overall score 7/10

review: We live in a day and age where society is quick to point fingers at everything else except the actual problem. Every time something violent happens in the world someone somewhere instead of pin pointing the actual problem blames video games. Especially this one or this franchise in particular.Well screw that. It's games like this that allow us all to do some pretty f'ed up stuff we wouldn't normally do that keep most of us from doing violent things in real life. Thanks to GTA I'm not out there banging hookers or running them over in my car. I'm not killing random amounts of police just to see how many more will show up to try to kill me. I don't run my car off the bridge to see how many barrel rolls I can do before I hit the ground or to see if I can land on the wheels and ride off in to the sunset like the mofo'ing badass I am...... seriously..... countless barrel rolls and landing on the wheels and driving off that's beast what up suckas?!?! Try that in real life.... DEAD!!But I digress. If you want some good clean.....err umm....bad dirty dirty violent borderline psychotic fun at the end of your hard day in real life. If you want something to blow off steam that won't put you in jail for acting out those road rage thoughts you had when that dill hole in the Audi cut you off on the freeway during rush hour this morning. If you don't want to be plastered all over the 5 o'clock news and labled a psycho just cause your way of blowing off steam was a mass killing spree for no apparent reason.... then GTA V is for you.So grab this game!! Get in there and start doing the f'ed up stuff you know is in your head! It's in there trust me I see it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The 2 year Beta test on consoles was definetly worth the wait for GTA V the game is nothing short of amazing and immersive. Driving on keyboard is easy movement is smooth and the HD graphics are such that i couldnt even try to describe them here. Well deserving of its ratings on meta critic and accoladesThe online experience i wasn't happy with trying to coordinate with friends to meet up after 1 was stuck in the tutorial was a nightmare with no option to create a clan within the game itself. I needed to physically go to social club website to create one a obvious oversight.GTA online still seems abit clunky compared to the single player experience. however if you finally manage to begin a heist with your buddies without one being left behind its incredibly fun and challenging.Overall GTA V is a big contender for game of the year for me even with the 2 year wait and delays Rockstar did deliver.Heres looking forward to a great yeat in game titles!

review: I've been playing gtav since it came out on ps3 over 5 years ago. I got it on ps4 as soon as it came out and dumped another 100 hours into the game. Finally I bought it on sale for pc and it was the superior version of the game simply because of the ability to mod. I beat the story twice and it was good. My only complaints on single player are 1. how hard maintaining your custom cars can be an 2. Rockstar has neglected to add any single player content to the game. I ONLY recommend this game if you wanna play single player with mods. If you're coming for the multiplayer STAY AWAY. I've invested over 150 hours easilly and I can say the most fun I ever had in that entire time was messing around with new purchases with money I got through duplication glitches. Actuallly making money in this game is a RIDICULOUS GRIND and Rockstar knew exactly what they were doing when they made it this way. The biggest payout you can make on the hardest heist in the game is $5 000 000 and thats after you've gotten a A good car $1 000 000 $4 000 000High end apartment atleast $800 000New DLC Bunker atleast $1 300 000A bunch of good weapons $1 500 000The average payout of missions and races in this game is $20 000 if you're lucky. OR you can do what Rockstar really wants you to do and take a big dip into their sweet sweet nectar of MICROTRANSACTIONS. Microtransactions have ruined gta online. Everytime Rockstar adds content it's around $20 000 000 worth of content and you know what $100 of REAL MONEY gets you? Only $8 000 000. It's goddam highway robbery. Like paying $100 for a glass of water in the gold rush the ingame economy is completely screwed in favor coercing a select few into dumping hundreds of dollars into ingame content. It's just sad and it makes me scared for any future online implementation Rockstar comes up with. It's everything wrong with the game industry and why this game has less than a 70% review. TakeTwo the company pulling Rockstars strings doesn't care if this game leaves any legacy behind they made their cash grab and proved microtransactions are the most profitable way to do it. They recieved little more than a slap on the hand with some negative reviews while they're rolling in money. In retrospect all those hours I dumped into gta online were all a waste. The community is full of hackers and modders and all the regular players are ABSOLUTE CANCER of humanity. Most people will kill you on sight to boost their K/D and all the most fun content is gated behind microtransaction paywalls. If it weren't for duplication glitches I used back in the day to get a bunch of content I would have dropped the game AGES AGO. It's just sad how fun and fulfilling the game could have been if it weren't for the pure greed behind the terrible ingame economy of this game.TL DR You wanna just have fun in gta5? get it on sale and play single player with mods for one of the most fun games on pc. You wanna have fun with other people? You're SOL with gta because Rockstar would rather gate of content with ridiculous pricing in order to push microtransactions and make the game a boring grind.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA V is a stellar game that I would be proud to put forward as the representative for games in general. The story is fantastic the characters are great the dialogue feels natural and is well written the controls and movement are really nice the driving is good the graphics still hold up amazingly the world is a perfect balance hilarious and ed the animations are soooo slick and just the general level of polish on just about every aspect is astounding. I've probably missed aspects that deserve mentioning but basically GTA V is a fantastic game that everyone who loves games should play. Nuff' said.Now GTA Online is a whole other beast. Upon releasing Online GTA V or Story Mode was basically abandoned. Promised updates were scrapped or diverted to Online and Story Mode was left to sit as this shining finished awesome work of art. But it was 'finished' which really stings. Once you've had your fill of Story Mode that's it and you know it because Rockstar and TakeTwo are too greedy to put resources into a less profitable game. And it is like a seperate game. Story Mode and Online are like polar opposites. If you come out of Story Mode with the splendor of what you just experienced fresh in your mind prepare for that memory to have the beaten out of it over and over and over again. GTA Online is the epitome of what bad multiplayer looks like. It took everything that was great about Story Mode and on it. Blow up someone else's car? Pay for it. Want to buy guns? Play the game for hours just to unlock the guns and then spend as much as a small house for ammo and sure. Want to buy clothes? $2k for a pair of pants.Kill someone? They go into passive mode and cant be hurt or hurt others. Want to do literally anything? Stare at a loading screen (with an ad for more that costs heaps) for five minutes each way and you're there. Want to swear at people? Text chat is censored. Want that awesome new car? Play 10000 rounds of stagnant repetetive 'jobs' or gamemodes (because anything more advanced would make less money) or pay $100 of real money and get enough Online currency for like 3 nice new cars. That cost doesnt include the apartment and garage you have to buy obviously.Do you want to do anything that isnt racing or shooting eachother? off. To become the CEO of a criminal orginisation is at least $1m of ingame money for the bare minimum which is barely fun. Biker gang? Same story. It's sickening. The only jobs people play are missions which are SINGLEPLAYER. Except for when a new iteration of the same comes out. Then you get full lobbies every ten seconds but only because of the cash and xp boost Online needs to get people to play their lame gamemodes.There is so much more that is just so fundamentally wrong with GTA Online that I could list but I'd need to play it to refresh my memory which I will never do. What you pay for when you buy GTA V is half masterpiece and half bloatware. If it goes on sale for 50% off go for it. You'll be paying for the only half worth playing.So all in all don't play Online and you'll have one of the best game experiences of your life. Otherwise I can't guarantee you'll like it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO FUN
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I love the GTA V Singelplayer Mode! (and only the Singleplayer) No Spoilers Here's the deal you can do basically anything in this game just like Just Cause but it feels very real.It's not solely you against the world with nothing but Robots but you can interact with any of the other people in this world just like you would in real life. Often times you find yourself facing real life scenarios such as a robbery a stand off or just driving around drunk or lost civilians and you can interact with them in different ways or just leave them. It's awesome.This game is so unique you can control 3 main characters with awesome background stories and totally different settings and morals each can do different jobs have different skill sets and own seperate businesses.However so far I do not like the Online Mode at all. Hackers toxic players Pay 2 Win System. I have played it for several hours but I couldnt get into it. I have put the game down for half a year just because I hated the Multiplayer Mode so much and just picked it up again for the Singleplayer and boy is it worth it!I recommend it for anyone who loves a great Singleplayer experience but I can't recommend Multiplayer at all so far.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I'm gonna be blunt the game looks even better then I recall it looking on the current and last gen versions. Running at a smooth 60 the driving is a very different experience and with the simple capture gameplay element along with being able to add your own mp3's to the radio it was worth a return. If you liked GTAV before then you'll love it now... if of course you're able to run it. My current build is a GTX 970 with a i7 4790k running at 4.0 GHz with 16 GB of RAM. On this I can run close to Ultra settings at a clean frame rate and I haven't had a drop yet. This game is well optimized despite the 65 GB install you can see why it's so goddamn big.

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Pros graphicly excellent fps mode adds alot to the game For the most part good port seemless use of controller and keyboard/mouse Director mode is a feature that will add lots of replay valueCons a few peopke having loading people (most people have no problems just a vocal minority) A few fps issues when on full greaphics even with high end cards minor camera control issues in fps (but that could me being an TL DR Great port (if it loads) highly recomend but turn down shaddows a little. The FPS mode adds a great new perspective that works perfectly with keyboard and mouse but have a controller ready for driving.For me this game works a treat. I have played the 360 version and this is deffinatly just as fun. The use of first person mode makes the game epic. Gun fights are better and more seamless with the ability to aim now a thing. I personalynuse a 360 controller and keyboard and mouse somi get the best of both worlds and i would recomend this. I'm using a nvidia 970 and the game is on near full graphics and well my fps is somewhere between 25 45 fps which would imply the game has a little work to do in regards to graphical bugs. Yes it looks tones better than 360 but not that much better i dread to see what 4k monitors look like in regards to full graphics. So i hope an update comes out to improve this. Either way the game looks good and super high quality shaddows are not hugely necessary and turning them down a little improves the frame rate alot.For those who have been having issues loading that gota suck and there is little i can say about that but it works well for me first time so I have to highly recomend this game and while it is technicaly a port its a fairly good one and think its worth all the money.

review: I have loads of memories of this game. Amazing single player. And trying to level my character in October of 2013 when the game got released on gta online on my Xbox 360. grinding survival missions for 20 grand a victory. I even remember getting a 100 million bounty set on me when that exploit was first found. And having to sell my whole garage to get most of my legit earned money as rockstar had removed most of it while trying to get rid of the exploited cash. I would grind gta online constantly all day every day. It was truly enjoyable. Then the pc version was released and i imported my character and didnt touch the game until CEO missions. And left because of the hackers rockstar failed to ban. I am loyal to this game and it was great back in the day. But after hundreds of hours of play the online got stale quickly repeating missions over and over. and getting killed by hackers spawning UFOs in.Great game ok longevity. But if you love the game as much as I did. You can admit it had its issues that rockstar ignored. I am scared to touch the game after reading the reviews of people getting hours of hard work wiped because rockstar are cucks. And I dont think unless they add lots of new content i will ever be going to be giving this game another go.If I could give this game a mixed review I would. So im just going to give it a 6/10

review: Six years after the violent death of her husband Amelia is at a loss. She struggles to discipline her 'out of control' 6 year old Samuel a son she finds impossible to love. Samuel's dreams are plagued by a monster he believes is coming to kill them both. When a disturbing storybook turns up at their house Samuel is convinced that the creature he's been dreaming about. His hallucinations spiral out of control he becomes more unpredictable and violent. Amelia genuinely frightened by her son's behaviour is forced to medicate him. But when Amelia begins to see glimpses of a sinister presence all around her it slowly dawns on her that the thing Samuel has been warning her about may be real.

review: I'm going to try and make this short ish.**I played around 400 hours of the game when I wrote this Singleplayer Amazing story and missions that I replay even to this day.Special abilities are awesome and gameplay is just amazing.If you have no internet this game is for you!10/10Online Well I notice most of the reviews are from people who got banned.From playing online mode for so long and being around level 120 right now I honestly have the fear of being banned for no reason. This should notbe a fear that I have if I do not mod/hack the game. I read other reviews and notice that they are exactly in my place right now 100ish level and a couple million dollars in the game. Why is it that I have the fear of gettingbanned for no reason while all the other hackers can easily roam freely without a carein the world? I think that there should be special servers for modding withoutupsetting those who want to play the game legit. Overall Online mode is fun butthere is a fear of getting banned for playing the game the way the creatorswant you to. I will keep playing this game but it is not right that R* is doingnothing about this problem.6/10

review: Having owned GTA V since 2013 on the Xbox 360 then purchasing for Xbox One and now for PC I can say I've had alot of experience with the game. I've played through the story twice once on Xbox 360 and once on PC however after that it just gets boring. The story mode isn't what keeps me playing.The main reason to buy this game is for GTA Online. It's amazing. Loads of customization options for cars bikes boats planes helicopters characters houses and now even yachts. Yes the prices are hefty and investing in a shark card will set you back but the ability to earn money with heists and side missions is becoming easier. One downside is that online doesn't allow mods. I was part of LCPDFR clan back on GTA IV which we used mods online. If there was some way to host private "freemode" servers seperate from GTA Online that did allow mods then this game would be even more amazingAll in all though GTA Online is the reason why you should buy this game hands down.

review: I was apprehensive at first but the launch went more smoothly than any other I've seen. Pre loading worked great. Even that small issue at the start with people not being able to play the game with them having "strange characters" wasn't an issue for me (The space in my username did not trigger any abnormalities)I can say as far as I am concerned that Rockstar delivered what was promised. I've had an impeccable initial experience and I pre loaded and waited for launch. Everything worked as promised.Happy to have spent the money even though Rockstar kept us the PC Master Race out of the loop until now. I'd say the wait was worth it.

review: *Pays $60 for another version of the same game 1 year later mainly for modding*Rockstar *giveth modding*Community "YAY WE CAN DO ALL THIS STUFF"Rockstar *taketh away modding* 0/10 "not enough modding"
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The incredibly hostile attitude of Rockstar and Take2 towards the PC community has led me to give this game a negative review. First GTA Online is a poor experience as it's a grind fest which encourages its players to pay for shark cards which buy you in game currency which is the goal of the experience. It punishes players who just want to have fun. They also insta ban people who have simple mods online. But most importantly they have sent cease and desist notices to OpenIV a modding tool for GTA games which is incredibly anti consumer. The modding community for GTA has been massive and has added life to the GTA franchise on PC. Being hostile towards modders is inexcusable when it's the reason when many players such as myself play this game. I get banning people who mod single player and then play online to an extent as you can't take any risk but this is just stupid. This won't affect cheaters on GTA Online as they don't even use OpenIV. You're just screwing with the average player of GTA. I won't buy your next product even if it is the best ing game ever because it's clear you guys are incredibly greedy and don't give a damn about your playerbase. If you guys can reverse order then I will gladly change my review. But until then this is my last Rockstar/Take2 game.EDIT They removed the C&amp D from OpenIV but removed a lot of mods that altered map assets. Keeping my review up because I don't think this is the end of Rockstar and Take2's nonsense with the modding community
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Modding has been an essential part of Grand Theft Auto since the very start of the 3D games (GTA III+). Killing mod support by issuing cease and desist letters is just despicable and a blatant screw you to their PC community. All in the name of getting people to play their ultra grindy Online mode that's filled with hackers and requires you to purchase shark cards if you don't want to spend hours on end playing the same thing over and over again. Keeping the above text as we can't forget about that.I've thoroughly enjoyed the game both single player and Online. Online does get very grindy and you will be tempted to purchase shark cards that's just the business model one I do disagree with. Other than that hours of fun to be had here.Luckily Take Two decided to reverse their stance on mods and allow them. This means that there are hours upon hours upon hours of fun to be had in single player.

review: The famous open world game GTA. GTA V did for sure bring great new things compared to earlier GTA games. We got Story ModeOnline with jobs of all kinds heist's or just good old free roam. Video editor with quite a bit of options to be within a game. SocialClub with crews friend list and the feature to share photos that you've taken with the in game phone camera.HUGE MAP!There are a buch of stuff in GTA V that you've not seen the previus games of the GTA series. Rockstar made a great job!The games looks very good with a pretty steady FPS (I have an AVG of 90 100 FPS on a 970 card) and that is so perfect when you take a helicopter and decide to just fly over the HUGE map. There are some BIG problems with GTA V too. Cheaters/ModdersNetworks problems such as server lag.For me this is game of the year (of 2015) and i give it 9/10.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I love the single player campaign on this game. The back stories of each character is very deep and the way the three come together is even better. After the missions I was left wanting more so I started playing GTA online. It's even better if you know a couple people who has it. There are fun missions and CEO and bikers that earn you a lot of money. I'm currently level 61 in the game and have about 140 hours in GTA online about 60 to finish the single player campaign. Not a letdown at all. Would absolutely recommend for anyone looking to have a whole load of fun or wanting to terrorizing a session with a Hydra.

review: After having alot of time in multiplayer I'm updating this review. What i can say is this. Right from the start you see this game is very optimized!! Runs like a damn dream and looks amazing. I run the game on all high and very high with advanced settings on and FXAA no SMAA at 1080p with 60 70+ FPS. Runs very smooth. The Single Player I haven't played much of but from what i did play it runs as good there. BUT the maltiplayer is where I have been addicted! Heist is just awesome and a challenge for you and your friends. Having to plan out you're attacks. Survival mod where you fight waves of enemies is like any other game. It's fun though and a good challenge also. Heist is just awesome and a challendge for you and your friends. Having to plan out you're attacks. Survival mod where you fight waves of enemies is like any other game. It's fun though and a good challendge also. PVP is pretty fun especially in first person only matches.I can finally kick prostitutes in the face in first person! 10/10

review: I personally loved the single player campaign I felt immersed and the parody/representation of LA was very enjoyable. The characters as well were very interesting. The multiplayer left so much to be desired though. It's as if they spread themselves too thin and didn't focus enough on the core fundamentals of multiplayer/co operative gameplay to the point where even though you know there might be good content to find you just aren't willing to trudge through the mediocrity to find it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Positives 1.Playing with three characters adds to the game. Swaping between the three in the middle of a mission was actually fun.2. Loved the chance to attack the enemy from different angles.Also nice that you can hang out with them by calling them up. The game looked great.3.I loved how the gangs. actually think when you get into a fight with them. In San Andreas they would just line up in a row and it would be to easy. I use to run around just to make it harder to take the lands.The gangs on this hide like they don t want to die. They come from all sides and even send their dogs.Negatives 1. I try to log and it tells me Activation of GTAV requires an internet connection.Thing is I do have internet and when I google this issue other people have experienced the same issue. Why should I even need internet to play offline.2.Have also had problems getting online when it does let me play offline.In game negatives 1.The gang zone is every limited. The Ballers territory alone was bigger than all the gang zones on GTA 5. The gangs don t cross turf. You never see them at war with each other.Not really a thumbs up or down more like side ways. Great game when it allows you to get on.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Runs great very well optimized now of course with updated drivers on 7850k. Now to to the gameplay its honestly the same than on console. But now including the major texture increase and the ability to play in 4k but where i noticed the biggest increase in from specificly ps3 and ps4 is load times. I mean WAAAAAAAAAAAYYYYY faster keep in mind only running of a 7200 rpm drive but i mean the servers for pc are a least in the loading respect they are much better. For those experiencing crashing google gta 5 crash fix batch files and you should be able to remedy if not fix the issue at least until rockstar gets its act together. All in all good game.

review: I have a love/hate relationship with this monstrosity of a "game". It's a fun and great game but it's a shame that the developers don't know how to keep the game even remotely functional. In an attempt to get rid of cheating they break the game more they take away mods they ban people who don't even cheat. The gameplay is fun and there is so much to do. I want to love this game but in the end you spend more time trying to avoid hackers and toxic squeakers than actually playing with friends. Speaking of playing with friends it is an absolute mess. It takes forever to load into a friends freeroam game much less try to go into a versus mode with a group. Getting together with friends is what I loved this game for and the developers can't even make that work. Find another game. FIND ANOTHER DEVELOPER. They don't deserve your support they don't deserve your money and they definitely don't deserve to get away with this steaming pile of trash. Another "AAA Developer" does it again.... 1/10

review: A few gamers worldwide have had an experience with the Grand Theft Auto franchise at some level. Whether it's from the bird's eye point of view perspective to the current industry trend that is first person.This franchise has definitely taken a couple of years of my life.From the Franchise debut to GTA 5's PC release (excluding GTA 2 and GTA China town Wars unfortunately).I've put countless hours into this series and enjoyed each and every sociopathic moment. Story (Spoilers) Micheal Townl.. I mean DeSanta Franklin Clinton and Trevor "TP industries" Phillips are the protagonists. Which brings variety to the gameplay with the new character switching feature a delightful addition in contrast to the previous one man army formula. Shouts out Niko Bellic!! It gives a thrilling dynamic to missions and the opportunity to use each character to their strengths and ability. Micheal with his Max Payne style slow motion gun play Franklin with his ronin driving skills and Trevor with his super saiyan rage where he can mow down whoever or whatever has a pulse.Micheal is your slightly beyond middle aged early retired bank robber turnt aspiring family man living with the odd midlife crisis. Franklin the youngster of the trio is your everyday gang affiliate / car thief with an above average potential. With something to prove. Not forgeting he also has a dog named Chop.Trevor on the other hand he's something else. I'd say that he's more nuts than your local peanut factory! Frankly He's the type of crazy that begs for the lethal injection. I do feel a touch of guilt considering that he's almost my favorite GTA protagoninst of the series. (Victor Vance baby).So Micheal is in debt to the boss of the mexican drug cartel.With his and his beloved families necks at risk he needs cash. A sexy amount of money at that.So long early retirement hello Heat the movie the video game. It's time to run some heists. The heists are easily the strongest elements in the story including Lamar with his punch lines.GamePlay The world that RockStarGames has created is phenomenal with stunning attention to detail a world that is seemingly living. The sense of immersion and atmosphere is superb the map is fair in size. From the dence city to the sprawling mountains various wildlife vast ocean and desert.Los Santos is a joy to explore. At your disposal are a number of vehicles from the all new submarine helicopters planes boats cars motorbikes and bicycles. Extending to in depth customisation options such as vehicle mods weapon mods clothing barbers and tattoos. There is a whole host of content on offer here that extends the gamplay value.However I am slightly disapointed by GTA 5's car handling Something seems a little bit off in comparision to GTA 4's driving mechanic's which were in my opinion vastly superior. The first person mode after tinkering with the sensitivity settings enchances the gun play giving the missions an added replay value. I'm Thouroughly enjoying driving in first person with fully functional speedometers exploring the world as well as when visiting certain gentlemen's clubs huh hmm. The LSPD Los Santos Police Department are hyper realistic in many ways although are more than a bit sensitive to your criminal activity when you're in isolated no witness areas like a mountain top. The music selection is on the weaker side in contrast to that in GTA 4. The Lab which is the PC exclusive radio station is a decent addition.PerformanceMany graphical options are availible that are on par with the excellent PC version of Max Payne 3 GTA 5 has kept up to standard.Texture quality shadows ambient occulsion ect. I'm having solid performance of 40+ to 60 fps with all options set to high on my 2GB Radeon R9 270x.For me Coming from the ps3 version which considering it's hardware was solid. To the PC release it's pretty.VeredictStory 75/100Gameplay 100/100Sound 90/100Graphics 95/100Overall 95/100

review: How the mighty hath fallen. What was once a sprawling city full of things to do has swiftly been consumed by pay to play mechanics that essentially force the player to purchase hundreds of dollars' worth of microtransactions in order to have any fun. All of the "free" content updates have been Online only and steadily increased in price until Shark cards are the only viable way to obtain the new items.The single player campaign until recently had been kept free of such predatory behavior now Take Two has threatened legal action against the modding community claiming it enables "cheaters" in Online. This in spite of the fact that the mods are singleplayer only. I cannot recommend this game any longer and will not be purchasing any future installments in the franchise.

Also I get maybe a few lag spikes ever 5 10 minutes which is no biggy and can be imporved in future patches!

review: Absolutely amazing. Everything is fun from the missions and heists that you do to the fun mini games that you can play like tennis darts parachuting and racing. What makes this GTA stand out most is its brand online gaming mode which enables players to play a wide variety of different game modes and earn levels and money. It's an incredibly polished game and a huge leap from GTA IV which was also an excellent game. If you're a fan of GTA you must get this. This is the culminating point of fun and the best sand box game ever developed thus far.

review: This game runs like absolute garbage. I purchased this game from gamestop for the PS3 and waited at midnight for it and loved every minute of the game on console. If I had a current gen console I would have re purchased it and waited at midnight again. That's what I attempted to do with the PC version. I have the EXACT reccomended specs and I get unplayable stuttering after 20 30 minutes of gameplay. The FPS will drop to literally 2 3 FPS and shoot back up to the usual 20 30. I should mention that when I first load up the game it runs a perfectly smooth 60 FPS but due to a memory leak that Rockstar has yet to adress or even acknowledge exists it gradually drops until the stuttering starts. Every update they release seems to make my playtime drop about 5 minutes. It actually got slightly better after they removed the junk code designed to keep mods out of multiplayer but they've updated it about 5 times (as of writing) since then and each one has made my FPS worse. I wish I could refund this and get my wasted 60 dollars back.Update I recently upgraded my graphics card to a GTX 970 and it seems to have fixed every issue I had with the game except for one. Rockstar's horrible customer service. I still haven't gotten an answer to my support tickets submitted in the above review. STILL. I honestly can't recommend this game in good conscience simply because if you have an issue with the game running properly or not running at all Rockstar simply WILL NOT offer any support. After going on to their support forums Rockstar employee's are basically extinct and the only people answering questions are 10 year olds telling you to 'get good' or 'fix your toaster'. Even submitting a support ticket either gets you completely ignored or told it's your computer's fault even though it probably isn't.If you're 100% sure your computer will handle this game fine then by all means do what you will but if you have any doubt in your mind that it will run stay away because you're not getting any support here.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Review Note Ignore the negitive reviews Don't listen to the roumers This review is 99% honestReview Hello people of steam i am writting this review to show you guys how good this game atchauly is. The game was $35! That was the perfect time to get it.We also read about hackers and framers getting you banned. The best way to get away from this LEAVE! I have met a few aimbotters it was bad. But there can also be good people. Modders arnt the end of the world they can make your GTA experience fun!Now for some PRO's!If you have ever played on consle and if you are wanting it on the PC Get it! It's worth it! The controls are smoother everything is better to use not a lot of lag (although that depends on your computer) The game is stable enough for mods as well!If you have friends on here go online! review: I overall enjoyed this game in single player both on pc and console but not so much now. I found that the cars had to much grip for my tast so i used the slidy cars cheat code for better handling in my opion. One day the code made cars undrivable after an "update" and rockstar seemed to not be fixing it. It seamed that all they care about this game now is multiplayer. In single player cars still disappear from your garage if you use auto save they broke their own cheet code and most recently the game refusees to run at 60 fps (no its not my card the game is only calling for about 50 percent of what the card can provide and doesn't matter what display settings i have).So i try online multiplayer and get hacked so i had to deal with rockstar for a day to get back my login information back. I look into this problem and see that their online gameplay security is so bad that any person with basic computer skills and the game can pull and decript your user information if they played with you. So make sure you have differnet password for this then anything else.So online is a bust and singleplayer is broken time to turn to mods so i can enjoy singleplayer. Well not so fast now Take Two (Rockstars Distributer) has sent an Official Cease and Desist letter to Open IV which is the backbone for GTA mods since GTA 3. And Open IV does not have the time and money to fight the legal battle so they have agreed to shut down. So yes if you want a game with broken single player (in my opion) with continued glitches that don't seem like they plan to fix. Or a multiplayer where they are basicly makeing money on people making micro transactions and you can get hacked basicly by anyone in a basement with a computer than this is a game for you. Personally I'll go back to GTA 4 see below for the links for Take Two vs OpenIV and the Petition to overturn it.Take Two VS OpenIVhttp //gtaforums.com/topic/889348 take two vs modding/Petition to save Open IVhttps //www.change.org/p/rockstar games save openiv

review: General Pros Fantastic graphics runs very well Free updates with good features Cons Very long loading times (SP and MP) Freezes often on my System when driving around or starting missions for a couple of seconds I have to cap my FPS to 30 otherwise my CPU will always run on 100% usage Car handling is really unrealstic Controls are really spongy on PC (expecially in menues etc) You have menu loading times (Like when quitting the game you have to wait several seconds to accept it because the game needs time to load the accept button)Singleplayer Pros Very good Story characters are authentical Long playtime and very much fun with sidemissions Singleplayer is fun itself even when just derping around Cons AI is sometimes really dumb just hiding 90% of a fight behind the cover Driving AI is dumb aswell driving sometimes into your car without any reason etc. Police is unrealistic und unfair on higher pursuit levels (they randomly spawn (sometimes visible) exactly on your route) Some enemys can hit you through walls and sometimes they like to have a kinda aimbot so they can hit you in distance in a boat or carMultiplayer Pros Makes fun to derp around with friends or do some missions together Cons HACKERS everywhere had not even one single lobby without a hacker i recommend solo/friend/crew sessions Income/Outgoing Rate is way to low you get way to less money to be able to buy the good things in GTA Online (I can really understand why so many players are hacking money) (Example You get 15k average per job and around 50k 200k per heist and with the elite challenge 10M once but a Yacht costs at least 6M and good cars ath least 1.5M) Multiplayer gets really fast boring you have to do the same missions again and again. Same with Heists. Same AI Cons in MP Multiplayer is bugged as f*ck several timeouts crashes long loading times contacts not calling network lags Annoying contacts Lester is calling me everytime even when i cancelled all heists. IT'S ANNOYING!All in all I can't recommend the game anymore. It's fun to play the Singleplayer because the campaign is just great and for around 20 50h the multiplayer but then it just get's annoying and boring.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: This game is great! I played it on the 360 when it first came out and I have to say that getting it again on the pc was a great choice. The game has really improved from the 360 version. It looks beautiful with max setting. I get about 45 to 50fps on max settings (check out my profile for all my pc info) which is still better than the 360. First person mode is really cool and the scenery is awesome. Also something that I liked is they put in even more good songs into the radio stations los stantos rock radio is the best haha. Last but not least hiests! If you are on the fence about getting this game I'd say go for it even if you have played it before like me on the ps3 or 360 it's so much better on the pc.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA 5....Easily the best game I have ever played. The role play in this game beats any other the graphics are amazing and you can do literally everything You can just wonder in a store and do a stick up go and join some races or even do some jet fighting/races customize your own character to the pinnacle of customization freckles dimples wrinkles size eye color. Then if you are feeling up to it you can even change your make up hair style literally everything. The races are fully customizable to however you want them weather cops own vehicles or basic vehicles. There are events like the $10 000 000 challenge if you complete all heists with the same team without dying once you all receive $10 000 000. Some of the downsides include connectivity issues there is a lot of loading and sometimes you can load for 5 minutes and then get disconnected or if you attempt to join a heist and it's full you have to wait a few minutes of loading. therefor I say do your best to not mess up the mission when you are in one because if you mess up means more loading time and it gets annoying. Also hackers Rockstar seems to be on the ball with banning them but there is a lot of them only yesterday a guy was blowing things up and everything he blew up turned into money bags was quite funny but the day before someone got angry at me and repeatedly killed me I tried to kill her but I did 0 damage she even ran towards me unarmed as I shot her and nothing happened and she killed me with her fists it was funny but at the same time very unfair.

review: GTA for my over 1000 hours 300 of those hours have been modding singleplayer. And that was so much fun and part of the reason I bought this game on PC. But now Take2 has decided that OpenIV is whats making it easier to mod online. OpenIV is one of the main tools used in modding GTA V singleplayer and now that it's "illegal" about 70% of all mods have been taken down and can now not be used at all. Take2 has screwed anyone that bought this game for modding. They say they did it for the betterment of online I'm paraphrasing. But Take two is just trying to get more microtransaction money from shark cards by pushing all the singleplayer people into online which has pretty much become a pay to win type of game.

review: I can't believe how greedy the publishers and developers are. I'm just blown away. The developers of the popular modding tool known as OpenIV have officially received a cease and desist from Take Two Interactive (the publishers of GTA V) forcing them to stop distributing their software and killing off a major portion of the modding community in the process. Anything that requires modding the game's archives (car mods texture overhauls etc) is now impossible thanks to the publisher's insatiable lust for f*cking over their paying customers. Countless people have bought this game just to mod single player. After putting about 500 hours into online I decided to move over to modding since the pointless cash grab updates lost their shine years ago.The online community is slowly dying. Take Two knows it and they've realized that the updates with overpriced super cars and convenient 10% off Shark Card sales isn't enough to bring online back. Because of this they've decided to FORCE you to either play online play vanilla single player or uninstall the game. I'm going for the last option.How greedy can a person possibly be? The developers and publishers have made more money on this game than I'll ever see in my entire life and they still feel the need to f*ck thousands of people over just to wring the last little bit of water out of the moldy sponge known as GTA Online.The most frustrating part is the fact that I've bought this game 3 times. 360 PS3 and PC. I've spent $180 total buying copies of this game and I know many of others who have done the same but our opinions don't mean sh*t. I'm done supporting Take Two and I'm done supporting Rockstar. They stopped making good games 7 years ago anyway.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Um. Yes this game is one of the best games I've had the chance to play to date. I've played a lot of games. The sheer amount of things you can do in this game is phenomenal. For me I only play online which does have its setbacks but theres a whole single player campaign which I hear is pretty good too. The level of immersion you can get in this game is excellent. Want to play tennis? Sure they got that. Want to race cool cars? They got that too. What about guns drugs and killing strangers of course! Now the biggest drawback for online is the money. Everything is terribly expensive and it's very difficult to come by money. Not impossible just slow and tedious. I believe they make it this way so that you'll buy money with real USD but that's pretty much status quo of the gaming industry nowadays. The bottom line If you want a game with a hell of a lot to do looks great plays swimmingly and is an overall joy to have this is the game for you. There are flaws but they're not significant enough to ruin anybodies day.GLHF Make that Money! twitch.tv/thethinktank

review: Hey I might not have the most hours but I can make an honest review to help someone outThis game is awesome the story mode is awesome I completed it completely when I got banned for a month (i'll get back to that) and enjoyed playing as trevor and running motorbikes into the strip club and killiing them all and the police can never find me. The CEO Missions are awesome motorcycle clubs are fun I've not really done races as if I wanted to do a game for races I would get Beam.NG drive or something similar. the messages to join theem are annoying but it doesn't matter.Going back to my being banned for a month I was a noob level 16 and had thought that modding was ok so I shot this guy some dms for his mods and surprisingly gave them to me. It took me 3 hours and 6 minutes after I logged off to get an email to say I have violated the terms of service and have gotten to Level 70 legitimately through heists and CEO missions so I have no complaints apart from the fact the Cheating system has been good for me (but as far as I can tell not as good for other people)If theres one thing I hate the most is those jets who fly around trying to kill you when doing missions and vehicle missions (even though its allowed but its still annoying) and I think they should be allowed to do what they want but the level 4s who do it and just sabotage by crashing into you is annoying but if you've got a hydra and paid money to do it what shows you are sad and have nothing better to do its fine by me just I would think it would make more sense to get the jets from fort zancudo shot down every time they leave the airfield (as it mainly happens to me most of the time when I try to get payback) but thats just my thoughts.Personally GTA is a great game lots of bugs (I was loading for 4 hours once and it crashed . ) and loading screens. but its a great game. looking forward to the next game

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA has been a favorite series of mine since the first game. In those days it was very convenient for party play pop in some cheats and hand off to the next person when you died. Nobody did the missions except if you were the only one playing. This trend continued on into 2 and 3 where multiplayer either did not exist (or on PC couldn't get it to work easily) or didn't matter. The real first experience with multiplayer I had was Multi Theft Auto for Vice City. From that moment on the dream of multiplayer GTA meant stupid impossible feats. San Andreas reached that peak in singleplayer but lacked multiplayer beyond co op (sad). GTA has many capacities for GTA V you have to take the game as two seperate parts delineated on borders of functionality. GTA Online is to a lesser degree an excellent game however the reason one would play GTA Online is because singleplayer after finishing the story becomes a dull boring affair with little of the emergent content present in GTAO. That emergent content however is dull too once you've become accustomed to it. If you have imagination GTA (any GTA) can be enjoyable.I will discuss both GTAO and GTA V in each facet to help you determine whether this game is a heap of dog crap or a brilliant postmodern mockery of sandbox games. First of all GTAO has microtransactions and it is stupid. It goes against everything imaginable for a decent company like Rockstar to engage in this nonsense microtransactions are a nuisance and a micro economy of fake money injected into games using your real money. It is unscrupulous and unethical and I think this personally that it is a great albeit evil business model. GTAO might be preying on stupid casual or lazy players who suck at GTA are 12 and have mom's credit card or weary married too young males who work a lot and just buy their way to success in P2W games. Still endorsing a Dave and Buster's style microeconomy of optional pay walls to content is tantamount to encouraging it even if you plan to gain marginal sales on their Shark Cards (they made a lot of money actually).GTAO and singelplayer suffer from the same gameplay issues that every GTA eventually runs into GTAO makes up for lack of minigames and activities by always adding more content over time. As of yet singleplayer is dead due to no new content injection. A major change to the gameplay is the quality of graphics and the new viewpoint. The first person view adds immense icing on the cake of new graphical fidelity which puts the game far ahead of any competitor. Even when textures look like runny jpeg slosh the after effects and great breadth of options mean that even without texture modding the game will look fine for quite a while. GTA IV is still getting new leases on life because both games leave a lot of room for personal taste for modders to eventually exploit and manipulate to get more intensive graphics (yet to be seen but the game just came out). The lowest generation versions (PS3 and 360) were quite bad looking washy textures and terrible aliasing abounding but the games still had excellent visionary quality for that generation's horribly gimped graphical power. It's quite an achievement that even on low settings the game is functional functional is the least I can say for games since the last big sandbox games I played a lot Black Flag and Watchdogs were pretty... pretty . They were functional messes at their best and glitchy contorted eppileptic siezures at worst. GTA V on PC still has glitches (though I have had few pop in issues) and crashing but it's far more stable than many multi console port/mish mash games I've been uncomfortable playing.A major issue I have with these games that is GTA V's various versions is that as updates and content have been implemented there is a major difference between singleplayer and multiplayer driving/handling configurations. Cars go slow or faster depending on the patch and there's awful discrepencies even in Online alone between the lag you experience when I do normal missions in full servers on this PC version I rarely experience floating cars and pop in. Now in every Heist related mission there is lag pop in invisible cars and fgloating cars dropping in on me. Consistent with PS3 (my previous generation version) Rockstar expends a lot of energy issuing small one day patches that clear up exploits and glitches but not ones that functionally break the game! No! They focus on exploits and hacking related to people griefing or making money (taking away from their Shark Card revenue) or duplicating cars. This goes hand in hand with contentious still approaches to "bad sports." I have never even been fully on bad sport lobbies but I hate that you cannot avoid it. Accidental car destructiuon happens constantly. GTA IV had many of the greater qualities that made fan created multiplayer (especially SAMP) so much fun in other words we need to stop having draconian rules about personal vehicles. Implement a server list so people can implement rules like "no cops" or "no personal vehicle insurance claims." Being able to ban or give tanks to players outside of missions would be a plus more control of the lobby like free mode would make this game immensely better! GTA IV multiplayer was enjoyable yet I do not want to give up new ideas like persitant weapons or personal vehicles but insurance and whatnot is so superfluous and pointless that I cannot stand it. I get it Rockstar! Sticky bombing peoples cars in a game about robbery and murder is a bully behavior (from the guys who made a great game called BULLY). The soundtrack is excellent though a lot of wierdness comes from the ambient soundtrack. I just wish there was a seperate soundbar for just THAT ambient music. The roster of artists is very good varied large. One feature I wish would one day be added is updates with new music after launch... a pipedream I know but GTAO is being built on a longterm profit and update model. As for the sound effects they are superb. The game has a quality more like GTA IV where I don't hear a lot of the sam pedestrian dialogue but it also falls in line with an overly serious tone the game takes (no quotable dumb pedestrian lines).As for story and this is my final topic I can only be brief. There's many elements to the characterizations and the cast that makes the game a compelling GAME and not some cinematic experience. There are definitely moments where it goes over into that territory but often this is temporary and is pointed out. We are not given characters that fall down under examination or have no criticism from the world beyond police and an antagonist. There is self deprecation and there is deprecation from these characters' families and friends. As for the preachy left wing/right wing saoccer mom/social justice warrior critiques of this game's treatment of LGBT topics this game is incredibly fair and kind to everyone involved. Major themes critique the protaganists their society and the enemies that motivate the main characters. You're going to feel sorry for things you do. I don't know how this is any less a story about reluctant criminals than the previous in 3 it's forced revenge to deal with a romantic betrayal. In Vice City it's forced independence to escape your betrayers. In San Andreas it's forced everything by everyone often because of their crimes and weakness. GTA IV was about an immigrant dealing with America forced to flee his past. Now we have three protaganists fitting these previous games (Franklin and CJ Michael and Vercetti Trevor and Claude).In closing I give it a number out of a number.GTA is still hectic even if you don't like the HD era. It's a ing parody of its own meaningless plagiarized movie plots. Online is fine and good even when it disappoints... you'll still play it. And where's the co op R*??? WHERE?!
