review: "Do you like dags?" The joke fell on deaf ears. I turned to Corey and exclaimed "There are a lot of different types of dogs in this game." Seriously. Pugs Rotts Shepards. I have never played a game that took the time to actually render several different breeds of dogs rather than a lame color swap.The word immersive is not an adequate description for this game. I played it on PS3 for a few days but my old hands cannot aim on controller I lost interest quickly. Being able to drive with a controller and swap to a mouse and keyboard setup without touching a menu is genius. The game runs smooth as butter on a mid range system. With an i5 3570k 16GB and a 680 GTX I can pull 60 fps in mostly very high settings. Nary a stutter or pop up tree or building in sight. I spent 40 minutes just driving around obeying the traffic laws listening to Fernando give me his views on Feminism. I haven't heard the same repetitive crap from the NPC's that seems to plague other open world games what I like to call the "arrow to the knee" problem. This is the first game in a long time that I feel completely justified in spending sixty dollars on. Here in America talk is cheap. Even so buy this game. I like it so much I wasted time writing a small review for you.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: I haven't fully played a grand theft auto game since Vice city. My friends have been raving about Grand theft auto 5 and I was on the fence about it because I outgrew the game and wasn't my cup of tea anymore (I was wrong).I took a chance and bought it and wow I do not regret my purchase one bit! DThe world looks beautiful (granted if you have a decent pc rig to play it) the game mechanics are pretty fluid missions are creative and the story is fantastic! I was never really interested in the story much for the past GTA i've played but this one has gotten me hooked. The characters are very memorable and well developed you can easily connect with them at all times.I haven't ran into many bugs (yet) in the main story mode. The online experience so far is so so. The open world and missions that you do are pretty fun against other players. Although it gets really laggy and glitchy often whenever I play with some friends not sure why this happens but it does kill the mood a little bit. Overall though it's decent but if you're in it for just the online multiplayer portion then I would probably wait a little bit until things get fixed and optimized. Again that's just my experience I would do a little more research about online experiences from others before purchasing.Honestly with that little negative asside I could go on and on about how awesome this game is but that would turn this mini review into a book. If you don't mind the violence (lots of) swear words drugs etc...Then this is a game for you and a must buy D

review: This is a great game tons of great content and amazing physics I end up just driving for hours because of how well they have made the driving experience. Slowly they have been adding more and more content and gradually making everything more expensive they finaly add a way to make a decent amount of money/ hour but it is extreamly repetative and honestly kinda boring after months of it. But thats not why I'm writing this review.I'm writing this because Rockstar has decided that they can/ will take your money whenever they want. I've been grinding away at the Import/ Export missions for a few months getting my bunker going ect.. I've been in servers with modders but I havent received money from them in almost a year (been killed by them though...) and my money was adjusted shortly after. After months of grinding I login to find that my money has been adjusted in the days leading upto 'smugger's run' Rockstar took $2.4 m and left me with 150k. I love this game I want to keep playing but now I'm afraid (becasue it seems being in a lobby with a modder is enough) that I may lose the money I'm saving to by cool I'm fine with them taking money that was modded to me but taking money that I worked for...Instead of punishing all the players that get money forced on them from modders fix your anticheat.

review: I bought 6 copies of this game from steam and 5 from GMG for family and friends to play with. Out of those 11 copies all work but 2 of them but its just my luck that the one of the two non working copies is the one I am using. I have tried every thing listed on all forums and support pages to fix my issue but nothing works an open ticket from rockstar in an attempt to fix the issue as well but still my issue is not fixed. I can play the game for random amounts of time before the game simply crashes on 2 of my computers and its the same symptoms on both machines. The game running with settings changed from extreamly low to as high as you can set them to test the issue and it crashes no matter what setting even safe mode crashes. I doubt that this issue is something to do with my equipment and I am finished jumping through hoops for support teams with all the uninstall reinstall disable enable rollback restore none of it works. I am convinced that this issue will be corrected with a patch and now I will simply wait until they decide to start looking deeper into the issue on thier end instead of looking at my msinfo file and trying to correct it on my PC. I have over 500 games and this is the first one to have this issue with its persistant crashing I have yet to trouble shoot any other game as much as I have this one and the biggest bummer for me is that when I do get to play this game for the brief amount of time in which my PC works with it the game plays and looks absolutly amazing I have no other game in my library that can touch it. I am hoping they can find a fix in an upcoming patch to fix my issues with this game so that I can enjoy it but until then I will just enjoy listening to my friends and family I purchased the game for enjoy it and focus on thier positive experience with it. review: A wonderful living breathing world that has quite a nihlistic cliched story bolted onto it.The radio stations are pretty rubbish the character creator is flawed and there's still a bug mountain but then there's those moments of sublime beauty where you're sitting shooting seagulls by the beach as the sun goes down and you realise that sometimes games can combine the best bits of books TV and films into a very personal experience.Just don't go looking for it in the campaign which seems like outakes from Sopranos + Breaking Bad + Bad Boys.Overall a game to enjoy on your own terms I just wish the NPCs weren't quite so cardboard.

review: Before you hack in this game hear my tale. I bought the game. Played the campaign for a while. I was a good man. Innocent. Then came online. Me and a buddy played missions together. We were dirt poor. My only car was a ruiner with tier one upgrades. Then one day a chrome rainbow lighted bus fell out of the sky. A man wearing gold rimmed sunglasses and white leggings covered in a luxurious fur coat stepped out of it. He took us and a few other players into the usually inaccessible FIB building. He whipped out a minigun that sprayed bags of money for all to enjoy. He filled our bank accounts to the brim and we flew around in the bus for a little while but after that he vanished. With our new supplies of cash from the friendly modder we bought top quality apartments juiced up sports cars and the most expensive outfits. We were living like kings. Then the money ran out. We tried to contact the wealthy gentleman from earlier but we couldn't find him. So we went to Youtube. We almost immediately found a flashy new mod menu. One that could give us powers like the stranger had. Within a day we had millions and every new car with all the best upgrades. We gave stacks of cash to noobs. We were gods. We even fought other malicious modders who wanted to ruin everyone else's experience. We had become greater than the saintlike flying bus driving stranger we had met so long ago. Things were great. Then came the ban wave. We had gotten so used to the laissez faire nearly completely non existent anti cheat that when I logged on to see a "Banned for two weeks" message I was stunned. No problem I thought. When the ban lifted there was already a new injection based modding method released. We went back to business. Bought the new yacht and all the latest sports cars. And then another ban wave. This time it was for a month. After a while I was inevitably permabanned. I bought another account. The cycle continued. Recently I got my friend's account which I had been borrowing banned. Rockstar wiped all of his characters. Completely reset his account. He was extremely at me. I now have to get him back all of his the hard way. Just because I wanted to be like the charming modder who stepped off the silver bus that one faithful day. Learn from me. Don't hack Grand Theft Auto V.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Best game ever! I never get bored.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: GTA 5 is simply a masterpiece presented by Rockstar to the gaming industry. The graphics are simply immaculate the ragdoll physics is almost fullly realistic no more strong pushovers to pedestrians like in GTA 4. The story although it has certain elements from various movies is still adrenaline pumping and the revoked combat system makes the spine chill. The vehicles are love and unlike GTA 4 the handling of the vehicles is realistic. The damage physics is also like in real life as tyres get bust after drifting. The activities (Hobbies and Pastimes as its called) are interesting and stress relieving. The sky and sea floor are quite detailed and convincing enough and the first person view is cool as the head rotates according to the situation. The director mode is fun if you're not interested in doing any mission or playing with any of the protagonists (sorry console peasants). #PCMASTERRACEThough I did not like quite a few things in the game. The AI is worse than GTA 4 especially the cops who kill anyone instead of arresting them. If you want to gain unwanted attention the quickest this game's perfect for you as the cops can smell you from anywhere if committed a crime like ANYWHERE. The traffic AI is also poor though this reflects the real life attitude of Los Angeles's citizens while driving. Overall I rate this game 10/10. Definatley recomended for anyone. Great.

review: +Probably my favorite single player game in the GTA series.+Crime man black crime man and angry crime man are very cool characters and the way the game has you play as all three working together is pretty cool+GTA Online is fun for a while. Not much to keep you playing after you beat the single player game as there hasn't been any new content released. The grind on GTA Online is terrible. It's way too hard to earn enough cash to buy all the cool they keep releasing leading to the next negative point. Shark cards are the devil. All the good new vehicles online are so costly that it's almost as if they've made the grind so awful that people will want to purchase their Shark Cash cards. Take Two/Rockstar seem to not be fans of singleplayer modding. In short buy this game if you really want it but dont waste your money on cash cards otherwise they'll continue to try to milk as much out of you as they can.

Tons of online modes and much progress in the way of ridding the game of hackers which was a problem which came up quite often early on. The recent addition of stunt races and so many new vehicles it's hard to keep up has kept me interested in the game long past playing through the hilarious and Tarantino like storylines which weave through eachother in surprising ways.Check it out really great buy.

review: Runs at a consistent 60 fps with very high textures using my 4gb 770 gtx and an i7 4770k at 1080p. I was a little worried that the PC port would run poorly even on modern hardware like GTA IV but it seems to be very smooth considering it is a port. The settings claim to require 2300mb of vram so I'd imagine having a graphics card with only 2gb of vram won't be able to run this at max settings simply because of a vram bottleneck. Invest in a 3gb+ graphics card or settle for slightly less than max settings. The game is beautiful at high resolution and high fps. This is a much better experience than my original playthrough on the xbox 360 when it was first released.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Yes
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: SIngle Player Good story. Probably kinda underwhelming compared to previous games but it's not bad pretty entertaining and has some variety. The world itself is fantastic detailed and was made with a level of attention that's usually unseen and it's probably one of the most convincing open world games that I have played. It's almost impossible to see everything that the city has to offer. Anyways to keep it short ok story but fun with an amazing world to explore. Could be a little longer tho maybe. Also special mention to the cast of the game because the actors did a really good job portraying the in game characters.Multiplayer It's a mixed bag. I haven't had issues as other players but as any online game with plenty of people the griefing cheaters and kids screaming on mics is to be expected. But...if you get some friends to play it's truly a way way better experience specially for heists and other activities. Racing is fun (for me at least) there are some modes that are quite entertaining and earning money is not as hard as some people think if you play the weekly 2X Money and RP activities you can earn a lot of cash in a couple of hours. Lots of customization also from vehicles to the character.Also I have fun also just driving and doing dumb stuff on the world trust me that's also a pretty fun way to enjoy the game rather than playing exclusively missions. The constant updates are also decent because they kinda help to keep the game getting stale.TL DR A pretty decent game overall with plenty of replayability but mostly better with friends if you wanna play online.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: The only way I can state this is that Grand Theft Auto 5 is a brilliant game. Massive open world ready to be explored containing countless locations to have enjoyable and exciting firefights the new freemode update takes full advantage of these locations by adding games like King of the Castle and Hot Property where players can hide out in buildings perfect for a shootout. The amount of detail in the vast open world is amazing especially the dynamic props (because face it no one would get anywhere if you couldn't drive through signs). Many ways to obtain money not just in missions. The ability to attain cash just by having fun in freemode makes it a much more enjoyable game than if you had not been able to. Rob stores take out bounty targets or just stab the guy that just used the ATM. All these factors make both singleplayer and multiplayer great ways to spend a few hours.I've seen lots of people complain about the amount of hackers and glitchers in public lobbies as well as those who drive around killing people randomly. I admit that sometimes I go on an airstrike killing spree in my Hydra but that's once every two weeks or so. Most lobbies I go in the kill feed is almost empty and the only players I see getting killed are those taking part in a freemode event or just a few friends having a gun fight. And while a lot of people say that there is a ton of hacking in the game I see less hacking in GTA V than there is crime in real life Los Angeles and if you think there is indeed too much hacking you can still play in private sessions or singleplayer.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: A surprisingly good story line. I had never touched the GTA series until this came out on PC and once I started playing I fell in love with it. I'm not someone who enjoys shooters and super violent games that much but this game was too brilliant to pass up. There's a huge open world with tons of things to do all the protagonists are very likable and constant action. I have yet to touch into the realm of online play but I'm sure I won't be disappointed the offline mode is pretty worth the buy anyway. Also it has some great humor.

review: Grand Theft Auto V the GOAT!I've been playing GTA nearly every single day since it was released back in 2013.I started playing it on my old but gold XBox 360 which was obviously overstrained by the high requirements that the game demands. However I didn't really care about low resolution all I wanted was playing GTA V.Then when it was eventually released on Steam I instantly spent the full amount of $59.99.At this point I was extremely hyped cause it was indeed an upgrade from 360 resolution to full hd.Believe it or nah this particular hype is still existent. As I mentioned earlier I nearly play this game every single day and it's great that Rockstar keep on working on GTA Online constantly to deliver us fresh new content at no charge totally awesome!In the end I can certainly say that I definitely recommend GTA V to everyone out there even to those who have never been into any GTA. Just give it a shot I bet you won't regret it.*EDIT*There's recently been a lot of negative reviews since mods got banned from GTA 5.I don't like this decision either however it was probably made for a good reason so just accept it and stop hating obviously the game didn't make that decision.*Have fun doing crazy stuff with your friends in Los Santos and surroundings Josh

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Thought it was great at the start although over time it became very clear that it was a MASSIVE cash grab. Playing online everything costs an extreme ammount in comparisson to the ammount you can earn. Queue Shark cards. This game is designed from the ground up to make you want stuff you can't ever afford it would take hundreds of hours of grinding gameplay in order to buy a yacht for example. By the time you've made the money? Theres a new chain of missions which require you to buy a certain type of building. Fun times get grinding again peasent. Or just give rockstar 30 and get your cruddy building "Fun" right?This all in all was tolerable. As much as I hated it I just bought sharkcards and had fun it. But then the rogue ban robot happened thousands upon thousands of players got permenenetly banned 3 of which were firends of mine that I regularly played with. The only difference between me and them? I bought shark cards they did not. I'm 99.9% convinced that they would not have been "accidentally" banned had they been pumping money into Rockstars pocket like so many of us do. Upon asking support for evidence of an offence one friend was actually insulted and had the phone put down on him Good job Rockstar support! Top marks there. Everywhere you go online you say you are wrongfully banned and you are told you are lying. Well I'm not banned but my friend was and he's not a cheater Rockstar know he's not a cheater but they probably just expected him to re buy the game and start again. Guess that's punishment for not buying shark cards right?!I've not played GTA O since this. Not one bit and now.. the great news that they are completely killing the modding community which will make the game no fun for me in singleplayer either. Good job guys you managed to make the best game ever into something so so terrible.TL DR Rockstar will ban your friends kill the game for you then insult you on the phone. Find anything enjoyable and make it borderline impossible to do unless you either A spend 200 hours grinding or B Give MONEYZ.They are destroying the fun I had with my small community of friends and recently decided to destroy a community containing thousands of people which is why the games reviews are crumbling histarically fast.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Edit The devs have tried their best to backpedal but the damage has been done already and the community's view of the company has worsened. The review will stay negative because there are major gameplay flaws with the game The worst problem with the game is that there is little to do You can play missions around with friends blowing things up while chasing each other and then do heists. The game becomes a grinding simulator for one vehicle that is a 5mph increase over the last. Racing is just a roll of the dice to see whether you'll get an to knock you off the track screwing up any chance at a win. Combat doesn't feel heavy enough it's too floaty and unbalanced. You don't feel challenged fighting players it's just a matter of who hits the other player with an RPG first. There just isn't anything to do after the first dozen or so hours.I'll keep this here so people understand what happened.Devs claim to support mods then threaten mod makers with legal action a year later. Nice t you just pulled there Rockstar &amp Take Two rethink your position as a game company.If you really wanted the community to be happy you wouldn't target a harmless modding platform. Your method of thinking follows as such "people own metal we love metal workers! terrorists exist oh no terrorists use solids so ban all solid objects everywhere!" Anarchism makes more sense than your guys' goal here.TL DR Devs are hypocritical s who claimed to love mods only to essentially ban them a year later.

I have heard from my friends that some of them do not have the same issue as I do so I am quite curious if any other of you guys out there have the same issue as me because I really experience great discomfort and cannot play the game anymore and just wish that I can play without any lag. Is my graphics card the problem or is there some sort of bug/glitch in the game which causes lag for no reason. Someone please explain but over all the gameplay would be an 8/10 but after 40 minutes 2/10. This game still gets a positive but I will not play this game anymore if Rockstar does not fix this issue. If you have read this whole thing thank you for your time.

review: Syphilis is a sexually transmitted infection caused by the bacterium Treponema pallidum subspecies pallidum. The signs and symptoms of syphilis vary depending in which of the four stages it presents (primary secondary latent and tertiary). The primary stage classically presents with a single chancre (a firm painless non itchy skin ulceration) but there may be multiple sores. In secondary syphilis a diffuse rash occurs which frequently involves the palms of the hands and soles of the feet. There may also be sores in the mouth or . In latent syphilis which can last for years there are few or no symptoms. In tertiary syphilis there are gummas (soft non cancerous growths) neurological or heart symptoms. Syphilis has been known as "the great imitator" as it may cause symptoms similar to many other diseases.Syphilis is most commonly spread through sexual activity.It may also be transmitted from mother to baby during pregnancy or at birth resulting in congenital syphilis Other human diseases caused by related Treponema pallidum subspecies include yaws (subspecies pertenue) pinta (subspecies carateum) and bejel (subspecies endemicum).Diagnosis is usually made by using blood tests the bacteria can also be detected using dark field microscopy. The Center for Disease Control recommends all pregnant women be tested.The risk of syphilis can be decreased by latex condom use or not having sex. Syphilis can be effectively treated with antibiotics. The preferred antibiotic for most cases is benzathine penicillin G injected into a muscle. In those who have a severe penicillin allergy doxycycline or tetracycline may be used. In those with neurosyphilis intravenous penicillin G potassium or ceftriaxone is recommended. During treatment people may develop fever headache and muscle pains a reaction known as Jarisch Herxheimer.In 2012 about 0.5% of adults were infected with syphilis with 6 million new cases. During 2010 it caused about 113 000 deaths down from 202 000 in 1990. After decreasing dramatically with the availability of penicillin in the 1940s rates of infection have increased since the turn of the millennium in many countries often in combination with human immunodeficiency virus This is believed to be partly due to increased promiscuity prostitution decreasing use of condoms and unsafe sexual practices among men who have sex with men.In 2015 Cuba became the first country in the world to eliminate mother to child transmission of syphilis.

review: The story is great but online has so much grinding and microstransaction incentives that it will leave you amazed that this isn't an EA game. It can take you hours to earn what can be lost within short periods of time. Also the modders are the worst. Usually they terrorize the server instead of being creative or generous with their mods. The microtransactions cost too much so you may as well just mod it for you and your friends but rockstar usually bans you or at the least removes all or most your wealth and levels. The CEO feature is far too expensive and annoying with 15minute cooldowns for missions that don't pay that well given the huge cooldown and army of A Holes who will probably stop you with ease with the laggy servers and overpowered vehicles combined. Missions that reward well are purposely rigged to be harder than they should be causing you to become frustrated to the point that it can ruin friendships and cause many rage quits. Also boredom is a huge part of this game. You will find that you will either stop playing because of rage or boredeom or both no matter who you are. The Motorcycle club feature is cool for the president who can afford to make it cool but sucks for anyone else. It takes hours of resupplies just so that you can attempt to make money off all your invested time and money. To add more insult many of the motorcycle businesses are very rigged in favor of Rockstar's greed. Resupply costs a fee more than the product is worth leaving you with the only option of stealing it everytime. Stealing it would be fine except there's either no reward or barely any reward for doing it and it takes several resupplies just to barely make any product. MC businesses cost an arm and a leg and take forever to do anything even when fully upgraded and fully supplied unless you can somehow maintain a full motorcycle club for an extended period of time such as many hours. Also if your business gets too much product the game will probably just take it all away from you making those 15 to 25 resupply runs you did probably by yourself a total waste of your time. Heists are terrible as they take too long and are too easy to fail. The only way to even do all the heist challenges is to basically cheat by using a combo of karuma miniguns food and bodyarmor. Even if you do well at mowing down the ridiculous number of enemies that stand in your way there's still a good chance you'll fail as there's a high likelyhood that as your rushing through that an enemy will spawn in directly in front of you or another heist group memeber with a shotgun leading to an instant death even with full body armor maxed stats bulletproof helmet and full health. Races with custom vehicles lack any form of balancing leaving you with the only choice of buying and customizing all of the best cars for each class of vehicle so that you can stand a chance at winning the race. Although it's nearly impossible to have a fully customized vehicle for each vehicle class since they cost a lot and require a high level and several challenges to be completed which a NOOB will be unable to complete considering how the game is now unless they were to cheat with mods or microtransactions. Also it's worth noting that this game is actually quite old now and still has more bugs than anyone could ever count. The bugs would be easy to overlook if it wasn't for the fact that these bugs can lead to situations where you buy a multi million dollar vehicle only to have the game or servers go down leading to the money being taken from your account but the vehicle not saving to your account. Some gltiches are simple like going in Motorcycle clubhouse only to have it crash leading to over 5 minutes of waiting until you can get back to where you were that is if that session is still even available for you... Also it's worth noting that MC presidents must pay a recurring staff fee that can easily be 9000 per business per game cycle which further hurts your MC business' profits. Also the best vehicles in the game cost way too much. To get a a karuma insurgent hydra savage and sports car it will be well over $10M which can take centuries to afford without microstransactions prior wealth modding or other forms of cheating. Also it's worth noting that the controls are mostly garbage as key binding and controller bindings will often feel awkward to use. Examples include selecting your weapon while in any vehicle(especially any motorcycle in the game) swimming flying while shooting and anything to do with the phone ringing or pulling up the camera. Also you might have serious issues with the microphone working since mine hasn't worked since I had this on Xbox 360 and that includes just hearing them talking as well as you talking. The online aslo feels lacking as many story features are not included such as wildlife road construction random police chases with npcs random small events and radar detection police. Also the online has the worst story telling. If it wasn't for the story mode you'd be left feeling like this game had no effort put into the online's story as you will hate any and all dialogue in the online even if it's your first time hearing the dialogue and not the thousandth time. Many of the most expensive items in the game are simply not worth even a fraction of the cost leaving you with yet another incentive to cheat. Then there's Benny's new car cutomizations. A feature that was supposed to be there from the start but was missing due to corporate greed and laziness so it got added later. Once it was added it featured 0 fast vehicles and basically no vehicles for you to truly love using for practical purposes. Later they finally aded some Benny vehicles worth liking but keep in mind benny customizations make the vehicle cost two or three times what it would've costed without it. People are not kind and are as opertunistic as humanly possible in the online leaving you hating everyone the second you join a server. In fact when you play as the MC president you can turn friendly fire off and you'll still find that without their being any easy way for other MC memebr to kill you they'll still find plenty of ways to annoy you as much as they can. So in the end this games best part is the graphics and worst part is all the waiting and annoying BS that is caused by people who either play or created this game. If graphics are the best part then that's kind of in line with IRL where nature tends to be the only thing that is pretty and innocent while man's creations are often hideous and destructive usually in the name of greed. Worst of all about the online is how it really is constantly tricking and manipulating you into thinking your going to make a lot of money only to find that it usually takes away your time and money. If you play this with random online people expect that they will not cooperate with the objective or you as they just continuously do whatever they feel like whenever they feel like it. Hard to blame them when any and all objectives that are more proftible than fun will make you want to rebel against the game's system and players. It really is the world most accurate depiction and simulation of California featuring many of your favorite and least favorite places stereotypes and general look. I would say that it's terible to have people yelling at the NPC's in this game except they really are just as stupid and annoying as actual Californians. Best part is how full of itself the entire game company state of California are. It just works. Except when the game isn't working because of the latest update causing you to reinstall it only to have it not work again leaving you to wait for a future update. Last but not least DO NOT USE THIS GAMES DEFAULT GRAPHICS. Whatver system you have it will not be setup properly at all not even close. Also Framerate dips to mid 30's even on the best systems with moderate graphic settings so expect performance to be quite random.

review: This game was great fantastic actually when it was out on the console and I was so excited to get it for my PC to play with my friends once I left the console community. The story mode is great fun filled with many missions and the classic GTA style killings and such but the three main character was an interesting change of pace. I do like the heists in the story mode which was another great addition. Overall the single player is fun but not worth the sixty dollars. What most people wanted from this game was the multiplayer experience and this is why I do not recommend this game.Multiplayer is complete trash. The server system is crap from there being no server browser (which is really annoying when the game throws you into a server halfway across the world making you have 3516 ping) to playing with friends and having them or you drop out for no apparent reason having to join back with no problem. The jobs are very repetitive and boring for they have not added any new missions to the game besides player made which are normally some weird objective just to gain max money and experience. Then there is the hackers or scripters or whatever they do to mod the game. This completely ruins multiplayer the free roam that used to be so fun with the crazy shootouts and car cases that has turned into players fleeing servers from this moders because they steal your weapons kill everyone in the server under a different player's name go into god mode and teleport to players and murder them left and right changing their bullets to explosive rounds destroying everyone's cars instantly or spawning in swat police with tasers that will tase you over and over again not being able to move. Then there are some that like to spawn in millions of millions of GTA$ defeating the purpose of doing those jobs and missions and heists that are in the game giving no value of buying the extremely expensive weapons and cars that many of us have gotten before this nonsense. I cannot play multiplayer anymore with my friends because they all have stopped playing due to this and there is not much point in playing anymore for me. I know many people wanted to get GTA to mod and I do not care if one mods in single player or even if Rockstar made mod servers which could easily be done if they added a server browser but now as is it is ridiculous trying to play this game. It is not fun anymore and if you planned to spend money on this game for the multiplayer and not hack/mod it is not worth it.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Update There has been a minor update to OpenIV. We still haven't heard from Take Two yet though so I'm not updating my review until I'm sure they weren't just allowing a token update while the sale is on before they force the OpenIV team to remove all useful functionality.There isn't any decent GTA left anymore. Endless releases of horrendously overpriced stuff designed to 1. cost loads of money and get players to buy shark cards and 2. get players to kill each other more (which friendly reminder EVERY DEATH costs you money in GTA O even if all your money is in the bank) using more and more expensive ammo and paying insurance payments on expensive vehicles needing to buy shark cards.Add to that that they just killed OpenIV to try and drive players who were having a good time with nothing other than the $60 they paid for the base game and I'm finally uninstalling this crap.Really at this point just wait for GTA VI. It's not worth $60 anymore and you'll just get suckered in to buying virtual dollars on virtual ammo.Update I see they've issued a cease and desist for a cheating tool Force Hax. This is telling. If their priority was to hit cheating they would have pursued that first. Instead they went after a tool that specifically is designed for single player modding to chase off the fun for people who were still enjoying the game without paying for shark cards.

review: (Summary at the end) This game is fun. It's been one of the most popular games on Steam for years and for good reason. But after actually playing through it the game gets really boring.The story is great. The transitions between characters is a little choppy at times but it still leads to a unique gameplay experience and a decent narrative. But after finishing the story there isn't much to do except go online and quite frankly the online mode sucks.In order to unlock about 75 95% of the game you must go to online mode. Dozens of weapons vehicles properties heists etc. are only available there. But transitioning into GTA Online is the biggest pain in the I've ever seen in a game. Right off the bat they ram you with stupid quests that prevent you from achieving the main thing that every GTA player wants Robbing banks getting cool cars and murdering players and NPCs. And if you skip through all the stupid quests then you'll have no idea what to do as random players shouting the n word run you over and mow you down with an Uzi. However if you do listen to the tutorials then they'll plunge you into the maddening mess that is the economic system. The economic system has the potential to be amazing Go on a heist use the money to buy a cool apartment start a company and do whatever the hell you want. But instead of being able to do this they put a bunch of obstacles in the way between you and that heist forcing you to slug your way through their races and survival modes and Adversary modes until you reach level 12.One of the worst parts about this is that they hype up level 12 to be awesome. They say you can unlock heists from there and they will lead you to believe that once you get there everything launches from there. But no it really doesn't. You still can't start your own heist until you own property and you can't buy property unless you join someone else's heist. Other people's heists are always available from a convienient app on your phone but as soon as you join one people will see your level 12 or below stats and think "Ew I don't wanna play with that noob" and quit. And as soon as someone quits during a mission it's over. You can't do any more. Not a single person at Rockstar has thought "Maybe we should put a bot in their place or something" like Valve does. The incompetence of other players and Rockstar developers makes it virtually impossible to get started in their potentially amazing game. Say you got lucky You joined a crew or a company and they provide a steady source of income for you so you can FINALLY get on your feet. The only downside being that you'll have to deal with the toxic GTA community which is composed of whiny nine year olds and creepy middle aged men with anger issues. (Sounds like the main characters of the game!) Naturally you're going to be better than a nine year old and you end up obliterating them when they try to gank you. Then being the entitled little crap that they are they're going to report you for hacking or greifing. And as soon as someone reports you you're banned from GTA Online. Now you're stuck with just the story mode which has as I said less than 25% of the actual content. Rockstar doesn't bother fact checking that you're cheating they just ban you. Their strict policies have made the extremely unlikely the impossible. Congratulations. And after playing on a few servers dozens of people have impossibly high stats all guns and a crapload of money on their third hour of playing yet they're not banned!And as if this headache weren't bad enough it's still sixty frickin' bucks. This 4 year old pay to play infuriating game is still sixty dollars. By the time Skyrim was four years old it was around twenty and Skyrim has WAY more replayability than GTA (Especially on PC). I get it they add new vehicles and guns and gamemodes a lot. But as I said before almost none of it is accessible! Sure the Tron bikes are awesome but you're not getting it without either another $600 to spend on the game a really high level friend or a cheat menu and a LOT of luck. Pros Good story lots of contentCons Toxic community awful economic system annoying quests crappy ban policyI see a few solutions to make the game infinitely better. A Update your ban policy. Remove the banning due to modding make it completely based upon whether or not you're ruining the game experience for others. Like griefing.B Remove the stupid level restrictions. Make it so you can start a heist at any level. C Add bots to heists.D Make an offline mode with all the customization features of online. I'm sick of playing as Franklin I wanna make my own character offline.E Quit making money grinding mandatory. It's so stupid and it usually ends with banning.

review: This is for single player only as I don't care for a cheater infested online 'experience' While certainly the best looking GTA ever (the colors are absolutely spot on) featuring a huge map heists Trevor (thx commenter) being the best GTA character ever still in the end I cannot fully recommend it and the so so story with the highly unlikely and incredulous partnership between the three main characters is not the reason why.So why not? In GTA IV one of my favorite activities was creating and watching chain reaction explosions by getting my vehicle on fire and planting it in rows of traffic waiting for the light to turn green. It was always alot of fun to watch the result without having to worry about getting relentlessly hunted by an ever increasing barrage of cops. In vanilla GTA V I've not once been able to do this. I had an elaborate idea of blocking off a crossroad with several trucks and rig them to blow but as soon as I exited the vehicle and tried to do the same on the other sides the truck simply vanished and traffic resumed as normal. I tried several other things in this way but the same thing whatever I would try to set up it would disappear. For a sandbox game supposedly offering freedom that is rather limiting. The traffic in general also seems to more rigidly (or more obviously) than ever follow a predetermined pathway. The in game mini games such as tennis and golf also aren't worked out well enough to hold interest for very long. The heists are also limited as you still cannot enter or rob just about any store you set your eyes on only some of them which is another limitation. As it stands the vanilla single player game pretty much begs to be modded in order to get the most out of it because in its original state it feels too much like an elastic shape that will immediately spring back into its original form after being pushed or deformed by you the bothersome player.

review: Score 4.5/10Total Playtime 35 hours. (+ 3 4 hour idling)Price I Paid $60Recommended Price/Value $15 $20**MODDING HAS BEEN BANNED. DO NOT SUPPORT TAKE TWO BY PURCHASING THIS GAME**Just a note before I continue into the review I have not played the Online component as I have absolutely zero interest in it. Grand Theft Auto V. Underwhelming and over rated. I have never before had to struggle to finish a GTA/Saint's Row title before in my gaming career but this one was indeed a struggle.Unlike past GTA titles where you play a single character you instead play three which you swap between. Franklin Micheal and Trevor. All their story arcs seem half finished as if there was supposed to be more content to fill things out but it was either removed or not put in. Micheal's character seems to be the only one with some real meat all the way through. Franklin seems to be there more so as filler between Micheal and Trevor's antics and fighting. Trevor's sole purpose seems to be shock value or for laughs. I'm not sure which 100% as neither are executed very well.Mechanics wise. The game plays like any other in the series after GTA 3. The main focus this time around is the 'Heists'. Some are interesting but how the story is executed into enabling these heists is rough. It also feels like you never get a solid reward that makes doing these Heists worthwhile other than moving the lackluster story forward.One thing I have to note it is a pain in the to make money. I have no idea if this is due to the Online component being the way to make funds or what but only by completing the Union Depository Heist at the end of the game do you have any real funds for vehicles aircraft boats modding building purchases etc.The radio doesn't capture the quality or amusement that it did in previous games which is a bit of a let down. This comes down to personal preferences though. So take that with a grain of salt. It is possible to import and play your own songs through the radio but I experienced performance drops any time I tuned to that station. All in all I don't see the big deal people have made over this. It's not worth the $60 $70 they were asking initially in my opinion.Even if you are a fan of the series I would recommend waiting till you catch it at a reduced price and on sale.

review: After Angering GTA 5 Fans Rockstar Releases New Statement On PC Mods UPDATE Rockstar and Take Two won't take action against single player mods but it's not quite that simple.Update A new update for OpenIV has now been released seemingly with Rockstar's blessing. It's unclear what exactly about it has changed to abide by the rules outlined by Rockstar and Take Two below but this appears to be a positive move for the modding community.Original Story The recent legal shutdown of Grand Theft Auto V mod tool OpenIV angered fans to say the least. Developer Rockstar Games has now released a new statement addressing its stance on mods and while there is some good news it still likely isn't what many people are hoping for.In a post on its website Rockstar reveals that it's spoken with its parent company Take Two and convinced it to avoid pursuing legal action against certain types of mods. "Rockstar Games believes in reasonable fan creativity and in particular wants creators to showcase their passion for our games " the statement reads. "After discussions with Take Two Take Two has agreed that it generally will not take legal action against third party projects involving Rockstar's PC games that are single player non commercial and respect the intellectual property (IP) rights of third parties."No Caption ProvidedThere are of course other restrictions as well "This does not apply to (i) multiplayer or online services (ii) tools files libraries or functions that could be used to impact multiplayer or online services or (iii) use or importation of other IP (including other Rockstar IP) in the project " the statement continues. "This is not a license and it does not constitute endorsement approval or authorization of any third party project. Take Two reserves the right to object to any third party project or to revise revoke and/or withdraw this statement at any time in their own discretion. This statement does not constitute a waiver of any rights that Take Two may have with respect to third party projects."All of this started when Take Two issued a cease and desist to the developers of OpenIV which is a tool that is used to power numerous GTA V mods. Take Two and Rockstar subsequently explained that this wasn't intended to specifically target single player mods and that "malicious mods that allow harassment of players and interfere with the GTA Online experience for everybody" were the real problem. The companies also said they were investigating how to "continue to support the creative community without negatively impacting our players." Despite this there was an outcry from fans who sunk the game's average user review score on Steam. Additionally a petition calling for OpenIV to be left alone has attracted nearly 77 000 signatures as of this writing.Today's statement doesn't totally clarify what the future of GTA V mods looks like. OpenIV would seemingly still be disallowed by these rules despite not directly targeting GTA Online. Rockstar told Motherboard that it's spoken with OpenIV's developer about allowing it to continue but at this point it remains unclear where things go from here. Gamespot

review: GTA V is two games in one A single player game with a storyline and GTA online named so for reasons one may assume to be obvious. As such this review will mainly focus on the online as that is what I have mostly played and why I purchased it. With that said there are obvious similarities in it and many of the things I will mention apply to both.In Grand Theft Auto you mainly start the game small Whether homeless or with just a small house there is very little you can lose. And from there you begin your adventure in crime and moneymaking. With what appears to be an anarchocapitalist society filled with well made backstory and world complete with multiple full series of cartoons mock TV channels(Better than real TV!) and radio stations. There is an internet ingame with plenty of often humour filled websites along with useful ones that you will find to be genuinely interesting on their own.In short The worldbuilding is top quality there is a lot of effort and attention in it and it shows that it was a great priority when it was madeIn contrast the controls are not very well thought through. Aside from the car and boat controls they are very clunky and questionable with movement being difficult to get right and taking cover means you will stick to the wall too long when you want to get going to other cover and you will not stick to cover when you actually want to stay in it. I've found the movement and cover to be questionable at best. Switching weapon is a massive pain and will generally not be viable unless you are not actively in combat. For airplanes and helicopters there is no joystick support at all.Following what they did right with vehicles is the damage model for cars. As may be expected from a GTA game the cars can be damaged destroyed and otherwise have their function impeded. Though it isn't massively realistic it is good enough to give you natural damage effects such as veering to the left or right or the engine beginning to break and give less power. It is then a shame that this will almost never show up in multiplayer unless you are a terrible driver because a thing that they clearly did not think about for the multiplayerNamely the balance. Everyone gets a homing rocket launcher no matter their level. This rocket launcher will destroy most cars in one hit and blows anything flying out of the air with a little aim and luck. This means that while you can put armour on your car to protect it from bullets your vehicle's function is more along the lines of "Has it exploded? Yes or no" than anything else. Similar for non vehicle pvp. You will be either dead in seconds or your enemy is dead no long firefights with players here. Pvp modes are a bit better but still often feel unfair. Much like this the rest of the online balance is out the window with many things costing a large amount of money and income being generally very low even for things with several millions of input needed to set them up. If you want anything more than just a gun and a random car you can still from the street you are going to have to actively grind for money or play for a very long time without spending on anything.The loading and in general connecting to the online servers for a first time in a session(Or when switching session) takes a truly massive amount of time though I have been told it is much less in single player I will still say it is unreasonably long You can go do the dishes and return in time to catch the end of the loading screen. Something I know because I've done that. I have no idea how they thought this was acceptable.With that said the rest of it is mostly good Sound and looks are pretty decent the map seems very nicely made with lots of interesting details and plenty of hidden spots. Someone seems to have thought about everything on the mapIn the end what really sells GTA isn't the pvp and fighting other people online. What is good about it is the single player the missions and the world. For online the one thing that is much more interesting than any of the official selling points is the fact that it is a world you can hop into with your friends and drive around together do a few missions or just decide to take everyone on a race go parachuting or even just play a round of golf. There may not be a real grouping up mechanic and there are a large amount of flaws in multiplayer but as just a world for you and your friends to hang out in and do whatever you want to do it does incredibly well.Worth full price? It's a rare moment when I say it is for something this expensive. But I certainly got my money worth and do not regret it. It has a fair amount of technical issues with it but the design is great for many things and there is almost always something to do So I would say it is.

review: Thank you Rockstar! OpenIV is back!I'm changing my review back to positive. I still hate Take Two but I respect Rockstar Games and that they care about their community and their own reputation.As for "real" review. This game dont need much advert its one of the best games out there. If you didnt play it yet you must try it. As for me story isnt that good (feels a bit unfinished imo) but the characters are great. You really believe them. They have their own life bagage. Man at some point GTA V story feels like a true Mafia game. Comparing to previous GTA games this one feels pretty much "real" just like Mafia. The online is pretty much "ok" except the fact that its a little bit empty (content). I mean yes there are alot of things to do but at the same time there is nothing to do. Its hard to explain but it feels like it has so much potencial in it but R* focused on wrong things. Yes there are great addons like Heists and Low Rider storyline but the other "global" addons like CEO and recent Bunker update they are cool to play in co op but you have to play it in open session versus other players and thats where its getting ed up. Its almost impossible to play. You take the objective and then there is some random dude with bazooka/minigun/hydra etc. etc. oneshots you and thats it GGWP. No fun in that.

review: Grand Theft Auto V is the latest (and thus far greatest) addition to the growing family of GTA. It has an open world of unparalled scope and the full freedom to do just about anything provided you can deal with the consequences of your actions. The GTA Online element is almost a small scale MMO in some areas and the experience of pulling off the perfect crime with some friends is what makes this game the best of the series.EDIT The following is written on June 23 2017 during the dark and bloody times known as the "Take that Take Two!" war. Take Two Interactive decided that mod support was no longer worth the trouble it caused and has banned the use of mods. How does this impact the game and make it worse?It doesn't. It's still as fun as ever (even moreso honestly) If you don't want to buy Shark cards... hey don't. It takes longer to grind out your income but the game is still a hell of a lot of fun and I still play it with friends. Go forth into Los Santos and make it yours.

Instead of taking the route of Bethesda and embracing the modding community they have decided to shun it entirely and in doing so they have destroyed what used to make Grand Theft Auto IV and Grand Theft Auto V some of my favorite games.I can no longer recommend this game due to the money grab it and particularly GTA Online has become. Had I known Rockstar was willing to take such a hostile approach to modding I wouldn't have bothered buying this game for a third time for PC after already owning a copy for Xbox 360 and Xbox One.I am greatly disappointed with Rockstar and Take Two they used to be the best.

review: Lemme tell you a story a story detailing one of the many kinds of people in the community ...One day while screwing around online I spot a level 80 on the map causing mayhem in his tank. I decide to have some fun with him and blow his tank up with an attack chopper. He respawns reorders his tank and continues his carnage campaign. I blow him up AGAIN just for and giggles. What follows is a not so intense battle between the two of us across the entire map (The server only has 2 other people in it). I kill him a few times he kills me some the score is pretty even. Eventually I get bored of it and run off to do something else thinking he'll be done with it.He catches up to me and snipes me. Respawn and he does it again...... and again... and again...I got tired of it and turned on passive mode. This guy a level 80 who thinks he's "defeated" me in some way scolds me by saying this and I quote "Don't with people you can't handle that should teach you." WELL I had no idea I was supposed to be taking notes!I a level 55 at the time ed around with a level 80 in his tank who consequently tried to make an example of me and my shenanigans to the other two people in the server who didn't give a The community is an abysmal melting pot of narcissists and hackers so bring a friend.

Well guess what I want to choose my own content I don't want to grind for days to get to that content and I don't want to wait a few minutes each time I try to launch a race/heist/deathmatch/whatever.

review: POSITIVES + Great graphics. + Good optimization for various systems.+ Single player has a good amount of content.+ Not just a crappy port you have plenty of settings to play with.+ Online can be great fun with some friend. + Free online DLC is released regularly.NEGATIVES No GTA MP Anti cheat is a terrible Hackers are everywhere. GTA Online pushes players to buy shark cards. Servers relies on player s connection speeds. VOIP is intrusive no matter where you are you will hear others talk.The game itself doesn t need much work single player is great Rockstar on the other hand are neglecting this gaming platform are treating PC gamers exactly like console players even though we have different needs and problems. Rockstar has not paid for any server and instead use a system were players host and maintain the server this may save Rockstar piles of cash but in return glitchy and laggy gameplay is not uncommon. Due to this the scripters roam wild and with the lack of a decent anti cheat these scripters are everywhere. I also feel like Rockstar is forcing users to play the game much like an MMO in which you have to grind heists over and over again to get some cash or you can just buy some sharp cards to save you 10 hours of your time.CONCLUSION If you were hoping to reminisce in the old San Andreas days filled with jet packs fast cars and fun community servers forget it. The game can still be quite fun and supply you with hours of explosive fun but maybe wait until for another year maybe by that time they would have implemented some of the core fixes that the game desperately needed.

review: Thanks you for ruining my favorite game. I think everyone else can agree with me on the fact that Take Two has no regard for their consumers before they take such reckless actions. They can only blame themselves for the aftermath of their decisions. I have no need to say any more on this subject because it would simply be redundant. It is my only hope that you can look at the effects of your actions before you take them because you clearly made a mistake this time. For those who still play this game or are thinking about purchasing it please don't give money to the corporate overloards at Take Two Interactive. I will happily correct my review as I hope everyone else will once this situation is resolved. However until then my game will remain uninstalled from my PC. I encourage other players and consumers to take the same actions. Thanks Take Two you really need to revisit the drawing board and get your act together.

review: Take 2 Interactive (Rockstar's parent company) has sent a cease and desist letter to the owners of OpenIV one of the if not the biggest mod for this game.Take 2 interactive has made an anti consumer move because they "are not making enough money off of the game." (they actually said this.). Considering this game is currently the 4th most sold game of all time this simply cannot be the case. They are not diversifying their products enough and are trying to suck as much money out of their customers as they can whilst providing minimal content a terrible online functionality and overall terrible online experience.Because of this anti consumer mentality and behavior I advise never purchasing any game made by Take 2 interactive or their subsidiaries which includes Rockstar Games.Rockstar Games is pro modding as you can see from their social media posts and general pro modding attitude. Unfortunately their parent company has made a decision that I refuse to support and cannot stand for. I will no longer buy anything from this software developer and will deter anyone I can from purchasing anything from this developer.Until they revoke the cease and desist and prove that they are indeed pro consumer and not trying to milk thier customers for every dollar they have I will no longer buy anything from this company and highly highly discourage anyone else from buying from them as well.

review: My favourite story in a GTA game very neck and neck with San Andreas. Although the ending left me feeling they either ran out of ideas or had deadlines creeping up as the ending seems to rush things and attempt a conclusion with a lot of unexplained caveats. The gameplay is a lot more accessible than previous games and the rather unrealistic arcadey vehicle handling offers some ridiculously fun driving experiences.But if you've got buddies to play with the game's biggest pull is its online section. Though often criticized for poor UI and money making schemes similar to free to play games there's seemingly no end to things to do in the game. There's co op missions races deathmatches and various other gamemodes to partake in some of which are even completely original ways to play in the form of adversary modes. Not to mention the continuously increased character and vehicle customization.I am happy to have bought this game on its PC launch day at full launch price as it has brought me countless hours of entertainment since then and will surely continue to do so for a lengthy while still.

review: This game is a Hacker Fest. There are very few times when online there wasn't someone ruining the game in some way for the others. I have no idea if Reporting people has any affect you'll never know and trying to kick people is pretty pointless. You end up spending hours just trying to find an instance with decent people who your pretty sure aren't hacking. This has nothing to do with the obnoxious people because sometimes having the free for all battle is great fun. Until someone starts spawning random objects or all of your guns are suddenly inaccessible or you watch someone teleporting across the world or they are level 23 but have millions in equipment and somehow have every weapon in the game. You can't access some of the neat content without being in the open area but inevitably several $$hats join the server and there goes the neighborhood. It doesn't even make sense since once you give yourself unlimited funds... the game becomes pointless... hence they get bored and just mess with everyone else. One can only hope that they simply lose interest in the game quickly and go hurt back to whatever meandering pointless existance they spawn from. Thats polite right?

title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: So ! after 515 hours (665 now) of game (192hrs in the offline mode) i feel like i can give a solid review of my experience on this game.My opinion about the Grand Theft Auto Online is based IN A SOUTH AMERICAN point of view which in my point of view is pretty different from north american/european have been experiecing.About the Offline campaign Its amaizing ! It's just awsome ! can't say its perfect it has its issues but the game itself is great !Story 9/10Graphics 10/10 considering that it is a huge open world with an especial compliment for the lighting effects.Sound 10/10 Driving 8/10 Don't get me wrong the driving is nice and the phisics are good in the game but the aceleration breaking topspeed traction of the tires are unrealistic phisics are good but its poorly tuned.Side Missions/stories 10/10Openworld in general 10/10 So many things to do such a rich and beautiful landscapes countless random events filling the game with life.For these alone i'd already recomend the game i did not play it on the last gen and didn't get it JUST for the online part as many people did.GTA ONLINESomethings first i have a 100 mbits fiber optics connection with Gigabit class routers/switches connecting the devices here at home. even though i have notebooks connectec with 300mbs 802.11ac wireless network (which is not slow at all) the experiencie that i'm about to describe is on my cable connected desktop. HUGE connection issues can't remember how many times i went "connection time out" trying to get in an online session. Countless times im thrown in a session all alone. I'm live in south america and already played with people from Russia and China can you even imagine the latency ? things were just randomly teleporting all around the game is a little stupid when choosing a session to put you in... The game itself becomes a sea of bugs. Teleporting things and people becomes something usual. Countless i tried a heist and someone couldnt load couldnt open the game menu the game HUD didn't load only able to choose weapons inside cars and the only "solution"(only way to quit the heist) for that is going to the Social Club menu and change characters so im thrown out of the room...EDITED Latly most of the issues described here doesnt happen anymore i've been experiencing better connetions no more "time out" screens and the only thing still happening is the time when someone won't load on a heist mission and we get stuck there but i can easily blame someone else connectivity issues for that.About the Rockstar Suport Downloaded the iFruit app to custom change the license plate of my cars my most expensive fully upgraded car just vanished. EDITED Got an awnser in about 1 day got the refund for the car and upgrades added tumbs up for that.BAD THINGS (in my opinion) Gang attacks are pointless pays too little for the effort Bounty on players are limited to 10k for that little money people wont really go after anyone The way level unlock weapons are quiet nonsense the higher lvl players have more gear in general and low lvl players just have way too little things to protect themselvs making the starting you online life very hard Houses are ... basicly the same the interior layout changed way too little from building to building and if you're not willing to pay the 900k for the customizable Eclipse tower the view from your window is the only trully different thing you'll find.GOOD THINGS i DID NOT FACE so many hackers as other people described and even when i saw one they weren't messing around they were just playing normaly. In more than 200h i was only killed twice by a hacker. Never heard of unfair ban never happend with me or any of my local friends. So many more cars and upgrades Not perfect but still interesting character creation Even though it's GTA the game has mechanisms to not let everyone go riot and it tries to keep peace(but people still do it anyway) thousands of things to spend you money on houses garages cars clothes boats planes upgrades weapons ... Sharkcards exist for that right ? anyway its huge and you may never get tired of spending.If you never played the campaign get it its awsome if you want to buy it just for the online experience ... well if you live in south america and don't mind trolling brazillians all around enjoy it!(i might edit later if i remember something else)

review: (tl dr Game is a masterpiece)After 18 months of delay after delay GTA V is finally here and I can firmly say that it was worth the wait. The game is the best version to have come out. The game has delivered on everything that was promised and it runs like a dream. Pros 1. Amazing Gameplay Gun play is perfect and very fluid. Playing in 1st person mode is incredible and the mouse aiming is as good as it was Max Payne 3. Driving in the game is fantastic. I use the M/K the whole time even when driving. Since I play in 1st person mode completely I find that driving with a keyboard works really well. Plus the cars are heavy and well balanced so your car doesn't swerve all over the place like some do when you use a keyboard.2. Optimization I've put many hours into the game so far and apart from some early FPS drops I haven't had any major issues. I run the game almost completely maxed out with MSAA turned off and advanced graphics turned off. The game offers you up one of the most detailed settings menu I've ever seen. From your standard graphics options all the way to the number of people that appear on the screen. They took their time and truly did a wonderful job.3. Story One of the biggest issues I had with GTA 4 was the boring story and protagonist. Luckily R* fixed this by adding three playable characters all with their own unique skills and missions. The game combines the three quite well so you never feel like is less significant than the other. Even though the game centers around Michaels life and problems the story very naturally intertwines the other two in there perfectly. 4. GTA Online I haven't spent much time in this but from what I've been able to do it seems pretty good. This is the weakest part of the game imo but that's mostly because I'm not a big fan of MP. I haven't done the heist yet but from what I've seen it seems like it was worth the wait. Cons 1. Can't think of anything major tbh. Not saying the game is flawless but there is nothing major that I've come across that I would put as a con. While this game isn't perfect and I wouldn't put it in my top 5 it is still a masterpiece of a game that will appeal to just about everyone. While the game had a rocky launch it seems to be running well for almost everyone now. So please don't listen to those people who gave it a negative review on day 1 because they couldn't get on. I understand their pain but the game runs and plays like a dream so don't deny yourself this amazing experience just because a few people drew the short straw. For me this game is a solid 10/10.
title: Grand Theft Auto V

review: Absolutely gorgeous game.I took my time on getting through the story in this game. I love sandboxes and this one was pretty good. Pinch of salt with the story. First time I booted it up (on release) I couldn't handle the far fetched acting and put it down for almost a year.There's some strange glitches eg. trying to store/save stolen aircraft/special vehicles (like armoured cars) and losing what you wanted as well as what you already had saved.The combat is kind of dumb. You can't really lose in a firefight. All in all it was a game that had me yearning to get back to to crack on with.

review: Great singleplayer multiplayer ruinedGrand Theft Auto V has a great singleplayer campaign with an even better open world for you to explore and partake in dozens of creative and exciting activities that can last you for many hours. However due to a toxic community plagued with hackers and greedy developers who let their hunger for money take over Grand Theft Auto V's multiplayer has been ruined. Every game of Online that you will join will be swarmed with hackers and cheaters who break the game by consistently killing you and giving you hacked money which will ruin your experience especially when Rockstar resets your hard earned money. Rockstar also has implemented a microtransaction system that is completely t for the consumer. Most good items in Online will take you hours upon hours to unlock but Rockstar consistently tries to get you to take the easy way out and the cough up your hard earned money for their 'Shark Cards' which ultimately let you skip through that t grind. Rockstar has also been known to legitimately reset people's money who haven't been cheating at all completely throwing away thousands of hours of work for some people. I have not encountered this issue.Overall I mainly played Grand Theft Auto V for the singleplayer campaign which is truly a great game and I know that Online would be a genuinely fun game but I cannot recommend you to buy it solely for Online. Rockstar's policy on microtransactions and the community of cheaters and hackers has ruined this game.

review: I'm pretty sure you can read literal hundreds of reviews about this topic but here's one more to add to the pile of complaints. T2 has made an annoucement that any modifications of GTA V will be considered an illegal action. Uninstalled don't buy this worthless pile of junk I used to love this game but any amount of joy I used to have is gone and done. I'm not buying another Rockstar product I'm not purchasing another T2 product or any other company affiliated with them. I no longer support this franchise. Since Leslie Benzies left Rockstar games this entire company has taken a downward spiral and I couldn't care less. What Take Two Interactive has done is disgusting and low even for a big company like that. I support EA games and Ubisoft more than them at least you know what to expect from them. If I had known back in 2015 that GTAV was going to be illegal to modify in two years I'd have never wasted my countless hours or dollars on.It's been fun GTAV but I no longer support you. Or your terrible money hungry father company shady business practices that continue to stab us all in the back and make this game a living hell for anyone wishing to play it. Goodbye and good riddance.

review: Bought the PC version after having played the game on the xbox one mainly due to the better graphics and a few other people I know owning the game for PC and I'm really quite disappointed. It's definitely worth the money if you're only looking for the single player experience but online play is a mess. There are so many people using hacks and exploits to spawn in money kill everyone on the server freeze you in place spawn in any vehicle they want etc. It's got to the point where the only way to play online without a cheater ruining the experience is by going into a private session. I wouldn't recommend anyone buys the game if they're looking for the online experience.

review: I've only played it a few hours so far but my first impressions have been very good. Sure there's the typical Rockstar type hoops to jump through but this game is genuinely good and seems like a solid effort by R* to create a difinitive PC edition. If any this is the game to convince me to buy a killer desktop rig just to see this gorgeous open world in greater detail.(UPDATE)Almost a week later and this is the only game I have played. It just gets beter and better there's so much to do and I haven't even played online used the editor tried director mode or done anything except the typical missions. This game seems almost revolutionary for video games it shows what can really be done when talented people collaborate to create something great. In a few years VR will make this game like real life except without the t.10/10
